Crawfish bisque was buttery and flavorful. And last but not least...banana pudding!! I took dessert to go and it damn near put me in an food coma it was so good. 

Strongly recommended!!

My hubby and his friends are huge fans and they took me there 2 days ago for dinner.

Disappointed, I would say.  To me, it is just another Cheesecake Factory restaurant NOT in terms of food portion but the style: noisy, dark, crowded.

For those of you who have never been to Pappadeaux, I still think you should go experience.  Try especially the dirty rice.  Would I go back?  Probably not.   I just hate talking to people by yelling and being not able to see the food clearly.

I never use the "to-die-for" phrase because I would only die for my kids, but if you come to Pappadeaux' you will likely taste a bite of what I would imagine you would find in heaven (if there is one)! We had the alligator appetizer- medium, a caeser salad, Pasta Mardi Gras, Costa Rican Mahi Alexander, Arnold Palmers, and a Purple Voodoo. The alligator (my first time trying it) was cooked perfectly. Squeeze lemon on it- try the sauce it is accompanied with, or eat it as is. It is great! The seafood (mahi, shrimp, crawfish, scallops) in both dishes was cooked/grilled to perfection and the portions were more than a person can consume at one sitting. The Mahi Alexander sauce pulled everything together for me and was even a compliment to the already delicious dirty rice! You cannot see the Mahi under the crawfish, shrimp and sauce, but it was a huge 7oz portion. As far as the staff, our server, Jaclyn, added so much to our experience. She made excellent recommendations and added wit and humor to our experience. It might be hours from LA, but this will definitely be a road-trip worthy meal!

In my opinion, this is the best seafood in Phoenix. I've never had a bad bite in the 5-10 times I've been to this location. I'd recommend the mahi-mahi with pontratrain sauce; it's amazing! Other favorites include the crawfish etoufee and bisque as well as the seafood gumbo. You really can't go wrong on this menu. For dessert, the banana pudding and the creme brulee are quite good.

Whenever you want awesome service and amazing food you come here!!! Seriously I carve this place everyday. I eat out a lot and I promise you can not miss with these guys! Food is amazing and the restaurant its a fun, loud, classy, sassy experience!!food for the whole family! Tons of flavors. They really know how to serve you! Love, love, love!

I really enjoy coming to Pappadeaux. The service is pretty good, and the food is excellent. They have alligator for an appetizer which is very tasty. I love ordering the gumbo and the lobster bisque for starters. As for the main course, The Mardi Gras pasta is very delicious. This place can be a bit expensive but if you love seafood this place is an excellent choice.

Everything was amazing from the atmosphere, menu choices, quality of food, to the service. Lisa our server was knowledgeable, friendly, efficient and just beyond amazing. It is pricey but you get what you pay for. Everything is made in house and you can taste it. Seafood is flown in fresh.

Very poor service.  Went in for late afternoon lunch (3:00) and the restaurant was less than half full but looked like a good number of servers working.  We were sat at a table and there we sat for 10 minutes without ever being acknowledged by any of the servers that walked by our table - after 10 min we walked out.   Good service isn't hard people - it's not rocket science.

My favorite place for great seafood. My husband and I shared a shrimp cocktail which had jumbo shrimp with a wonderful texture and great cocktail sauce with fresh horseradish. Crawfish platter in a medium size was too much for me to finish. Blackened catfish was perfectly cooked. Hubby enjoyed bread pudding for dessert. All desserts are huge. Prices are high but worth it for quality. Service also great. The down side of this place is the noise level. But for the noise I would have rated 5 stars.
amazing food and  good drinks! Service was incredible! Definitely try the gator! and Sea bass!
I love this place! No other seafood restaurant can compare to Pappadeaux. The best Alaskan King Crab-legs you will ever find!

Wow!  Great service.  Great food.  Great relaxed atmosphere.  Andy, our server, was awesome.  Very polite, fun and extremely attentive but not at all intrusive.  We were greeted by at least 4 different employees on the way to our table; as well as being wished a good evening by 3 or 4 on our way out.  He gave us a free order of Aligator since it was our first time there.  Everyone loved it!  Only my 16 y/o son was not impressed with the food; although it was his first time trying anything "blackened."  The service manager (I think his name was Malcomb or Matt) came over and comp'd us a desert  for my wife's birthday.  The price was about what we expected for great seafood, but the quality of food and service was worth DOUBLE what we paid.
Great food, but the 1hr wait for a patio table ruined it (while there were a few open tables out there).

We came up to Phoenix last evening to attend the Amy Grant and Michael W Smith Christmas concert at Grand Canyo University Arena.  We always make a point of eating at Pappadeaux's Seafood Kitchen when we can.  We were running behind. 

Lisa the manager and our server, Lexie pulled off a miracle and got us drinks and food in record time.  They displayed unflappable hospitality and friendliness. They did not have to.  It was our fault that we had not allowed appropriate time to not be rushed.  

We live in Tucson and would love to have a Pappadeaux's in Tucson but until then, we will always come back.  

God bless you for running a top shelf establishment. Lexie and Lisa certainly deserve more recognition than the tip we left. 

Happy Thanksgiving and Merry Christmas. 

Horace Noland, M.D.
Tracy Noland
Jeanene Headlee
Amazing, amazing gumbo for an appetizer then sea bass for lunch was to die for !!  Service was A+ ....look forward to my next visit !!

Loved their food but their service sucked! She acted like she was doing us a favor. Paid $10 a shot for Patron n I asked for another n she rolled her eyes! Then I had to go to the bar for salt n pepper shakers. SMH

Great place to have a great meal, however if you dont like long delays to het in I recommend dining on off peak days or hours as this place is super popular on the weekend evenings.  Everything is super good wait staff is great!
Service was awesome tonight. Although they over cook my filet mignon, they gave me another hole order to make up. Thank you

This restaurant never fails to amaze me with the food and service! My boyfriend and I had a great dinner here. We sat at the bar first since the wait was so long. The bar tender was very assertive and even delivered out oysters to our table once we got one. I forgot his name, maybe Trent? He wore glasses. Then our server Ariel was just great!! She was extremely sweet and attentive. Request Ariel if you're there on a Friday night!! Oysters were on promotion for 10 bucks a dozen. We had no clue so it was a nice surprise!

Yummy seafood appetizers.
Large varieties of dishes had the salmon special and enjoyed it. A bit on the pricey side so nice treat to yourself and family.

Never been here before...never even heard of them actually, until this recent biz trip down to Phoenix.  For being a "chain" restaurant, boy were they good!  Everything tasted extremely fresh and the quality of the seafood was wonderful.   I was accompanied by two of my co-workers with all very different palates.  We each ordered something extremely different from the other and all you heard was the sound of us chowing down.  One colleague got a salad which she devoured...said it was fresh, not too little/much dressing, etc.  My other colleague ordered the crab legs and she loved every last bite...tore it all up.  I ordered a tuna dinner item...don't remember the name...but it was a special item they had that evening and it was divine.  The mashed potatoes were so fluffy...loved it all.  I also ordered the banana pudding for dessert and was a complete pig...and ooooMG was it worth it.  It was layered so well and served in a keepsake mason jar...very cute.  Anyhow, it beat my mom's banana pudding which is one of the many foods I would eat before death...!  SO, I couldn't believe how delicious everything was.  Additionally, the service was SUPER prompt and the young woman who was our server was extremely courteous and efficient.  Would definitely return again!

Love this place, both food and atmosphere. They are usually busy at least when we go in the evening. But the wait is reasonable and the atmosphere makes the wait easier. 

I am a fan of their dirty rice. And their wrapped shrimp. I have also had a halibut there that to this day is the best I have ever had. It was one of the specials one of the evenings there. 

What makes this place great is not just their spices, but the tenderness of the way they cook their seafood. 

Service excellent each time.
Best place to go eat on a special occasions fried gator everyone needs to try it so delicious
Awesome food and great service!! Took a client over for lunch (large group of 20 people) and we loved the experience...

Pappadeaux. What can I say? You are DELICIOUS! 
Our waitress was probably the best waitress I've ever had. Carrie was enthusiastic, really attentive without being overbearing or annoying, and just overall super awesome. 
We came in for lunch around 1 p.m. (their lunch is until 3), and I ordered the sampler platter, but I don't really like tilapia, so I asked if I could get some calamari instead of tilapia - done, without a hassle. Mum got the crawfish lunch. The bread they bring out is amazing, by the way.
Our food was out in probably ten minutes. Not only did I have an abnormally huge portion of calamari on my plate, but our waitress brought me out all the sauces that go with the calamari - their spicy marinara and a lemon aioli that you will stare at for several minutes and wonder how an aioli can taste that good. Yup. Several minutes.
Our waitress checked in on us often, and when we were done, boxed up our meal for us while we got our check. 
It was really hot out, and I was dreading walking to the car to sit on sizzling black leather seats, and before I know it BAM! There is a take-out cup for each of us, filled with our respective drink choice, our food bagged up and extra sauce for my leftoevers in little plastic take-out cups... Has anyone ever seen such awesome service?
If you go... you better ask for Carrie. If you don't, you will be incredibly and horribly jealous that you did not get the best waitress I have ever SEEN.
My favorite place to go! They have got a large variety. I love their oysters I really enjoy the atmosphere...

Love... Love... Love!! After my long flight back to the Arizona desert, I was excited to try their frog and alligator - extremely delicious.  Next time, I will try the frog and alligator legit, no frying and no bread crumbs to change their natural flavor.  

Oysters are soo yummy.  I automatically taste the ocean, which I miss dearly.  

Definitely recommend and don't be scared to try the unusual!!
We have had several terrific meals at Pappadeaux's, I enjoy the crawfish étouffée.  My wife likes the Salmon, and we normally order the blue point Oysters on the half shell, very tasty.

I am always happy when I can enjoy fresh seafood in the valley of the sun.  After all, this is Phoenix, Arizona. My family and I went to Papadeux Restuarant during the                                                                             holiday season.  I had a pleasant experience. So,here is a brief review.  The restuarant is decorated in a French Quarter New Orleans Louisiana style. The menu had many entrees to choose from. Our seafood dinners were delicious so were the appetizers and the desserts. The customer service was professional and staff was friendly.  I enjoyed it and will go back.

Came here to celebrate my birthday and I loved it! Great atmosphere and excellent cocktails. I had the Costa Rican Mahi Alexander and it was delicious! Will definitely recommend and come back again when I return to Phoenix.

First heard of this restaurant in Houston a few weeks ago.  Absolutely perfect.  Almost too good.  Found out there was one in Phoenix, AZ, where I live.  Tried it, expecting it not to be as good, since the Gulf is well known for its seafood, and Phoenix is not.  We received the exact level of quality in food and service.  Highly recommend this Restaurant

Have been back several times, and all have been fantastic until last Sunday. Waitress was obviously new, but without trainer.  Spoke very broken English and I knew she wasn't understanding order.  My wife ordered soup for app and crab and lobster salad for lunch.  I ordered one crab cake for app and pan seared talapia for lunch.  Even pointed to the dinner item so she wouldn't mix it up with what my mother in law ordered, which was the lunch grilled talapia.  Totally different dish.  First my crab cake came out.  10 min later my wife's salad came out.  I asked about her soup.  Waitress replied that she wasn't sure which she wanted first so she guessed.  2 minutes later the soup and our lunches came out.  I received the wrong lunch, as I expected.  She asked me if I wanted to change it.  Didn't feel like waiting, so I ate just the fish, but none of the sides.  The waitress just asked how everything was, even though my plate was barely touched.  She should have noticed, and not just smiled and took my plate.  At minimal, she should have sent the manager over to talk to us.  Figured she just wanted to cover her mistakes.  I am 3rd on regular check in's, so we will continue to come back.  Service was definitely not up to their norm.  Was not very busy at the time, so she was not rushed.

Just grabbed a to go order. Very efficient and super friendly. Heard that they were rolling out new training for take out. Everyone was enthused and seemed happy to be there. Thanks Pappa!

The fact that the tilapia was the best tilapia I ever had. And the crab cake with fresh crab sprinkled with lobster chunks. My bf got the salmon that was about a foot long covered in scallops and scrimps definitely coming again and again and again lol. Tons of leftovers

We went there on Saturday, and it was" very" busy, not just cause it was a Saturday, but the Saturday before Mothers Day. However our experience was awesome. We sat at the bar, and well gotta send a "shout out" to Jemma, who was not our waitress, but was delivering food to the bar. She took time to tell us what each dish was as this was our first time there. She was Awesome! And our two bartenders who took care of us Nick and Missy, hooked us up on the lump crab & spinach dish which was amazing. The food here was very good, and these three persons great service will definitely bring us back!!
If you love oyster then this is the place. Jose has been with this restaurant from opening day. He is an oyster expert. Stop in and  experience heaven with on the half shell.  Love this place!!!!

Tried out this place for lunch with my family. Ordered the lobster and shrimp salad + small clam chowder soup. For $22 salad, I was expecting a lot more meat. Sadly, it only came with a few bite size lobster and couple shrimps. Clam chowder was good, but bit on the salty side. 
We were given free toasted bread with butter. Bread was delicious! The place has a beautiful outdoor patio and our waiter Blake was excellent. 

They also had a secret crawfish plate that was done upon request. Best crawfish I ever eaten. Extremely fresh. Try that out next time if you're a fan of crawfish. 

Other than the high prices, this place was good.

I went to Pappadeux a few years ago and it was fantastic. The place was nicely appointed, the service was great as was the food and it was worth the price. Recently my husband and I decided to go there for lunch for our anniversary and were disgusted by the negative experience we had there. The place looks more like a cheap Vegas cafeteria now, the carpet is filthy, the silverware was dirty and the service was horrible! Our waitress seated us directly next to the only other people in the place which was ridiculous since the entire restaurant was wide open. The waiter waiting on that table was bringing them bread and going over the menu with them, ours did none of those things. We ordered the fried alligator appetizer which was over seasoned and chewy and when our lunch came it was clear that the catfish my husband ordered had come straight from a bag of frozen fish. The fact that the sauce and butter are served in paper cups at $20 a plate was unreal. The food was cafeteria quality at best my food was inedible. The waitress was rude so I finally asked for the manager who came over made excuses and finally comped the meal. It was a complete waste of time and we both left hungry. I don't know what happened to that place but it has become a terrible restaurant and we will NEVER go back!
This place is exceptional! Food is delicious and drinks are scrumptious. Great staff too! Definitely coming back for more.
So tasty. Food is the best as far a seafood goes in the state. Drinks are nice as well and staff always has a great attitude

I have always enjoyed my dining experience here and occasionally have business meetings over lunch. The service has always been friendly and treated me professionally and their manager took care of me when they made a mistake. If you like seafood and don't mind paying a little more you will enjoy the experience.

The staff was first rate here, from host staff, to bartenders and servers. I had a chance to watch them for a long time, as I was "vulturing" on one of the outdoor balcony tables: there are three, and they are offered on a first-come-first-served basis. The patio seating was devoted to private functions on the two nights we dined here, and we really wanted outdoor tables, because I have a shellfish allergy and wanted to be in the open air. The reason I mention a food allergy is because of the highly professional and dedicated approach the staff uses to ensure an excellent and safe guest experience. After telling my server, the manager actually came to the table and the manager has to basically be in the loop on the order, which is amazing. The food was great and our experience was delightful. Hats off to this place!
Very nice environment. Prices a little spendy but the experience is well worth it.

This place is by far the best seafood in Arizona, this is why it gets 5 stars. However, it is a bit pricey on the food. But Pappadeaux also has some seasonal specials that make up for that. Like 50 cents an oyster. I could spend all day there at that price. Also they have a great happy hour both on drinks and food.

Its a great atmosphere also with great service. They offer a variety of mixed drinks that are superb. I recommend the sweet tea and the swamp thing.

Also don't forget to try the crispy fried alligator ;)

Wonderful meal with copious amounts of fresh seafood seasoned perfectly. The bread is excellent. I'd recommend staying away from the gumbo...it's not terrible, it's just not necessary. The Mixed Seafood Grill and the risotto were great. Our server, Annie was efficient & helpful without being intrusive. This was a great end to an excellent day in the Arizona sun.
Love the Pappadeuax delux platter.  Enough food to feed two easily with extra to take home...great value!  Love the environment, and the desserts are awesome!

We gave this place a try for the first time. I expected more delicious food or maybe we're just not seafood people. I had the Moroccan salmon; it was a little soggy for my taste. My hubby ordered steak and said it's better at Texas Roadhouse for less the price. The calamari is really good though and the dip that comes along with it but overall we most likely won't be back.

YUM!!! Worth the wait if you do not have reservations. The food is delicious and the drinks are very good!
I had a Purple Voodoo drink

Apps: Shrimp cocktail, Calamari, and bodain A+

Meals: Salmon with Maine Lobster was good BUT kinda deceiving it came without a lobster tail it was just a FEW (4) LITTLE chunks of lobster.   (This was why I only gave 4 stars)

The Cheesey grits are so good and so is the crabcakes! The dirty rice is to die for!!
 We shared Key lime Pie and banana pudding
 My husband left his credit card so he ate their a 2nd night and LOVED the food so much we will be going at least 1x month

Waitress spilled ice cold water on me in first 5 minutes. Drinks from bar were really bad. Had to send the first back. Second still was not good. Took her 10 minutes to make the Greek salads at the table while the other guests food got cold. Bad experience overall. This was Monday.

Some of the best grits you can find at a restaurant, this was our first time here and it was amazing.
The only thing better than the food was our waiter Nick, he took very good care of us and insured that I will return whenever I'm in Phoenix.
Awesome love to be full and have left overs great place love it here.

Pappadeaux is our go to spot to celebrate special occasions or with friends in from out of town. the food is always excellent, as is the service. Megan, on of the managers, knows us on site and always swings by to greet us.

I came here to celebrate a birthday. We got the appetizer's and the drinks fairly quickly, but the bread took an extra 5 minutes to show up. We got the Fried Alligator, and it was delicious. I ordered the seafood gumbo, but the restaurant was out of oysters so it had extra shrimp. I felt like the Gumbo wasn't as good as others I have tried. I also tried fried Crawfish tails, and they were delicious. For desert I had the Creme brulee. Overall the service and food was great, but I was disappointed by the Gumbo.
Awesome happy hour deals but ooohweee it gets crowed :) food yummy

My wife and I stopped by for a late lunch around 1:30. Place was much busier than we would have guessed but were seated immediately. Server seemed busy and took awhile to get our drink orders. Since we had been seated for a time we ordered our entree at the same time.  Appetizer came before the drinks and shortly after manager came by and explained that they had to change out the CO2 and it would be a few minutes. Entrees came before drinks and when drinks finally came we said we didn't want them. When server came back to check and apologize for the late drinks I told her 25 minutes was unacceptable. She was very rude saying she was busy.  Manager came later, we told her what happened and to our surprise she bought our lunch. In addition gave us a gift card. What a great place!  (By the way, food was awesome as usual)
We had a large party here;  the service was impeccable, the food was delicious & the atmosphere is delightful!

Pappadeaux is over the 5 start rating.  It was the first time there.  The photos do not do the place justice as it is so much better in person.  Lucky to be seated away from the bar area to avoid the noise.  Very accommodating as asked to be seated at a bit larger table that was available.  There was a number in our group.  I'm more about the food and could care less about the settings, not so here.  From the minute you are in the parking lot you feel like you are mentally taken away and transported to somewhere else.  Never been to New Orleans but, the other guest said it was very nice.  So, from the minute you get out of your car take the time to look around. Enjoy the settings from your car and including up to your table.  Glad to be seated away from the bar area noise.  The inside was nice as the lighting was just right as not to be to dark or to light.  I like to see what I'm eating and enjoy it, perfect lighting. Staff was helpful and nice.  We all got the Pappadeax Platter. We were told it is a lot of food and I thought, ya sure I'll see.  It was and had some to go home and I'm ok with that!  Enjoy it a bit longer.  The food was very good and was fresh, even the next day ... what I took home.  We all were to full for any desert and then saw some of deserts pass by to the next table, we're drooling at the site.  Just to full so, we plan on going back before dinner crowd just for desert. For a special night out it is a winner.  It is a relax place without the stuffy attitude that some places have.
Food is so tasty and plentiful! I think I had a Mardi Gras platter for dinner and breakfast AND lunch!!!

I do not understand why a recipe gets changed after years of proven success.  I love Pappadeaux's - but why change the PO Boy recipe?  I was in Houston for business & thought how lucky to be getting a Po Boy from Pappadeaux's.  I did not read the menu as I knew ahead of time what I was going to get, but to my surprise it was different.  Instead of Remoulade Sauce, it now comes with Tartar & Cocktail sauce and pickle slices??? Not so good anymore...planning a trip to Phx in August, want Po-Boys...but not with the new recipe.

We meet up at Pappadeaux for an early dinner Thursday night. We get together about every six  weeks and have a nice dinner, laughs, and catch up. First of all I want to say our waitress was great. The three of us ordered Pasta Mardi Gras. I was so disappointed. I got a bowl of pasta with pink sauce and a couple of tasteless shrimp. Then I saw the waitress bring the next table a plate of onion rings. I called her over, please bring us a plate of onion rings, she did and they were amazing. The onion ring were about $6 and Pasta Mardi Gras was $18. I brought the Pasta Mardi Gras home so I could really look at it. All that was in the bowl was pasta, mushrooms and pink sauce. There was no craw-fish in the pink sauce.What a rip off. Then to top it off, we were sitting in a booth we had people coming up to us asking if we were done because they wanted our booth. For goodness' sake people we are still eating. So, Rude! and the management just watch what was going on and did nothing about it. If you were thinking about stopping in, just skip it, it's not the good food it once was and the management sucks.

Had a great lunch there ... The mussels by far were the best ever!
Service was great .. a bit noisy even at lunch but I'll take it.

Pappadeaux is an old favorite of mine.... good menu and good prices and good service.... my last visit was no different... Jane our waitress was perfect! knew her menu and was able to guide us through our choices... will be going back!

First off - the food is freaking incredible!!  Secondly, Daphne (our server) is the sweetest and most helpful gal on the planet.  We were on a quick lunch before we hopped on a plane and I just wanted a salad - she recommended the chopped salad and holy cow!!!  It wasn't just an average salad.  Super fresh, hot juicy grilled chicken - YUM!  Best service!! Third - the spicy Bloody Mary is to DIE.  Ask for Amanda at the bar - she's legit!  Your welcome. ;)

Too expensive, more than red lobster, and red lobster is good. We went knowing that this place was well known, however way to greasy, small portions, and we kept smelling fish that smelled expired. We tried it and my party of 4 all got sick. We were told that when fish smells too fishy it usually means it's bad or old. Plus our waitress continued to come to our table to inform us that the bartender was too busy and our child's milk would be out as soon as it could. "What did you have to milk the cow out back"..... come on the place is always busy , hire more support.

Pappadeaux is definitely my favorite restaurant.  The food is to die for! Cajun deliciousness and fresh seafood!  Who could resist?

Things to definitely try:

Oyster & Shrimp Fondue
Mediterranean Calamari
Shrimp Brochette
Pasta Mardi Gras
Crawfish Bisque
Mussels
Blackened Opelousas
Desserts?  Where do I begin???  Sweet potato pecan pie ala mode, carrot cake cheesecake, creme brulee, bread pudding, banana pudding, all are good!  The list goes on. 

They also have yummy cocktails, including the famous Swamp Thing.  It's a fru fru girlie's drink and pretty sweet and potent.  If you like that sort of thing give it a go!

Things to note:

If you are on a diet forget it, there is nothing lite on the menu. 

They have a happy hour M-F and a live band on the patio on Friday/Saturday.  

The service is almost always good and the interior is warm and inviting.

Becoming one of my favorites- this is the Ruth's Chris of seafood / Cajun!  So many menu options make every picky diner take 20 minutes to decide what to order.

My boyfriend and I have taken his grandma here as well as my mom and I having dinner here on a different occasion.  The prices aren't cheap but either is the experience.  I'd say the only downside is it can get very loud at peak dinner times.

Every time we get a helpful server with an a+ attitude trying to make their guests enjoy their experience. 

When we waited for a table at the bar with my bf and his gma- the bartender had the people's appetizer upgraded next to us so we could have some too!

I also love their margaritas and New Orleans inspired drink menu here- always starting the party with a frozen margarita or mai tai!

I enjoyed the Moroccan salmon and also had the naked salmon previously.  The kitchen has a tendency to serve broccoli raab with the naked salmon instead of green beans like the menu lists.  Broccoli raab is so gross and I do not recommend it!

Lastly the dessert tray is the real reason for my review!! Old school offerings on a tray always entices! Last time we had the pecan praline cheesecake (seasonal?) which is the most delicious thing ever.

Wow! What a great dinner and dining experience! We ordered the shrimp and crawfish fondeaux appetizer (which came with an awesome garlic bread loaf), Chilean sea bass (topped with jumbo lump "crab gratin"), and crispy Atlantic salmon (seared, topped with crab, shrimp & scallop), a cup of andouille gumbo, and finished with a house-recipe key lime pie.  Every dish was excellent, and the fondeaux lived up to all the Yelp hype. All of these items were at the recommendation of our young but very knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and attentive server, Tory (you were awesome Tory and thanks for all the great recommendations). Our only regret is that it's taken us so long to finally try this place. We've passed it a thousand times, never realizing it had so much quality food and ambience (New Orleans flare). It's crowded, for good reason, so make reservations. - Mark & Rebecca

The food the service and the atmosphere are good not great. I have been here several times and each time I am whelmed. They tend to go a little heavy on the dirty rice but other than that I can't complain. The overall experience was very meh.
My favorite place in az as of yet ... I've never had anything I don't like ... The whole menu is great & drinks are just as yummy

Best creme Brule I've had in arizona! And the half smoked Half fried alligator appetizers are to die for! And I had never even tried alligator before! I've had it in a few other places but this by far is the best! I'm guessing it's supposed to be "fancy" but people come however they want to dress. So don't worry about it if you are in jeans

ABSOLUTLY FABULOUS!!!!!! Amazing staff and even better food! Alligator was good and mahi mahi was great too! Look behind the bar for the secret outside private patio tables!! You won't regret this place!

I acually always go here with my mother who absolutly loves this place!  I think the service is great and the food is really delicious!  I am a fan of spicey food, and they totally meet the standard here.  I like everything about this place, I only give it a 4 star rating because the menu is too freaking huge!  I never know what to get since there are so many creole and cajun dishes and they use lingo more native to like Loiusiana, so I don't know what it means.  But all in all a great experience every time.  My mother even chose this place to go to after her wedding.  So cute mom!

If you looked at any of my previous reviews, you'll see I eat all over the country!  This is one of the few places I've tfound to be very consistant,  excellent service, great decor, and some of the best food you'll find for Cajun restaurant, that has a multi-state presence!  The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is its always busy plan, so ahead! Secondly it is pretty pricey $$$$! So definitely bring your favorite credit card,  you'll need it! Overall this is one of the best locations, and the Servers, the Management team,  just really great folks. I think you'll find nothing but a wonderful experience for you, Family, and Friends.

Sat at the bar for Happy Hour.  The bartenders were friendly and made fresh squeezed orange juice for my drink. Had a really good half size fondue app.  Dinner was delicious... The best scallops I have had! 

Also had a really good atmosphere. The patio section was beautiful!

I ve been to Pappadeaux about 6 or 7 times and this time was the worst. The service was very good but the food was overpriced for the amount we got. I always order the same thing,Pasta Mardi Gras, and never could finish it before but this time there was less than half of the normal amount. Disappointing.  mY wife got the scallops and she got 3 tiny, tiny scallops for $25.  The last time we went the same thing happened but I chalked up to a 1 off. Overall, a very good place to eat but the last 2 times have been disappointing COMPARED TO THE PREVIOUS 2 YEARS.  I may be unfair judging a restaurant by the amount of food given but spending $25 for a pasta dish, I guess I am used to copious portions.

Go here frequently and usually get Lobster and Filet Mignon. I can honestly say I personally have never eaten anything here that wasn't of great quality from Lobster, Filet Mignon, blackened salmon, Southwest Grits, Lobster Mac & Cheese, even tried alligator for the first time here and it was delicious (I believe that's the name of the Grits  and Mac & Cheese). I can honestly say I don't have one complaint from ever going here.
First time here and it was great! Server (Matt) was very knowledgeable and helpful. We had crab and blackened mahi, both were great. Also never had to ask for a refill, my iced tea was always full!

If we didn't submit a review previously back in November 2017, sorry - we ate here, loved it, and are coming back for more!! We live in Missouri but found this place when we came to Phoenix 6 months ago; thanks to yelp. The seafood is T-O  D-I-E  F-O-R!!! Brent even brought his father and brother when they came to Phoenix last month for a golf week. Raw oysters look amazing and are very popular!! They are shucked by Jose, a really sweet, attentive "mother-shucker". Don't forget to tip your shucker!! :)  Brent has gotten the crawfish etouffee all three times, and has LOVED it every time!! I got the small fried shrimp and then this time got the fried shrimp and scallops. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!! While Pappadeux's appears to be a chain - we saw one in Albuquerque, we are lucky there isn't one in KC!! We'd be fat but happy!! Btw - my fried shrimp and scallops is not on the menu, but our awesome bartenders, Susan and Amanda, said it's not a problem whatsoever to do a fried combo, so they got exactly what I was craving. And it's beyond words!! And look at the size of the baked potato. Amanda/bartender said this was a small one. :/  Amanda and Susan worked their butts off at this large bar, but were extremely attentive despite the rush of people and drinks. They had awesome smiles and great, friendly attitudes!! The bar is where you get the best service!!! For those of you with larger parties, larger than Brent and I, there appears to always be large parties of 8-10 people that get seated quickly. Don't let the filled parking lot scare you off!!! Come - enjoy this place!! You will have a wonderful, YUMMY meal!! And - as the added bonus - they have Diet Coke!!! :). That's not why they got 5 stars, though!! :)

This is one of my favorite places.  Great seafood and great service.  A bit busy sometimes but that comes with being a great restaurant.  Everyone wants to eat there.  And this place has been packed since opening night.

Try the crawfish platter or the jumbo shrimp brochette.  Both are outstanding.  But then, pretty much everything is.
Eaten here at least 50 times...Best west westside seafood ever...And fresh!
It was my first time coming in and it was great! The food was really good and the service was even better!! Thank you Jaclyn for making my dads birthday dinner special!
Awesome food, great customer service. The only bad part was when my pregnant hormonal fiancé saw a gentlemen taking a lobster from that big tank to its death lol.

I have been to this location four times.  The first was good.  The fourth was flawless (and also on a Sunday @ 11 AM).  The second and third were disastrous.  The third, unfortunately, was my birthday.  

The BOTTOM LINE:  
I would go back, my spouse will not.  However, I would not risk a special occasion on this restaurant.  

THE GOOD:  
(1) a something-for-everyone menu 
(2) truly spectacular tasting menu items 
(3) managers seem genuinely contrite, and they are adroit at making good on mishaps. 
(4) reservations are accepted, but waiting with a drink on the patio is a great experience.

THE BAD: 
(1) a service bar so slow during dinner peak that you'd think the first step in making your drink was applying for a liquor license. 
(2) if you're like me and appreciate a well paced meal, you'll have to DIY-it by specifying to the server when the kitchen is OK to begin preparing the next course. (inept and thoughtless pacing happened 3 of 4 times) 
(3) You will invariably be first sat under a full-blast A/C vent or fan aimed at your upper back, and you will have to request a new table. (happens every time I sit inside)  

The UGLY:
The food quality is inconsistent. (3 of 4 visits resulted in myself or someone in my party sending back a deficient item for being too cold, overcooked, watery, etc.)  Rectifying the problem takes long enough to ruin the pacing of the meal for the table as whole.  Ordering is slight gamble, which, for a restaurant, is the deadliest sin of all.

Don't come often but every time we do the food is always great!  Definitely get the Mediterranean calamari!  Personally can't get enough of the crawfish étouffée.  Service is always great, the waitstaff definitely know the menu.

Overpriced, Food average, extremely overcrowded, slow service. Waited 1/2 hour only to be sat at the bar crammed next to a wooden pole, that my right arm was jammed against it (my friend was seated on the OTHER side of the pole too), sigh, so difficult to carry on a conversation. It wasn't worth it, & I will not be returning. Crab Shack, Blue Water Grill much better.

We just left Pappadeaux's and had a wonderful evening! Our server Jalissa, was so engaging and informative. She let us know our options before choosing our food. We had the Filet mignon  with lobster tails. Delicious! Then to top it off, we were served a complimentary yummy dessert for our Anniversary. We are looking forward to returning and hopefully having Jalissa again. Thank you for a great night!

I treated a young friend to her 1st real New Orleans oysters. We began with orders of oysters on the half-shell and Pappadeaux's version of Oysters Bienville (baked cheese topping). I lived in New Orleans for years, so I was disappointed at the soup-y cheese that couldn't stick with the oyster -- took the adventure out of it completely. My favorite, Oysters Rockefeller, was substituted by their version adding hollandaise sauce to the spinach (yuck!) so we passed.

The entrees went better. I had the Shrimp with Andouille Sausage & Red Beans (excellent red beans!) and she got the Shrimp Po Boy & Gumbo combination. We topped off with Praline Bread Pudding in Bourbon Sauce. Highly recommended.

Service was mediocre. Our server was no help even tho I mentioned it was her 1st oyster outing. I tried to the point of frustration to order the appetizers, and she only regurgitated the menu to me repeatedly. I knew how to read. I didn't know how to order combo raw oysters & oysters bienville in a way she could understand, even tho I've done so hundreds of times at Felix's or Antoine's or nearly any New Orleans restaurant. After waiting 20min for our check, we stood to leave and she brought check to us at the hostess stand, so being cumbersome, I signed for a $75+ bill writing a large 15% pointing to tip line and left. Not a big thing, but my checking account was deducted for a $15 tip instead, which I would have not blinked except the service was not worthy of over 15%. For the $3.25 hustle at the register, they got the motivation to write this review. Sad, as I had looked forward to *my kind of restaurant from my old neighborhood.*

The manager did present himself at our table to clear up an allergy question, and he was outstanding. I told my friend, "Now he's like the waiters usually are in a good restaurant!" Friendly, interested, concerned, competent, professional. Not so with the overly-tipped waitress.

Great food and wonderful services. I love Cajun food, and living in the desert doesn't help. My husband and I love this place, it's the closest thing we can get to the south. Service Carla was so knowledgeable,  wonderful, and gracious. Give her a raise ya'll!

Soooooo yummy!!! I love the dirty rice and their shrimp is to die for, along with some of the best scallops I have ever had. My family comes here every New Years Eve, and we have always had exceptional service. This year we sat on the patio and we had the BEST server. He was super nice and he really paid attention to what we needed. He kept our table clean and our glasses full! He was so great. And Megan, the kitchen manager is so awesome! She came out and asked us how our meal was, and she was so wonderful. Love this restaurant and its staff.
Been here 4 times and every time it is very good. Steaks and seafood are fresh. Service is good every time. Love this place.

Love this place! Had the Moroccan Salmon and the Sea Bass. Outstanding! This place ranks up there with Emeril's New Orleans Fish House.  Make sure to ask for Johnny C. to be your server.  He was the best!  Made great suggestions and was very attentive.

very enjoyable,  fun atmosphere with hearty portions.  the seafood was wonderful,  better than expected for Arizona. 
service was friendly and fast.
would go again on next visit

Loved this place.  Quick seating for a city, friendly staff, and delicious food.  Crawfish Etoufee with dirty rice was the bomb! The cheesy grits are a nice surprise with the sweet crunch of the corn.  Loved it.  The desserts are ginormous and can easily be split two or three ways!

This place. I was seriously looking forward to this restaurant. From the reviews I read, pictures I've seen, I was very excited to try it out. 

I initially called to make my reservation, within seconds of speaking with an employee, I received a text confirming my reservation. I received a text a day prior to my reservation as a reminder. I thought all of that was very cool. 

Walking into this restaurant, I was shocked to see how full it is. Which leads me to my review... 

Let's have a seat, shall we?!

We started off with the Calamari. Large sized. Which cracked me up when it got to the table. The large size looked like the medium size. So I'm not sure I would want to see what the medium size looked like. Was it a "large size" because it had two small bite size pieces of fried zuchinni? The calamari, which I heard was the very best, was mediocre at best. It wasn't all it was made out to be. The little fried bits tasted like churches chicken. Not cute. 

Onto my main course. I got the Mardi Gras pasta thing. It sounded amazing, looked amazing, smelled amazing, however, it wasn't as good as I had hoped. 

As with other reviews I read, the lobster tail is overcooked. It tasted as if it was previously frozen, cooked, and then left under a heat lamp until it was chosen. 

The cheesecake slice for desert was massive, it was ok. 

Our waiter, John, was great. He was at our table at appropriate moments. He wasn't over bearing, or no where to be found. 

All in all, I wouldn't go skipping to this place. It wasn't what I had imagined. I will not be back, thumbs down.

Just returned from sleep inducing dinner at Pappadeaux's. 

In my stomach: half dozen (actually 8) raw oysters, Pontchartrain fillet, and peanut butter cheesecake. 

Service was A+... luckily Justin (our waiter) was a jovial one. 

Will update next time with details. 

My system will have the sweetest sleep tonight.
I will come back...the food was excellent the fres  fish was very fry just.  The restaurant was nice.

This is the place that food dreams are made of. I love Pappadeaux. Although I have not been here in a few years now. Time goes by fast.
But, as always it was wonderful!!! Our server was John and he could not of been better!
We sat inside although it was a lovely day out. This place is decorated so beautifully , you forget you are in Phoenix. The outside Patio area is amazing and so peaceful. It really just adds to the wonderfulness of it all.
Our food was divine! Really good. I started with a cup of the Seafood chowder. Even the Bread and Butter were great!
For my meal I had Shrimp and Grits, so good! My friend had Tilapia with Hazelnuts. She let me have some. Oh my gosh! Divine, and I cannot wait to go back here.
We even got Dessert and shared it , but we could not finish it all. It was such a large item. The Brownie cake it was.

Lots of parking here, Restrooms are clean and nicely decorated as well. The decor inside and outside is great. The staff are wonderful. I have always had a great experience here.

Ate here with my husband for a small dinner while we were visiting friends in Phoenix. Since this restaurant was within walking distance (less than a 5 minute walk) to the hotel we were staying in (Candlewood Suites), we decided to eat here. The first thing I thought of when we came in here was that this was one of those expensive tourist restaurants... and well it is (well duh, it's located right next to a few hotels). 

Anyways, when we first came in here (sometime after 9 pm), no one acknowledged us. There was no one by the hostess area. So we waited by the front for a few minutes before deciding to just walk over to a table and seat ourselves. When we sat ourselves at a booth near the bar, a server saw us and brought us 2 menus. 

We ordered the following:

Crispy Fried Alligator: We got a large order and was surprised that it didn't really come with a lot of pieces. Would really have liked to have more, especially since the price tag was a bit high. Anyways, my husband wanted to order this because well, how many opportunities do you get to eat alligator? It was tasty, but a little on the oily side. And it tasted like chicken (but you know, a lot of things taste like chicken). I don't know if I would ever order this again just because of the price tag and I didn't really feel like my palate was wowed a new culinary treat.

Louisiana Seafood Gumbo: We ordered a bowl to share and really liked the flavor of the gumbo. My husband just wished that there were more seafood pieces in this instead of just a few pieces of shrimp and mostly sausage. 

The service we received was below average... Our server only came to our tables a total of 3 times (1 to get our order, 2 to bring us our food and 3 to bring us our check). He was not attentive to refilling our water and so I had to find another employee to get us some more water. The place wasn't even busy at all, there was just a handful of tables with people eating and no one at the bar. The place was basically empty (pretty spacious, which made the emptiness more noticeable). 

The ladies' restroom was clean and there is plenty of parking in the lot. 

Overall, would not come back. Food is overly priced and nothing seemed to wow us. This is just one of those tourist traps who just like the convenience of dining here due to proximity to their hotel.

I have been here twice and twice I have been satisfied. Of course the parking lot get's full after 1 pm , poeple want to dine with friends and family also the waiting patios gets full very fast. So make time to plan it. Well, any ways  , My wife and I tried the Gumbo and Shrimp Coktail , Pasta Mardi Gras and Shrimp  Scallop Pasta. For Dessert the " Dessert Trio " ..  Pricey but Good.. I dont' always dine here, but when I  do I enjoy it..... There is alot of plates to choose from they look good. Very good come and check it out .

I'm not an expert on New Orleans seafood by any means, but the mixed seafood grill was very good.  Everything was cooked perfectly, which is quite a trick, especially with the variety of meats on the skewer.  I would have saved some for leftovers, but my hotel room doesn't have refrigerator or microwave :(

The only thing I could have wished for is wild Pacific salmon instead of the Atlantic salmon, but I guess that would make it less authentic.

I dined on the patio, so I didn't much of a feel for the ambience inside, but it did seem rather loud as I passed through the lobby...
We had a party of 21...Excellent food and service. Timely, delicious. Personally I had mussels, everyone loved their dinner. The service was superb! Thank you!

Pappadeaux has been one of my family's favorite seafood restaurants in Phoenix for several years......until today!

We just went for dinner fairly early to beat the Friday rush.  We ordered our drinks and appetizer, approximately 15 minutes later my beer showed up after I had to ask the waiter for it again.  That was the first disappointment but was actually the least disappointing!

We ordered our food and were patiently waiting, we understand that the food does not arrive immediately.  20 minutes went by...then 30.  After about 40 minutes the waiter came out and let us know that he was sorry it was taking so long and that our food was coming right out.  After this extremely long wait our 22 month old son was at the end of his rope and was out of patience.  We told them that we had to have the food to go since it had been so long.

The manager came out and apologized to us and offered us either a free desert or a gift certificate ($7 desert or $50 gift certificate...don't take the desert!).  We do appreciate the gift certificate, however the disappointment was not over.

We got home to eat the food (travel time only about 15 minutes).  My fried oysters were cold and soggy, I assume they had been sitting on the counter for quite awhile before they packaged them up for us.  My son's kids shrimp meal ended up being only 4 shrimp in the box with no fries!  My wife was also not very happy with her fish, very bland and not satisfying.

We are very disappointed that Pappadeaux's has sunk to this level, we used to love it in the past but will not be eating there again.  To whoever we end up giving the gift certificate to.....sorry!
We have been there several times, & have always had exceptional experiences. They acknowledged our date night we posted on Twitter, & we were impressed they took the time to comment.

Given this restaurant so many chances and all fails.  This is not to review the bar area service, which is excellent.  The restaurant itself is like a different entity.  

Last night took two guests for a birthday dinner.  Place was empty but by the time we placed our order (45 mins later!) it was packed.  Server (Bryan) was in the worst I can remember; unfriendly, ignorant about the menu, rude to all three of us, failed to offer more drinks, never came back to ask about meals, and this is only the beginning.

To start I ordered oysters appetizer; at 6:30 on a Tuesday they were all out.  Came time to order dinner and chose crab legs; guess what, all out. 
Now I know this isn't the server's fault, but in addition, two lobster dinners were completely charred black, dry and tough - like lobster jerkey.  After 1 1/2 hrs. no time to send back so stuck it out.  At one point Bryan was no where to be seen for over half an hour.  He never came to offer dessert until we flagged him down for our bill.  Got there at 6PM and were out at 8:50 - that's how long this disaster took.

I had often heard of this place and was excited to go. I must say that I was not disappointed at all. The customer service was excellent from beginning to end.  The peach ice tea was great, with a fresh taste to it. We ordered the large basket of calamari which was shared between 3 people. Large, warm  French bread was included and it was fresh. With so many options to choose from, I chose the Seafood Platter. The seasoning was not overwhelming, but rather just enough, to still know you had seafood on your plate. This meal is actually enough to share with your special person. 

I highly recommend this place for just about any special occasion or with a group of friends.

My husband and I went to Pappadeaux for lunch today, and I have to say I was disappointed. The bread before the meal was dry and a bit stale, and the shrimp in my salad had a bleach taste to it, which was absolutely awful. 
We've been to this restaurant before, and had a much better experience, but it's been a while.
We won't be going back.

The food was amazing. My sister and I took my mom there to celebrate her birthday. The down side was for a Wednesday night we had to wait 45 min for a table, and we could see open tables this was at 7pm. They should have had all the servers on by that time. But other then that it was great. The food was so good. We had the fondue which is rich creamy. The seafood is fresh and delicious. I would definitely return. Our server was great and they even gave my mom a birthday dessert. Thank you all for the great time.

Had lunch here with our daughter before heading back to Missouri. Would like to stay and eat here again!  Superb lunch for all and delicious key lime for dessert. A wonderful place with a very nice atmosphere along with great service. What more is to be said !

Third time here and they've yet to disappoint! Our server, Audrey was friendly and very attentive to our needs. Boyfriend and I shared the Pasta Mardigras and the desert trio, both of which were really good. The pasta had just the right amount of seafood and the desert trio was more than enough to share between two people or more.  Overall, a good dining experience with great customer service and good food.

Great great food. I come to Phoenix every couple weeks for business from La Jolla and still can't believe the seafood here is 10 times better. This place is a jewel.  I also like the AC in the bar is now nice and cold

I love this place! They don't have it on the menu any more but one of my favorite things you can still order is Mediterranean style calamari. The gator appetizer has the best sauce too. My favorite experience there was when they had a live jazz band playing. It's very noisy and crowded and usually you have to wait for a table but it's SO worth it if you like seafood.

My boyfriend and myself have been discussing where we should eat for our first anniversary so he brought up a place called papadeux. He added some details about this resturant and the food was mostly southern themed. Also, the cost is a bit pricey but worth the trip to dine there. I decided to read up the reviews and did some light skimming based on people's experiences here.

Finally, on our anniversary we drove up to papadeux which was around 8 - 8:30 when we got there. Luckily, they closed at 10pm so *whew*. lol. 

I already knew what I wanted due to looking at other people's reviews on which entrees were good. 

The place was really lovely and words can't describe how romantic this could be coming here on our first anniversary *hearts*

When we arrived, it was pretty empty and very dim too, I wasn't sure how to take it but I was just nervous and excited to arrive to such a lovely and uppity place. 

We were seated immediately and our waiter was Johnny. I really loved our waiter! He was very attentive, very well mannered and had a really good intuition which he could anticipate our expectations and such. I was so awed and wowed by this waiter and there couldn't be anything more lovely then having a wonderful and smooth service.

He asked if this was our first time here and I mentioned that my boyfriend has been here once but this is my first time so Johnny came around my side and opened up my menu and just went through each section of the menu and explained a bit of some of the popular dishes for each category. Which i loved! *hearts*

so I picked out an appetizer, I don't remember what the name of the appetizer was but it was really good! I had the lobster bisque soup with lobster chunks in it....oh man that was soooooooooooo delicous and the lobster was a bit chewy but still tastey!

 Then I had the costa rican naked tilapia the 7oz, now that was seriously good *drools*

But in between our dishes, johnny kept checking up on us and communicating about our food and the time which was very excellent customer service...i mean his service was so top notch I couldn't have been any more happier *smiles*

He also was talking story to us and I loved that. I really could tell that he was very laid back and wanted to get to know us a bit and also asked if there was anything he could do for us. He also was curious if there was a special occasion as to why we were here and I mentioned that it was our first year anniversary and he smiled and congratulated us *blushes* I seriously felt that johnny just knew we were here on a special occasion and he has a really good intuition. Again, such an awesome waiter!

towards the end of our lovely meal both of us were getting a bit full and I must admit that the food at papadeux is really rich but delicious food *drools* I couldn't admit defeat yet and I went on to getting desert . I got the banana bread pudding and I was sooo full but I was determined to finish it so I wolf that sucker down. lmao. Though I was bloated and full and...just wanted to roll out instead of walking. lmao. food was really good.

In the end, my first experience went so smooth and perfect for our first anniversary that I was very very happy and I am hoping to come back again for another special occasion!

I do want to add that johnny was so lovely and helpful and he boxed up all of our left over meals. He is such an awesome waiter! If any of you guys get him, you'll be taken cared of very well!

Even though when we first came in this yahoo cut in front of us in line and called him a jerk...and he did not care. The wonderful hostess seen what happened and put us in front of him. 
This place is a total 5***** restaurant, to me a ways. 
I am what is called a picky, picky person. But, our server Kody was one amazing person. Very friendly, over the top informative, thee best. The food and drinks (drink, Garden of Eden)... were the best I have had in quite some time. I have been to some other places that were in equivalent pricing and quality food. They can't even surpass this place. 
Yes, it was our first time here. We will be back.

What a great place to eat! My brother and I have had lunch here a couple of times and the food has been excellent both times.

We tried the alligator bits. As cliche' as it may sound, it "tastes like chicken".

Although people always make fun of me for it, I like catfish. I ordered the blackened catfish with dirty rice and it was excellent. Portions are very large and I couldn't finish my meal (although not for lack of trying). My brother had the tilapia on one occasion and a mixed seafood dish on another. Both were great.

The seafood tastes fresh, the location is great and the service staff is friendly. Also, I love the patio in the entrance area. Highly recommended.

EVERYTHING was delicious!! Our food, appetizers & drinks. We left there happy, full - totally satisfied. This location was everything I thought it would be. I've only been to the location in Atlanta but so happy I got a chance to visit this location also!

I was in phoenix for the day and had a craving for oysters on the half shell.  Living in a small town in northern Arizona a person does not have that luxury.  Went there for lunch ordered the blue point oysters, gumbo and shrimp poor boy. The oysters were  ice cold and fresh as you will find anywhere. Everything there was great including the service.  I will be back.

I eat here regularly, and always have a pleasant experience.  I am absolutely addicted to their green beans in lemon butter sauce.  They have excellent Salmon and believe it or not, their chicken dish is one of the best around, even for a seafood restaurant.  I have had some incredible waiters and waitresses! Very attentive and engaging!  Great customer service, and they really make the experience just that much more wonderful.  A waitress in particular comes to mind, which has served me over four times now.  Julia is her name, and she absolutely did a fabulous job! So so so many good things to say about her!!!  There are a few other waitresses that really have gone above and beyond in service.  Im terrible at names, and for the life of me, cannot remember the others.  But I am always blown away by how fabulous their wait staff is at this restaurant!!!

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Parking: Not an issue at all since I walked here from my hotel, but there's a massive parking lot with many available spaces.

Ambiance: The ambiance and decor immediately transport you to the bayou, although I have never been to the bayou and only know it from what I've seen in the media.  Went twice during my stay in Phoenix.  Once during dinner and also a to-go order for lunch.  During dinner, it was very dim and some would say too dim to even see what you are eating.  Very loud so you can forget about having a nice, tranquil conversation with whomever you are dining alongside.

Service: DINNER - service was ok.  I got really irked when I asked for recommendations from our waiter.  Their menu is massive and I had a hard time deciding what to get.  I asked for some recommendations and the waiter immediately blurted out the most expensive thing on the menu and nothing else.  Hmm so just one recommendation...do you really think that's good, or are you just fishing for a bigger bill which will lead to a bigger tip?  Water refills were on time, and the wait staff was for the most part attentive, so the recommendation thing was the only major downfall.
LUNCH - Called in my order and said it would be ready in 10-15 min.  Walked over from my hotel (about a 10-15 min walk) and went inside.  Hostess pointed me to the to-go pick-up area.  Went over and waited for another 5 min before being attended to.  Paid for my order and waited another 5 min before receiving my food.  Waited a total of 20-25 min for my food.  Not that big of a deal, but they should know this for future reference.

Food: DINNER - After receiving a short-ended recommendation, I had to look over the menu a little bit more so my table mates placed their orders first.  I ended up getting the Crawfish Etoufee.  The dish was filled with crawfish.  Everything tasted fine except the white rice.  I'm Filipino so I've had my fair share of rice in my lifetime.  This rice tasted like minute rice.  That might fly in Phoenix, but in my world I expect something a little better.  At least the rest of the dish kinda sorta made up for it.  Portions are huge!  Everyone at my table had leftovers.  I would've had leftovers too but I was pretty hungry and ended up leaving super stuffed!
LUNCH - I ordered the "Louisiana" Seafood Gumbo & Shrimp Po Boy.  Now this was good!  Gumbo had a bounty of different seafood and tasted awesome.  The po boy had plenty of fried shrimp.  The bread on the po boy could have been better.  When I dipped the po boy into the gumbo MAN OH MAN was that BANGIN!!  Here's a tip for a new menu item: instead of a "French Dip," how bout a 'FRENCH QUARTER' DIP = Shrimp Po Boy + ("Louisiana" Seafood Gumbo - white rice).  Dip the po boy in the gumbo and as Chef Emeril Lagasse would say BAM!!!

Overall: 3.5 STARS this place is A-OK.  It is a bit overpriced.  If it weren't for the great lunch I had, I probably would have given it a lower rating.  Get the GUMBO and PO BOY and you won't be disappointed.

Okay so this place is pure indulgence. Not a restaurant for someone trying to watch the calories. Long story short: the food was excellent, atmosphere fun, service great, and desserts AMAZING. 

The long review: we were able to call ahead which was a lifesaver. This place was BUSY and for good reason. We waited about 15 minutes where others were being quoted 45-60. When we got seated we started with the alligator. It was fun to try. I honestly think it tasted like any other meat since it was battered and fried. Anything tastes good fried, right?  What made it special was the dipping sauce. I liked it. For dinner my husband ordered some type of fish with the dirty rice. I could not stop eating his rice. I would love to know the secret ingredient.  I ordered the shrimp platter and it was heavenly. The shrimp with crab cakes on top was seriously something I will be craving. 

The portions are huge. We were so stuffed and yet could not resist taking a peek at the desserts. We ended up taking them home to eat later after we walked off some of the food we ate. We dropped them off and later when we got home to eat them they were still delicious. 

We got the bread pudding and banana pudding. I don't usually care for bread pudding but they have converted me with theirs. The next day we ate the banana pudding and again- I am converted. We bought our babysitter the chocolate cake and she seemed to really like it. 

Definitely will be returning!

Food was very good. I ordered a half dozen Gulf oysters. It took 30 minutes to serve them. My dining buddy finished his appetizer and waited to order his main course.

I ordered a second glass of wine which took 10 minutes. Maybe our server, Alexa, was overwhelmed but it sucked.

If I return, I will sit at the bar.

F
We know it is a chain, but the food is consistent and good.  It is a little expensive and can get crowded.

Such good bread and butter at the beginning we knew it would be good! The Sea bass was delicious but my spinach was undercooked! Also the crab dip is Such good bread and the Seanad was delicious! Also the crab dip is so good! We are stuffed! It's a little pricey but good!so good! We are stuffed! It's a little pricey but good!

We've been here several times and enjoyed the happy hour. We went for a dinner last week for my birthday and remembered why we hadn't gone for a full meal here in about five years. The food is fine, but overpriced. A small cup of gumbo is $9, which isn't worth it as it's just okay, not great, and it isn't like any gumbo I've had before. It's like vegetable soup with a few shrimp thrown in.
It's the service that needs so much improvement. It was a busy night, and we we're shown to a table that didn't have any utensils or napkins. The hostess didn't notice, the server didn't notice and the person who brought our apps out didn't notice. With our food sitting there getting cold, I left the dining room where we were seated and went into the main room and found napkins and utensils on a table, and as I headed back, I ran into our server and told her that I'd come out to get our utensils myself. She smiled and said very cheerfully, "Oh, that's fine!" As if I'd been apologizing.
By the time our meals came out I'd finished my cocktail and asked the person who brought our food for another and she said she'd get it. 25 minutes later, I'm done with my meal, and our original server walked by, saw my empty glass, and said, "Oh yeah, I was suppose to put an order in for another." Says that to us, then runs off before I can say that I didn't want it any more. She brought it two minutes later and I drank half really quickly because we were paying for it, but we were done.

I had reservations at 8pm on Feb 10th, for 17. 17 wasn't able to make it which they stated was fine. It was 14 of us. They informed me that as long as majority of my party was there they'd seat us by 8p, well my whole party of 14 was at the establishment by 745. I informed them that my party was here they reassured me they'd get us seated. 805 comes around we're still waiting by the bar, my party was hungry and their feet were getting tired. I asked the, rude and dismissive, woman upfront and one stated their getting the tables together now, it'll be just a moment longer. So, 820/830 rolls around, now "it's the party won't leave, they've been there for over 3hrs, and i cant ask them to leave, Im sorry"...and this was stated by Kathy the Hispanic manager. We were not seated until after 9pm...approx 930 was when my party and I were seated at two different tables, not one as promised. The waiter Mike was awesome but the food was bland, and mediocre I did not eat my entree and neither did my friend next to me. It seemed rushed, taking they close at 10, it might've been. The manager did offer us free appetizers...but my whole birthday experience was ruined because of how they lied to us and then separated us at the tables, and made less than mediocre food. When I asked at 805 if we were getting seated she should have gotten the manager and told me the truth then, and the manager kept stating we'd be seated soon, but soon was an hr and a half later. Had I known they gave our table to another party we could've left and ate somewhere else. My friends/family and I loved Pappadeux before this horrible experience. We won't be giving them anymore of our service. Thanks for making my birthday experience and unforgettable one by the way we were treated.

I've been here several times and the food is excellent.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because on my the last visit my date and I were bombarded by flies (we sat towards the street by a window)
However the food is amazing!  Seriously, the only thing i've ever had bad here were all the dates I've been on.
The mediterranean calamari is orgasmic, the lobster bisque is yummy.  The service is good.  Get there early or else you'll be waiting, either for a seat at the bar or in the dining area.

This place is awesome!!! I've never been here before and when we showed up it was packed. No where to park and the wait was an hour to an hour and a half. So long story short we tried sitting in the bar and there was some miscommunication about where we were sitting. Meagan came and totally took care of us. I was shocked at her resolution for the problem. We were seated right away. I was like.... what!!!  She didn't have to do that. The service was great. The meal was so delicious. I just can't get over their level of customer service. I can't wait to come back and visit and eat here with my husband (we are from Dan Diego).  Oh by the way our server was Kaylene. She was so sweet and adorable. She played along with us and was funny. Loved her!! Thanks for making my last night with my girlfriend a memorable one!

We went on a Friday night. Very busy. My husband had the MahiMahi with Dirty rice it was Bomb!! I had the shrimp, scallops with pasta which too me was way too salty and unedible. The waiter was very good offering me a replacement. Great customer service but very pricy for the ambiance.

Had lunch here today It was great, the food was great We had the Appetizer Trio, Pasta Mardi Gras, and the Mixed Seafood Grill. It was way more food than the two of us could eat. The server was very attentive and very helpful. I would recommend Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen to anyone who likes Cajun food or Seafood there is so much to choose from and basically the server said we could change anything on the menu to have it made just the way we wanted. AWESOME

Haven't been here a long time not much has changed food is still pretty good for a large chain way better than Red Lobster I have the sea bass it was cooked perfectly very juicy great texture he can tell his fresh the calamari was okay at best little cold when I came out not very crispy didn't like the red sauce the white one was was little better but not much now that deserves a delicious at the banana putting and the bread pudding both are excellent we wanted the praline cheesecake which I've had in the past I think it's probably the best she's ever had but they were out one thing I did notice about here can see everyone has some kind of cocktail they do all of delicious though maybe next time I have to get one now for the service was it very very slow she didn't know much about the menu wasn't helpful I even had to go find my own picture of water I understand that they were slammed busy but I don't know how many tables she hand and she was never really around overall it's better than most places we have in Phoenix bless you up to Scottsdale and pay $100 a person probably be back lunch is probably best time to go little slower and food seems taste better

The last few years while visiting our family in Phoenix, we seem to always fit in a visit here. Despite what my check-ins say, this was our 3rd visit and we have become quite the fans. The first time I came here, I was at the tail end of my pregnancy so instead of seafood, I chose the Pappardelle Pasta with spinach and butternut squash. It was pretty tasty but it was also pretty heavy.

This last two visits, I went for the live Maine lobster and I was in heaven. I thought it would be a lot of work but the kitchen did a really good job preparing it so the lobster meat came out of the shell really easy. This plate comes with pappardelle pasta but this last visit, I gave that to my little one to eat and got the cheese grits with andouille and corn for my side.  It was a good choice because not only were the grits super yummy, the pasta was the perfect size for the little one. She's going through a phase where all she wants is noodles and broccoli so it fit the profile. Even though the menu is extensive, this might have to be my go-to item on the menu. Can you ever go wrong with live main lobster? 

This restaurant is really large which means it can pack a lot of people in...which means it's LOUD but the perfect place to bring a toddler. ; ) To keep with her bedtime routine, we made a reservation for (5:15 pm) and still, we had to wait 10 minutes for our table. I was amazed how busy it already was. 

That being said, I'd highly recommend making reservations if you plan to come here. The place is a hot spot and I can see why.  We can't wait until our next years visit. ; )
Excellent service! Love the crab cakes! I don't think I've had one dish that wasn't good.
Super expensive but super delicious! Great for a special occasion with a good group of people.
love the place! it speaks for itself only thing is the long wait. What can you expect. After years of coming here it still a very nice and fun  place to have dinner and enjoy the live music.
Loved it. We always go and the food it great. The service is on point and the look is old fashioned. Reminds me of a simpler time.

What an interesting concept...

Seafood in the desert.

Nevertheless, it was very good and probably the best meal that I had in Phoenix.

The things that we ordered:

1. Oysters
2. Gumbo
3. Ahi Tuna
4. Fried Alligator 
5. Calamari

The food was delicious. Although I was hesitant, the alligator was quite delightful - It was surprisingly flavorful and tender.  The servers were very accommodating and it was an great atmosphere.

I'd definitely come back here.

Pappadeaux's a bit difficult to get to but you would expect it to be difficult to find Cajun food this far west.  Really popular place for the weekend crowd but if you call about 15 minutes before arriving they will put you on the wait list so that's nice.  Decor is pretty good but the dining room is so big it sort of feels like a factory, maximize the number of times the tables can be filled and flipped.

Well, that's enough about that...bar was kind of disappointing especially since they do not carry any southern beers, no Abita no Dixie.  I was actually surprised about the beer selection being so sparse, if I remember correctly 8 choices, nothing really a standout.  The food....it was ok.  She had the steak...a rib eye if I remember correctly, it was not a 37$ steak by any means.  Presentation was not great at all  meat looked lumpy and misshapen.  I had the crawfish étouffée and fried crawfish.  It was ok...really nothing special.  Étouffée was by far much better than the fried but I did not walk away waiting to come back again.  For a starter I had a dozen raw oysters on the half shell.  They were the highlight of the night by far.  Nothing else really wowed either of us.  

Bottom line:  if you're craving some Cajun this is the place to go in the phoenix area, but you will probably not leave feeling like you just had a memorable experience.

A friend recommended Pappadeaux when I asked him where we should go for our anniversary dinner.  The restaurant itself is beautiful both inside and out.  We were greeted immediately upon entering and seated very quickly.  We didn't love where we were seated though, feeling as though we were in the middle of a walkway.  The dining room wasn't very full when we arrived, so we think we could have been seated in a less busy location, but it is what it is.  

We ordered the fried calamari appetizer and we're a bit disappointed in the size for the price.  There was a lot of just batter prices and fried artichokes (something we'd never had in calamari before), and not as much actual calamari.  We were concerned that our entree might be lacking too, but they most definitely were not.  I ordered the Texas redfish Pontchartrain which was delicious!  It came in a le!on butter sauce with some shrimp and crabmeat and dirty rice.  Hubby ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette, which was bacon wrapped shrimp filled with Monterey Jack and a jalapeno sliver with dirty rice.  He really enjoyed his as well.  The entrees were a great size.  For dessert we had crème brulee, which was very good too.  

Overall, a very good meal and we will probably return, although we're not likely to order the calamari again.  And really, we didn't need an appetizer because they brought out warm, crusty French bread and that is really all the appetizer we needed.

My wife and children splurged on me for father's day and brought me here knowing how much I love it.  We were sat immediately which anyone who knows this place is a miracle!  ....we were thrilled!  The place was buzzing with people being sat and I heard each of the wait staff we passed say happy Father's day when we were greeted by our waitress, Ashly, not even as much as a welcome to Pappadeauxs....  We ordered our drinks and when my martini was served it look half full so my wife asked in a comical way where the rest of it was and if looks could kill...she would have been vaporized!  We are a very comical family and when we go out, which is usually limited to special times or celebrations, we lime to have fun and Ashly wasn't having any part of it.  She was strictly business and throughout the entire meal we never got as much as a smile.  We had a heck a time getting her attention whenever we needed refills or any service.
