We cannot complain of the food but we were VERY disheartened by the service we received and if we choose to spend our next special night out Pappadeauxs we will make sure we are not being waited on by Ashly.
Delicious food. Audry-our waitress-AMAZING! Took care of us quick and with a great smile. Prices were a tad more than we expected. Alligator was excellent with fresh squeezed lemon.

I do not usually review chains as a general rule; However I made an exception in this case.  It has an unusual location (on a freeway surface road) If I could give the service 100 stars I would in a second! In a busy restaurant on a Saturday night I almost expect less than par service.  The management in this place is definitely doing something right tons of customers tons of staff so we never wanted for anything (refills exc.) My fried shrimp was good not great and the fries were borderline room temperature and tasted like they had been sitting under the heat lamp for a while.  The atmosphere was so cute and creole warm! And I can not rave enough about the staff, even walking out every employee we came in contact wished us a good evening even servers that was not ours.  I will be back to try something different for sure!

Our meal at Pappadeux was excellent, I ordered the crawfish étouffée/Fried crawfish combo.  I was a little leary as I have traveled this year to New Orleans and even the server wasn't sure how it would compare.  Note - it was excellent. My dad had the catfish (as always) and it did not disappoint.  My mom only had the lobster bisque and a wedge said and again she loved it.  

Mom also had Creme Brûlée and again it was very good. She loved it and I liked it which is something since I rarely care for Creme Brûlée! 

The special cocktail which was made with watermelon was also excellent.  

The restaurant did a great job with seating is as my dad uses a walker so closer is better and this is a huge restaurant!

This is my brother's favorite place to dine, and now I see why. My husband and I took my brother and his family out to Papadeaux's during our visit to Phoenix. 

Having just visited NOLA last year, I was impressed by the ambiance. The service was TOP NOTCH, and the food...my goodness! I got the Morrocan Salmon and Cous Cous...SO DELICIOUS!!!! I'm adding Papadeaux's to my food itinerary, right next to Karson's Kornbread in DTPHX. Oh and don't sleep on the banana pudding!
Always a good time there.  Food is great and the service is amazing.  I need one to open one up in California.

Went here for lunch and everything was great. Ordered the crab spinach dip for app and it was phenomenal! For my entrée I had the seafood mixed grill it came with shrimp, tuna, & scallop on top of dirty rice which was delicious with a little kick. For dessert we had the bourbon bread pudding, oh so delicious. It cam out hot with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, warning...this dessert is not for kids, you can taste all of bourbon goodness.

I Love LOVE LOVE this place!!!! The Bread melts in your mouth, Butter is so yummy!!! The Seafood is so Fresh and Perfectly seasoned..You can order Anything off the Menu and be Happy.. Drinks OMG again SOOOO FRESH,CREATIVE AND TASTEEEEE..I have even ordered Pies to go home on Holidays...ok I'm done..JUST GO..Thank me later lol

I've had Pappadeaux in Dallas, Austin, Albuquerque and Phoenix and was more than satisfied every single time!  This is one of my favorite chain seafood restaurants!  The quality of the seafood at every location is suburb.  Big portions and flavor galore!

I must admit ... this location I think has the slowest service ... even at the bar!
The alligator bites are so tender and tasty.. Thier fish is always fresh and cooked just right. If you have room for dessert try the bread pudding.

If you want Cajun food in Arizona, this is the place to go. 

If you want Oysters (remember, in season in months with an "R" in them) this is the best place in the valley to get them! 

If you want a giant hurricane with a skewer of fruit sitting on top, this is the place for that as well! What can I say, I love an alcoholic slushy!

My personal favorites are the Pappas greek salad, the gumbo and the crawfish etoufee. 

You'll pay a fair bit, but you'll never leave Pappadeaux hungry or unimpressed!

Being from Louisiana / Mississippi I have a special spot in my heart (and stomach) for Cajun food. If you want truly authentic Cajun food then look no further than this restaurant off the I-17. Everything is great. No matter if you want broiled fish or fried seafood the taste is awesome and the price is good. The raw oysters are great. The crawfish platter is fanstastic. The crawfish bisque is to die for. The boudin is authentic and good served on a bed of white rice. The only other place in town for Cajun food is Baby Kay's. I'm posting a review of them as well.

Was it craving satisfied? Yes, indeed. This place took us down memory lane to our many trips back to New Orleans. I'm in love with their Mardi Gras Pasta. I even had left over sauce that I ate with rice it was so tasty and delightful.

Mostly disappointed. I'm from New York and no stranger to fresh seafood. I understand we're in Arizona and flown in is about as fresh as you can get. Be warned not EVERYTHING is flown in daily. Only one page of the menu is. My boyfriend and I shared frog legs, crab Mac n cheese and the Chilean sea bass. I will say the Mac n cheese was freaking delicious but I tasted very little crab. The frogs legs were the saddest of the 3. Just plain fried like the heap of French fries it comes with. No finesse or seasoning. A lot of their menu is just fried seafood. The sea bass was ok. I don't think they treated the fish amazingly and the toppings/accompaniments are lackluster. Overall nothing was really elevated or screamed fresh seafood. For the price and drive I will not be going back there. Check out little cleos for a much more exciting seafood experience.

Great seafood. I tried Alligator for the first time. It was pretty good. But the service could use a tune-up. My Son had Swordfish, I had Salmon, and my land lover Wife had Chicken. All were delicious and cooked perfectly. We love this place and will be back again.

Delicious seafood and expert staff who know their menu and their food inside and out. Expensive food but that is because their seafood is flown in by airplane fresh every single day. It is worth it. The dining area was a bit too crowded together, though.

Wow, super impressed! I've never been but have always heard about it. I generally try to stay away from huge chain restaurants, but this place wows. I started my meal with a 1/2 dozen raw oysters, super fresh and just perfect! I went with this blackened Mahi Mahi with crab, shrimp and crawfish in a spicy cream sauce. Holy hell, this dish was perfect. The seafood was cooked to perfection and everything seasoned well. All in all, a great meal and I'd definitely come back

I was in Phoenix for the NFL Pro Bowl last weekend and had to try this place because it came with a very good recommendation. We had a dozen Taxes oysters, fried alligators and calamaris for appetizers and for dinner we had seafood gumbo, lobster bisque, and a seafood grilled combo which came with shrimp, white fish, vegetables and rice. Huge portions of food. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and taste really good. The servers were really attentive to all their customers. Oh the spicy Bloody Mary were very good also.

My favorite restaurant in world and they are from Texas! They never disappoint me, great service, great food, great atmosphere, clean restrooms,
if I give it a negative mark it would be the wait to get in, there is always a wait but it is so worth it!
Thank you Pappadeauxs!

Pappadeaux's is by far my favorite seafood splurge in AZ! Although this place is a chain the customer service is always excellent as well as the food. I've been here many times and have never had anything I didn't think was extraordinary. This last time I went I ordered the Crawfish Etouffee with Dirty rice; every bite was loaded with crawfish it was so much I could only eat half. It was fairly priced at $20.95, which at any other restaurant I would tucked my tail and hide but the food here is well worth the price. For appetizers my favorites include the Lobster Bisque, Fried Alligator and Crab Fingers. The only thing I don't like about Pappadeaux's is they don't have free refills on the Strawberry Lemonade.  Which again is fantastic, it has a delicate balance of sweet and sour but the glass is so loaded with ice you're literally paying $3.50 per glass on about  cups of actual juice.  The atmosphere is fun the lighting is more on the dim side but it fits the New Orleans theme throughout the restaurant. This place handles large crowds like a champ, my group this past Saturday was a party of 12 and the server had no problems with remembering who ordered what, as well as properly splitting the check. I highly recommend the restaurant to any seafood lover. If you don't like seafood there are a few other options but not many; the few they have are well executed. I also recommend trying out the Chef's Special of the Night. This place has an outdoor patio and the band is always playing on the weekend which serves as great entertainment when waiting for your table.
Chilean sea bass is to die for. Bartender ryan was excellent.  Outstanding food and service. Oysters pappadeux were incredible.

One of the only spots in the Valley that I'll eat raw oysters.  Yes, I said it.  We live in the Valley.  No large bodies of water nearby. So, the chances of getting fresh seafood is slim to none. But I've always found Pappadeaux's to come through in that department! Not only are their oysters the bomb dot com but so are the crab fingers! I would also recommend picking out a lobster, most especially the larger ones to share because it is worth it! Desert is always great, too! We've celebrated birthdays and graduations here. I mean, what's not to celebrate here?! Staff are on top of their game and so is their food.
Food was ok but service and follow up was lacking...  waited over 20 minutes for water refills and just to check out was 15 minutes more than it should've been.

Came here the Saturday before Mother's day. It was busy, 1 hour and 45 minute wait, which we were expecting. We called earlier to make reservations, but were told all reservations booked up 2 weeks prior.

Got drinks & apps at the bar to pass the time. Closed out the tab there as it could not be transferred to the table.

When we finally sat, our waitress Megan did not bring out utensils. I had a few questions about the menu, she didn't know the answers. She compred some dishes as "similar" as her only form of description and after a simple google search, I found they were very opposite. We started to eat some bread after placing our orders, but there was no Megan around to ask for napkins. I saw a bucket and grabbed some for the table. A manager saw and half-apologized. 

Our food came 30 minutes later and my dish was completely wrong. Megan claimed my hard shell crab was soft shell. She claimed she brought me a dish that wasn't on the menu. She tried to cover up her mistake. I wasn't having the lies and just asked her to take it back. Not once did she apologize or say sorry. A different manager came over and gave me the right dish to go. 

Started to eat a side of the dirty rice someone at my table got, it had a LARGE onion shell in it and was very dry.

We tried to get our check but Megan disappeared. Waited another 10 minutes to flag her down.

It seemed they were understaffed - even though they had been expecting this crowd for over 2 weeks. Kinda felt bad for Megan, but that wasn't an excuse. Please steer clear of this place. Customer service and food are subpar.

This is our go to restaurant! I have never had a bad experience. The food is delicious, the environment reminds me of New Orleans and the staff is so friendly. Esther is our favorite waitress! We can go months without coming in and when we do, she remembers us immediately. We love the courtyard that greets you upon arrival and if you're lucky enough you can catch some live music on the weekends. The raw oysters are a must for us, they are always served super cold and taste great. My absolute favorite dish is the Pasta Mardi Gras. Flavor explosion!! I always make the mistake of filling up on the hot delicious bread and butter, but it works out since I always package the left overs and have a second meal (typically around midnight the same night )

A bit overpriced, I think. It's really good... but not 5-star amazing. I've gone here many times before, and I'll come back eventually. This is a great place to take a date, but some of the seating is just awful. Who wants to sit near the entrance or on the edge of a hall with people constantly walking by and bumping your chair? Kind of annoying... especially when the place is empty and there are far better seats.

The little things are what get you 5 stars.

Very nice restaurant. Ordered takeout and sat at the bar while we waited. Friendly professional bartenders. I'm not a fan of calamari. As a matter fact I really dislike it however companion ordered it and of course I thought I'd try some again. It was delicious perfectly made.  The food came out promptly and it was very good except my rice and beans or very very spicy but good. The portions were also very good. I would most definitely go back to this restaurant the food was excellent the staff was friendly and professional and the wait was not long at all. I want to add that they don't have Jambolaya on the menu. Really strange for seafood place that spouts Cajun in Louisiana style seafood. Very big disappointment
The food and the service was great. Kirk,our server, made our visit totally awesome. I would recommend this place if you love seafood and Cajun food. The cook George did an awesome job too.

Overpriced greasy, slimy food with below average service. Service was so so. Loud inside. My mother was looking forward to coming here and she couldn't wait to leave. Similar to Red Lobster. If you are looking for tasty seafood and a fun atmosphere, I'd say the Angry Crab is a good place

The food was great!!!  We ordered gumbo, fried oysters, calamari, and a crawfish broil. The oysters and calamari were cooked to perfection!  Best I ever had. The crawfish boil was good as well. Seasoning was not over powering and 2.5 pounds were more than enough for my table of 3 to share. Only minor complaint I have was that the crawfish may have been overcooked as the meet wasn't so easy to get out of the shell. Either that or they weren't fresh. 

Everything else was good. Service was a little bit slow but to be expected on a Friday night when every table in the house is occupied.
This is a favorite place to go for us on a cold rainy day for some Gumbo and Cheesy Grits.

The gulf oyster on 1/2 she'll  were good. I love their own sauce. And on special for $9.95/fox. Love it!"
M
We usually love Papadeaux French bread but The waitress brought us a not so fresh loaf of bread. That was disappointing.. Asked her to bring us a fresh baked one. Brought us same kind. Papadeaux either changed their French bread recipe or the bread back in the kitchen is just all stale and microwaved to warm up. First time to be disappointed with Papadeaux French bread. All their restaurants in Texas serve great fresh bread but Phoenix I guess has to microwave theirs. Greatly disappointing.

Happy Hour and Calamari with the fresh marinara is great! Also the Fondue is rich and cheeses. Customer Service is hit or miss. Some days they are fabulous while others they are dull and unhelpful and I end up having to reorder my food because it was incorrect.

OMG! I really love this place! The best seafood place in Phoenix! It's pricey but really worth every penny! The food will never disappoint. I like the fact that they have FRESH seafood deliver EVERYDAY! THAT'S A HUGE PLUS we're far from the waters. Highly recommended to anyone who love seafood!

Food was amazing, service was exceptionally suburb, and overall a wonderful experience. I ordered the table size greek salad with 4 oz of lump crab (enough for 2 people) and the seafood kabob lunch portion. Sad we don't have a Pappadeaux in San Diego! But glad I visit PHX for work often enough and this is my go-to for lunch. 5 stars for the exceptional service our server Mia provided. She was attentive, friendly, on top of our refills and such a natural! She also provided great recommendations that we actually chose and was glad that we did. My colleague and I left as happy campers (as usual)!

We went here yesterday evening to celebrate a birthday. Made the reservation several days in advance since we had a party of 20 expected. Really enjoy Pappadeaux's. We come here often enough and at times in larger groups. Once we were seated we were greeted by a really personable server. The food here is always great! I understand that a party of 20 can be challenging. We let the server know we would be doing separate checks right off the bat. I'm not sure what happened but the ends of the table were asked for a drink order and appetizer but the middle was never approached. Waters came out and bread. Next thing I know appetizers were out and I never got to put one in so I just figured ok entree it is. Well once again server came out to take the order sporadically. She would take an order and than walk away. I thought it was a little strange why not take all the entree orders at once? Well after the entrees came out no one came out to check on us or they would have found out we were missing three entrees. When those of us who got our food were finished we were left waiting for the check. Several in the party had to try and find someone to bring us the check and take the payments. At this point the dinner had gone on longer than what anyone had planned for and everyone needed to go home. We didn't even get to do cake and sing happy birthday because by the end everyone was feeling really disappointed and tired. The missing entrees eventually came out at the end of the meal. No manager came by to apologize for the service or to make sure everything was ok. Overall the food and drinks that did come out were great but the execution left little to be desired.

Fried alligator no way! Is what I've said before trying it here. We ordered the appetizer that also came with a cheese crawfish n shrimp fondue that I wanted to pick up and drink straight out of the cup. The portions are absolutely amazingly enormous! I was stuffed after the appetizer that could have easily fed 4 people. I am so glad we decided to share our main entree (Pasta Mardi Gras). We enjoyed the little kick it had which we later found out from our waitress she specially adds a little chili flake. If you like the spice might want to ask. I was very appreciative of the mindfulness of our waitress as well as she split our meal for us. The atmosphere is a little loud but that has to be because people love this place. We went on a Saturday night at 10 pm and the place was still full. The hostess told us that they just got over a rush! That speaks volumes. I stand by what Rachel Ray says, "You go where the lines are" it means it's good!
Excellent Dinner.  Great food, service at a fair price. One of my favorites in Phoenix area.

Thoroughly enjoyed my recent date night at Pappadeaux.  The Hubs and I have been dying to try this place out thanks to all these amazing reviews on yelp and boy are they right.  The place was packed on a Saturday night at 5pm, which is a good indication one is in for a treat.  We made a reservation just in case, since we were going to see a show later that night.  Our waiter greeted us quickly and was very friendly and upbeat.  He told us the specials and took our drink order while we looked over the huge menu.

In the end we got the lobster roll appetizer, halibut, and bread pudding for dessert.  Everything was soooo... good and very filling.  The lobster appetizer was full of flavor, especially the sauce it came with.  The halibut was cooked perfectly and the grits on the side were amazing.  We loved the bread pudding, which was HUGE for the price.  I wish there weren't as many raisins, but all in all it was great.

So glad to have found this place!  I know it's a chain, which I usually don't love, but the old-school vibe and good quality/quantity of food made up for that.  We'll be back for sure!

I absolutely love this restaurant! I have been coming here for years, especially when they have their seasonal crawfish and the all you can eat lobster deal. Their crawfish is nicely seasoned as it includes a corn and few small potatoes. My good friend always order the soft shell crabs and lobster bisque, both are delicious. Then again, all their food is delicious. 
The one thing I find good is their customer service. I've had a few visits where my food came out cold, too slow, or wrong order (which often happens at restaurants anyways) and the manager came over to apologize and comped that meal, even when honestly half the time I don't even realize it.
 If you are a seafood fan, don't hesitate to come here. You won't be disappointed.

Best seafood on my 10 years of Taekwondo trips. 

How to describe it?

Authentic

Creative

No parallel

Must comeback

Worth every dip of sauce 

Don't want to leave

Definitely will come back

Don't want to fight in other state championship

Eating here is more like an experience than just a meal. I had the salmon Yvette tonight, it was perfectly cooked, in a luxurious citrus sauce with crawfish and shrimp... This is definitely the best seafood dish I've had in Phoenix to date... Go to pappadeaux! You won't be disappointed!

Absolutely extraordinary. Best seafood I've had in a long time. If you've ever been to Savannah this really has the feel of "The Pirates House".  The food, the atmosphere, the server were just sensational.  Having grown-up in MD, I consider myself a crab-cake aficionado, best I've had east of the Mississippi in 20 years.

Went to Pappadeuxs seafood kitchen tonight and has always had a wonderful dinner, the lobster was fabulous my son loved the fried crawfish dinner oh and his fav soup crawfish bisque cream style, this really is our favorite restaurant every experience is fabulous and our waitress Yelena (the spelling of her name may not be right so I do apologize for that) was so sweet and took great care of us we hope to see her again on our next visit which will be real soon specially when the crab finger dinner comes back ( that's my fav)
Everything about this restaurant is fabulous the food, drinks, staff, atmosphere definitely recommend. Thanks again Yelena.

I have been going to this restaurant since it opened. I moved away from Phoenix for a while and couldn't wait to get back to my favorite restaurant; however, this was NOT the food quality I would have ever expected from here... We had soft shell crab (which was reeeeally small, soggy and had the taste of burned, old fryer oil.)  We also had the very tasteless and disappointing, ($20)Calamari appetizer and Crawfish Etouffee (yuck). The over-priced, baby portioned Brussels sprouts were amazing, however...  The only thing that saved the evening was the amazing server, Johnny! Simply wonderful service! It is 2 days later and we are just grateful we didn't end up sick...  So sad.  What a beautiful restaurant with wonderful servers, too bad the food quality has gone so far downhill. Until Friday, this was my favorite restaurant and with the money we spend there I am almost afraid to go back.

I have been here many times....I keep coming back for the blue point oysters, even though sometimes they are out but I still come back in hopes I will get them eventually...lol The service is great every time, the servers are fast and always willing to go the extra mile. 
It's not really your romantic type of a restaurant, the table are very close to each other and it is very loud in there but the food is amazing!

The only reason I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars is because the atmosphere inside is terrible. (too crazy, very loud, poor lighting, high traffic)

Seating outside is another story, especially in the fall. It is beautiful. The food is great and definitely exceeded my expectations. I ordered the Atlantic Salmon as I had heard it was excellent there. I've never been a big fan of salmon and have had several bad experiences with it in other restaurants. My first bite was timid, but by the end I thought I was going to start licking the crumbs off my cedar plank. Amazing. Absolutely amazing.

My dish also came with some of the largest asparagus I've had. I'm always very leery of large asparagus as it is almost always too firm. Once again, grilled to perfection just like the salmon. 

The wait staff was also very courteous and enjoyable. Overall a great experience after we had moved to the courtyard area. I highly suggest, especially if you are a fan of all you can eat lobster.

I have never been disappointed by the chain or this restaurant. After taking my folks here years ago, it became a "must visit" on their annual spring road trip to the Southwest. This year was no exception, even with a glitch in service.

The patio with water feature was perfect in April and we could talk at normal volume in contrast to the sometimes loud interior.

We placed two orders for grilled trout with shrimp and sauteed spinach and my mother ordered salmon with dirty rice. I got a mixed greens salad and my father got a beefsteak tomato salad with crab meat. The salads were excellent.

The fish was done just right and nicely presented. The trout plate was just the right amount, while my mother left some of the rice on her plate.

The one glitch was a mix up, missing my father's entree. As soon as the first two main courses came out, the waiter realized he had made an error. A manager showed up quickly to apologize, assure us they were fixing the problem, and offer a cup of chowder or bisque. My father took the lobster bisque and the second trout plate came out rapidly. 

In the end, the bill showed that they comped my father's whole meal! Way to make things right. Again, we had a great meal with unrushed conversation on the patio. We will certainly plan on returning here and have a strong positive view of the brand.

The server and staff was very accommodating and attentive. This is my third try as I have not wanted to wait an hour just to eat here. So it's after lunch hour and the crowd is gone, the pace slow and relaxing. I'm looking forward to a great experience and delicious food! 

For appetizers it was lump crab and spinach, it was tasty but no crab flavor, then I got a side of gumbo. Gumbo as I remembered it living in Louisiana and how I learned to make it was usually in a thick broth, what I got was basically a wet salty soup, so salty I stopped after the first spoonful. 

Moving on, my main course arrived, I ordered the lunch combo of blacken catfish on a bed of dirty rice and shrimp (4 pieces) creole over white rice. Again it was so salty I could not eat the catfish, my white rice along with anything supposing to resemble a vegetable was soggy. I ate 10% of what I ordered, the rest was thrown away. 

Perhaps this is the after lunch crowd quality of left over or watered down food, I'm not sure. What I am sure of, is that I will not return for the quality of food for the price point was not present. I would not return there even if they offered me my next meal at no charge.

Also surprising my server did not question the amount of food left on the plates, especially after I mentioned how salty the food was. I should have requested a refund, the other party with me also complained of the food and stopped eating citing an upset stomach. I suppose if I had an adult beverage I may have tolerated the feasting of the horrible food... good thing I do not drink.
Excellent service!  I've been coming here for years on my way from L.A. to Tucson and I can always expect top notch service!

I had been to other Pappadeaux restaurants in the past but this was the first time at this one. It was a nice evening so we sat on the patio. There is a fountain and it is actually quite lovely. Our server was very attentive. It seems like service is a priority for this chain. We started with the crab and spinach dip. My fiancé wanted to get a big spoon at eat it like a soup it is that good! I had the soft shell crab grilled....I am a huge fan of soft shell crab and only get to have them on rare occasions. My fiancé had the creole shrimp and grits. The grits were insanely delicious. We were actually very full but the dessert presentation was done for the table next to us. What a smart couple they ordered their own desserts because they all looked and sounded so good. Their pecan sweet potato pie is one of my all time faves. So good. If you have a special occasion, I highly recommend this place. It is pricey but good seafood usually is and this will not disappoint.

Holy wow. Choices galore! We had catfish which was perfectly fried in a super light batter and absolutely fresh! Talapia was ok, a little dry. The crawfish were New Orleans style and perfectly seasoned. The calamari to die for! If you go you must have the cheesy grits with corn and andouille sausage! We also tried the gator, a bit on the hot side but absolutely perfection and the wedge salad was crisp, cool and loaded with bacon and blue cheese bits! All in all not a thing wrong with the food and portions are substantial! The only reason they don't score a 5 is our server, served our drinks with his fingers placed firmly around the rim of our drinking glasses and my first jameson nd tonic was served in a dirty glass (yuck). A little work on serving etiquette and this is a 5 star easy! Eat well, live well! Enjoy

I'm giving this place a 5 star review because not only is the food excellent, the service was exceptional!   I've eaten here a few times and I can't review the meals I've eaten in the past and I'm sorry but my meal tonight was not seafood.  I went for their original Greek salad.  At the bar...solo.  bar help all work together, they all seem happy to be here and they are so polite and service oriented.   My salad was put together right at the bar so not only will it not get soggy in route from th kitchen, I was able to approve of everything that went into the salad.  Great experience.  Next time I will review thir Seafood meals!

I'm not usually big on chain restaurants but Pappadeaux's has consistently been good at every location I've been to.  I almost always get the Crawfish Etoufee.  I'm so addicted to that stuff.  I took my husband here for his birthday on our most recent visit and mentioned it was his birthday.  Hubs got to pick out any dessert he wanted, complimentary!  I know a lot of places do this but it was also a full size dessert.  Awesome!

Okay came here for a birthday dinner and ohemgee it was sooo packed...that place was literally poppin. We asked for a table for 6 and they told us it was an hour and a half wait (actually ended up being 1 and 15 min) but we decided to stay coz it was worth the wait!
They have a garden patio waiting area whichbwas very pretty and lush green on a nice spring night! If I wasn't starving that wait wouldn't have been bad with company... And there's always the bar while you are waiting (21+ only tho ) got me a pina colada! Yummmyyy tasted coconuty and creamy.

We got the apetizer trio to share but substituted calamari for the salmon. The other two were the fried alligator and shrimp/crawfish fondeux. Fried alligator was interesting but good...didn't like the sauce coz it was too salty. The fondeux was good but I still prefer peeling my own crawfish than it already mixed in a sauce(its part of the fun). And the calamari was breaded and crispy yummy!

I decided to order crispy atlantic salmon with maine lobster. The waitress told me that the lobster was only abiut 2 ounces (I guess I don't know what that estimate is because when my plate came out and I saw three tiny pieces of lobster) still considering... My plate was delicious even if was the most expensive plate on the table for 33 bucks and also the smallest portion. The salmon was a good size and yummy, also came with crispy shrimp that was seasoned very well and the tiny pieces of lobster with the side of roasted acorn squash (never had this before and it is freaking delicious and buttery). Everything was delicious and worth the wait!

We got a free dessert and another one for the table to share: brownie and key lime pie...eh... But they sure were pretty!

Our server was great! Her name was Lena :) love the ambience and I think there was live music earlier but i didn't know where it was coming from. It was a great time! Can't wait to go back here!!

Dinner was fair at best for the price. Mussels were sandy. Otherwise were tasty. My entree was lukewarm. My companions were hot. I ordered the crispy salmon-3 -4 new potato pieces and very woody asparagus. Drinks were slow coming out of thre bar.Waitress was doing her best. No reason to go back anytime soon.

My husband, mother, and I went to Pappadeaux's for a late lunch on Valentine's Day. We didn't realize it, but February 14th is smack dab in the middle of Mardi Gras, so Pappadeaux was quite busy! The courtyard is beautiful, though, with live music, ample seating, and this time popcorn, cheese, and sausage was being given out while you waited, along with bottled water and Mardi Gras beads. The wait was projected to be 30-45 minutes, but we were seated in 20 minutes. 

The food was delicious, as always, and the service was friendly and adequate to good. It was a very busy day, so I understand that it is difficult to keep the drinks full. I chose the Blackened Mahi Alexander Style, my husband chose the Blackened Mahi lunch special, and my mother got the Tilapia lunch special. The spices were bold and impressive. Loved the grilled shrimp with my dinner. For dessert, we got creme brûlée and pecan sweet potato pie with vanilla bean ice cream. So. Totally. Delicious. This is one of my favorite places to get creme brûlée. 

I always look forward to my lunches and dinners at Pappadeaux. I was not disappointed!

This place is just consistent. Been a fan for years and am not sure why it is not in our regular rotation. But, I have had the opportunity to lunch here the past two Fridays. Our server Audrey was fantastic as always. Try the bacon wrapped shrimp brochettes and sausage/seafood gumbo, of course.

I have not been to New Orleans for a while but last weekend I felt as if I were there again, WOW!! This place is great, the ambiance, the food ,the people, a cornucopia of what was to come. We started with oysters on the half shell, fresh,briny, and sooo cold I got brain freeze. I've had frog legs from Alabama to Zanesville and these were far by the best ever fall off bone croaking delicious flippers I ever had. My 1 1/2 lb. fresh Maine lobster was so sweet I did not even think twice about using the clarified butter. The claws were as big as a baseball mitt. Oh, by the way I did have the wedge lettuce with blue cheese and bacon dressing and again it was the best. The rest of our party had food fit for a king and remarked on every aspect of our dining pleasure.When ever I get a hankering for the Big Easy again this fine establishment will beckon my name, and it will be soon.

We returned here for dinner and had a much better experience than previously.

This time, we ordered the appetizer trio, shrimp gumbo, the fried shrimp & cajun chicken tenderloins platter, & the 2 catfish plate. We thought that the best thing on the trio platter was the shrimp & crawfish fondeaux! It was really creamy & tasted delicious with the crostini. The two other items on the plate were also worth mentioning; the hot salmon was really flavorful due to the honey mustard that it was topped with & the alligator sauce was really tasty (I've never had alligator & it wasn't for me but it was really crispy). The shrimp gumbo was interesting ... again, not for me but not bad either. Our dinner items we had ordered were good - the shrimp & chicken were both crispy & tasty, the catfish not as much but still okay.

I think that this restaurant, based on the service & food gets 3.5 stars (4 only b/c I really enjoyed the fondeaux!!). This would have been much more impressive of a restaurant if the prices were lower, but I'd leave it as an option for a once-in-a-blue-moon date night option.
this place is awesome! I brought my family for lunch along with some out of town guest. great food. the marti gras pasta ( shrimp, crawfish,sausage, and clams) was awesome along with the service.

My bestie and I came in for dinner a few weeks ago.  Everything was perfect.  The food is by far some of the best I've had in a while.  I definitely recommend the spinach and lump crab dip, the Mahi Mahi, and the creme brulee.  The ambiance is dim, lively, and very New Orleans.  Our server, LeAndrew (sp?) was perfect and made us laugh the whole time (a couple of times I'm pretty sure he didn't mean too; he was just so accommodating it made us smile).  Additionally, any staff member who walked by made sure to clear our dirty dishes and fill our only half empty waters.  Even though it is far from my Mesa home base I WILL be returning!

Jose and Missy took great care of me with the most amazing blue point oysters and a Virgin spicy Bloody Mary .  This organization does not advertise, and they are always busy.  Word of mouth advertising is alive and well for this company.  I want to visit soon; I do a lot.

This was my first visit, we were a party of about 20 people celebrating a friends birthday. The service was good for it being an extremely busy night. I tried the surf and turf pasta, it was tasty. It was only on the lunch menu which I didn't realize, priced at $19, but I was charged  $28. The gave a really good amount of shrimp, I could have done without the sausage. Wasn't a fan. My boyfriend ordered chicken strips and fries (he doesn't like seafood). The portion was laughable, it looked like he ordered from a kids menu. Small portion, which could have been ok if they atleast plated it nicely. It's all just tossed on a small plate. I am definitely interested in going again and trying something else, I was playing it a little safe.

Loved the food here! A little on the pricey side, but it's not like we live on the ocean here in Phx, so that's to be expected. A big, roomy, dining area, so plenty of room for big parties, and a nice bar area to go with that. I recently celebrated my bday here and we had a party of 6, they got us right in and food was delicious. Along with the free desert they threw in for me. First time here and we will definitely return.

Went there for happy hour yesterday (Friday).  Food was excellent, service was spectacular, and the oysters were quite good.  The desserts looked amazing but when it came time for a slice of cheesecake we were just way too full...  Great prices for happy hour!
It's a glorified and expensive Long John Silver's. Greasy fried seafood but 5 times the price.

Excellent Cajun seafood restaurant. Very nice and atmospheric. Nice vibe. Outstanding service. Had Mussels first. Biggest Mussels I`ve ever had. First class. Then Salmon Alexander absolutely delicious. A little pricey but absolutely worth it. Highly recommended. Shame there is not one closer to where I live in Scottsdale.

Wonderful place, I always recommend. The service is good. It's our top place for birthdays and special occasion. I love the atmosphere it's so nice. My favorite dish would have to be the Pasta Mardi Gras! I get it every time! Yum!
Freakin love this place! Pricey, but the food is always great and the service is exceptional. I met Alice Cooper here once too.

Service that went above and beyond excellent!  The food was great too. 

My father is the most high maintenance customer that ever came into a restaurant, in other words he is a huge pain in the ass. He thinks it is clever to ask for a plate of lemons, squeezes all of them into his water, adds sweet n low, and is proud he got free lemonade. He is also hyper critical of servers and demanding with no regard to everything they do. Don't even get me started on how he hits on female waitresses. Hey, I love my dad, but he is no picnic. I just wanted to give a little exposition so you would understand how fantastic the service was.

The waiter actually took the time to pay attention to my dad's unfunny comments as my mom and I cringed in embarrassment, even though I'm sure he had things to do. He made a decent wine by the glass recommendation for me, and gave me great ordering advice when I was wavering. He kept all our our drinks filled and the table cleaned as we finished things like soup and bread. We never wanted for anything from soup to dessert!

The lobster bisque was delicious, I had the Pappas Greek Salad, which was great, and prepared table side with flair. My parents split the Tilapia, which they loved, and the waiter brought them two plates without them even asking; thank God.

Since it was my mom's birthday we did dessert as well. Thank god I had soup and salad. Of course my dad had to ask for my mom's dessert to be comped in front of her since it was her birthday...classy. My mom and I both had the crème brulee, which was not the best I've ever had, but still pretty good crème brulee.

Our waiter was friendly, patient, attentive, and overall fabulous! Seriously, who knew service would be this wonderful here?  I will be back for sure!!!

Close your eyes; listen to the waves on the beach crashing, the smell of fresh shrimp in the air, the warmth of the sun massaging your complexion.  Oh wait we're not in the Bahamas, were at Pappadeaux! 

Great atmosphere, AMAZING food, and great service. Growing up in a beach house, I know fresh seafood. I'm talking fish and shrimp from water to plate in 10-20 minutes! This place is amazing! Not only did it taste fresh, but it was fresh! Either they have the ocean in their back kitchen or their transporting their product in giant fish tanks using 18 wheelers!

Great food, great people, amazing experience.

Thank's Pappadeaux's for an amazing experience with my wife.
My new favorite place to eat.  Fried alligator ROCKS!!!

Blue Point oysters were excellent. Seafood platter- broiled with tilapia, stuffed shrimp, mesquite grilled shrimp and crawfish! I'd order again. Very good service and the presentation was top notch. We don't have many seafood choices in the valley and this one is just as consistent as any.
Happy hour is well done. Drinks and small plates. Spicy shrimp with potato and corn cob is really good
Love pappadraux, we had an off dinner and the manager did everything she could to make it right . I appreciate the marking the off night right.

My wife and I decided to try Pappadaux since neither of us had ever eaten there before. What a great experience! Not knowing what to expect, I was extremely pleased with the restaurant. 

We arrived with no reservations and told it would be a 20-30 minute wait but we were shown to the bar area. As I am a fan of local microbrew beer, I ordered a Four Peaks Kiltlifter My wife had her usual cup of coffee. The bartenders were happy and funny and seemed to genuinely enjoy their job. The 20-30 minute wait only lasted about 10 minutes and we were shown to our table. 

The server was extremely helpful and knowledgeable in giving us a few suggestions to try. Even going to the point of letting us know what dishes she prefers in pairing with the appetizers. Since my allergy to mushrooms can cause issues, I asked if the meal can be made without them. Absolutely she replied. What happened next is what shocked us. The person running the kitchen came over to our table to make sure it is just an ingestion allergy and not a contact. She wanted to make sure that it was OK to cook in certain pots and pans. In my 48 years, no restaurant has ever asked me that. I felt taken care of from the beginning. 

The appetizers we had were fantastic. We enjoyed the crisp fried alligator and he crawfish and shrimp fondeaux. The fondeaux was the best creamy blend of cheese and seafood I've ever had. Definitely one appetizer you must try. 

Our main courses were equally as good. I had the Pasta Mardi Gras. Normally in restaurants when you order a main dish you can finish the entire thing. Pappadeaux loads up the plate with their food. I had lunch leftovers for two days. 

All in all the meal cost us about $100 with appetizers and drinks. Not a bad price for the experience we had. The atmosphere and employees were five star all the way. Leave room for their bread pudding for dessert. It's worth it.

One of my fave restaurants in Dallas and so happy there is one here in this godforsaken wasteland.  If you like raw bar seafood..this is the place for you.  Their oysters are awesome (just hint..don't be swayed by the more expensive oysters..not worth it and they are smaller.  Texas gulf oysters are delicious).  This place can get expensive, but the portions are huge and splitting is recommended.  The raw bar is very very reasonable and it's where I tend to hang out.  Bakers dozen of oysters and one of their sublime Bloody Mary's is a perfect combo.  Usually get their mozzarella sticks too which are light and crunchy with a very good marinara sauce.  Salads are yummy.  I tend not to order off the menu as the appetizers are filling enough, but I have had their fish, although I don't Cajun anything..if it's a good piece of fish and cooked right, you don't need to pepper it up.  Seafood brochette over dirty rice is one of my favorites and always tons left over for like a dinner and a lunch.  Best seafood place in the valley..hands down.  Oh..and the waitstaff is top notch.

Wow really surprised the seafood was excellent the lobster bisque was delicious and full of lobster meat we had the Halibut Alexander style with gulf shrimp and diver scallops was delicious the soy ginger sauce with spinach really complimented the dish yum.

Although we waited over 75mins for our food (after placing our order), the manager made our out of state, first timer experience right. Our waitress was a delight, and I'm grateful they accepted accountability opposed to making excuses. Will return.

I really enjoy this place. I've been here many times over the years. Love the majority of the food on the menu. Happy hour is great. Drinks are always perfect and strong. I strongly advise everyone to order the fried gator. The roux served with this delicious meat makes me feel that I'm in New Orleans... The only difference is the spiciness. Nothing here is as spicy as true cajun food but still very good. The reason I am only giving four stars is that i am holding back because of the cost of eating here. Two people can get in and out with a couple cocktails for $100.  We celebrated my husband's birthday here recently... all food was great however with a party of 7 our bill was $300 and three were children. I believe there were 5 alcohol beverages on the tab... but still this is just too much for my liking.

This place used to be good...Great even!  Going here was a treat and a family outing because it's kindof far from our house.  But for about a year now, the food has gone down hill a little bit.  the past 2 times we've been here the roux has been burnt!!!  Is anyone else picking up on this??  My Grandma who was born and raised in Louisiana and has cooked creole food for years says she thinks they've switched to pre-made roux from a jar.  Either that, or the chef doesn't know what he's doing.  When we went several months ago, she ordered a big bowl of the seafood gumbo, I ordered a small cup.  Immediately she said it tasted burnt and sent it back.  I sent back my cup as well and had the lobster bisque, which is always excellent.  We thought it was just a fluke or an off night, so when we went a couple weeks ago, she steered clear from anything with roux, but my lunch order came with a cup of seafood gumbo...Once again, it tasted burnt to me...so that was the last straw. Something is off with their roux and thats twice now, spread months apart..Maybe they HAVE switched to store bought roux...who knows. I wouldn't expect a restaurant of this caliber to do that, but something is definitely off with their roux.  If and when we go back, I'll steer clear of it and just order something else.

Disclaimer: for a weekend night the parking lot was beyond a nightmere...imagine the mall on Saturday December 23rd.  We actually saw a guy steal a spot and then just about get into a fist fight over it, THEY WERE OUT OF THEIR CARS PEOPLE!  FYI, with a little patience we found a great spot close to the enterance.  

For a chain....this place is AWESOME!  First of all the garden and fountains had me 100% even if the food had sucked (which it didnt).  Live music and cocktails while sitting in lush foliage with the sound of running water and the beauty of sparkling light made the 2 hour wait worth it (it was friday night, I've been told its not that bad on other days).  You pretty much HAVE to try the Spamp Thing cocktail....its the strongest bomb pop you'll ever drink.   We also sampled a strawberry peach cooler and a 'catagory 5', also fantastic.  

Our server was great.  Charles Chester  was double sat but did an awesome job of making us feel as though we were his only table.  The general atmospher is very southern bayou with dim lighting and gas lamps, pretty unique for phoenix even if it might be considered cliche.  And listen here ladies, that flickering gas light does WONDERS for the complextion!   

Alligator bites, eh....but the Lousiana Talipia I had served with green beans and spagetti squash was SOOOOOO GOOOODDD!  Plus I added a garden salad (which was huge....I actually ate very little of my meal due to this) for 2.95.  Where do you see THAT price anymore??  My dinner partners enjoyed a blackened talipia with dirty rice, fried catfish with fries, and a steak with mash potatoes and brocoli.  There was not a single complaint at our table!  

Dessert was great.  Pappadeaux has those cheesy 80's dessert trays where everything has a coat of acrylic to keep it looking fresh....I LOVE those corny presentation trays!  FYI Pappadeaux has maybe 15 options for dessert?  Pretty impressive.  As a first time visitor we were offered a dessert on the house (WOW) and choose a chocolate brownie turtle thingie which was served warm w some yumm-o vanilla ice cream.  The single slice was HUGE, even shared between the 4 of us we hardly finished it.  Somehow we were able to force it down :)  

For the price i thought the meal was a good value with plenty of fresh options.  The only think I'm dissappointed about is that Pappadeaux is not actually locally owned, although it is family owned.  It doesnt feel chain-y but I still try to avoid them as much as possible.

Wow!  I ordered the Louisiana Blackened Catfish topped with pecan butter and spicy pecans with dirty rice.  The fish was done just right -- succulent, moist and flavorful.  I also had the fried alligator appetizer.  The meat is tender and scrumptous.  If I can eat it, so can you.  Oh, you haven't tasted a roll until you have one from Pappadeaux's.  Hot and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.   

If you're in Phoenix, be sure to make this your top restaurant visit. You won't be disappointed.

Flavorful dishes!!!! Everything from their WATERMELON DRINK to the DIRTY RICE are delicious! It is a family owned and operated restaurant meaning even the trucks that deliver the seafood are employed by Pappadeaux!!!! Definitely try their BANANA PUDDING served in a mason jar!!!!!!!!! One of our favorites!!!!
If you like seafood this is a must place to eat when your in Arizona going back before I leave here We ate well  and you won't break the bank Dang this shit is Real Good

We went to meet some friends and had drinks while our friends finished dinner.  The server was OUTSTANDING!!!  She knew her job and did it with amazing accuracy! I have not had this kind of service since leaving Okinawa.  The place was packed but we were acknowledged immediatly and there was no issue when we joined our friends. :-)  CANNOT wait to go back for a full meal!!

Delicious and great service!  First time I've been here - busy on a Wednesday evening but we were greeted and seated very promptly, had a great waiter and the food was delicious.  Huge restaurant so even though it was busy it didn't feel crowded.  Highly recommend!

Our first time dining here, our waiter seemed visibly disgruntled that we only ordered a couple of cocktails, an appetizer and soup. We just wanted to check it out.

Thinking it was just a fluke, we decided to go back again a few months later, craving seafood and a taste of the south. After being seated we noticed a tray of dirty dishes in front of our table, unattended to, and waited 10 minutes before being greeted, but were happy to finally be able to order cocktails. We waited another five minutes for water to arrive at the table via server assistant, all the while (since being seated) staring at the tray of dirty dishes from another table being unattended to. After another ten minutes of waiting for cocktails we thought we should maybe get up and leave. As we were talking about this,
our waiter arrived with our drinks.  He mentioned the bar was backed up (yet, never came by our table the entire time we were waiting to let us know). We let him know we were unhappy with the wait and were just about to leave, but we decided to stay and order: crab claws and boudin as appetizers, beef filet and mahi mahi as entrees.  We waited another 25 minutes for our appetizers and a chance to order another cocktail (our waiter again didn't stop by the table).  We got a water refill by the server assistant though. You would think at this point a manager would have stopped by to check on us, but no. 

The crab claws were tasty.  The boudin, when cut open, smelled and tasted rancid however.  We were actually grossed out. When the waiter came back to ask how the food was, thankfully just a couple of minutes later, us being already irate, my date answered "this boudin tastes like shit".  The waiter apologized and said that he would send a manager over to take the dish away.  Really?  Can't you just get the dish away from us?

Ten minutes past as we tried to ignore a dish we didn't like the smell of and eat our crab claws. Just then, the tray of dirty dishes in front of us was cleared. Just after, the manager arrived.  Instead of having the dish taken away immediately, she held it up in front our faces, asking what we didn't like about the boudin. We mentioned the "boudin" smelled, and then... she tried to correct our pronunciation of "boudin", and mentioned some tasting notes about the dish. My partner  replied, in more colorful words, that he was born and raised in New Orleans, and that that dish was not "boudin". She then apologized , said she would take the dish off of our check, and left with the dish. No mention of the long wait times or dirty dishes came up from her. 

Our entrees arrived. My mahi mahi was actually delicious, as was the filet.  Our waiter was attentive in checking back on us.  The dessert tray came around, and we decided on a fudge brownie. When the brownie came out, in a reasonable time, our entree dishes and silverware were still on the table. Instead of clearing our last course and then giving us our dessert, we had to push our dirty dishes aside before they put the brownie in front us, along with new forks and spoons... then took our dirty dishes. 

We then asked for our check, looked it over and paid promptly. We couldn't help but notice though that there was no follow up visit from the manager or even an offer for dessert on the house, considering the experience. We left a 20% tip anyways. On the way out, no management or any other staff said good bye to us.

Why two stars instead of one?  You can thank the mahi mahi and filet.

Why am I so persnickety about this experience?  Because if I'm going to spend $200 on a dinner, regardless of the dining environment, I expect at the least good service, without disagreeing and negligent management.

So close to our house, but we choose to spend a couple of franklins on dinner somewhere far from here.
Love this place!   Best salmon ever.  Always busy so plan to wait in the bar.   Great drinks too! Enjoy your evening here
Great food & service is hit or miss but overall it's very decent.  The pasta & seafood dishes are delicious everything we've tried we've been satisfied.

This is a great place to get fresh seafood in the Phoenix area.  This is Cajun style seafood so it is a bit spicy but that is just something unique to experience here.  The atmosphere is very romantic.  I would come back here again for sure - this is a perfect place to take your wife for her birthday or Valentine's day or something special like that.  4 out of 5 just because I'm not normally a seafood fan.

My son and I decided to give Pappadeaux a try -- had never dined there before.  We had Mia as our server -- she was excellent and so was the food!  Everything came out to ou specification and the food (temperature wise) was hot!  We very much enjoyed our dining experience there!
Mmmmmmm mm mmmmmmmmmm cheese fondue and seafood gumbo! If you don't know, know you know!

One of my favorite seafood places in Arizona. Has a Cajun style that is to kill for! Their fried alligator is excellent as an app! Always friendly staff . Good job. My only complaint is the wait on food - but it is well worth it

I've always heard great things about this restaurant but had never gone. I decided for my 29th birthday that I would take all my family and friends here for dinner and drinks. 

The service was okay. Kids meals came out with the rest of the food but it took a while for drink refills. No big deal. Food looked very good when served. Here's the kicker.....

I became deathly ill about a week and a half after my birthday dinner. I'm talking- convulsing on the floor ill and then shitting my brains out while vomiting at the same time. I was like this for a solid week. Went to my doctor and had a lot of tests run. Spent another two weeks living feet away from the toilet because I couldn't stop crapping myself. Turns out Papadeux fed me tainted shrimp from China and I got Salmonella poisoning. I've got the report from the MCHD to prove it. Not only did I receive Salmonella from them but a lot of other people did to. I will NEVER go back nor recommend this place to anyone I know.
I've always had excellent service at Pappadeaux and the food is incredible. The Moroccan salmon and shrimp is a family favorite.

Pappadeaux sure is the real deal! Which explains the big crowd of people waiting to be seated outside. This is an eclectic restaurant that is great for any type of gathering, from a romantic date with your significant other to a big blowout birthday celebration with friends and family.

We came on a busy Friday night with no reservation, so we were given a pager. We snagged seats at the bar and started off with drinks. They have a huge selection of their own alcoholic mixed beverages. Bartenders can sure make a mean cocktail!  

If you don't mind the loud hustle and bustle, then there would be a shorter wait for an inside table. However, we loved the fun outdoor lighting and decor, so we didn't mind the extra wait. When our pager finally went off, our hostess immediately seated us at our table before a live band. I couldn't get over how charming the patio area was. 

The food is AMAZEBALLS! Please keep in mind that the portions are LARGE, especially the appetizers.

My Loves:

Sea Bass and Shrimp - My favorite dish of the night. It must have been a special, as I don't see it on the menu. It was fresh and tasty and had lovely presentation.

Coconut Shrimp - Can't go wrong with this dish. Each bite sent me to food heaven. The marmalade sauce it came with complemented it perfectly. And the shrimp was huge!

Oysters - very large and fresh and muy delicioso

My Like: 

Crispy Fried Alligators - Tasted kind of like chicken, but a little slimy. It tasted great with the Creolo sauce it came with. However, I thought it was a bit too oily and fried for me. 

This was absolutely way too much food for two people. I highly suggest going with at least a group of 4. That way you can share and try a lot more items. Pappadeaux is definitely worth trying. I cannot wait for my next visit to Phoenix, so that I can feast here again.

We had to go to the west side of Phoenix and that was just the excuse for another dinner at Pappadeaux.

This time we were there in the middle of the week so there was no wait for a table.  

We went the same route on the appetizers with alligator and oysters.  No sense messing with perfection.

The hubby ordered the Chilean Sea Bass.  Expensive but fabulous.  I stole a couple of bites and it was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.  Heavenly!

I wasn't very hungry after appetizers so I just had a bowl of Lobster Bisque.  HUGE chunks of lobster in there and so warm and satisfying.  This will be my choice from now on if I'm not feeling super hungry.  

Pappadeaux definitely has my vote as the best seafood place in Phoenix.

Delicious Cajun food! A friend took me here for my birthday and I am definitely a fan. Great flavors and great selections. The food is slightly pricey but wonderful for the restaurant. Very memorable. :) 

I would definitely come back. I love spicy and butter and this place has a wonderful combination of both. The portions are also large so it will feel you up until you are a happy full. Service at the table is also a hundred times better than the bar so sit at the table. For Westcoasters, like myself, definitely give this place a try!

I've always judged a restaurant based on the service that they give the food can be as horrible as anything but if the service is there then you got me for life this isn't Pappadeaux Pappadeaux service and food is excellent my kids gave me a gift card for Christmas for my wife and I to use and unfortunately my printer ran out of ink for the last 30 minutes between the waitress that was taking my order at the two gold counter and both of the managers assistant managers and anybody that came over we were trying to figure out what was the PIN to the gift card as my ink ran out at the last on reasonable moment to figure out what the pain was we called the customer service for the gift card I called my daughter to resend and I finally found a screenshot of it but at that that time we had locked ourselves completely out of the gift card thank you kudos to Pappadeaux's your staff the managers the waitress that took my order they caught my mail this time because of the Valiant efforts that everyone had to do the take and try and get my order together and figure out what this gift card is I am grateful deeply deeply grateful for you guys and will continue to come out here and patronize your establishment

Came in at lunch for my Christmas eve clam chowder and boudin, both were excellent , as they always have been. I have tried just about every thing on the menu here , it's always been good, best alaskan king crab legs in the valley. I swear they change the menu  and the prices every few months.   Everything keeps going up, but very , very tasty food. The deserts are all good, if you have room after dinner. I love the key lime pie, not too sweet , or sour.

Much disappointment :(

This place has great reviews, but I am not sure why..

  1) There is poor communication and timing in the kitchen
  2) The food represented online/in yelp/on menus are grossly misrepresented
  3) Food is average
  4) Staff needs training on how to pronounce menu items
  

I came here with a group of 8.  We started by ordering the Crispy Fried Alligator, Crab Fingers (sautéed), Frog Legs, and Calamari.  The Alligator was the best thing we ate the entire meal.

The Crab Fingers were mediocre and very messy.  The Frog Legs were average, and the Calamari was sparse among a pile of deep-fried artichoke (not mentioned in the menu)

Next up was the Andouille Sausage and Seafood Gumbo, which I thought was great; enough for me to finish my cup.

We ordered meals (I got the Crawfish Etoufee).  1 person in our group got her food 20 minutes ahead of everyone else.  The rest of the group received their food by the time she finished her meal.  The guy who had my plate kept pronouncing my dish "Ee-too-fee crawfish" so it took a while for us to figure out what he was saying...

Halfway through our meal, another person brings an extra random dish (the same dish that the first person received).

Not a single person felt the need to finish their main course; it just didn't impress us.  The pictures on the yelp site and on their menus may have led us on a bit too much.  Thank goodness my phone can make anything look good...

Let me start by saying don't know if I would ever go back! 
I took my wife there for her birthday and it was really bad. We had a party of 15 people the lady's at the front desk were rude they wouldn't seat us unless we had all 15 there and they where counting and being careless I had a a family member who recently had heart surgery.  The table was ready and we only where missing two people from party. After our order was taken it took well over an hour to bring us our food. My wife order wasn't rite and the food was cold it was just really bad service.   Dont know if I could go back!!!

Been coming here for over ten years and our go to place for cajun and seafood. Prices have kept up with the times but it's still worth it to get some excellent dishes. Seafood platter and pasta mardi gras are two of our favorites. I tried the shrimp & grits today and it will be added to my list of favorites.

Ugh... I love Pappadeaux, but I will never understand why the service is so bad in the AZ location.  We asked to move tables and after arguing with me for a few minutes the waiter finally agreed to let us switch to a more suitable table (one with slightly less flies) ... He promptly stood back and watched me carry all of our drinks and plates to the next table.  Another server was kind enough to come from his section to help my grandmother from her seat.  Food is typically delicious, but the continued poor service leaves an awful taste in my mouth.

the Greek house salad....... is friggin delish!  

lots of different offerings from the sea........ lakes and rivers too!

haven't had the gumbo or etouffes...... but i hear they're pretty decent.

the most recent visit consisted of:
Greek salad
Grilled Costa Rican Tilapia Lafayette
Blackened Catfish Opelousas
Oven Baked Stuffed Tilapia

everyone was happy with their food...... but i am guaranteeing i will b gettin the blackened catfish opelousas next time!

Mixed experience.  Came in on a Friday around 730.  The place was pretty busy.  Tried to make reservations over the phone earlier but were told no reservations were available.  Walked in and the hostess said 30 minutes.  Went to use the rest room and the place looked 30% empty.  Walked back out and 5 minutes later were told the table was ready.  Kind of a shaky start.

Our waitress Nancy was extremely helpful and friendly.  She went over all the specials and the whole background of Pappadeaux.  We ordered several items to share.  Calamari cajun style, crab legs, Texas redfish, and Mississippi catfish.

We waited for our food and no bread was served.  We literally ate some of the crackers on the table.  Drinks were also very slow to come out.  We received the calamari and it was okay.  Kind of small for the price and could have used more cajun spice.

Our food finally comes out after quite a wait.  The large order of crab legs consisted of about 4 legs.  We asked for them to be cut in the back and there were a couple small slits on the legs instead of them actually being cut down the middle.  We expected much more from a restaurant that accounts for 1% of the entire seafood consumed in the U.S and charged $55 bucks for 4 legs.

The Texas redfish was ridiculously flavorful.  The brown butter and wine sauce just danced all over my taste buds.  The fish was fresh, buttery, and everything went perfectly with dirty rice.  Every bite was absolutely delicious.  

The Mississippi catfish was quite dull in flavor after the Texas redfish.  It was severely lacking flavor and freshness.  We really regretted this choice.

For dessert we ordered a banana pudding to go.  It was okay.  Nothing special to really say about it.

Our bill came out to $240+.  Probably won't be back for quantity/quality vs price ratio was too much in favor of the house.  If by chance I do happen to come back I am definitely ordering the Texas redfish!
I eat here all the time. the food and the atmosphere is absolutely great! I've had so many different meals here I cannot count them. I will definitely be back!
I've never had a bad meal here and the service is great.  The atmosphere is fun and the food very flavorful.  We like to go here on special occasions and highly recommend it!

Mm mm MMM. this place is outstanding!! Excellent food, not to mention excellent service!!! My boyfriend & I dropped a pretty penny here, not to mention our server got a great tip for being so outstanding & helpful. Super cool guy, our drinks were always full, went above & beyond explaining all the food/dessert options they had, super polite. I have nothing to complain about. Food was promptly delivered. Thanks guys!
I go here often for lunch meetings and the Cajun style seafood is great. I have never been disappointed.

Great seafood - Blue Point oysters are so fresh and you don't want to miss. The only reason I did not give a 5 star rating is ... it is pretty loud and the price range is high. The quality of the service is not consistent - either you get a super good server or lazy one. Overall, I always go home happy after visiting there :)

I hope this was an isolated incident, because I really love Pappadeaux's.  It's not someplace I go regularly, rather reserved for special occasions. It's a little on the pricey side but certainly in line with the usual value they offer. The food, service and ambiance have always been top-notch and I've been saying for weeks now that it's where I wanted to go for my birthday dinner.
 
Despite the fact that they're a chain (huge in Texas and elsewhere, but only 1 single location in Phoenix), I feel like they operate like an indie and get it right on most fronts.  My favorite dish is the Crawfish Platter (a ginormous platter piled high with authentic dirty rice in the middle, flanked by breaded, fried crawfish on one side and thick, savory crawfish étouffée on the other side).

Last night's birthday dinner was unfortunately an absolute bust.  I was excited to show my boyfriend the amazing wonder of Pappadeaux's, as he'd never been there before and I'd been talking it up for weeks.  We were seated right away (which was atypical because they're always packed), but we did get an annoying end table right on the corner so there were constantly people pushing past us and bumping into my chair.  Whatever, luck of the draw, and I was happy to be seated right away.

Our server Erich came over and took our drink order.  I ordered a Coke and water.  I got Diet Coke, which tastes like poison.  Waited a few minutes trying to flag him down (admittedly this guy had at least 2 other tables he was waiting on) and I pointed that out to him and he launched into some weird back and forth about how it should be Coke.  You're tellin' me buddy, that's WHAT I ordered.  He took it away and a different server brought me a regular Coke with a smile.  Very nice.  Thank you.  Then Erich returned and babbled awkwardly about the mishap. It's fine. This happens a lot. Most people drink Diet Poison - I get it.   He took our orders and said he'd be back with some bread.

The bread and butter was dropped off pretty quickly, which is when we realized we had no set-ups.  It's kinda hard to spread butter on your bread without a knife.   We waited a few more minutes looking for him to flag him down again.  He grabbed set-ups for us and said something about "I wish we could assure that all tables could have set-ups when they're bussed but that's nearly impossible..."  Ok, whatever, I just want utensils and a napkin.  Thank you.

The food this time was OK.  Normally it's stellar. Maybe I was already annoyed by what I considered "Strike 1" and "Strike 2".  Both crawfish entrées were great.  The dirty rice was definitely subpar --undercooked and very dried out/chewy.   Erich asked us if we needed anything. I asked for an extra tartar sauce and a spoon for my étouffée.  He brought them right over.  At that point, at the beginning of the meal my Coke was still full. Like most people, I drank it intermittently while I chewed and ate and it was soon gone, but I still had half a plate of food to eat.  No sign of Erich.  No Coke in my glass. So I just continued eating and finished my plate.
  
At the end of the meal, Erich re-appeared and asked if we needed anything.  My other half motioned at my glass but at that point my food was gone and I just wanted to leave.  Erich then realized that maybe I wanted a refill and asked if I did. I said don't worry about it and asked for the check.  Then we waited some more.  The check came and I swear to you the fastest thing I saw the waiter do all night was process the check and get us out of there.

What bugged me was that I could see many other tables around us being served and having a great time with their servers, lots of smiles, hospitality and ambiance. I felt like we got the shaft.

I have to say that in the past I've always had impeccable service, amazingly fresh food and a top-notch experience at Pappadeaux's.  Perhaps this was an off night.  Perhaps Erich had too many tables.  Perhaps we shouldn't have even left him 10% gratuity.  Three dings on service, one on food and one on the crappy table.  I'll have to think long and hard before spending my money there again.

$6 for a dozen Texas Gulf oysters Mon-Thur.  We ordered 8.
Waitress was slick and upsold us on alligator, which contrary to popular belief, does not taste like chicken.  Get the spinach dip with real crab meat - it's fantastic.
Excellent food. but really expensive  great happy hour. Their fried shrimp is to die for. But their catfish is soso.  I will be back

Second time I've been at Pappadeaux's and it was good food. They give you a roll of bread to eat that is free. The bread is rock hard and it feels like it will break a tooth. They should definitely invest in a different bread recipe, I like soft bread! I ordered the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer and it costs 10 dollars. The shrimp cocktail tastes good but it is very small in portion and not worth the money! The waiter recommended a jumbalya type of dish and it was around 23 dollars. It was big in portion and tasted good. My fiance got filet Mignon and she said it tasted good except the sauce wasn't very good. She asked for a salad to substitute the asparagus and the waiter said he couldn't. The asparagus comes the size of tree trunks lol. The bill totaled about 70 for two people. I would say that the food tastes good but it is over priced. The waiting staff was very good as well. The reason for the 3 stars is the over priced food.

Cris R guest relations manager here is my mailing address for my post on Yelp 
I would of gave them less if I could. My co-workers and I went to this location through word of mouth. We ordered the Crab crusted Mac-Cheese it was so bland I couldn't eat it. We also ordered the Seafood Platter this was good quite a bit of food cool. Here is where the one came in for a referral. We got ready to leave the waiter Eddie offered us the desert off of the try. We were full and decided to get the banana pudding. Eddie swore by it saying it was made fresh everyday. Well here is this mess that they call freshly made the bananas were spoiled in the jar the cookies were extra mushy and the pudding was gritty. We drove from the Radisson on 44th by the airport which in traffic took us almost 40 minutes. We were so disappointed if they were close We would of drove back. Don't order desert. Or the Mac n Cheese

I've only ordered one thing from here and it was the fried shrimp. I love it! It's spicy and crunchy mmm! I have tried the fried alligator once though. The flavor wasn't bad, I just don't like the texture of alligator. At least I tried!

The price is very expensive BUT they give you a good amount of food so it makes up for it. 

The staff is very nice especially Nora! She's the best!

This place wasn't bad. The food was overall very good although there were some things that weren't the greatest. I got oysters and the alligator for appetizers. The oysters were probably the best I've ever had and the alligator was amazing! Not at all tough. Although on the menu it only lists the alligator as fried, they also serve it blackened which I totally recommend. They let us have half and half. Then for my main dish I got the Costa Rican Mahi Alexander. Although I only wanted the smaller portion, I forgot to say so, so I was given the larger and paid more than I expected. It was overall a very good dish though my scallops were a bit undercooked and my shrimp were a bit over. Over all a very good experience. I wouldn't mind going again but I wouldn't go out of my way to go again.

Excellent food, loved the blackened fish w/red beans and rice.  The blackened alligator is also very good.  Our waiter was named Matt and he was excellent with his service and really knew the menu and gave options on how things could be prepared or changed.  Top notch service!

I love  good food and Pappadeaux's never disappoints! I would like to thank our server Nick for such great customer and the manager Arizania ! They were super busy but they made me and the birthday boy feel as though we were the only ones there!
To the rest of the staff you all are awesome great staff it was my boyfriends first time there and he wants to come back! Thank you for making this such a special night!

I admit that growing up in a coastal Atlantic town where we caught our own crabs and fish, it's a very high bar to scale.

I have eaten here twice. The first time I had as a appetizer the Oysters Pappadeaux, a variant of Oysters Rockefeller.  I had to send them back- they were way way way too salty.  For an entree I had a fish and pasta dish, it was okay, but not spectacular.

Today I was someone else's guest, but I got to pick the restaurant. June is the time of year when blue claw crabs molt, and when soft shell crabs are available fresh.  Since I saute them when I cook them when back east, I ordered the pan grilled and not the deep fried softshell dinner plate with three crabs.

Traditionally the lungs are removed,  the eyes and "face" of the crab removed, and the rest left intact.  There are also strict rules regarding harvesting of crabs, that their top shell must be a minimal length from point to point.  These softshells had the tops completely removed. The actual bodies of the crabs were grossly undersized, and I mean grossly. One of my three crabs had a body that was only an inch wide. 

I don't know if Pappadeaux has crab farms where they raise them, and then segregate them at molting time, or if they are wild harvested.
