If they are wild harvested then the crabs served to me were hardly legal, unless they were not from the Atlantic coast.  On top of that, a crab has saline liquid inside of it, so there is no need to put a salt laden coating on the crab before grilling, but Pappadeaux seems to salt them. Eating the crabs was like eating mouthfuls of salt. Had I been the one paying for the meal as I was the first time I ate there, I would have sent them back.

In the future I have decided it is better to wait until I am visiting a coastal area to eat seafood that is brought to market from boats moored at local docks.  The flown in seafood at Pappadeaux has failed to impress me.

The waitstaff was professional, prompt and  friendly. Pity the food does not live up to the servers.

Horrible hostess service prevented us from eating at all. We were told it was a 45-60 minute wait. After waiting patiently for more than one hour, we were told there were three 5-top tables in front of us and it would be at least 30 more minutes. No apology or accommodation was offered. No restaurant is worth that brain damage.

This is definitely the go to place for seafood in Phoenix. That said, I don't really like fish that much so I didn't really know what to order. I got the blackened catfish because I figure that is a staple in this type of eatery and it was pretty good for what I ordered. I definitely would go for the shellfish though, they've got some great deals during happy hour.

All I ended up getting was the Seafood gumbo and a caesar salad. Both of them were good. The service was excellent. I think the gumbo could have been seasoned more. I didn't try any of their specialties. I was tired from sitting in the airport all day, a little hot, and jet-lagged, but I am definitely going to go back (and update my review). Be prepared to spend some money because they are definitely pricey.

Louisiana born Hubby decided he wanted to go to Pappadeaux's for his birthday dinner after we discovered that Barrio Cafe would be closed Monday. The restaurant was unbelievably packed for a random Monday, but I was a tad annoyed that we still had to wait about a half hour to be seated- and that was with a reservation. 

Our waitress was great and got Hubby's requisite Oyster, Crawfish, and Mushroom "Fondeaux" started right away. That kind of chain-y cutesy naming cheesiness makes me roll my eyes, but Hubby is blind to such lameness since Pappa's has a whole empire of similarly named restaurants in Texas (from where he moved to Arcosanti whence I snagged him- but I digress). He also ordered some kind of layered frozen fruity monstrosity that made him positively loopy (in his defense, we're not big drinkers).

After the Fondeaux appetizer, we barely had room for our entrees, so we both have excellent lunches today. I had a mixed seafood grill which had very nicely cooked pieces of scallop, mahi, and salmon together with way too well done shrimp. In apparently some sort of fugue state I also ordered a side of onion rings which I promptly regretted when the platter came out bigger than my head. They were mighty tasty, though, and I have not had much luck before finding really good onion rings (except at Ted's Hot Dogs, of course). Hubby ordered a crawfish platter with fried pieces and etoufee, but the waitress  convinced him to get the triple slam with blackened crawfish as well- and this turned out to be his favorite on the plate. All the portions are gargantuan, so we have to remember next time to share an entree, especially if we need to get the Fondeaux. Which I'm sure we will...

The food was very good, but overpriced. The out door area is beautiful! The service unfortunately was not so great. Everything seemed to take forever!!!! Not sure if that was our waiter or the kitchen, we were surprised he hadn't put our daughters dessert in when we asked while we were about done with our entrées. The time delay ended in us not trying dessert and cancelling hers simply because we didn't want to wait another 30 minutes just for that too.

My first visit to Pappadeaux was in Houston in the early 80's. Living in the dessert now I miss the great tasting flavors of living on the Gulf Coast and then some. This is the place we migrate to when we are looking for a that type of feel good food.

Both outside and inside is fixed up so that you feel like you are in New Orleans or nearby. Service is exceptionable. Just let them know what you need and / or want and they will make it happen. Grandpa Mark says so. Trust me!

Food is always very good and tasty. We like to start off with a  large portion of fried alligator with an extra side of their special Creole dipping sauce. The complimentary French Bead with butter definitely take it to the next level. Dip Me Baby!

Some of our favorites are anything deep fried of coarse, the blackened fish, all the items they grill, as well as the gumbos, salads, all the etouffees dishes and the dirty rice. Tally ho! The menu is just too big to go over it all.  Yummo!

Last visit with the extended family we ordered the Ginger Salmon, Blackened Mahi, Blackened Catfish. Sampler Seafood Platter, Shrimp and Catfish, and of course some Alligator to get things rolling.

Mention a special occasion like a B-Day celebration for an extra special treat. Hmmm? 

This is not a Long John's Pete's type fish place so prepare to enjoy. Place gets really busy and loud at peak times. Recommend going there for an early lunch to get the extra attention. 

Mr. Mark ........ table ready.

Ah-YEE!

We went for our anniversary on a Friday Night. There was a very large crowd and a thirty minute wait. We decided to stay, and boy was I glad we did. They had a live band playing in a very nice court yard with water features and seating outside. The cocktails were very good. I started with a dozen oysters, they were excellent. I also had the Filet Mignon and grilled lobster tail. It was beyond words. The service was excellent. A little pricey our tab was over $300  for a party of three. I would go again. It is a very fun environment and very loud, so if you are looking for a quiet romantic place, not so much.

We were looking for a place that served oysters so I looked up best oysters in Phoenix area and on the top of the list was Pappadeaux.. so we decided to try it. From the moment we walked in we had great service from the hostess to our waiter Sam. The manager even came by when she heard it was our first time there. Sam is a great server, very attentive to our requests , very helpful in describing the different dishes they serve & believe me they have a very big list of things to choose from. he food was delicious and plentiful. We tried the gator tail , which i've eaten before in other places. It was so good. The raw oysters are superb and I decided to have fried oysters. I grew up in Fl and grew up eating them so I was hoping they'd be good. They were ! My husband got the crawfish etouffee which he loved. the manager even had us pick out a dessert to take home, on the house. We were way too full to have it there. The dishes are more than enough , you won't go home hungry. The atmosphere is great, very nice looking place. We most definitely will be adding this place as a favorite to eat.
Went here for the first time the customer service was great the drinks OUTSTANDING & VERY REFRESHING . Quickly became one of my favorite spots

The food was good even though by steak was overcooked AZ for medium-rare and I got well done not the way I really like to eat my steak but I went with my wife for our anniversary little expensive but the meal was good
OMG the alligator tail appetizer, and probably some fo the best salmon and craw fish etouffe I have ever experienced!

The sea food was fresh and Samuel was an excellent waiter, however I have NEVER tasted such salty food in my life. I debated sending it back but decided to tough it out. I don't think it could have been any more salty if someone had purposely tried to over do it.  The prices also rather shocked me but I knew it would be expensive to have fresh seafood in the desert. Almost all entrées start at about $30 and go up from there. And then there is exorbitant up selling of salads and side dishes. Also be prepared for extreme noise levels during dinner. This was my last dining experience here.  I don't wish to overpay AND get hyper-tension.

my dad took us here for my mom's birthday -- one of the best seafood restaurants i've been to! prices are reasonable for the quality of food and service you receive. also, complimentary choice of dessert on your birthday. great place!

I know you wouldn't be thinking of eating seafood in AZ, but if you are around you gotta try it out. Back in the day when home-base was Pheonix I would frequent this place, it was pretty much my religion. Pappadeaux is some of the most amazing cajun food you will ever experience. Why 4 and not 5 stars you ask? Well, I went home to visit the family and came to eat and wasn't too impressed since things seemed to have changed, sad but not overly sad.

I always get the crawfish, always always. Always perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. Crawfish etouffee is amazing, tastes like a million bucks. Appetizers like calamari and fried allligator are pretty normal, nothing special. Don't miss out on dessert, the dessert trio lets you try a little bit of everything. A++

I'm allergic to seafood/fish. So I could very well be disqualified for reviewing this restaurant. However! And its a big however! They have the yummiest banana pudding this side of the Mason-Dixon line! Where is that by the way??!! LOL! Seriously, it comes served in a Mason jar and if you don't finish it all ( I never do), they give you the lid to close it up and take it home! I guess I could share it....but noooo!!

Natalie's F*#! the Recession Item:
BROILED CRAWFISH w/ Potatoes & Corn only $3.95 per 1.25lb
Wednesday & Thursday Only. March 4 thru April 30
After 5pm Dine In Only

Great food, fast food service to the table, the wait time was long to get a table, but the hostess's attitude was the real mood killer. When I first checked in I was told it was a 45 minuet wait time by the hostess and that was fine since it was a Saturday night and I expected a wait. After about an hour I went to ask how much longer it would be and the hostess was kind enough to tell me it had only been 58 minuets and she said it was going to be an hour so we needed to step back and continue to wait. I told her she said it would be 45 minuets when we checked in and she told me she would have never told me 45 minuets and we had only been waiting 58 minuets so she would get to us when there was a table open and there was 3 parties ahead of us. I stepped out of the way and they called up the first party they were seating. I didn't want to go far if they were going to call us soon. They called up and sat 4 more parties in the the next 15 or so minuets I was standing there. By that time my girlfriend was getting visibly upset, so thank goodness they seated us right after that. In the end it wasn't the long wait, I get that it was a Saturday evening and very busy, it was the hostess that had to be so condescending telling me we had only been waiting for 58 minuets, not a full 60, and implying to me that I was either wrong/lying/or I didn't listen to her say 45 minuets when I checked in. In all honesty the food was great and the desserts were amazing. We even ordered extra desserts so we could give the babysitter one. It's definitely on the higher end of mid range restaurants but well worth it if you love sea food. Also I recommend just ordering a few appetizers if it's just you and a date because the portions are really big. I really wanted to give more stars.

We had the best server I have had in a very long time, thank you so much Brandon for the best service for me and my fiances birthdays! Great service, great food this place is my new regular seafood restaurant spot forever! We had the best gulf Coast Oysters, the crispest alligator and amazing jumbo crab cakes! So glad my parents referred us to this place. And don't even get me started on the Creme Brule ! I work in the restaurant industry and it's rare to have my standards met and damn did this place do an amazing job. Yah.. boo hoo we had to wait 10 mins with a reservation but it was so worth it even the bread was amazing!

I've had multiple poor experiences here. First, this place is always busy and has terrible parking. Every time I've gone, I've had to circle the parking lot looking for a spot. Because it's so busy, the service is terrible too. They're always busy. You have to wait to get a table, even with a reservation, then wait for a long time for them to take your order.
The last time my family went, the staff was VERY apologetic so maybe our experience was unique. We counted and they apologized to us 10 different times. 
I concede that the waiting may be due in large part to going during popular nights (Friday and Saturday) and that this is a VERY popular restaurant but I didn't find any of it worthwhile.  I love seafood, but I really didn't think the food was very good, honestly.

Aarrgghh! I feel like a Pirate inside the restaurant. I love the atmosphere! 
It is not my first time but I thought it was time for me to give a review. I asked to go for my birthday. Did not disappoint as usual. 
The hot loaf of bread with butter is always a good start to get my taste buds going. Of course, I fill up too much on it to get to dessert. 
My hubby and I normally start with a dozen of raw oysters and they have been consistently fresh and briny. Then we have a few appetizers as our meal. The frog legs have been great and have a light spicy kick. The Fried calamari is light, crunchy and not over fried (like the addition of the artichoke hearts mixed in with the calamari). 
This time I had the Costa Rican Tilapia Lafayette. It was perfectly done (I hate over cooked fish) and the sauce was plate lickin' good. My hubby had the Pasta Mardi Gras and he gave it the thumbs up. I gave it a taste and it was very flavorful with the Andouille sausage and in a very rich cream sauce. 
We'll be back soon so I can try more items off the large menu!

I love patio dining.  This place provides a very large patio dining and would be good for small parties. The food was good and next time I will try the oysters. The banana pudding in the mason jar (lid provided for taking leftover) was very tasty and not overly sweet. It tasted like homemade pudding. Yum

I would like to share an update with my fellow Yelpers.  After making my initial review I was contacted by Guest Relations and was offered the opportunity to return to give it a second try.  The General Manager stepped in and that was honorable of Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen to right a wrong and offer an apology for the service that was provided.  I was also given a gift card as a token of respect as a customer (the amount doesn't matter) and I will choose to give it another chance, which is why I have given them another star for the effort.  The food has always been decent when I've visited on other occasions, so let's hope that I can add some more stars the next time I visit.

Pretty. Busy. Too expensive for what you get. Ordered an amaretto on the rocks & got a glass full of ice with barely enough amaretto to wet my palette. All of the food is A la carte which,  if it's served family style makes sense but, for the price of 1 baked potato you can buy 10 lbs. Our friend's ordered the oysters & they were undercooked, which can be dangerous.  The cheese grits, However, we're excellent.  In a small town perhaps I could understand the popularity of this restaurant but, in a city like Phoenix there are too many other restaurants with the same type food for less money & better food. No need to return.
Great seafood for a reasonable price! The waitstaff is always prompt and the ambiance is always welcoming!

Food is amazing. Absolutely delicious. Its loud when it's busy so something to take into consideration. If you want an intimate setting or in our case we had my older parents with us, we couldn't carry on a conversation it was so loud.

I absolutely love Seafood and this place is amazing!!! The freshness of all the food really shines through. The atmosphere is casual with a fine dining feel.  Prices are pretty  reasonable especially for what you get.  I had no problem paying $150 plus tip for a family of 4.  Even the kiddie meals were outstanding and they aren't shy on the portion sizes......This will definitely be my go to place when in need of supremely fresh seafood and steaks!!!

If Papadeauxs were a person, it would be a large, well dressed, garish Rolex wearing pompous ass of a man who talks big and has little in the way of substance. Think, well, Donald Trump. Yes, this place is "the Donald" of rip off dining!!!
The service was excellent. Marcus was friendly and most professional. But the food sucked. I tell you it was pitiful for the value. The martini glass was literally just half full. Pathetic. They should be ashamed of themselves, and for $10 per drink.  
Granted, Im a Louisianan, thus a tough critic on any pseudo LA house beyond my home state. That said, I tasted the gumbo: watery, huge chunks of celery sparse proteins and just truly a joke. Campbells in the can puts this stuff to shame. 
I opted for the halibut. Previously frozen, the piece was tough and the sauce devoid of flavor other than that of the overwhelming tablespoon of huge capers atop it. 
In sum, Papadeauxs is a hands down sad imposter of Louisiana cuisine and so overtly overpriced its simply comical. 
I had the halibut ($33), two puny martinis and a shrimp cocktail, the high spot of the meal, but whats is that, Ketchup and horseradish? Really??  My tab was $72.00!! Highway robbery. Do yourself a favor and head to Texas Roadhouse for a steak or Red Lobster if you must have seafood outside the state of Louisiana. Save the difference a few times then take a nice vaca to the Big Easy, treat yourself to Commanders Palace or Galitiores in the French Quarter. Your check will be identical but your meal superlative in every way.

I had the Red Snapper with squash topped with brown butter tonight. It was FANTASTIC. I expected it to be good but this was beyond good. Thank you for the excellent service, Chad. You are also a delight tonight.

I love this place! Service is great from the door greater to the waiters. The  food here  is delicious.  I've  tasted all their plates made with Mahi Mahi. Have the alligator  or frog legs appetizer next time you stop by if you're not in the mood for trying something new try the calamari. You can not leave without having desert they are all good.

Wow!  Great food and great service.   I got the pan seared tilapia and it was perfect in every way.  It had a brown butter sauce that was amazing and was topped with crab meat and grilled shrimp...so delicious!  Even the green beans were cooked to perfection.  My dinner partner had the redfish and it was also wonderful.   Huge portions too..no scrimping here.  Our waiter Kyle was great too.  We look forward to going back soon.

Ya know, I just kinda get Pappadeaux. Is it exquisite? No. Is it fancy? No. Is it really really good and consistent? Yes. The food is always spot on. It is as fresh as it can be in Phoenix. I have yet to find anyplace as consistently good as Pappadeaux. It is not cheap but quality seafood never is. Party of 5 with 1 child 300.00 with gratuity. We ate really well. My two favorites are Shrimp Po Boy and Shrimp Etouffe for meals. Alligator is very very good, so is the lobster bisque and the oysters on the half shell. I don't know how else to say it other than I personally totally get it and I love the fact that I do.

I like seafood just like I love other foods I wouldn't prefer it over any other food so I'm not obsessed with seafood but but I eat it and love it. So I wouldn't be able to tell you how great or not great or fresh something is. I went with a friend that is a sea food person and says that this is the freshest you will get in Phoenix. The food is sometimes heavy but still delicious. It's southern food and people go here to get that Louisiana type of taste.

We went to this restaurant last night and noticed that the prices have gone way up, so I had settled for expensive plate of simple chicken when my husband and I noticed that a small roach-like bug was crawling up the wall behind us. We were seated just on the other side of the kitchen, right below the window to look inside of it. We told our server who got the manager. He said "oh it's just a stink bug" and grabbed it with a tissue and threw it away. We asked for a new table and he went to find a new one. While he was gone (about 3 minutes) another critter started crawling up the wall and went right under the wood by the window into the kitchen area. At that point we just left. It was really disgusting. We have always loved their food, but I think it's going to be a very long time before we can go back there and we will not recommend this place to anybody again.

We have been to several Pappadeaux and have always enjoyed the food and experience. The one in Phoenix was no exception. Great atmosphere, service and food. My only complaint was I ate too much but that was my doing because it was so good.

Last night was the worst experience I've ever had at a Pappas establishment. I've eaten at all of them but the service and timing last evening was horrible. I waited 1.5 hours to be seated then after 45 minutes waiting for the appetizer the manager came over and pretty much said he would take care of us. Well that did. It happen either. We paid full price for horrible service. The food was great but my two year old grand son just did not have the patients to be there 3 hours. Please reach out if you care.

Audrey B is AMAZING!!! Came here the other night for my birthday dinner with my father and brother and was served by one of the best waitresses ever. She was very kind, funny, sat us at a great table and just made my overall experience the best it could be. She got our drinks to us very fast, got our appetizers to us fast and did a great job on upselling us to a great choice of another appetizers. She never missed a beat when we needed something at our table. Never had to wait for our food or drinks, always had something in front of us. 

The food was great but the service Audrey B gave was fantastic.

Best and freshest seafood in AZ! Flown in fresh daily. All appetizers and entrees were delicious! From alligator to oysters to crawfish and more... Desserts are true "Nawlins" style! Bourbon sauce on bread pudding... OMG!!! Oversized and yummy créme brûlée ... I'll be back!!

Pappadeaux ended up making for a great night out! 

Given it was $6.95 for a dozen Gulf Coast Oysters, my girlfriend and I did have to wait for about 30 minutes until we were seated. However after that wait, we were seated and quickly assisted by a kind waitress, who's name is passing me right now. She was a great waitress given she was attentive but not overbearing. 

My girlfriend and I ordered the Gulf Coast Oysters as a starter and we're pleased with them. They came with horseradish, lemon, and a soy sauce garlic type of sauce. After scarfing those down, I ordered a bowl of Scrimp Gumbo and my girlfriend order mussels. The gumbo was good, but the broth had an abnormal flavor that I wasn't accustomed to. The mussels; however, were excellent. They were in a white-wine garlic sauce that was topped with parsley and lemon. For dessert we thoroughly enjoyed and shared a glazed creme brûlée with berries, that was also excellent. Through and through, with an exception of the gumbo, the food was 5-Star. 

Shortly, the atmosphere was similar to an average creole restaurant. Given the Cubs were playing the Indians, the bar was packed and quite loud. The fun laughed and formally dresser servers makes for a romantic atmosphere. 

With all of this being said, Pappadeaux is a great place to eat at for creole and seafood. 

4.35 Stars.

This place is a little more fancy than I expected....decor and atmosphere-wise...I thought it would be plain and simple like Red Lobster but actually the place has a very southern homey feeling to it.....although a seafood place they had like deer heads hanging and other sorts of weird decor. 
 
Came here for dinner yesterday night with my bf and his apartment-mate...we got a table right away but even for a weekday they were still half a full house. The first thing I saw on their menu was the Crispy Alligator appetizer. ALLIGATOR! ooooh but then I wanted to try their oyster appetizers cause they sound good too....ahhhhhh their menu is full of yummy choices! It was difficult deciding what I wanted to get...but after much debate....my bf and I decided to order the Oyster Duo appetizer and share the Pappadeaux Platter -- which is an amazing sample platter of all the fried variety they offer on the fried seafood section of their menu. 

So the Oysters Duo -- comes with 3 oysters on half shell baked with a parmesan romano cheese sauce and 3 oysters on half shell topped with crabmeat, spinach and drizzled with Hollandaise sauce. -- oooh they were both delicious however I recommend the later one more just cause it's very unique to this restaurant. I got to also try a few pieces of the Crispy Fried Alligator from our friend's Appetizer Trio Platter - It was pretty good actually tastes like chicken...but surprisingly more tender - I was thinking alligator meat would be tough and rough but not at all....I wouldn't have known it's alligator meat if you didn't tell me. But now I can say I have had alligator meat!

The Pappadeaux Platter was pretty good - everything is well  -- fried! However I like the blue crab cake the most, the mini fried crawfish (kind of like popcorn shrimp) is second best however I have to say that the fried Tilapia was a disappointment because it was sadly bland and really dry...it was the only thing I didn't like on the platter. but everything else was good. - - I even tried their watermelon lemonade and it was super refreshing!

I was really excited for dessert cause I saw them carrying around a platter of sample of the desserts that they have...so when we were ready for dessert I was excited to see the dessert platter - unfortunately there was nothing on the dessert platter I wanted because they all looked really rich and sweet....such as their sweet potato pecan pie, key lime pie, praline cheesecake, praline bread pudding souffle or turtle fudge brownie was just too much even for the eyes..lol They were also massive in portions so I decided not to have any. 

The service was really good, our waitress was pretty quick and friendly. Overall I enjoyed the most of the food (except the fried tilapia) and the service is good so it earned it's four stars. :)

Since I was in AZ area for the weekend with my gf for pleasure we decided to visit one of my friends in the area. She picked this place and we decided to get seafood instead of steak or a meat house. 

First of all, I'd suggest making reservations otherwise DO NOT COME HERE. We showed up at 7pm but weren't seated until 845. Good thing we ate a really good lunch otherwise I'd be starving and complaining like a baby. At least this gave us time to have a few drinks before dinner in the LARGE outdoor waiting patio area. I think it was so crowded because it was the weekend before Fat Tuesday. This place kinda reminds me of Bubba Gump or something similar. It seems fun and they do have a large bar and waiting area. 

We ordered alligator and frog legs as an appetizer. LOVED IT!!! We wanted the fried alligator and frog legs but the waiter absolutely loved that he worked here and HIGHLY recommended that we order it grilled instead. Since he worked here, we figured why not? I was thinking to myself that the cooks were a bit lazy and maybe they didn't want to prepare it. Lol. To my surprise, it was good as he mentioned. I have had both before but not for a few years so I was pleased. My gf ordered the crab stuffed shrimp which was really good. I ordered a  combination seafood plate which was good but not great. 

There are way too many things to order on the menu. A lot of fried food so if you are trying to watch your diet/weight then don't come here. 

I would definitely come here again but I wouldn't be in any rush. Great for a lot of people and groups, but PLEASE make RESERVATIONS.

My Favorite in Dallas

This is my favorite restaurant to visit when I'm in Dallas.  I haven't made that trip in awhile, so was eager to come to this one.  The building layout is the same and the food is just as good.  Be ready to pay some $$ as it is not cheap.  $90 for two people.

Last time i was able to visit papadeauxs for dinner (excuse my spelling) my experience was less than stellar at one of the Georgia locations. This time around this location knocked me off my feet with the quality of food and service for their carry out orders. While in phoenix to celebrate my friends wedding. I didn't have enough time to dine in so i opted to carry against my usual notions that carry outs are never as good as dining in. Well, I would like to thank papadeuaxs for changing my mind because my carry out meal was phenomenal. It was just as fresh and delicious as if i would have dined in. The portion size and quality was not skimmed on. The food was still hot when I made it back to my fathers home which was about 30 minutes away from this location.  You can tell that this location puts pride into every dish they serve out their kitchen!

We went here for father's day. The place wasn't too busy when we arrived, about a 20 minute wait so we took seats at the bar which was open. It was nice to see that the bar offered full service and had the wait been longer we might have entertained the though of sitting at the bar but there is limited space and we weren't sure how big the servings were, the plates, etc. So we grabbed a few beers and waited. They do have Turbodog on tap which I had never heard of before then. The bartender offered me a sample and I really enjoyed it. We weren't up at the bar long and our pager went off. We had to cash out there which is customary and we headed to our seat.

Our waitress was very friendly. We already had beers so she didn't need to get us drinks and we already knew what we wanted for appetizers so we ordered right away the and appetizers came out pretty quickly. We had the oysters Baton Rouge were fantastic to be honest with you. No complaints at all there. 

For our main dishes I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette and Brandi ordered the Crawfish Platter which includes fried crawfish and crawfish etouffee. Each dish was 23.95 and neither dish was worth it. The jumbo shrimp was flavorless. All you could taste was the bacon. You could have served me straight bacon for 5 bucks and it would have tasted the same. The jalapeno rice that came with it was good though. the fried portion of the crawfish platter was plentiful and very good but the etouffee was bland. 

On top of that we never got any bread until the meal came out and here's the kicker on that. It took an HOUR for the meal to come out. Keep in mind they weren't even really that busy. We had 3 tables sit down around us afterwards and all three got their food before us. And the thing is the waitress was oblivious. We had to track her down in order to inquire about our food. I feel it is part of her responsibility to know that we are sitting there for an hour without food. She said she would get a manager right on it. and when we did get the food it was brought by a manager to us but he never once acknowledged us or said he was sorry for the wait or anything. Didn't ask if we needed anything else either. Came, dropped our food off and split. To be honest with you I expected the food to be cold as if it was sitting somewhere forgotten about but it wasn't. Seemed fresh which makes me think the order never was put in and when it was they made it immediately. 

For me to go to a place to eat and drop 100 bucks I expect better food than what I got and I definitely expect better service. 

I was extremely disappointed in this visit.

My family and I love to get together and have a big dinner here when we can all plan it on the same night! The last time I ate here was about a year ago and since then I have converted to eating a vegan diet. I wasn't too worried because I saw someone's review that they had a pasta and it was really good. When we got there I asked Kami, our waitress, if I could just get a plain pasta with marinara and some steamed or roasted vegetables and she was very knowledgable on how the food was prepared and made sure there was no butter or dairy anywhere near my plate, which after having some bad experiences, I am SUPER grateful for. She was so sweet and she made sure I was happy with everything that came out. We also had an incident where someone's lobster wasn't fully cooked. It came out of the shell still clear and Kami had no problem taking it back to see what she could do for us. Half of the lobster was eaten and was pretty much cooked, it was really just one claw that didn't get fully cooked and the manager at the time Drew was so sweet as she brought back the claw fully cooked and told us that the whole lobster was on the house and that she was extremely sorry for the undercooked lobster. That was really amazing because you just don't get service like that anymore. I can't remember the last time that I had to send food back and the manager actually comes out, let alone takes the dish off the bill.

Always 5 stars and a great time. They are even open until midnight on Fridays! But it is true that they don't bring breadsticks out unless you ask for them.

I took my son here for Valentine's Day because he loves seafood. I actually hate it. Anyways, I like that they do have other options here for those like myself who don't like seafood. We ordered the lobster and fillet. Since, I don't eat seafood and my son is five, I asked if they could take the lobster meat out of the tail because well, clearly I sure as heck don't know what I'm doing with that. I was really appreciative that they were able to handle that for us so that my son could eat his lobster. Their dessert was delicious! We ate so much we left so full we couldn't breathe. First world problems.

I am a fan of Pappadeaux...Went on a Saturday night in JUNE; seated right away; hostess/manager came by to say our server just had a "7 top" and was taking their order; and would be there to get our order.  It took over 15 minutes to get our drink order; because none of the wait staff or management told our server that we were seated behind a wooden support beam.  We didn't even get water; not good...But after our server saw us he apologized for the delay; and the meal was great from that moment on; the food & drinks were great.  Our server after the rocky start; was one of the best I ever had at any establishment.

This place is always packed so my husband made a reservation to avoid the wait.  This was our 1st visit and the food and service was great.  I ordered the Caribbean lobster tail and he got the deep fried shrimp & chicken.  He mistakenly ordered a large portion which he couldn't finish.  We ordered the sweet tea and mango ice tea and they were the best we've ever had. I now get why this place is packed all the time.

Made our reservations for 8pm and  sat down right on time. Started the meal with beers that were flat, i then ordered another beer but they ran out of it. Followed by limited appetizers because they were out so many things. As we ordered we were told they were out of several fish selections. 20 mins later we were told they ran out of dirty rice and had to wait 45 mins to make some more. After waiting a very long time i had little appetite.. Once our food  arrived i was unimpressed by the anount of salt it had. Every dish my party ordered was drenched in salt. None of us finished our meal or wanted to take it to go. To compensate for the wait we were offered dessert which were limited because they ran out of so many... No surprise! 
I however, will compliment the waitresses. She was friendly and made our experience better.

It's been at least 4 years since we have had Pappadeaux in Texas.  Always enjoy it and love the crawfish trio.   This time around tried a variety of items and favorites were the crawfish, pappadeaux platter and the mussels.  Mussels were big and juicy in an awesome broth.    Layout is just like other Pappadeuax's around Texas, but felt a little larger in the patio waiting area.  Great service and got our fix for the next few years.

I like this restaurant very much, and actually  I have been there over ten times since 2013. Especially they have many types of beer, and many Cajun foods so I enjoy drinking beers and eating Cajun foods every time. Today my wife and I ate gumbo and spring roll, thus she said they tasted great, and I also felt good for them. In addition the server Ms. A was very kind and gentle for us, so we were very comfortable with our lunch time there. 
I really want to visit there to enjoy lunch and dinner again.

This is the 2nd time I have been here. After a shopping excursion with my Wife, we stopped in around 8pm. It wasnt too busy, and found a booth in the bar right off the bat.

We decided to be a little adventurous and try out the Fired Alligator and Fried Frog legs. Both were extremely good. Since I am afraid to death of alligators it was a little self satisifing eating one! Now instead of looking at them as scary things, I see them in bite sized fried nuggets! 
The Frog legs were equally as good. As the saying goes, tastes like chicken.

Dinner I had the Australian lobster tail. It was cooked perfectly! My wife had the tilapia laffayette thing, and it too was cooked perfectly. Nothing was overcooked or undercooked. They definately know what they are doing here cooking fish.

Waiter was prompt, courteous, and was johnny on the spot for water/tea refills. We didnt feel rushed at all, but we were definately in and out very quickly.

Would definatley visit again!

We went here last night for my fiances birthday and I was very pleasantly surprised! The environment and ambience reminded me of a restaurant from New England. Casual but classy. Our server, Marcus, was absolutely delightful. He explained the menu to us and made some great suggestions. I ordered the Costa Rican mahi and it was perfect. It came with green beans and cheesy grits. I felt the seasoning was just right. We got the creme brûlée for dessert and I highly recommend others to try it!

OMG! First time was the charm. Delicious and the waitress was great too. First time having oysters! Wow! Incredible! Fried calamari was great. Pasta with scallops and shrimp was to die for. The alfredo sauce was so good. I don't generally eat seafood but had a business dinner and I am so glad I did! Very pricey but hey I wasn't paying. Really had a nice evening.

My friends  love this place . I am always  tempted  to eat there . The wait is horrible  normally  45 minutes . I tried it recently.  I love their jumbo but it is a little  on the salty side . The restaurant  is dimly lit . Menu is huge which makes it hard to decide.  Service was a little  slow
My favorite place in Phoenix ...food never fails and the Swamp Thing cocktail is amazing!

5 Stars is saying a lot about the quality of your dining experience at Pappadeaux.

-I've been here probably over five times since I've lived in AZ and every experience is top notch! 
Our server was really chill, laid back and even though very busy always checked to see if we needed anything. Most people these days even if the place is dead will not even check on you unless they are looking to drop off the bill. 

-The food is bomb, I had Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp wrapped in bacon over dirty rice (recommended). 
Atmosphere is fun and poppin all on a Sunday at that! I was really surprised. 

-Beast Seafood in AZ hands down for the reasons above, I would definitely check it out if your in town and want some good food and southern hospitality in the desert. 

5 STARS

The first time came it was great food. I got stuffed lobster . It came with these noodles with a great sauce. Went back a month later ordered the same thing did not get the noodles with sauce I asked about it. I was told it was no longer available. I was very disappointed. I don't know why it was no longer available. Have not been back since.

My husband swears by this place as he loves Cajun food.Unfortunately our 12 year old daughter had the crab cakes served straight up in a crab shel.That night she was violently ill! Pain continued along with unsettled stomach resulting in doctor visit as well as labs ordered( imagine what type of lab orders..not blood orders)! Very upsetting and not only did we pay over $100.00 for lunch, we paid for much more.Hoping nobody else experiences food poisoning. ...Needless to say if the husband wants Cajun we will have to go to New Orleans! I've never used Yelp, but felt this was important!

Southern atmosphere 
Cajun theme
Seafood is great 
Other dishes are NOT n afterthought

Get the gator!! #perfection

I know what your thinking. A chain? It can't be THAT good right? You can't go wrong with Pappadeaux. Unfortunately it's the only location in Arizona so most of the time it's pretty crowded during peak hours. I usually sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. 

Starting with the drink options. They have a variety of mixed drinks for whatever you are in the mood for. My personal favorite is the swamp thing. 

If you are an oyster lover you came to the right place! They have the best oysters in town so make sure you at least get a dozen for an appetizer. If oysters are not you cup of tea then you must try the fried alligator. Trust me...you can't go wrong with this one.

Now on to the entrees! They have everything from seafood plates, steak, fresh fish, salads, and cajun favorites. Don't skip out on dessert they have quite a selection to satisfy your sweet tooth. 

The service is always great here! Everyone is professional, knowledgable, and friendly. I can honestly say this is one of the few places I trust for amazing seafood and cajun style dishes in Arizona.

This place had to be the highlight of my trip to Arizona. I haven't had such good seafood in a long time. Not to mention the great service by a young lady named yelena who well deserved the tip that she received, she made the experience even better. It was seven of us and she made sure drinks were full and food was out in a timely manner .Three of us had the shrimp etoufee and all i can say is Mercy. The crab mac and cheese yummy goodness . Also the fried calamari and seafood platter . I can keep going on and on because we ordered so much food we were stuffed before our entrees even came out. Everything was so good no complaints at all. On my way to catch my flight to San francisco lets just say this spot is now one of my favorite spots to visit in Arizona.....See you next time

Love this place!!! Best seafood around. My last visit, I went for lunch. I tried the shrimp and sausage jambalaya. Yum!

Service is always great! Relaxing atmosphere with indoor/outdoor seating. Prices are very reasonable.

Years back we were regular customers considering our snowbird status. In recent years we hadn't been here so when friends suggested we meet there to celebrate two wedding anniversaries it seemed a good idea. I am not so sure now. Friends split the halibut special and were enthusiastic. I ordered a wedge salad and the mussel appetizer and was happy enough.  My wife had the clam chowder and shrimp cocktail and was disappointed with quality of shrimp and said the chowder was terrible. She loved her cheesecake dessert and our friends enjoyed the creme brûlée and pecan pie.  Interestingly enough the salad our friends had came in a separate course whereas the salad I ordered and my wife's chowder came with our other dish which overfilled the table. Wine list was ok.  Waitress was seldom around. Water and ice tea ran dry. It was busy. I still feel this chain normally does a better job. We did get free desserts.
Fun place. But a recently changed menu took off the best salad.  Now gone is the lobster/shrimp/crab salad. We always make it a point to stop at the other sites at DFW and IAH.  Not my more.

This place is the place to be if you like seafood,great atmosphere and great food prices are really good the only bad experience I had there was the wait the hostesses told me 30 mins for a party of 2 and we waited a lil over an hour but still gave them 5 stars cause there food was great

Father-in law was in town and felt like some seafood. I thought nowhere better to take this out of town-er than Pappadeaux's.. My husband and I have eaten a few times here for lunch and everytime it's been out of control good. We arrived friday night, no waiting needed. 

We sat in the back and ordered drinks, and a medium size gator app, yes as in alligator. My margarita was very sweet, felt like they added a cup of sugar in it, and it came in a fu/fu glass. The gator was good, but too small for three people. 
Wait staff was very nice and explained that the fish flys in fresh daily, and went into detail of the dishes we were going to order. I ordered the Marti Gra.. My husband and his dad got some seafood array?? not sure of the name.. but it looked good. My main dish came and woohoo... it was slammin good. It had crawfish, sausage, shrimp over a bed of creamy pasta.. it was so good, I could only eat 1/4 of the bowl. The portion sizes are pretty big. By the way there bread is baked daily and is so good, they serve a loaf of it for an app, if you eat the whole thing you can ask for another. (Very Good stuff) 

Anyways.. always fantastic food, if you have visitors from out of town that like seafood I would recommend this place... Lunch is cheaper, around $12-16 a plate.. Dinner from $15-35.

Best seafood in Phoenix.  The atmosphere is like dining in a little home restaurant.  The service is above average.  The food is to die for!  Rich and spicy cajun style cooking with delicious sauces.  When you order shrimp or oyster appetizers, you get big bivalves or shrimp.  Everything tastes fresh.  This is a favorite to take the wife for a nice evening out.

Fantastic food. Amazing service. Dominique, our waiter, was attentive, friendly and energetic. We were so happy with him. Drinks were refilled before we had a chance to ask. The fried alligator was so tasty! Ambiance of the restaurant was great as well. Will definitely be coming back!

Our 2 servers, Viv and Josh were outstanding, providing AMAZING EXCELLENT service and very professional, esp. Josh who served the children table. Thank you both. It was the first time for our family dining at Pappadeaux, since we re from SoCal. The portions were HUMONGOUSLY YUUUGE!! The wifey had the Blackened Catfish w Shrimp. Our son had the Fried Shrimp plate (long story short: Josh had a mixup and thought he had orderd from the kids menu, so his platter was a bit smaller compared to his teammates dining at the same table. Josh was so cool, he brought out more than a handful more fried shrimp!! ). Our daughter had the hot dog bites w fries, came w fruit & lemonade from the kids menu, and I had the very delicious Mixed Grilled Seafood Skewer platter (came with Salmon, Scallops & Shrimp w Dirty Rice, and Grilled Veggies). Wifey and I also shared a bowl of their equally delicious Seafood Gumbo. Would definitely come back again!

The Prodigy Hoops Fam

Have had gone a few times for seafood great place! But  just recently had a surprise for my girlfriend who has a daughter in the Army. Her daughter and I made arrangements with the restaurant and were very gracious to help us out with the surprise. Since her mom had no idea she was here in state. What the restaurant did next was even a bigger surprise, all 7 military personnel and three of us as family members received a 50 percent discount off our bill. My hats off to them, any other place that I know of so far give 10 to 15 percent. What a great way to say thanks for service and support to our troops.

I came here with co-workers on a business trip to have some great food and unwind.  The decor is nice, and we were seated very quickly.  Service is fantastic and I never had a water glass less than half full.  Excellent specialty cocktails and ice-cold beer complimented our food.

I ordered a appetizer sampler and it was incredible.  Highly recommended.  Also had fish which was cooked to perfection.  Pappadeaux is a bit on the pricey side, but that was expected and the food and service are definitely up to par with the prices.

My husband and I have been celebrating Mardi Gras at Pappadeaux for several years. We have had the best waiters that are extremely fun and cheerful. The manager even stopped by our table to make sure my chocolate food allergy was taken seriously and made every accommodations for me. We definitely had a terrific experience. 
Complements to the chef - alligator was nice and tender, as well as my crawfish. Thanks for a wonderful meal.

I do not go here often, but would highly recommend it for those special occasions.  The atmosphere was stunning, with romantic lighting as well as a live entertainer.  I had the sea bass and every bite was delicious with lots of flavor and flaked off on my fork.  Can not wait to go again.

A unique place in Phoenix where you can get fresh fish, craw fish, gator tail and soft shell crab!  Great service,  very nice ambiance, but it does get crouded and loud on the weekends.  Don't forget your wallet, because it ain't cheep to bring the swamp to the desert.

We had a great time food is good a little pricey but atmosphere service worth it we had a private room by luck it's real loud there but exciting definitely worth it. 5 stars is taking everything into account, server Vivanita  (I think) was great she handled table of 9 separate checks never rushed us. I had shrimp etouffe was good and spicey decent portion  gumbo was awesome  (small portion) we were in the wine room which was wonderful because it was private except for servers getting wine every once and a while. Well worth it, the restaurant itself large vibrant bar activity and people watching on a Friday night was great. Diverse crowd was beautiful. Keely the manager also was very nice.

The service and food was amazing. Even though they were extremely busy, our server was on her game! She was polite, funny and never let our drinks get empty. Sure wish I could recall her name! 

The food was amazing! My steak was cooked to perfection and the rock lobster was delicious! We were a party of 5 and everyone enjoyed their food!

Will definitely be back to this location!

Great food. Great service. Started with the wonderful Blue piont oysters. I had the Seafood platter, and it was the first time I ever had anything served with fries where I couldn't care less about the fries. Everything was lightly battered and not at all greasy. Husband had the Pasta Mardi Gras, and it too was amazing. We topped off the night with house made banana pudding and pralines cheese cake (both free for our birthdays).
Stuffed and happy to have leftovers. 
Oh, and they also give a Veteran discount with ID.
The absolutely most delicious Cajon food I have ever eaten.   Great family atmosphere,  friendly staff and yummy drinks.  My favorite restaurant of all times!

Great service, beautiful atmosphere and very, very tasty,....we loved it all! We all tried several dishes and ate off each others plates,...hahaha! My one and only suggestion is add tomatoes to the po-boy. The French bread was ok, but when you've had New Orleans french bread, it's hard to not compare! I will definitely visit Pappadeaux's every single time we're in town! Thanks for the good eats,.....my taste buds were doing the HaPPy dance!

For my 100th review, i choose Pappadeaux. The first time i was ever there , Saturday night.   Fantastic ,Wow we loved it!  
Our server was Robert, he gets an A plus in customer service..We started with Water ,wine, Ice Tea, and my girl got coffee. He brought lemons and straws for our water, Brewed fresh coffee and kept my Ice Tea refilled the entire night.
The meals were incredible. Our appetizer  was to die for.   
The meals are huge ,we had to take it to go and we had enough for dinner on Sunday. Mediterranean Calamari was so good!  We did not like the Capers in it, but it also comes with fired artichoke!! 
Lobster Bisque, was probably the best i have ever had!  The Lobster,Crab, and Talapia were all very fresh. They say they have it flown in every day. I believe it because, it was as i said fantastic!    The decor is very good, dark wood, everything nice and big.  
 We cannot wait to come back here. Lots of Parking in the lot.

I have found a new favorite restaurant.  If there is one place on my reviews where I could go for a special occasion - this would be it.

To start - the ambience...  You feel immersed in New Orleans, from the moderately lit dining hall, gaslit lamps, waiters in black pants and white aprons and wonderful music.

The food was absolutely fantistic.  I had the Crawfish Trio, which was a mix of Crawfish Etoufee, Fried Crawfish and Sauteed Crawfish.  The etoufee had a rich, dark, buttery roux and was smothered over dirty rice.  

The sauteed crawdad was a pleasant surprise.  I expected a crawdad sauteed in butter, but instead it was sauteed in a spicy cream sauce.  They also served the dinner with a loaf of fresh bread baked in-house.  

If you've been to Disneyland's "Blue Bayou", this place reminds you a little of that restaurant.

The shelfish/seafood selection is EXTENSIVE.

Like it and Loved It!  Go to this place and you will not be disappointed.  I heard they have several locations throughout the US.   When are they coming to California?!

Always great but prices are getting out of reach. Service for this location seems "Iffy". Sometimes good other times not good. We have frequented at least 10 different Pappas restaurants in Texas and AZ. location. Big fan but the prices are rising and there's no real reason other than padding for more profit margins. Understand all that but it's making it a "No-Go" for a budget minded family.

We enjoyed the atmosphere with a southern bayou vibe. The menu had quite a selection. Some menu items were intriguing. I ordered the Halibut,shrimp & octopus entree. The halibut was a bit over cooked but tasty, shrimp was yummy too. The octopus was very chewy & I wasn't fond of the taste. My daughter had the filet mignon Oscar & love it. It was just the 2 of us & we did have an appetizer & each had 1 cocktail. The check was $142 which is on the steep side.

One of the best seafood places I ever been to.  I was in doubt at first since I am in Arizona, but found out this family owned operation gets daily deliveries from Houston.  Frog legs fell of the bone.  They offered Caribbean lobster and clam chowder was so tasty.  Also had the Bluepoint down oysters.  So many options on the menu it was hard to decide.  Try it out if you are in Phoenix.

Oh Pappadeaux's, how I wish you were closer to my home. If I didn't have to drive 40-45 minutes to get there, I would probably spend my entire paycheck on two things: Oysters and Fried Alligator. As such, I'm going to stick to those two things in my review. Those are really the only two things that I eat when I go, because I cannot get enough of them.

First things first, the staff and ambiance. The music can get a little bit loud, but the atmosphere is always fun and upbeat. The staff all seems to be pretty friendly, too. Our server was especially friendly and helpful. This is definitely a place I like to go to with my friends to hang out and have a good night.

Now, I'll talk about the food. First, the oysters. The oysters here are great! They give you a few different sauces to go along with them, each of which has a distinct, delicious flavor to add. To make the oysters even better, they have incredible deals on them! They only cost about $4.00 per dozen for the special they supposedly have running almost all the time. The type of oysters that you get on the special vary based on whatever factors affect the catching of oysters. As for the Fried Alligator, IT'S FRIED ALLIGATOR. As soon as I saw it on the menu, I had to have it. To quote one of my favorite movies (Transformers), "Alligator is the most succulent meat." The Fried Alligator here is one of my favorite things to eat. I absolutely cannot have enough Fried Alligator. The meat is moist and juicy with a light and non-fishy flavor, and the batter/breading layer is fried crisp. That combo of the moist meat with the crispy outside is phenomenal. Add on the dusting of cajun seasoning and the creole dipping sauce, and you have a dish you won't forget. 

In conclusion, I definitely recommend this place. I can't really speak for anything other than the oysters and the fried alligator, but do I need to? Come on, it's Fried Alligator and cheap oysters! Stop reading and go to Pappadeaux's!

Great restaurant! !! I absolutely love this place.  I just graduated from Grand Canyon University with my Master's degree and wanted to celebrate.  My family and I went here for the first time.  My dad fell in love with the Lobster tail, Mom loved the steak, and I loved all the sea food. Great service,  justified price, and the dessert is fantastic! !.

The price is a bit high. The kids' meals are good quality compared to some places. We have gone here three times. The service is always good. I typically get some kind of fish along with raw oysters. The included bread is good. We enjoyed the blackened alligator appetizer.

Great food and great service!  Even though it was a busy night, they did a great job seating us in a reasonable amount of time.  Once we ordered the food came out quickly.  I highly recommend if you are looking for Cajun food in Phoenix.

This place is simply amazing.  If this place didn't break the bank I would be there all the time.  The crab cakes covered in rich sause with crawdad's is unbelievable.  Atmosphere draws you in and the service is top notch.

It is pricey but once you taste the food you will understand the price.
Delicious seafood! If you love seafood and can style, this is the place to go! Wonderful customer service too! My second time visiting Phoenix, and this is my second time coming here.

Very Very Disappointed ordered the $35 Big Bay Plater. The shrimp on skewer was over cooked with no flavor and the Caribbean lobster tail had no favor what so ever. first time there and might just be the last.

Was here about a week ago and if you are in or going through Phoenix this is a must go to. Had several items and all were great. The Oysters were fanominal.  The Lobster was terrific and the steak was beautifully cooked. The most disappointed part was that I could not have dessert.  I was just so full.
AMAZING. WORTH the hour long wait. Best seafood I've had in AZ. I recommend the jumbo crab cakes and the swamp thing (drink). Pretty much anything else you eat there will be amazing!

Came here for mother's day! It was packed but the wait wasn't too bad and they had a band and drinks while you were waiting. 

We got Calamari for the app. It was your typical Calamari. My sister and I shared the Sampler Platter. It had Tilipia, Shrimp, and Chicken with fries. We got full pretty fast, and it was really good. I don't normally like seafood, but it was all fried and good. Dessert we shared the turtle brownie...It was a little dry and needed to be warmer. 

Our server was really outgoing and funny. It was super busy so it took her awhile to get to us, but she was a good waitress. Made us laugh quite a bit. 

I'd like to go back on a calmer day to see if the quality was lacking because of the Mother's Day rush.

I have been around Phoenix for about 4 years and today was one of the saddest days of these 4 years... I realised today that I was so close but so far away from an amazingly delicious kitchen of Pappadeaux Seafood for those 4 long years... wish somebody had told me about this place earlier and I would have spent at least a double dozen nights at Pappadeaux while I was in Phoenix... what an amazing place !

We started with a bowl of "Louisiana" Seafood Gumbo... yummmm... spicy and so tasty ! ... (those who don't go for spicy food should stay a yard away from it... it was really spicy... as in Indian Vindaloo spicy... ) ... I felt like I could have easily had a couple more of that gumbo... :)

Shrimp Creole With white rice and Crawfish Etouffee With dirty rice followed that gumbo... both of these were so mouth watering... a perfectly cooked Crawfish with rice so close to Jambalaya, it was probably the best seafood I have had after my last visit to New Orleans...

The place carried a very nice, relaxed ambiance with light jazz in the background... our server was very soft spoken and knew her way through the menu and preparations... I don't think this place gets crowded easily as it could sit, to my guess, 5 times more number of guests that an averagely large restaurant... 

Overall, definite 5 stars for variety, taste, ambiance and service... be it a family or a romantic one on one dinner, this place is just too awesome !

Seated quickly, there is not much of a wait at 6 p.m., even though the place was PACKED!!!  We ordered, and watched as plate after mounded plate was  delivered to delighted patrons.  I mean, it ALL looked good.  Hubby had the salmon Oscar, I had ordered the Sea Bass.  The salmon Oscar was roasted slowly , so it was a glistening, flakey slab, slathered in crab, shrimp, and scallops with a sauce I SWEAR I could have licked off the plate.  My piece of sea bass was larger than a tennis ball, slathered with a gooey cheese, and seasoned top to bottom, resting on a perfectly sauteed mess of spinach.  Really.  I cannot stop thinking about how danged good it was.  Wine list was fine, Key lime pie needed to be a little more tart, but that is a personal preference.  All in all, I would eat there three times a week if the budget allowed.  It's that good.

The restaurant was busy on a typical Thursday night, but the experience that I got was incredible. I cannot even remember the last time I was here - probably it was 5 or 6 years ago - since I live in the East Valley. I was running errand and decided to visit the restaurant again.

A long long time ago, I was amazed by the flavorful and scrumptious crawfish varieties. However, since crawfish is not on season anymore, I ought to try other items on the menu. I was hesitate at first, but pictures and appealing descriptions of the food got me. So I decided to try Mixed Gulf Coast Oysters & Shrimp for appetizers, along with Seafood Cobb Salad, 
Chilean Sea Bass, Crab Fingers Combo, Atlantic Swordfish, Scallop & Shrimp. 

The seafood were so fresh, and the Crab Finger Combo was creamy and tasty. Especially, the Seabass was fantastic. To me it tasted as close as the taste of lobster - Well... I may be a bit of exaggerating, but it was moist, chewy, and cooked perfectly at the same time. 

Our server was quick and attentive, needless to say the fries came out within a heart beat. I'd recommend this place!

Yayyyy for happy hour and a beautiful setting and scenery!! We love coming here for Happy Hour. We stopped coming here to just have dinner. Their entree's aren't that great in our opinion and especially for the high price. But their Happy Hour and almost all their appetizers and drinks are worthy of 4-5 stars!! My -1 star is for their regular entree's. We love love love their sautéed crab finger (you won't have this amazingness anywhere else, but they only have them when crab is in season,) Alligator (usually melt in your mouth,) and perfect oyster's! They also have Grey Goose Martinis for 8 dollars (happy hour.) The oyster's have this delicious ceviche sauce, it's a must try!! The building is mostly red brick, surrounded with water fountains and greenery!! It's very gorgeous. If I could imagine a restaurant in Louisiana, I would imagine it to look and feel like this. We will be back for Happy Hour as we have been doing for about 2 years now. But most likely that's it. Wish we enjoyed the entree's but the Happy Hour is plenty worth it!!

I can't say anything bad about the food or the service in the past.  Always my favorite place.  However, I went this past Saturday evening and contracted some sort of allergy from the shell fish that I've had many times before.  As soon as I was leaving the restaruant I got sick in the bathroom.  As we were leaving the parking lot, my entire head and neck broke out in hives-and I don't have a seafood allergy.
My date is now also sick and we shared the food.  He is having severe stomach issues.  After reading Patricia M.s review dated 11/6/13, I decided to comment in the hopes that management may look into their food quality and kitchen cleanliness.

This is my favorite restaurant in the WORLD. I love seafood and flavor. If you want both, Pappadeaux's is a master at the highest level. I always try something new and I am never disappointed. The atmosphere is always energetic. The food on a different tier than its competitors. I have tried the lobster, seafood pasta, seafood fondue and others. It is all fantastic. My only regret is that there is not one in southern Oregon. Each time I am in Phoenix I swing by. Thank you for your memorable food and great service.

We had to try here being that I love seafood & my hubby is the oyster man!! So glad we did, it definitely did not disappoint!! We left there full as a tick & we could barely even finish our entrees since their portions were quite generous. We started with the oyster & chilled shrimp app as you'd guess, my hubby chose to start with the blue points & OMG is all I can say!! He was completely in love with the oysters & the shrimp were a definite hit also, very good value for the buck!! I then had to try a cup of the crawfish bisque, all I can say is there's really nothing to say except it was creaminess heaven!! Then yes the hubby needed just a few more oysters so he wanted to compare the gulf coast & he could of course tell the difference with their saltiness compared to the blue points sweetness but he said either way they were both sheer bliss!! Then we've got the entrees but at this point who really has room, lol!! My hubby chose the half of grilled chicken because he needs more white meat in his life, haha & he was so glad he did! He had the chicken with the brocolini & red skin mashed potatoes, he said everything was so moist & fresh! I had the grilled seafood skewers with the chilled barley salad with fresh arugula, okay everything was soooooo good & the portions were huge!! I literally could only eat half of one of the skewers & the barley salad was so good you almost forgot that it was healthy!! Can't wait to bring my southern mother in law their when she comes out to visit us because she'll absolutely love it. This will definitely a hit & will be one of our regular spots, you definitely get a great value for your money!!

This place is great but the food is extremely expensive. My group went here for a dinner party and it cost us around $2000 worth of food. Anyway, the portions are alright and I loved the crispy alligator plus several types of lobster tails. The only one dish I didn't like was a dish that contains rice, two pieces of sausages, and a baked potato (I think). The sausages were too soft and soggy. They ran out of cheesecakes when I wanted to order. But the creme brulee was good. The prime rib was huge (I mean for that price it better be). The margaritas were great and there were four types of margaritas. I didn't like the Swampthing too much. We ordered like 10 batches of oysters. My favorite was a sea bass dish. The fish was soft and melt in your mouth. It's covered in a creamy and buttery white sauce. The service is great!

First time at Pappadeaux. Arrived 10 mins early with reservations and waited 20 anyway. Hmm.
Our server, Reno, arrive about 7 mins after that. He dropped off water and turned to leave but we had waited long enough to know we wanted the Oyster Duo for an app. He tried to leave again before we could order drinks. Not a good start. 

Besides the app and two drinks, we got Filet Minion with Lobster Tail and the Atlantic Salmon Alexander. The bill came to $119.20 plus tip. 

The oysters were good. Our favorites were the cheesy ones but the spinach-hollandaise oysters were good too - just too much spinach. Most of the food on the entrées was excellent. The fillet was seasoned perfectly, tender and juicy-just what my wife wanted. The lobster tail was huge, accompanied by a vat of butter and some big, tender asparagus. My salmon was cooked just right, with a crispy crust but was still moist and with great Cajun seasoning. The crawfish, scallops and shrimp were all good but the shrimp were small. The decadent sauce over all was rich and creamy. I didn't care for the dirty rice but I think it was due to flavors, not the way it was cooked. Just not my kind of rice dish. 

Reno was okay as a server. He was new and didn't have a routine down yet but he was warm and engaging and he will be good if his managers will give him a chance to bloom. 

We may go back to Pappadeaux again. The parking lot was cutthroat and the wait time for some was brutal. Perhaps we'll return in the summer when the snowbirds have left!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on a Friday night with his parents for his birthday celebration.  I had heard it gets backed and that I should make a reservation.  Trying to ensure no annoyances with waiting, I made sure to call early in the afternoon to ask for a 6:00 pm reservation.  They don't take reservations during that time ... okay, that's fine, I understand BUT they will accept call-aheads and they will make sure your name is already on the waiting list before you get there.  Woo! that works! I call at 5:30 pm and let them know we will be half an hour.  Due to the fact they did not have a wait at that time, they would not take my name or party information.  When we got there at 6 pm, they had a wait.  I was decently annoyed but since it was only a 15-20 minute wait for our table, I wasn't overly annoyed.  We got our table, our server, and placed our order.  Sadly, there were multiple tables around us in and out before we even got our entrees.  There were several tables that ended up having three parties in and out before we were finally done.  That was a pretty big annoyance to say the least, especially since we were pretty hungry and we saw other tables getting served at a much more rapid pace!!!  The place does extremely well because the food is absolutely AMAZING.  The seafood gets flown in daily and not too many seafood places in Arizona can say the same thing.  Despite the waits we had to have to get seated and to finally get our food and then the wait for dessert, I still managed to embarass myself with the amount of amazing tasting food I devoured
Ridiculously overpriced.  If you want good Cajun food, head on out to Flavors of Louisiana in Avondale.  Better prices, great food. Heck, you're better off at Popeyes on Greenway and 35th Ave.

I learned to eat in New Orleans, so I'm not easily impressed by Cajun places. This is authentic. I love good crawfish étouffée and this is really good. I can recommend this cuisine to anyone. It isn't fast food cheap, but it isn't fast food. It is good value because it is such good quality.
Probably the only place to get fresh seafood in the desert. Cajun cuisine at a reasonable price!
Great place to some pretty good seafood.  Love the service.  Got to try the Fried Alligator appetizer.  Will definitely be back.

We've been coming here for years - and it has always been one of our very favorite places. Perfect for a special night out - either for a romantic dinner or with friends.  But tonight we discovered a new thing to love here at Pappadeaux: the chargrilled salmon diablo! Perfectly prepared - and the flavors of the mesquite-grilled salmon were perfectly complemented by the slightly tangy diablo cream sauce, with big tasty pieces of crab and crawfish in it. Even the broccoli was delicious! Steamed with a light sprinkling of garlic lemon olive oil and a touch of warm red pepper flakes. Love!!!

Wow. From the beginning to the end was amazing. The food was amazing!   Worth every penny, and our waitress Brooke she was on point!!!  Thank you girl! Keep doing ur thing!  And Pappadeaux you mos def need to keep doing what you're doing!! 5 stars from me!
I WILL NEVER STOP COMING HERE!!! Everything I have ever ordered has been phenomenal. Great service & atmosphere!!! Worth the wait...

Excellent food, good service.  I have been coming here for at least 15 years, im going to say that there are times where you can tell they changed their chef or management because the food will be off and service will be a mess but after just eating here again a few days ago their food and service is on point right now so i am loving it, their alligator is the best with the old red sauce.

We used to love Pappadeaux when I lived in San Antonio and in Phoenix but this trip we had a less than steller experience. I want to love this restaurant with the cool vibe and atmosphere. It started out with Bread that was a little over done on the outside, and then their version of Lobster Bisque which was a little too cajun for my liking, but it is a cajun restaurant after all so they won't loose any points there. The Wife had a good Pasta dish with Crab and scallops which was a little peppery but still good. 

I ordered a stuffed 2 lb lobster which was a cluster from the beginning. About 5 minutes after i ordered it, the server came out and said they were out of 2lb lobsters but they could give me 2 one pounders for the same price, so i went with it. Another 5 minutes passes and out comes a manager and trainee with a menu telling me they are completely out of lobsters and I would need to select something else. Then another 5 minutes pass and the server comes back out, takes my menu and says the manager didn't know what she was talking about and he has them working on my 2 1 lb. lobsters. Now another 10 minutes pass and out comes my meal, and i get 2 1 lb. lobsters, however they forget to stuff them. So now we get another visit from a different manager apologizing yet again for the mixup. I finally get my lobster and it is overcooked and tough. Guess it wasn't my night for lobster, or theirs for that matter.

They did give us dessert on the house which was a nice gesture.

I think next time i'll pass on Pappadeaux.

The food is decent. A knock off of New Orleans Cajun food. We have been to New Orleans many times and there is no doubt when your eating at Pappadeaux's you are not eating in New Orleans. It is fairly high priced for what you get. At the best it is ok

Such a huge restaurant. Very awesome looking actually. It's more like down in the south atmosphere. The food is all very delicious of all the times I've been there Taste of different selections. Great spices to them. Very fast friendly staff. Very clean nice and neat. Didn't have to wait long or that long for the food.

Loved!  Oysters were wonderful. Red fish and lump crab with jumbo shrimp and squash risotto and the pasta with vodka cream sauce were delicious and very well done. I was a little disappointed on the bread pudding; it was okay, but I'd come back any time. 
The service was prestigious.  Barely any wait time for NYE at 9:30pm. It was great.

Soooo disappointed. We use to love Pappadeaux, but it wasn't good this time. We moved to Sedona and brought friends down to enjoy a great seafood restaurant, but it wasn't the same. All of our dishes came out cold. Clam chowder, they did take off because it was sent back. No one had eaten their fries, and our friend had left most of his shrimp. The oysters were great!!!  Our poor server was overwhelmed and was lacking on refills and forgot most of what we had asked for. We would love to bring more friends back, but probably will not make the drive, since it's not the same. Too bad.

This is absolutely the best place for fresh lobster/seafood. I was able to pick out the lobster I wanted from the tank and it was served fresh with butter and asparagus. The service was incredible and made for a great date. I will be going again soon I hope.

Hoo, boy..these are some good eats!

We stopped in for lunch to find a bustling crowd in a massive restaurant, though the attentive staff more than made up for the lunch rush.

We were seated quickly and had little trouble finding something on the seafood heavy, Cajun-inspired menu. Kicking off the meal was an order of the alligator bites: spiced, fried chunks of alligator with a zesty red sauce for dipping and a heap of crispy potato straws. The gator was cooked perfectly, neither mushy nor rubbery with a noticeable punch. Figuring it would be awhile before I saw alligator on a menu again, I went for the half po boy/gumbo lunch combo. The baguette was stuffed with fried alligator, lettuce, and pickles covered with tartar and cocktail sauces. Topped with a squeeze of lemon, it was hearty, delicious, and paired nicely with a cup of fiery andouille and seafood gumbo, packed with crab meat, sausage, shrimp, and that holy trinity of bell pepper, celery, and onions.

Worth the trek from lower Phoenix (or the suburbs).

AWESOME! One of my favorite restaurants for my "King Crab Leg Fix" ! Great food,fun atmosphere, wonderful service and will always remind me of our first dinner with "meeting  my  family " ! Greg my love, your taste in choosing the perfect restaurant and girlfriend (me) was and still is awesome!
The shrimp and mahi with dirty rice is fantastic. The French bread before the dinner is fresh and tasty. The restaurant is a bit too loud though.

I almost didn't want to write this review because of how busy it already gets there!   But they deserve some serious kudos for the quality of their food and service.     We went as a group and ordered the Blue Point oysters, Mediterranean Calamari, Boudin and Shrimp Cocktail as appetizers.    

Oysters  - fantastic, fresh - great presentation - on special for $10 a dozen.   Heaven. 
Mediterranean Calamari - Wow they took calamari to a whole new level.   I won't ruin the surprise - just try it.   
Boudin - I'm a bit of a freak when it comes to Boudin (aka Blood Sausage).   I like mine with more blood and less filler.   Theirs is more filler with less blood.   It's also quite spicy.   I had to try it, but probably wouldn't order it again.
Shrimp Cocktail - Really nice sized fresh tasting shrimp.   Really nice presentation on a bed of crushed ice.   Great appy.

Dinners-
I had their Salmon Alexander.    What is Alexander?   Grilled Shrimp.   Grilled Scallops.  Crawfish.   In a LEMON BUTTER WINE OMG SO GOOD SAUCE.  All of this on top of perfectly grilled salmon.  Came with dirty rice, which, on the scale of dog barf to awesome - you guessed it - awesome.  (full disclosure - never ate dog barf before - probably won't eat dog bark ever).

Dessert - Didn't indulge.

Service - You would think you were in a place where they somehow bred servers or grew them on trees.  There are so many of them buzzing around taking care of your every need in a prompt manner.    (I think I finally figured out why there are so many cars in the parking lot - they have a ton of servers!)
