Give it a try - I promise - you won't be disappointed.  Just don't go anytime I'm going there so I can get a table, OK???

We get to Pappadeaux's on a Monday night.  It was packed.  We put our name in and we were told it would be a half hour wait.  Not bad.  We were early and we were waiting for another friend to show up.  She finally arrived and we chatted during our wait.  Our half hour wait turned into an hour.  How did that happen????  My friend complained and we were seated just like that.  We made it to our table, relief.  Our waitress was friendly.  The bread was good.  There was a great special on gulf oysters and our waitress explained that the season was coming to an end.  $4 something for a dozen oysters.  Great deal.  They were tasty too.  We had them for an appetizer.  I was happy so far.

I ordered the scallops.  They were not huge.  In fact my entree was not that big portion wise.  I had to order a salad a la carte.  No bang for your buck here.  The scallops were over $20 bucks and adding a salad to that pushed my portion of the bill over $30.  I had an ice tea too.  I enjoyed my salad and the scallops were good.  BUT!  I felt a little ripped off.

One thing they have to change is the PA system.  "Bob party of 3 your table is ready" is heard loudly throughout the entire restaurant.  Yikes!!!  Change that please.

Pappadeaux's is A-OK.

My first experience with Pappadeaux was ~6 years ago, just after moving to Phoenix (I worked nearby and drove past it every day). Try as I might, the only remarkable thing I can recall about that meal was the alligator and was unimpressed with how chewy 'gator is.

Fast forward to the present: five stars for ambience and freshness of seafood, three for value, one for finding a myriad of extraneous items in my entree. I had ordered the Blackened Catfish Opelousas (with oysters, shrimp & crabmeat in a lemon garlic butter sauce with dirty rice). I found a mini pearl (which I promptly lost when it rolled off my napkin) and sliver of something hard like shell in the butter sauce, and a small oddly shaped nugget of God-knows-what in the dirty rice. I'm still confused by that last unknown item. No, it wasn't an uncooked grain of rice; it was shaped somewhat like a dreidel and about the size of a mustard seed. It was in one of the last bites of food on my plate and left a poor impression in my mind as I left.

The girlfriend and I ordered bloody marys and a dozen oysters on the half shell LONG before our waiter returned for taking our entree request. Drinks came first, then an apology about why it was taking so long to get the oysters shucked. On the second return to apologize for the delay, we put in the rest of our order. A third return to apologize included a loaf of their french bread. The bread was phenomenal, and went well with our bloody mary drinks - but between their house bloody mary and the Absolut Cajun Bloody Mary, go with the house version. It's $2 cheaper and virtually no difference in spiciness - which was a disappointment to me because I really like bloody marys to be quite spicy. The oysters arrived a few minutes before our entree, and at $9.95 per dozen they're a rockin' bargain despite their delivery being late.

I don't understand how people think this is a cheap place to eat. All one has to do is go to their website to see prices up front. Entrees are generally priced $19.95 - $24.95, although steak items are significantly higher. Adding a drink - not your obligatory diet Coke, but a REAL drink - and tax, AND tip, pushes the price easily into a 3-dollar sign tier. Unless, of course, people opt for the cheapest items on the menu, ask only for water, and tip a mere 10%.

I'll return, but only for happy hour and cheap oysters.

Hello All! Last night my husband Michael and I went out to dinner to celebrate my new job, we went to Pappadeaux which we had been numerous time before but last night I have to say we had the BEST server that Pappadeaux has her name is Kara Reveas and she listen to want we liked she picked up on the fact that my husband doesn't eat meat so when she brought our meals out she replaced his dirty rice with white rice since they prepare their dirty rice with meat. She offered us choices to try on our return visit of certain items on the menu. You could see when she explained how they prepared the meal that she was passionate in her job and wanting the customer to have a wonderful food experience. We also meet the Manager from Mississippi Cori Woods she was absolutely wonderful as well very charming and caring you could tell that she really enjoys her work. If you haven't eaten there please stop in you will be so happy that you did. The food, atmosphere and service is 5 Stars and remember to ask for Kara she works Thursday evenings. 
Oh and the Alligator is great you need to try it!!!!!!
They prepare seafood here like no one else in the valley can . The oysters Rockefeller style is a great starter , a must have !

This is a Louisiana twist kitchen, fresh fish, oysters, alligator, crab, lobster, steaks and much more. I have been coming here for years and I can finally write a review! The key to a good experience here is "Reservation!" You don't have a Reservation you could be waiting for an hour to hour and half for a table. We ordered gulf oyster on the half shell it comes with horseradish/ketchup/cilantro base soy  dressing on the side and I love mixing the sauces it was very good. I had the Alaskan King Crab legs and they were so fresh and sweet and just right. My fiancé had the Branzino with grilled shrimp and Broccolini in a herb lemon butter sauce it was yum! Check it out it! It's a fun experience also this place comes with a heavy bill at the end of the night so be prepared! Happy Eats!

First timer here! Alexa was great and made sure all our beverage and food needs were met. I got the Jumbo Shrimp Brochette.....delish! Another in my party got fried shrimp (good bit nothing special) and another for the pasta Marti Gras which was also delish!

So good! Love the food, atmosphere, everything! If your going for dinner make sure to make reservations 2 hours early! I highly recommend the Pasta Mardi Gras and the Crispy Fried Alligator (both kinds)
My wife & I had a lunch here & everything could not have been better. Excellent food and service.
Awesome food and staff. Happy hour here is perfect. Get a chance to sample a lot of  menu items at a great price. Get there early, it fills up fast.

Out of town and close to where we were staying. Looked at reviews and was excited to go. The place is HuGe. We couldn't get a table for 45 min so ate at the bar. Food was really good. But note this is not a chap place.

Glass broke infront of us get wet all
Over The manager came in and just said " i saw that happen before and did even do anything 
Sk just all be careful wen h guys pick up ur glass!!!!
Well so happy the manager did us a nice  gesture !!! Well done

Very nice variety -- My hubby is a huge fan and practically has our car on auto-pilot to drive in and grab a bite.  The restaurant is beautiful inside, definitely not a fast food place, but still comfortable and relaxing.
Great place to eat ...best Cajun food I've had! Love the variety and portion size! :) will be back again

Had lunch here with my wife today. It's the second time I've been and her first. After my first visit it rocketed into my top five favourite restaurants of all time. They have some top notch food, and the best thing is that it's such a deliciously welcome change from the bottom-feeder's Mexican crap that you see all over Phoenix. The menu is varied and I think I eventually will want to try everything. Appetizers include fried alligator and frog's legs. The main I had today was their Mardi Gras Pasta, which is linguini with tomato, thin-sliced garlic, andouille sausage, crawfish meat, onion and delicious shrimp topped with a really nice creamy sauce. Absolutely delicious. The wife had mahi-mahi with an even NICER sauce, and dirty rice on the side. Although a tiny bit on the pricy side it's definitely worth coming back to. Large open seating (outdoor seating also available), dimly lit, old-style jazz, a large full-service bar and a very quaint outside waiting area with water feature, giant fans etc. The service was also great and both times I've been, the waiters have been very helpful (the first guy told me that if I got the large serving of alligator, to try it 'half-blackened' - a great tip which allowed me to taste both 'styles' of the appetizer). They also have things I've not heard of before like etoufee and opelousas. If my dad didn't live over seven thousand miles away I'd take him here in an instant - he'd absolutely love the place. You will too.

Oh yeah, they have creme brulee (with fresh fruit) and sweet potato pecan pie, amongst other things, for dessert. We had the latter - yum.

Very beautiful restaurant. Very beautiful. Food isn't spectacular and the price surely will leave you budgeting in order to afford a meal here again. Very pricey... even for simpler meals of chicken and noodles. If money isn't an issue, then definitely go. It was more of an experience then anything else. But a good, memorable experience. :)

I thought the food was only ok. I  have been t Papadeaux's in Houston,Dallas and Austin and the food was great!  

We were hungry for Cajun food and even though the restaurant was 30 miles away,my wife and I gave it a try .

The gumbo was as far from the real thing as I have ever tasted. It wasn't awful,it just wasn't gumbo. 
The Shrimp Po Boy was ok and they were generous with the amount of shrimp but
I wouldn't drive 30 miles to go there again.

We love this place. The stuffed shrimp are to die for!!! The lighting stinks but the food makes up for it...it is pricey so make sure you got enough in the bank..drinks are good as well.... Great party room too

Expensive, but worth it Everytime! Dessert is yummy and meals are great. Kind of a dark setting, but delicious nevertheless. I would however recommend making an appointment cause the wait time could get long of you just walked in. Most things have some extra spice to them also, being a Cajun Resturant it was to be expected, but the gumbo was very spicy, almost too spicy even for me. Delish however. No complaints at all. Great service, ambiance and experience.
Best steak I have had in a while! The steak was comparable with Mastros! I could not believe how good it was for the price! Also the service was great! Definitely recommend!!!!

I'm really impressed by this restaurant. I've been here a few times and the food and service are consistently excellent. They excelled at everything yesterday, ensuring folks had the best Mother's Day experiences possible. Colin is one of the best servers we have ever had at any restaurant. Loved how well they prepared for the crowds yesterday with full staffing, free bottled waters, free snacks, entertainment and ballon artists for the kids (and grown ups too).

We arrived and found parking quickly. Very few people waiting in the outside seating area. Feb 15th on a Weds. Checked in at the host station she told us 15-30 mins. The lady behind us had a child and a male with them. They where told the same time.

Our kid and their child starting talking and watching the lobsters. 25 mins went by and they complained to the hostess and they where sat promptly. I wait another 5 and said something. The hostess was extremely rude and said " I can see how long you have been waiting" when clearly they seated several people that arrived after us. She never mention the bar table area was open seating.

At 42 mins of waiting I told them either seat us now or we are leaving. She said sorry I can't and people are taking longer to eat than expected. Another server heard us and said some one was getting up I. The bar table area.

She was kind and offered to help. She cleaned the table and got us menus then told us our server would be with us shortly.

Not one person greeted us, looked at us or anything for ten plus mins. We where not even looking at the menus because you this time we knew what we wanted 25 mins ago. Out 4 year old was starving

We started to leave and the this server guys said. I am going to get to you in a rude sarcastic voice.

I said no thanks and we left.

I did call as we drove to another restaurant and the manager was friendly and offered to buy us dinner if we came back. At that point we just did not feel welcome to eat their so we declined.

The best part of the dining experience was sitting on the beautiful patio. Service was average and took a while to get drink refilled. I wish there were better options for non-fish eaters. We had a friend there that had a difficult time as most were seafood dishes. I enjoyed the meal but wasn't impressed enough to go back. I had a salad and it was ordinary. Two people had the mahi and enjoyed it and the grits.

Love this place. Great food!  Closest thing to new orleans seafood.  I always bring my family here and they really love it!  Prefect for big parties.  Note: must try the category 5 daiquiri (more than one is at your own risk) lol! Enjoy!!!!!

My family and I love Pappadeaux, it's my husband's favorite place to eat. I finally tried the alligator! We had a large order where half was battered and the other half was blackened, it truly was amazing! What I didn't plan on was paying $25 for fish and shrimp and getting $20 worth of french fries piled up on my plate. When I think of Papadeaux restaurant I think of dirty rice not fries. Otherwise an amazing experience.

I have been here 2-3 times in the past and remember liking it a lot more.  Today, however, I went during the lunch and thought the food was very uninspired.

I really hate to say this, but I think Pappadeaux is becoming Red Lobster with a Cajun twist.  This place has somehow transformed itself from a unique eatery into a full blown Red Lobster meets Joe's Crab Shack franchise.  The only difference is the price (higher) and the seasoning (Cajun) instead of over-salting.  The seafood is no doubt frozen as well.

Sure, I love fried fish and other creole calorie bombs just as much as everyone else, but I think this place is losing its authenticity as it makes its play towards the masses.

Anyway, I wouldn't mind coming back to try more of their offering to prove my theory, but I'm certainly not going to rush.

I don't eat seafood nearly enough, primarily because it is typically so expensive, and the pricing here was no exception.

I showed up for dinner at 9:30 on a Tuesday night, so they were not very busy. The restaurant itself was rather large and very nicely decorated. They had a beautiful patio area and I asked if I could be seated out there, but was told it was not available at this time. (I don't know if this was due to it being 9:30 at night or what, but it was an amazing 75 degrees out and would have been perfect. Of course, for most acclimated Arizonans, that is rather chilly.)  I wish I had requested a table as the main area of the restaurant seemed really relaxed and intimate. I ended up being seated at a booth in the bar, directly next to the very loud kitchen. 

The waitress was reasonably friendly and promptly re-filled my water cup at least six times. I ordered the Alaskan Halibut & Jumbo Crab.  Within minutes she brought out a loaf of hot, freshly baked bread. It was delicious. My meal came out not long after that. My first impression was, holy crap, that is a TINY meal for $40!

The food was amazing, however. Lot's of flavor and cooked just right. Although I tried to pace myself, it was over all too soon. Immediately upon finishing, I was thinking I could have easily eaten three more just like it. A little bit later, after the meal had settled however, I felt very satisfied, if not quite full. 

My total bill, including the tip, came to just less than $50. As I stated above, that is a lot of money for me, and it will definitely limit how often I eat at this place.  I am sure I will try it again sometime however.

Really enjoyed this restaurant.  It is easy to access and has an adorable ambiance both inside and out.  The service was friendly and efficient.  The food was delicious.  Really enjoyed my shrimp and grits.  My son enjoyed his plate of fried seafood and we both had plenty to bring home leftovers.  They offer kids meals and my friend enjoyed the gumbo.

There was only one negative to the trip.  My daughter (12 years old) accidentally stepped out of the car with her reusable coffee cup from home.  By the time we realized we were already walking in and it is HOT (getting to be summer in AZ) and we were all hungry.  We told her she shouldn't do that but proceeded into the restaurant.  At the hostess stand we were informed that she couldn't have the cup and that they could throw it away.  Instead of walking all the way back to the car or having the cup tossed she went outside and placed it on an out of the way table, to be picked up on the way out of the restaurant.  We weren't seated but a few minutes and an employee holding the cup walked to our table.  We were told the cup can't be out on the table because it might be thrown away (this was a risk we were willing to take).  At this point we walked it all the way back to the car.  It was just a silly damper on an otherwise very enjoyable meal and experience.  The cup could have been placed in my purse for goodness sake.
The best seafood house in Phoenix.  Prices are in the higher side but you get what you pay for!!!

Yes, yes, yes, yes......YES!!!!!!!! What an amazing spot for some kick ass seafood. Met some friends here for dinner...This is what we ordered:

Mediterranean Calamari and OMG, It's spectacular. Crispy and tender calamari with artichoke hearts, capers & pepperoncini!!  We also ordered a cup of the andouille sausage and seafood gumbo. Yup, another mind blowing experience! So good. Make sure to mix it up well before you eat it, the way it's intended to be eaten. We also ordered (yes, we were hungry, don't judge), the filet mignon oscar. The only issue was there wasn't much lump crab meat, in fact it was next to nothing on the filet so they ended up taking that off our bill. Still so delish and they followed up and took care of us.

I highly recommend this place, great atmosphere and amazing food.

I absolutely love this place. The food is amazing! I've been there for their crawfish boils...so perfect and the best price for what you get anywhere in the valley! Any other time, the crawfish platter is my favorite. Actually everything is my favorite :) And for as busy as the place is, I still get my food quickly and an awesome wait staff is there for anything you need.

I just reached out to them because of something I saw on their to-go menu. I was transferred to a low energy to go person. I asked if they had a family pak item at their store I got a simple no we don't and that was it. there was no effort to maybe attempt to get me to look at something else. Family paks start at over 60 dollars so it would have been a nice ticket for them, but I guess they are doing so well they don't need or want that type of business. I have eaten there once and it was just Ok so not surprised about the interaction.

Holy Moly! This food is sooooo yummy! I came here while on vacay in Phoenix with a group of people. The restaurant is pretty huge and it was PACKED! Good thing we had reservations! We started off with the oysters, which I thought were tasty (though I'm no expert). Then we had the coconut shrimp, which was awesome! The breading was very tasty! Then I had the scallops which were phenomenal! So melt-in-your-mouth with a little kick to them! Finally we had to have the sweet potato pie. Holy Smokes did it ROCK! This is an absolute must try! The key lime pie was also good (not too sweet). This restaurant has quality food and quality service.
Great food and service. Only complaint is it's overpriced, but great for a special evening out.
You get what you pay for. This place is amazing, never had a bad meal or experience. Some of the best seafood in Phoenix.

The wait was quoted as over an hour at 8 pm on a Friday night. We ended up sitting at the bar. Less than 10 minute wait for 2 people. The blackened gator bites were really good and Service at the bar was actually pretty fast. Food was delicious and the bartender/waiter did a great job.

Great, I mean talky great service today. Food is always good here. We stayed for a few hours for a meeting today and service was consistent the entire time. 

I certainly will be back.

Was at a spring training Dodger-DBack game today in the hot sun. Needed a place to be entertained.  Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen was just the ticket.   Came back to the hotel and then we went to the Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen without reservations.  We had to wait for awhile, but that was OK as it gave our party of 10 time to soak in the atmo.  The approach is a bit of  "round the block" but once you get there it is a huge complex of dining, bar and patio areas.  Eclectic crowd, especially for Phoenix.  They had a troubador playing a soft electric guitar and spillin' his lyrics out on the patio.  Lots of fried food.  Their seafood dishes looked tasty.  I asked where the salmon was caught and found out several of their seafood dishes were farm raised.  I am picky about eating fish that was caught in the wild and not farmed.  I had a deep fried chicken and shrimp dish with fries that was good.  Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen will probably not see me again as not really my cup of tea.

I have only eaten twice at Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen, once in Denver, CO and the other in Phoenix, AZ. Both visits were excellent! My second and most recent visit was at the Phoenix location. The restaurant was very busy, even still our wait was under our quoted time, by only a few minutes. Everyone from the bartender to the server were all friendly and accommodating. The live music playing outside was an added benefit. Management was also outstanding. We had a challenge with the timeliness of our meal and the manager was very helpful in resolving our problem. The food was outstanding, with nice portions too. Flavorful, creative, and well presented are just a few attributes describing the food. Please consider Southern California for a future location!

Maybe it's because this Pappadeaux is in the desert it's not as good as the one's in Texas. But I have been to one in Dallas and one in the Houston airport and both are much better.

Sorry but I don't remember what I had but I just wasn't impressed and didn't get the feeling the seafood was really fresh. I guess I will continue to look for a place to get fried seafood in Arizona.

If you are expecting Pappadeaux like it is in Texas don't go here.
If you are expecting Legal Seafood don't go here.

In town for work. Sat at the bar. Happy Hour app was very small, like 2 bites small but yummy. Cocktail was perfect, not too sweet. Stuffed shrimp was ok, but  not memorable. Well seasoned fries. If I was with the company of some friends seems like it would be a fun place to get together.

I've been here several times and the food is always good. I ordered the scallop and sweet pea risotto which was delicious but the scallops were a little sandy. My husband got the filet oscar which he absolutely loved. Our server Nora was really professional and pleasant and tried the best she could. On a Wednesday night, it was packed and really noisy in there as the tables are packed in tightly. Nora was super attentive but the kitchen was really slow. There were 4 of us and we were there for 2 hours. WAY too long! 
Other than sandy scallops and super slow service, we love this place and it's always good to bring friends.
We will be back but I won't order the sandy scallops.

This was my first time trying Creole food and I was pleasantly surprised. The service was amazing. I ordered broiled shrimp with spaghetti squash which was nicely cooked and tasty. The fried catfish fillet was also very good. The calamari was a little spicey.

My husband and I have been coming to this restaurant for many years. We had the best service from Brenda this past weekend and I had to share. She is worth requesting when you stop in to eat! Thank you Brenda for such great service! Can't wait to eat here again!

Love this place! Clam chowder was piping hot and creamy delicious! Our waiter, Christian was delightful and attentive, an Awesome waiter ! We shared the PapaDeux platter so yummy and lots of good sample of crab cakes shrimp catfish and fries. We will be back! Bought the gift card special they have right. Ow! Good deal!

oh nom nom nom nom here. I've been to the one in New Mexico - but for some reason, it didn't stand out as much there. I think it might have been the Lunch course.

THIS was definitely a much better experience.

We got here a little after 8 pm, a bit early for our 8:30 pm reservations. They had our table ready and whenever we were ready to go. They were uber accommodating - even when our party of 10 became a party of 8.

Brook was our server. AWESOME MAN. Fantastic suggestions, substitution, and all over awesomeness. Wished I lived closer to have this place all the time.

Wine cellar for our private party. You should ask - it fits about 10-12 people comfortably. 

What we ordered-
* Mississippi Catfish Opelousas - Blackened catfish with shrimp, oysters 
& jumbo lump crabmeat in a lemon garlic butter sauce with dirty rice ... It was so light, so flavorful. OH my. I totally understand why my friend LOVES this dish. $29.99
*Atlantic Salmon Yvette (11 oz. 26.95 .. 7 oz. 22.95) Char-grilled salmon with shrimp, crawfish, mushrooms & spinach, in a sherry white wine sauce, with dirty rice.
* Pappadeaux sampler - Fried fish filets (choice of catfish, tilapia or both), shrimp, blue crab cake, stuffed shrimp & stuffed crab with extra fried shrimp & crawfish)... the extra is what separates the seafood platter vs pappadeaux sampler. ($32.99)
*Oyster sampler appetizer - with both of their baked oysters (Oysters Pappadeaux - Baked oysters on the half shell with crabmeat, spinach & hollandaise and Oysters Baton Rouge - Oysters on the half shell baked with a Parmesan Romano cheese sauce) - $13.95, with three of each oyster.
*Appetizer Trio - Mini shrimp & crawfish fondeaux, fried alligator & hot smoked salmon* (we switched the salmon for Coconut shrimp) OH nom nom nom. This was one fantastic appetizer - can be shared or ordered as an entree - $22.99

Somewhat disappointed in their section of raw oysters - Gulf Coast and Blue point only.

Lobster tank in front, with their prices per pound. 

Will definitely come back especially now i know what I ordered. Pretty pricey, but totally worth the flavors and food. OH nom nom nom indeed
I would go there everyday if I had the money it's super great food here the people are very nice and caring and super great food the best

I've always heard people talk good about this place. And now I know why! This place is f****g amazing. Been here twice now I forgot to write the review lol first time had a seafood pasta that was amazing! With shrimp and scallops! Also tried the alligator. I will go back. I grew up eating tons of seafood and I know it's expensive but I know what I'm getting and how much I can get with the same money at the market. I wish it was just a bit less expensive and I would definitely would go more often.

Being someone that spent a lot of time in New Orleans, it's hard for me to give this place any more than 3 stars. Their food is "OK" but way over priced. 
The gumbo is not very gumbo like and their PoBoys need "more"

The drinks, however, will knock you out of your shoes! The bartenders are super friendly too!

I totally miss the Gulf Coast Oyster special since the oil spill....3.95 a dozen!  Not any more :( Ahh well. Life goes on.

I can't really suggest heading into Pappa for your seafood fix. There are better places in the valley.

I absolutely love the crispy Atlantic salmon & Maine Lobster!  What a wonderful dish!  The most moist salmon I have ever had, seasoned perfectly with lobster and grilled shrimp on top.  It was on a bed of super sweet roasted acorn squash.  My boyfriend ordered the Mississippi Catfish Opelousas.  It was amazing!  A huge portion of fish and seasoned well.  I like that this place is a made-from-scratch restaurant and you can customize your food.  I also love that they sell Vietti Moscato.  A good moscato is very hard to find at restaurants for some reason, and this is a really good one.  They even put fresh raspberries in it!  Would come back again and again if I lived in Phoenix.  Wish there was one in St. Louis!
Good food, out of oysters, waiter had too many tables. Tossed the butter at us, and forgot to ask us if we wanted another drink as he rushed by to give us water

We just had the most tastiest dinner. It was wonderful. Six of us had different menu items and many appetizers everything was cooked to perfection. The service was impeccable Ariel has wonderful knowledge of the menu. Such a joyful person thank you for a great 25th anniversary dinner.

My family and I always go to the Pappadeaux in Albuquerque so when we saw this one off the freeway we knew we HAD to stop for dinner.

We had a big group when we went but it really wasn't a problem for this place because it's such a large restaurant. The menu is extensive and heavy on the seafood which is awesome since it is delicious! We always get the fried alligator appetizer which is SO GOOD! I know it sounds gross but where the heck are you ever going to find ALLIGATOR?! Try it, especially with the sauce... YEAH! We have also tried the oysters on the half shell (great) and the fried oysters with fries (yum!)

For dinner I like to get the pasta mardi gras which is linguine with shrimp and sausage in a creamy marinara sauce. It has a bit of a kick to it which I like but the portion is really big so it's best to share. Crawfish etouffee is great and is a favorite of my dad. We have had the king crab as well which is yummy but can be hard to crack the shells and take apart. The filet mignon oscar was good but a little light on the crab meat that is on top of the steak. 

This place can get quite loud so be careful! Also can be a bit pricey but I believe the cost is less if you go for lunch.

We were given a gift card to try this out and we are impressed. Service was exceptional. Food was filling and yummy!! You have to try the lemonade drink and crab dip!! Those two were my favorite. I also enjoyed the one of a kind crème brûlée!!!
The oysters Pappadeaux were out of this world and the bacon wrapped shrimp was equally as good!

Never disappoints, large portions great southern atmosphere and the food is delicious. You have to get the crawfish trio, not on the menu and it's worth every bite. Fresh food cooked to perfection. Off the chain!

if you're looking for authentic cajun, this is not the place.  it's more like Joe's Crab Shack with a Louisiana theme.  overpriced food, the servers/bartenders are too busy to be attentive .  I ordered a special redfish dish (which was not cheap) and the redfish had either been frozen for a long time or, most likely, microwaved.  tis was the deal-breaker.  everything was decent until I got my entree but eating rubbery-textured redfish was not a great way to top off a meal.  I have spent some time in New Orleans and LOVE cajun food and this place does it no justice!  and for what you have to pay for the food, you can pretty much fly to N'Awlins and have the real deal.

Let me start by saying the crawfish ettouffee was the best I've had in a long time! The food itself should probably get 4 stars, however, our service was just plain bad, so I'm just going with 3 stars.

The outside patio area was really nice and they had live music and a bar outside.

A welcoming spot, strangely bare on weekends.  We don't have this place around our area so visiting r there is nothing much for me to complain about. Gumbo is quite tasty, the bread I think was complimentary but I devoured like it was a meal.  Drinks refreshing and pretty strong.  We got lucky and got a great server, so service was attentive.  Stay put, Papadeaux, we will be back!

The restaurant is a great environment and the food is excellent. I recommend getting the alligator bites as an appetizer or their oysters.

Every lunch and dinner entree I have tasted has been top quality. The only reason that I do not give Papadeaux a 5 star rating is that all entrees are high price. I understand greeting crab stuffed crab claws and lobster being pricey, but typical Cajun dishes are $10-15 over priced. Expect a $75-100 check if getting an app with dinner.

I have eaten at a Pappadeaux's twice in my life; this experience was better than my first at least.  If you are from Louisiana, or travel there often, this place doesn't compare to the real deal.  Our party had the half-price oyster deal and ordered several orders.  They liked them, but I thought they were just OK.  It was a good value though.  I had ordered the new scallops and sweet pea risotto, and it was pretty tasty, but the portion size was way too small and way overpriced.  I only had 5 scallops on my plate and they were relatively small.  I felt like I could have gotten more scallops for less from the grocery store.  We got the bananas foster cheesecake for desert, which was pretty uninspiring to me.  Seemed like a regular cheesecake with very little topping whatsoever.  If it's not a traditional bananas foster desert, don't bother with it.  Also, there aren't very many non-seafood options on the menu!

Pappadeaux used to have this oreo cookie mousse dessert thing

It was the best dessert ever in this world.  Ever.

Then they stopped carrying it.  So now I won't go back.  I protest Pappadeaux!

Went there for my birthday dinner.  Everything was wonderful.  Super busy for Sunday afternoon.  The sweetie waitress,was outstanding.  I even got to pick which dessert I wanted for my dessert.  Wish I could work there

I am now OBSESSED with Pappadeaux. My friend and I sat on the patio by the water fountain which was so cool. We ordered the lobster tails, shrimp cocktail, crab mac & cheese, and spaghetti squash. Lucky for us they messed up and brought over 6 lobster tails instead of two and everything was just so delicious. I 100% recommend & cannot wait to go back

Wow this place is great!! We came in town for the probowl and came to eat here. We had the gator appetizer and it was nice and tender. Catfish is very clean flavor. Price is a bit up there but well worth it. A must visit next time. My server Kamarie was great.

OMG!!! So good!!!!  I was in AZ for work and I asked a colleague to do lunch and she recommended Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.  I absolutely love this place.  It was a beautiful March day and we sat outside.  It wasn't too hot or too cold, just perfect.  The service was great with tons of parking. 

We ordered the following:
Shrimp and Scallop Orecchiette Pasta ($30) - It has shrimp, scallops, oreccheitte pasta, lump crab, asparagus in a creamy parmesean vodka sauce.  It was delicious.  The shrimp was huge, the scallop was rich and delicious.  Everything came very well together.

Grilled Redfish and Jumbo Shrimp ($34) - My colleague had this and it was fantastic.  I was able to taste the Redfish and it was flaky and delicious.  This is the dish my colleague always order. 

Cup of Seafood Gumbo ($7): So good.  I asked for spicy and it definitely was not spicy.  I should have asked for extra, extra  spicy.  Lots of flavor with good pieces of sausage and seafood and rice.

When I'm in Phoenix again, I want to try their Crawfish Etouffee.

Great food, great service. And they were happy to accommodate to gluten free or other allergy needs.
Very good fruit ice tea.

My ex co-worker/friend love this place/ go as often as we can!! The service is great/the food is great/the white wine spritzers are beautiful/great  :)  :) This location is east of the freeway on 26th ave Phx  :)
One of my all time favorite seafood places. Went on Father's Day. It was really crowded but still enjoyed the food when I finally got it.

Very busy place 
Great food, we have been going for years. We have noticed the serving have gotten really small while the price has gone up crab cakes are totally not as good as they used to be. My husband loves the food there. We will definitely be back! The price is really high!!!!

Always enjoy the experience of dining at Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen. Probably the best selection of seafood items in the Greater Phoenix area. We both ordered salmon dishes. My wife's was med-rare and she ordered well. It was quickly taken care of and corrected. 

The service was excellent. Our waiter, Ed, helped make the evening a good time. He was efficient, but took time to chat and make sure it was a nice experience for us. 

We like the way the restaurant is decorated to add to the experience. From the outside curb appeal, to the entry way, to the inside, you feel like you have left Phoenix and are in some New Orleans restaurant.

I grew up in AZ and still have family there so every trip home going to Pappadeaux's is a MUST!  They have the greatest food and a huge selection even for those who don't like seafood.  They have great Oysters and Jose the oyster shucker is the best!  The staff there is always warm and inviting and even when you have to wait on weekends they have a great live band out on the patio.  It's always packed so I would recommend reservations.  I usually get the steamed muscles and the cedar block salmon which is sooo yummy it's served with asparagus that is the best I have ever had in a restaurant.  If you are going to Phoenix or live there, this place is a MUST!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! 

Get me some lobster bisque and the Mardi Gras pasta and I'm all yours! 

Happy Hour here is pretty darn good because the prices become more affordable. I feel that you get what you pay for at Pappadeaux's in terms of food and service, but anytime you can get that with a discount it definitely gets better! 

I love all the desserts, but the sweet potato pecan pie with a cup of coffee really makes the evening paired with a side of Jazz on the covered patio.

Yuk.

Grease, grease and more grease 

If you like fatty fried food this is your spot 

If you like Cajun spice.  This is your spot.  

If you want fresh, clean, healthy seafood.   Don't go 

Plus the prices are outrageous.

I'm too fat and happy to write this properly now but holy schnikeys,  Batman, that was some good grub.  And atmosphere.  And service.

More later.

a month ago
Best seafood in Phoenix hands down. It's always packed and you could be in for a wait if you don't make reservations which I always do. It's a big place that with a lot of people eating, drinking, and enjoying so it can be loud. The food and the service are top notch. Well worth the $$$

Probably the most expensive food without the flavor.  Maybe it was my dish?   Blue crab...  spongy and boring.  Thank goodness for the baked potatoes &dinner rolls...   that's all I ate.  Definitely won't be spending big bucks here...Red Lobster is better ...
Surf and Turf rock! Had my birthday part-ay there and it was fun. Great service and we had a ball. Appetizers were amazing too.

Came her this spring and last. The shrimp and grits are to die for!!! Shrimp have the perfect grilled flavor mixed with grits cooked with the perfect consistency and loaded with cheese. Bread and butter are alwaya a plus. Add a few good alcoholic beverages and creme brulee...you can't beat it!

I prefer my food from the land and not the sea so seafood is not a dining favorite of mine. My picky style has never resisted me for taking up an opportunity to dine at Pappadeux as they have on shore tasty items on the menu. I always seem to dive into the crispy chicken fingers along with the wide variety of sides, however my last visited I was tempted to try the broiled half chicken. Boy was I impressed. It was so flavorful and fell right off the bone. Not only was it not dry but it was juicy. Matter of fact those seafood eaters who dined with me tasted a sample and wanted to clean my plate. Too bad and so sad for them they will have to come back because I ate it all. Along with the spaghetti squash and a bed of white rice. 

The great thing about this restaurant is they have a wide variety of options to choose from. A large dining area for larger parties and even a private room. You can dine casually to a romantic date or even have a party the whole crew will be impressed. They even have a full size bar with the same great menu. 

Pappadeaux the place to go!

I went here for the first time with some friends a few days ago and was not disappointed!! My server, Andrew, was very attentive and was super nice. I ordered oysters and a few others that were all pretty good. My daughter ordered the crab mac n cheese and fries and although the mac n cheese looks like a small portion, don't be fooled! She was full halfway through the plate. Some orders my friends did not like, but everyone has different taste buds. The bill came and was a whopping $300. Get ready to splurge if you eat here.

Craw fish season! Came here last night with a couple of friends for oysters and crawfishes. It was delicious. The crawfishes are juicy and big. Our server was nice and attentive. The environment inside however is quite loud since the tables are close by. If you have a large group of people, help to make reservation ahead of time.

I order togo which was very fast on everything was correct.  Had a couple of drinks while I waited.  The N'awlins punch is awesome with fresh watermelon.  I found a new drink instead of the Swamp Thing.  Brook the bartender was GREAT... THANKS for a great experience when my second drink was not right.

Not sure how I feel about this restaurant.
Came here for the first time last night.

I was given silverware with a visibly dirty disgusting napkin, had to ask for another set. Waitress never offered drink refills, had to ask. Very very busy and only the large party tables really received attention, our table was not as important.
Lastly , asked to see dessert tray. Picked out bread pudding then later told they were out. Offered another dessert complimentary but then we were charged for it.
Good grief.

I frequent the Pappadeaux in Denver which has been consistently excellent over the past 10 years. 

The Pappadeaux here in Phoenix, while "never" up to the standards of the Devnver franchise, was always worth the trip. Not so on my past 2 visits, while the ambience is still up to standard, the food quality, service, and bar energy has dropped off a cliff. 

The place was still packed with customers, I guess there's no accounting for taste.

I can't see myself going back.

I ordered the Cajun Combo not amazing but very tasteful it was beautifully cooked and was buttery smooth only thing I did not like was the saltiness of it but otherwise great atmosphere and wonderful crew.

Wonderful fried alligator and "ok shrimp gumbo". Seems like the bowl has shrunk on the gumbo, or it differs by location. 

We came here for lunch. The wait on a table was about 30 minutes and the fried Alligator came immediately. However, it took over 35 minutes for our meals to come.

Seems coming on a crowded Thursday business lunch was a less than stellar idea. Generally, I've enjoyed this chain in other cities, but was a little less enthusiastic about this location and the food quality.

Went here for the first time today and i'm in love!!! 

I think that Crawfish nights are Asians' night. When happy hours hit, I felt like I'm back in the old country. 

If you have ghetto nails with all kind of crystal-ness, be careful not to choke on the crystals when you go to lick the deliciousness off your fingers.

The most amazing food!! Wonderful atmosphere. Service was wonderful! I had the Halibut and spaghetti squash and my boyfriend the oysters. Will definitely go back!! Wish they had one I the east valley hint hint, but the trip was worth the drive!

Food was good experience not so good. Was told an hour wait, waited an hour an forty five minutes after complaining. Went to the bathroom and noticed six open tables. Waiter forgot our orders and never filled our drinks, and took forever to box up our leftovers.  For a 110 dollar tab for two. Not my top choice.
First time and last...very dissapointed w service and food not good at all...guess that we are  not coming back. Joe's Crabs is.the best.

We walked in and were completely impressed by the ambiance and the overall look of the entire place.  We stared with the shrimp cocktail - which had Fresh gulf shrimp, chunky avocados & pico de gallo in a spicy cocktail sauce.  I can say, this was the best shrimp cocktail I have ever had.  We also split a ceasar salad which was perfect.  For dinner, I had the Mahi blackened over dirty rice .  The fish was fresh and spicy - all their fish is flown in daily.  My date had the Pasta Mardi Gra - Linguine tossed with crawfish, andouille sausage & crimini mushrooms in a marinara cream sauce topped with jumbo grilled shrimp. . .  This dish was quite spectacular... We thought we were in New Orleans...  For desert, we had NY Cheesecake - with fresh strawberries in a sauce - topped with fresh whipped cream - I can't think of any cheese cake I have ever had that was better than this...  The desert plate they bring to the table has all the deserts on there - they all looked amazing- quite a difficult choice... WOW - the entire dinner was perfect!  AND on top of it all, our service was top notch.  SAM was excellent - he talked with us and explained the items we had questions on, cleaned the table in between courses, and gave us fresh silver ware - along with always keeping our drinks full.  And he had a great attitude - he acted like he wanted to make our dinner very special.  The manager came and talked with us also, and thanked us for coming in.  Quite impressive.  This was one of the most memorable dinners we have had, from the time we walked in the door until we walked out.  We were completely impressed with Pappadeaux - and can't wait until we return.  If I could give it 10 stars, I would, it is worth it.

Love this place! My server was Matt and he was awesome. I asked him for his recommendations and he knew them right off the bat.  He has many favorites as you really can't go wrong but I decided to go with his top picks: the lobster bisque to start with and the Jumbo Shrimp brochette with dirty rice. SO GOOD. When I got there, they had just opened 30 mins prior and already they were pretty busy. The place is clean, excellent food, and marvelous service. I'm definitely making this my go-to spot for my monthly business visits. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

I usually enjoy a trip over to Pappadeaux but last night was the worst dining experience I've had in years. We were quoted a 10-20 min wait time... no biggie... ended up waiting 55 min to be seated. It is spring training and spring break so not a big deal because we did arrive at 7pm. The problem is we left at 10:30pm! I ordered the seasonal craw fish as an appetizer since I had an hour to look over the menu I ordered right away. Took 45 min to get the craw fish out and when they came there was an old dehydrated piece of corn with scraps of potatoes. I had watched other tables getting several pieces of corn with large potatoes so we must have been given the "left overs". It was truly pathetic. We ended up just getting the gumbo since we had already filled up on bread and my real motivation to eat here was the dessert. We ordered two desserts and after 15 min our waitress only brought out one (she forgot the other one). Our waitress was nice but just not good at her job. Every time she knew she messed up she would have the manager come to our table instead of just explaining to us what had happened. It was a long confusing $50 app, soup, and dessert. I would recommend going at 2pm for a stress free dinner!

This is probably one of my new favorite seafood restaurants in town. I had my first experience here on Christmas Eve to celebrate my birthday with friends and I must say, even though they were crazy busy, the service was excellent and the food was very fresh and delicious!
Of course my only 'beef' is that it's a bit pricey. However, it was worth it for the freshness of the food. 

I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a great seafood restaurant in Phoenix area. Even though it's a chain restaurant, they delivered! Two thumbs up from this super taster!

I really love this place!! Nothinglike a fun Sunday meal with my family to make me love it even more. We stuffed ourselves with delish catfish, fried shrimp , and tasty hazelnut Mahi. Service from Rocky was 
really fast , effiecient without that fake cloying attitude. Felt like we were
the center of the restaurant. Funny how things like fast drink refills, quick service and welltime plate removal can do that.  
And here is the kicker of the evening ..I know have ordered or tasted every dessert on thier dessert tray, scary but true. Did you know that three of their desserts are made fresh there the rest including cheesecakes are made in Texas and brought in. I got the fresh Brulee  . yummy.   Can't wait to go back.

I come to Pappadeaux regularly. I love this place everything is always good and fresh. The atmosphere is great,service, and southern vibe makes me feel like I'm at a restaurant in New Orleans. Thanks Pappadeaux!..I'll always be a fan.

I have always liked Pappdeaux. I remember eating all you can eat Lobster many years ago at one of their Chicagoland venues. I wasn't planning on going here the other night but just decided to dine here on a whim when I was traveling North on the 17 heading for another restaurant. The parking lot was about 90% full. I waited for one of the kitchen help to leave since he thought it was okay to take up 2 parking spots. 

There was a 45 minute wait on a Friday night which is not unusual and not a big deal for me. After being seated we ordered drinks and checked out the extensive menu. I decided to go with the catfish and fries which was in the $14 dollar range. I have to say that I was not happy with how my entrée was plated. Two fried catfish filets on top of the fries, completely cutting the fries off from plain sight. So how do you eat the fries? I transferred the catfish to my bread plate. I noticed that all of the other diners around me had all of their food presented in a professional manner. I'm guessing that they either ran out of plates or just thought that since my entrée was only $14 bucks that it didn't matter. I've been to greasy spoon places that did a better job separating the fish from the fries in a basket.

The Catfish was just okay for me. The fries were actually nicely seasoned and delicious. I will not order this entrée again since it was unspectacular. In fact, the next time I go to Pappadeaux, I am going to try to snag one of those semi-private outdoor areas in back. This seating backs into the gorgeous grounds around Pappadeaux. Also, the lighting around the restaurant and parking lot was excellent as well.

Unusually disappointing experience!  My husband, My daughter and I went to pappadeaux for dinner on Sunday evening.  We know it is usually busy so we decided to beat the dinner rush and get there early...around 5:45pm.  We put our names in and were told it would be a 15 minute wait for a table.  Perfect ( we thought).  In the meantime, more and more people began filling the patio waiting for tables.  We watched people come and overheard many of them talking about how long it would take to be seated.  45 minutes later, as we watched people who walked in after us being seated, including a table of 10,  I asked to check our place in line to make sure that there wasn't an error in their system and was told people were just eating slow and hanging around and that it would be another 15-30 minutes!  I walked through the restaurant and saw that there were many empty tables.  Mind you...there were only 3 of us.  Needless to say, when our number came up, we had to stand at the hostess desk for nearly another 10 minutes to have someone come meet us to seat us.  Once seated, our server was friendly and attentive. But I can't leave out the fact that people who put their names in after us already had their food at the time we were seated.  Food is delicious but expensive so for that type of treatment, Pappadeaux can wait a long time for our return to repay for the treatment that we received.

Several people suggested that I revisit Pappadeaux and since it's close and I often eat seafood out I did.

I had a very different exsperience this time. I sat on the patio this time and I found the patio very pleasant and comfortable.

We started with the in house made Hot Smoked Salmon appetizer. We received a generous portion of salmon topped with a mustard herb sauce and seasoned thin crisp bread toasts. The salmon seemed like it was slow cooked as it just melted like butter in your mouth. I also liked that it was lightly smoked and not too much so you could get the yummy taste of the sauce with it. I thought this was a masterfully prepared dish and this one really wowed me as I would like to get it again some time.

We received our dinners. My husband ordered the Gulf Coast Redfish Pontchartrain and I got the Halibut with spaghetti squash. I taste the redfish and this one is perfect, it's fresh, tasty and prepared perfect. Then I taste the Halibut and it's overcooked and dry. I sort of feared sending it back since it was still edible but my husband convinced me to do so. We flagged the waiter over and he took care of it right away and sent the manager over.  The manager and the waiter were extremely kind and didn't at all make me feel guilty for sending the fish back. They also remade my husband's dinner so he could have a fresh one with me and also gave him the option of nibbling on the current one he had if he wanted to. The manager even suggested having some salad or soup while we wait he really couldn't be more hospitable.

We receive our new dinners and both were very good. My Halibut was MUCH BETTER as it was tasty and flaky and moist. The Spaghetti squash was good it was slightly sweet and buttery and the redfish was nailed perfect again, it was really delicious. The manager checked on us and said we could have dessert on them. We enjoyed the dinners very much and over ate a bit so we didn't have room for dessert but we saw someone walk by with a dessert tray and they looked really good.

This was an educational exsperience for me. 
I know I can come back to Pappdeaux because the food will be good or they will do their best to make it again right for you.

I will try to be a better diner and say something to my server if I need too.

We started off with some alligator bites. Very well cleaned, and wasn't gamey at all. The dipping sauce was really good too - buttery and not too spicy. We ordered gumbo - which the flavor was a bit bland. Lots of shrimp and seafood, and the juicy andouille sausage. But the broth was lacking and super runny...

I was definitely a big fan of the Pasta Mardi Gras! HOLY MOLY!!! the cream sauce was delightful :) Abundant pieces of shrimp, sausage, scallops and crawfish! Swimming in that tasty cream and tomato sauce. The whole bowl of dish was accompanied by a buttery garlic crostini that was used to sop up all the leftover sauce. Can't stop talking about that sauce!

The servings of the dishes were huge and overwhelming - but i'm definitely not complaining. The service was overall good - the food came out in lighting speed.
Jalissa was amazing. It was my first date and she made it amazing.  She was quick, amazing, and friendly. The food was great.  If she wasn't our server I'd walk out.

Great service, delicious food and fresh seafood.  Our waiter gave us the heads up that the Crawfish Étouffée is spicy and the item most sent back for heat.  He suggested a trio of crawfish:  fried, ettouffee and cream sauce.  Good call because it was definitely spicier than I like.  I would definitely go back to Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.

Love this place for fish!  I enjoy flying though Houston airport just so I can eat at their restaurant during lay overs.  It is very pricey $$$$!!!

I always get a great meal, but not everything is a "Wow" on the menu.  Friends from time to time get a dish there that is at best - average.  I find that if you get their specials, or fish with a sauce topped with crab and shrimp or crawfish you can't go wrong.  The Calamari has always been really good too!

We had an excellent meal here.  The mussels were cooked to perfection; fried alligator was spicy with a great dipping sauce, shrimp gumbo, delicious and  the étouffée, to die for.  Our waiter was excellent, one of our party was very late arriving so we were ordering courses one at a time, never fazed him at all.  We will definitely be back!
I was really excited to try this restaurant as I heard good things.  The food was okay, but everything took FOREVER and they were not that busy.  I probably will not go there again.

I would like to extend a formal apology for not walking into this place sooner. It honestly blew away all my expectations! The food, the atmosphere, and the service were all absolutely wonderful. Our server was Brent and he was fantastic; sweet, quick, and very polite and happy. 
It has been a while since I've set foot in this place. Not because of any slight or grievance on my part, but because of a long string of bad luck. This place is not for people looking to save money, but if you're tired of being practically robbed at your local Red Lobster, you might want to give this place a try. Better options on the menu, infinitely better quality, just at a little higher price, but to me the price was worth it.
Started with the calamari appetizer. Delish! Extra points for the fried artichoke hearts. Entrees were the Pasta Mardi Gras (for me) and the Scallop & Crab Pappardelle Pasta. Good lord was the Mardi Gras good. Actually grilled shrimp (instead of browned shrimp dowsed in liquid smoke), crawfish (I know it's lazy on my part but I was so happy they had already just put the meat of the crawfish into the dish instead of placed whole ones in; I'm clumsy by nature so I would have made a mess), and andouille sausage (which I've never tried before but found I liked it greatly) all in a marinara creams sauce (my favorite). I highly recommend this dish because I couldn't find one fault (not that I go looking, but the other seafood restaurants near me always manage to somehow magnify their faults when I visit so it's hard not to just expect mistakes). I wish I'd had room for desert because I'm sure it would have been wonderful, but then again it gives me an extra reason to come back. Please don't be scared of the prices because in my mind it's completely worth it due to everything backing the prices up. This is a great place for once in a while special occasion type outings! Especially for people who are fed up with the subpar seafood most places like to tout out of their kitchens!
This spot is as good as it gets for Seafood in the West Valley, nothing else to say!  AMAZING in every way!
It is as excellent as the one in the Chicago suburbs.  The food is awesome and the atmosphere is charming.   We had the alligator, crabs cakes, crawfish trio and the 1/2 chicken.  All were fantastic!

I usually choose this restaurant for my birthday dinner. Their food is absolutely delicious! Tonight they did not disappoint. We started with the crab and spinach dip. I had the Pasta New Orleans which is fettuccini noodles in a pink Cajun creme sauce with lump crab, grilled shrimp, mushrooms and tomatoes. My husband had Mississippi Catfish Opelasoosas which was Cajun grilled catfish with lump crab, mussels and shrimp with a creme sauce and dirty rice. Their dirty rice is amazing! We both took left overs home and we are pretty big eaters. We both got a cocktail and my husband got a Caesar salad. The total was ~$106 before gratuity. The service was great. I loved the atmosphere, such a beautiful patio. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful but can be pretty loud. There is usually live music on the patio on the weekends too. Also they take reservations!

Love love love this restaurant. My boyfriend and I had sworn off any restaurant that had served seafood after many awful dinners but one of my clients had recommended this place... After looking over the menu several  times online, I figured it would be worth trying. We will only be coming back here! Our waiter, Kyle, was very attentive and took the time to go over the menu with us. We had alligator and oysters as appetizers, they definitely hit the spot and salmon and the Alaskan king crab for our dinners. I couldn't be more pleased with how everything turned out and I can't wait to go back! Even their drinks were delicious!

Excellent food and service! Went here to try some new orleans food with my girlfriend and we had a great time. The location is a bit to be desired because its next to the freeway and theres only one access point but overall a very nice place.

This is the spot for a little bit of Nola in the desert. I thought this would be like Applebee's with seafood-- I didnt have high expectations. Instead, i was pleasantly suprised to see quality of seafood to be much higher than anticipated. I had some Alaskan crab which was delicious. It wasnt cheap but you get what you pay for. Being fron the northwest, I'm excited to have somewhete with some good seafood close by.

First time ever going there had a few months back and the food was phenomenal I love seafood. They had a wonderful menu, they even had crocodile puffs that tasted just like chicken. Sounds funny I know but my boyfriend and his family and I went and I have the best time ever the interior is really really authentic, mixed with the southern Louisiana and Cajun look. So totally would recommend it to people little bit pricey but totally worth it.

I came here on March 25th for my boyfriends birthday as a surprise dinner. Let me tell you, I had no idea what to expect and it was more than I could've imagined. This is my boyfriends favorite restaurant, which is why I brought him, and now my absolute favorite as well. We started off with an appetizer; a dozen blue point oysters. For people who don't know me, I love pretty much all seafood except oysters and squid (I used to love squid but the texture freaks me out. Maybe someday I'll love it again) but my boyfriend wanted me to try it, even though I knew previously I didn't like it. So I did. He put lemon on it and there was 3 sauces to choose from. There was one that reminds me of soy sauce mixed with wasabi, like a person would dip their sushi in. But I'm not sure if that was what it was. But I put that on mine and it was actually really good. So officially I like oysters now!! And then we both got a soup cup. He got the lobster bisque and I got the Louisiana seafood gumbo which I have ALWAYS wanted to try! Both soups were super yummy. I was very impressed. So far I had not been let down! Next was our actual meal. I got the pasta Mardi Gras and my boyfriend got the grilled Caribbean lobster tail. My pasta was amazing. I've always been big on pasta. The sauce was tasty and it has sausage and shrimps in it. My boyfriends included lobster, mashed red potatoes and broccolini. His was good too. Lastly, I had told the waitress by the name of devyn (I think that's how she spelled it) who by the way was very nice and friendly. She had great customer service. If you go, definitely ask to be seated in her area!! Anyways I told her that it was my boyfriends birthday so at the end they offered complimentary dessert. They had so many good ones to choose from. We picked the banana pudding. Haha thinking about it makes me hungry and my mouth water. I've had banana pudding before. I usually only like my family's cause it's a family recipe but pappadeux's knows how to make some amazing banana pudding. Lastly a couple things, if you are going for a special occasion, I recommend making a reservation. I was so glad I made a reservation. When we got there it was so packed, inside and out. Second, the place is beautiful. If you can, and you know it's going to be a nice day, I'd say sit outside. We didn't get to, but that's okay. Thirdly, everyone there is nice and quick and efficient. Please check this place out! They deserve some more good business.  I can't wait to go back again.

Dropped in for HH on a Friday, plenty of seating.  The service wasn't too bad, but the food was unimpressive:

Catfish beignet-  basically just deep fried catfish but I'm a fan of catfish and couldn't tell what was in the batter
Crispy orange shrimp- not bad, tasty
Fried calamari-  standard
Mini fondeaux- best thing we ordered...get this!
Crispy alligator-  "tastes like chicken"...it really does.  I already knew this, but tried it for pure novelty reasons
Oysters-got a  dozen, but not on the HH menu

We weren't sure what Phoenix had to offer, but it was an ok experience.

This is one of my favorite seafood restaurant.  I could not wait to get to Phoenix to go to the restaurant.  I shared the combo plate with my husband since it is so much food.  We were not disappointEd.  My husband also had the gumbo which he enjoyed.  I also enjoy their catfish.  I definitely will make it one of my stops when I go to Phoenix.

Every chance I get when near Pappadeaux I will hit it.  The food is always great! We were doing a foodie road trip to the Phoenix area to hit some select spots.  Pappadeaux was the #1 spot for us to go!  Well worth the drive from Las Vegas.   I had the catfish blackened and dirty rice both were great.  I have been to locations in Denver, San Antonio and Austin worth it every time and every where!!!
This place is very good but expensive. More upscale and definitely worth the money. Yelp needs to changes the pricing range to $$$ though, it's misleading and needs to be updated. Please update it.

Pappadeaux is always a "yes" for me. Came here most recently on my birthday with my husband and infant son.... 4:30pm on a Saturday which was early enough to beat the rush, so there wasn't a wait when we got there. We were seated promptly and our waitress was pleasant and prompt with our menu and drinks. She told me they were out of the Crab claws that came with the Alaskan Halibut Piccata entree I wanted and what the substitution would be. I was ok with the substitution and ordered anyway. Once my food arrived the substitution Jumbo lump crabmeat was a joke, I could barely see any. I told the waitress. She took it back to the kitchen and the manager came over. The manager said she'd make sure they corrected the issue and took 50% off my check and gave me a free birthday desert. The food came back to my table and was fixed with the added  crab meat that was enough to see and taste. The Bayou cake was everything. They made an unpleasant substitution issue better. I will always have a soft spot in my heart for Pappadeaux and will definitely return. The manager Arizonnia was gracious and kind.

Been here many times and even had an event for 20 people.  Best Sea Food place in Phoenix.  Service is always 5 stars and the staff is always great.  Try the seafood gumbo, oysters and lobsters.  I had a 4lb lobster there and it was the best.

Had a business dinner recently, for a party of eight. Place was pretty crowded and busy. But our service never suffered, food was very delicious. In fact, the coconut shrimp was my favorite for the night. Seems like they were able to get everyone seated in a timely matter through out the evening. It does get a little noisy. Food was very good, service was really good, never had to request anything refills. Since I am not a huge seafood person, I also had a very good Caesar Salad. 
Overall we had a very good experience,

The best advice that I can give is that if you plan to dine at Pappadeaux, plan to arrive early.  This place is positively packed later in the evening! Still, if you're ready to set aside the money to have a good night, you'll probably get it here.  

The restaraunt is extremely customer-service oriented with very polite employees who attempt to fulfill all your needs.   They'll even offer suggestions on what items to select depending on what your party is looking for, very helpful! 

On this particular trip I settled on the Crawfish Etouffee and ordered a Bloody Mary from the bar.  Between my meal and our appetizers (we went with the combo platter and pan-fried frog legs) I can say that I was totally satisfied by the end of the night.   Things were noisy but we were in the mood to relax and have fun and the atmosphere was certainly condusive to doing just that.   

The food may not have been particularly authentic compared to real Cajun/Creole food but it was completely satisfying and I was surprised that my drink was relatively inexpensive for its size and for a bar inside a restaraunt in the middle of the city.   While it can get expensive fast at Pappadeaux, the folks here definitely earn their money.  The live music on the patio was certainly a plus as well.

I was visiting Phoenix, Arizona and went to dinner at this establishment and was denied an opportunity by mangers Catherine Belford and Lisa Winslow to order a drink according to the law here in Arizona, which it applies to state residents not out of state. Their interpretation is incorrect! I will not be coming back here again. And I suggest if you're 21 don't even bother ordering a drink here. After reading this law, I am interpreting that this law ONLY applies to Arizona residents. I am NOT a Arizona resident! The staff would not serve me even though I was legally able to drink. I am 21 years old! The law saids: 

Acceptable forms of ID include an unexpired driver license or identification cards (vertical or horizontal) issued by:


- Any state OTHER THAN ARIZONA,
- The District Of Columbia,
- Any Territory Of The United States or Canada
if the license includes:
- a picture of the licensee and
- the person's date of birth.


A liquor-licensed business may not accept as the only form of identification an unexpired, vertical (under age 21) ARIZONA driver license or identification card when the owner/presenter has been age 21 for more than 30 days. This applies only to Arizona driver licenses and identification cards.


If you are age 21 or older and have been denied entry into a bar or denied the sale or service of alcohol and would like to replace a vertical ARIZONA driver license, you will find complete instructions by visiting this link to the Arizona Department of Transportation website: http://azdot.gov/mvd/driver-services/driver-license-information/duplicate-or-renew-your-license.

Great fresh seafood shipped in daily! Great atmosphere. I always love to sit at the bar. Most importantly... the service is the best! Every server i ever got is well trained at customer service. Friendly and very professional. Great place.
Marcus was our waiter and he was seriously the best! Our first time there and will definitely be back. He was so knowledgeable about EVERYTHING on the menu!

Even though we had a reservation we still had to wait. They have a 15 minute "grace" window which I have never heard of before.  We order the calamari app and it was fantastic. 

The entree is where they struggled.  We both ordered the shrimp and grits.  The shrimp was tough due to being over cooked.  It tasted like rubber.   Very disappointing as we had a wonderful experience at the Dallas location.  Unfortunately, the Phoenix restaurants food quality has gone down hill.
I came to your restaurant yesterday with my family I felt like the food was overpriced for the amount that you put on the plate I paid for a $30 played in only got $15 worth of food not happy
Hello I went tonight and once again a nice time the server we got ask for he was very freindly nick michalle it was a very nice birthday

Some think the term "It is what it is" is stupid. 
I think the saying " I hate fish that tastes fishy" is stupid. 
Especially when the person saying it  just happens to be the Summer's Eve poster child and coincidentally, your date for the evening.

I've eaten here since they opened, trying everything on their menu at one time or another, even some things not on the menu. 
If you don't see the cedar planked salmon on the menu, ask for it. 

You'll never tell another soul how you don't like fishy fish again after eating this salmon...it's the most un-fishy-est, yet fishy-est fish fish dish you'll ever eat. 
If that makes any sense.

You do however have your date to contend with afterwards. Or did you forget?
Oh well.
It is what it is.

This place has a beautiful ambience. I highly recommend this place for special occasions. The restaurant has a lovely Patio area if you want to avoid the noise inside. We ordered few drinks and crispy calamari for appetizers, which didn't disappoint. My husband and I ordered pasta Mardi grass and scallops shrimp pasta. Both were delicious. I ordered creme brûlée which was out of the world. Overall, I give 5 stars and highly recommend this place for finger licking sea food.

I've come here multiple times and each and every time I HAVE to get the alligator.
I love almost everything on the menu. It's all worth trying. Just watch the deep fried platters...there is such a thing as too much deep fried food on one plate. It can tend to get a bit overwhelming.
I think my only complaint is that the service always kinda seems a little slow and the prices are a bit much. I mean, I understand that seafood prices can be a bit much but they seem to seriously jack up the prices at this place.
I love the little dessert tray they have to show you what they have on the dessert menu that night. I'm a visual type of person and it's just so helpful. They're desserts are really good too so if you can manage to leave room for them, I suggest you try something.

I love this place I go for my birthday every year. Their creme brulee is to die for. The salmon is off the hook and I love all their appetizer.;m  The one thing I not a fan of is their clam chowder it wasn't up to my standards. Love their lobster bisque though and would recommend that. The fried stuff is a little heavy but my husband loves it so there a little of everything.

Great seafood and steak.  Love surf and turf and getting it from here, I know it's extremely fresh and tasty.  Great place to take a date or meet up with friends or take your clients to.  I'll be back.

We tried to make reservations about an hour ahead of time but they were booked up for reservations.  But not all tables can have a reservation.  So we decided to just go anyway and were seated right away.  The place is huge and has more tables than I could count.  The bar area is also very large with many booths and tables.  The menu had so many choices it was hard to decide.  So many cajun dishes too.

Our appetizer was shrimp cocktail.  It came with 9 shrimp instead of the usual 6 served at most places.  The cocktail sauce had a half teaspoon of straight horseradish sauce for those who may want to kick it up a bit.  We prefer less kick and dipped around the sauce.  It was a great way to start the meal.

My wife and I split a small order of fried shrimp (8). It was served already split in separate plates which was nice. The shrimp were butterflied, light and crispy, delicious.  She also ordered the stuffed shrimp and a baked potato loaded.  The shrimp were rolled in a rich crab stuffing which was seasoned perfectly.  The baked potato was huge, hot and smothered with all kinds of goodies (butter, sour cream, bacon, chives, celery).  She ordered the smaller portion that came with two stuffed shrimp.  If you get an appetizer this is the size you should get, more than she could eat and she loved every bite. 

I ordered the Shrimp Creole.  It came with a side of cheese grits with andouille mixed in.  The creole was not too spicy like a lot of places.  The sauce was full of veggies and chunks of tomato.  It was outstanding and worthy of a repeat order.
 
My wife had a frozen margarita blended and sipped on it throughout dinner.  I had Cabernet Sauvignon by the glass.  Our server was sweet, spunky, and very attentive.  She was enthusiastic and genuinely wanted us to enjoy ourselves and our dinner.  We both probably ate too much but everything was cooked and seasoned so well, it was almost impossible to stop eating.  A truly memorable meal which these days is hard to find.

We have never been disappointed here. We've been customers for years and have always had delicious food, amazing service, and a great dining experience. This is a favorite of ours for special occasions. It is worth the long wait on the busy days. We'll keep returning as long as they keep up the great service and delicious food.

Wish we had one in california. everyone's dish was amazing. I had the crispy salmon with scallop, shrimp and crab meat and talk about seafood overload, but in a good way. each savory bite melted in my mouth and although i wanted to eat it all up I was full by the time I was halfway done with my meal. that combined with the voodoo cocktail and brownie dessert made my night. Nichole was super awesome and very patient with my friends and I.

Came here last night for the 1st time. The experience was okay, I may have given it 5 stars if I actually got everything I ordered.  I was really looking forward to trying the clam chowder,  but when it never came with my meal I was disappointed & decided to be happy with the food I did get; which ended up being a challenge. The stuffed shrimp sound better on the menu than they actually taste. The mashed potatoes tasted as if they came out of a box, which is surprising considering how much they charge for them. The best part of the meal was when my husband kindly let me try a bite of his lobster bisque.... and I don't think I've ever tasted anything so delicious!!  that one bite is the reason I gave this review 4 stars instead of one. I will go back here again but only to get a to go order of the lobster bisque!!!
Love this place.  Had the almond crusted snapper for lunch.  It was the absolute best fish I have ever had!  We also had Greek Salad, Calamari and a pasta dish.  Everything was delicious!

Stopped in for a quick bite with the little guy. Sat immediately by a young host. Server came by quickly and we skipped the intro as we have been here multiple times. Order the chargrilled halibut, crawfish étouffée and a Lafayette topping. Our server Ben brought us a cold glass a milk and a tall Kilt Lifter. Life is good. Infant loves fish and crab. Was out in a flash and had a few good laughs.
Love this place. The waiting area outside is cozy. I've never had a bad meal. Great specials too.

Bleh. If you like deep fried, breaded seafood for an exorbitant amount of money, you'll love this place. My boyfriend likes this place so I've given it 3 tries. The first time was an epic fail, horrible service and cold food. Second time, didn't really like my food. Third time just got a blackened fish, it was okay but way too much in price. Not my cup of tea but apparently those who do like it love it, because they are always busy. So, to each their own.

Had such a great time and meal, I would recommend Pappadeaux  for sea food. So many great choices, crawfish, frog legs, alligator, oyster . The Manager "Dawson" was awesome dealing with my family.
