It will be a dinner experience we will talk about forever. Can't wait for our next trip there for dinner, I just wish it wasn't so far from us (about an hour). Many thanks to Dawson and our server for an enjoyable experience.

My favorite things here are the fried alligator and for my entree I always get the bacon wrapped shrimp, it's to die for and by far the best thing on the menu. Such a unique flavor I love coming here ... oh and the swap things are a must try!

Been on our to-try list for months, and we finally made it.  Sorry, we won't be hurrying back

First, order two glasses of wine at a time.  That way, you'll get one decent sized serving.  Had the catfish po-boys.  Huge, but something was lacking.  We just didn't think much of the sauce, kind of a strange flavor for Nawlins, which is where I go to compare po-boys.  We would have been happier with a smaller sandwich, if it had some flavor.  Or I would have ordered a catfish plate, but how can you eat catfish without hush puppies?

Service was like the food - just ok.  And someone said the place was tired.  Yep, my take as well.  But 8 glasses of wine out of a bottle?  And not cheap wine either.
The food is amazingggg. Absolutely delicious. But I don't really get the tacky decor/expensive menu combo. I wish it looked more upscale to match the menu.

Love, love, love Pappadeux.  Only my second time here and both were on Fridays to connect with friends. Both times we had EXCELLENT service with fantastic and attentive wait staff. I don't mind paying a bit more when I get quality food with great service. We enjoyed music on the patio with a pretty cool local singer/songwriter.  The vibe of Pappadeux is unique with families, couples, and large groups all appearing to have a good time.  I had grilled shrimp with sautéed green beans and my. oh. my... was my mouth was happy! 

Last note:  I never have dessert. The dessert tray was toO unique to give it a pass. The King cake cheesecake was to die for.  you should order that!

Wonderful outdoor seating. Service here was great and I was so thrilled to see I could find them in Arizona. I can't come here without ordering the dip and a swamp thing. One of my favorite dishes is the Texas Redfish Pontchartrain but I honestly don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. I wish there were more locations on the east coast where I'm from.

We don't live nearby, so it's been a while.  But we happened to be nearby and so came in again.

I don't recall it being so loud last time.  It was VERY loud.  I mean really LOUD.  Not sure why.  The place was full, but I don't see why everyone was shouting.  Weird.

Various dishes were ordered.  I was hoping for a Cajun catfish.  Breaded and deep-fried.  Sounded good.  Well, it was a disappointment.  It may as well have been Long John Sliver's.  There was no seasoning.  The waitress was nice enough to bring me some Cajun seasoning which I sprinkled on the fish.  It helped, but I think it would have been better if it was part of the coating instead of adding it later.

The other dishes ordered were better (I got to sample them).  So it's clear I just ordered the wrong thing.  However, I think it fair to deduct points for this.  Everything should be flavorful and exciting.  And the fried catfish just wasn't.  It's not a question of not liking something.  The catfish was cooked properly and tasted like catfish.  But there were no exciting flavors unlike the other dishes they offer.  Why did they do that?  I expect more than Long John Silver's.

I also got a bowl of gumbo.  It wasn't quite as good as I remember from last time.  it had a slight burned flavor to it.  Like maybe they cooked the roux too long.  But it was otherwise flavorful.

I'm still a fan based on the other dishes I sampled (and wished I had ordered).  I just won't order the catfish ever again.

I also had the key lime pie.  It was a bit too sweet.  I've never had such a sweet key lime pie before. The tart tang was there, but overpowered by the sweet.  Strange.  Maybe they assumed the raspberry sauce they drizzled on the plate would help counter the sweetness?  Don't know.  I didn't use the drizzle because I just wanted key lime.  Usually whipped cream is there to counter the tartness (and there was some).  But the pie was too sweet already.  I gotta deduct a few points for that too.

So I'll take one star away.  I can't really justify taking two from them.  I definitely expect better than what I got.  It's one thing not to like something, it's another when something you like isn't executed as well as it should have been.

Was treated to an amazing surprise luncheon here recently with some fabulous friends and what a culinary experience. Fried alligator tail, oysters in the half shell and we also tried some lobster and a Cajun dish that was so amazing. Topped off by a desert that took my breath away!! Off to the gym now!! I can not wait to return!!

My first time at Pappadeaux. I LOVED the architecture, ambiance and landscaping. Very beautiful.  My review is a 3.5 stars.  This place is very pricey $113 for two.

HIGHLY recommended:  
* Cedar plank salmon with asparagus.
* Banana bread pudding in a mason jar! You can get this to go too! INCREDIBLE!!
* The pasta that comes with the NOT recommended alaskan king crab legs was yummy. Just get the pasta ala carte.

NOT recommended:
* (2) Alaskan king crab legs with pasta. Very pricey and my friend and I were greeted and relayed that their seafood is fresh and flown in. I ordered this item and it was definitely NOT fresh. The crab legs were extremely salty, inedible. The texture was super off. 
* Creme brulee - was extremely bland, without flavor and the consistency was very loose, soup -like. Interesting enough I inquired about this to the hostess and she says that's how they make it. I just left it alone.
* Mojito (1)

I'll definitely return for other items to try. Yet, I recommend asking what is fresh before you order it. My oder was very disappointing and ironically enough the "NOT recommended" portion was mine. Boo.  Good news my friend shared and treated.

Tonight was my first night trying Pappadeaux and I couldn't have been happier! Our server Ryan Martinez was probably the best server we've ever had. He was very attentive and made us feel so welcome, as if we were part of the Pappadeaux family ourselves. The fresh Mahi-mahi was to die for and the lobster was exquisite. Desert presentation was so amazing that we had to take home a brownie for later. Thanks for the great night out!

My in-laws wanted to take me somewhere for my birthday, and Pappa's always used to be one of my favorites so for dinner, this is where we decided to go. Even though many chain restaurants have come and gone in the era, this restaurant has remained a staple along the I-17 freeway. It's always tricky to get to especially when heading south on the I-17 since you have to go one exit past the restaurant, make a U-turn, and drive on the access road, but it's always crowded no matter what, even on a Thursday evening. 

The oysters were really good. They were fresh and regular in size. 

The Grand Hennessy drink was an especially tasty treat! Almost dessert like from the start! It featured the Hennessy VS Marnier with fresh lemon and orange juices with a "splash of Moscato D'Asti." It's also very refreshing too - something I'd really enjoy during the summer.

I usually order more traditional fare like catfish with dirty rice or similar, but this time I ordered the biggest photo right smack on in the middle of their menu, The Lobster Boil. It somewhat reminded me of what you'd find at Joe's Crab Shack, but definitely much higher quality and less salty. I felt like everything was deliciously bathed in butter and light spices. 

The service was less than to be desired. It seemed like the restaurant was understaffed that night. From the get go, they sat our group of four instead of the couple that arrived there before us, so they brought only two menus, so as the hostess sat us, she only gave us two menus and took away the other 2 place settings. No problemo. I simply asked for her to keep those extra settings there and bring us two more menus. But then, our waiter would disappear for long periods of time, and forgot to bring my father in law a 2nd drink as requested, so the less than stellar performance kind of left us disappointed even though the food was good. It's not a deal breaker or anything, but that cheerful memory of this place is definitely jaded a bit now.

Fried everything is the best explanation of their menu. I went here to celebrate my fifth wedding anniversary and left feeling about twenty pounds heavier. I'm not into fried foods so maybe this place just isn't for me. I couldn't believe how busy it was considering. The prices are very high. The employees are very friendly. But I have zero desire to return.

Get here early or late, othrerwise a 630pm arrivals nets an hour and 45 minute wait. But it is worth it!

My husband and I used to visit Pappadeaux every Friday for the past year or two, until we recently moved to CA and I almost didn't want to move because there is no Pappas in the East Bay area of San Francisco/Oakland CA. BUMMER!!!! 

I highly recommend the soft shell crab, the mixed grill skewers, Salmon Yvette, and the andouille grits! We usually sit at the bar and have Nate, Susan, Rich, or Le Andrew serving us. Great atmosphere, great food, great service. 

WE MISS YOU PAPPADEAUX! We will make sure we visit whenever we are visiting Phoenix, AZ again.
Stopped by here to have a bite as we waited for traffic to subside. I got the salmon, octopus, and shrimp plate. It was good and hit the spot! I think if you're in this area, it's an obvious choice.

So I have been here twice in as many months, my gf dad, loves this place...I think it is OK. I liken it to an overpriced red lobster.

The service is ok. And this place is always busy, so you can expect a few hiccups with service being slow, or your waiter forgetting something simple like bread or silverware or water.

They are trained well, but I think are often overwhelmed, often times you have to ask someone to come remove plates to make room for new stuff, once again if they were not so busy or had a few dedicated bussers, I don't think this would be an issue. But alas it is. 

Food, the food is just OK, I know people that rave over it, I just don find it that appealing, I am a huge fan of gumbo, so the last time I was here, I ordered the shrimp gumbo, only to end up almost cracking my tooth on a piece of bone from god knows what was in my gumbo. It might have even been a piece of the bowl as far as I know...

This last time similar experience got the rainbow trout and shrimp, Loaded with butter almost drowned it, and bones thru out...does not make for a good dining experience. This place is ok, but for the prices I would expect more attention to be placed to small details. Will go here if invited but have experienced better seafood places throughout the valley. And if I had to choose I would go there instead.
Fast service, fastest i have seen!! Also very nice servers!!! I reallllly love their foods here oh and their bread omg!!! Honey plus bread=ftw
I really enjoy Pappadeux. Servers are usually competent, food is quite good and the prices aren't outrageous.
Food was amazing. Portion and service was great. We definitely will come again the next time we are in town.
Service by Ryan was good. Enjoy appetizers Oysters main course Shrimp Etouffee, coconut Shrimp, Atlantic Salmon Yvette.

I went here with a good friend.  My friend got food poisoning from the 'grilled red fish and jumbo shrimp'.  She said it tasted gross and that she couldn't eat it.  I decided to take it home not wanting to waste food.  After trying it at home, I threw it away because it didn't taste right.

I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and that was very good.  The lobster bisque did not taste fresh.  It tasted old but the lobster pieces inside the bisque did taste very fresh.

I didn't feel well for the next 2 days after eating here.  I didn't feel better until I started taking a 'parasite cleanse'.

You would think a bill and tip for 2 that came out to be $139 would be a better experience.

Service was good this time.  Last time service was annoying.  We had a waitress that kept on insulting me the entire time and thought that was funny.  We both thought she was weird.

I went here 4 months before and the dishes were hit and miss.  The the fried calamari was stale tasting and tasted like a quick defrost of frozen food left too long in the freezer.  The Texas Redfish Pontchartrain was excellent.  One of the best tasting fishes in the Phoenix area.  

The 2 star is really for the hit and miss on certain items and for food poisoning.  This is a shame because this was one of my favorite restaurant chain when I lived in Houston 20 years ago.

Great service from hostess, bartenders and wait staff.  We were very disappointed in the quality of food for the price. Fish was not hot or crispy as expected from the fried mixed platter. Fries were not hot either. Not worth trying again at their prices.

I was so impressed with our lunch today. Very delicious. I had my doubts, but when the seafood grill came to our table every piece of fish was fresh light elegantly cooked to perfection. We are from San Francisco the land of excellent seafood. This is a top notch seafood restaurant.

Great date night spot or get together with friends place!

Food is good, not cheap but not overpriced...

Cool spot and the food is great!
Yum!  Food was great, service was even better- we had a wonderful time at this restaurant when friends were in town and will definitely be going back!  Must try the desserts as well- delicious!

Loved this place - great atmosphere, food was delicious! However they did screw up my order and sent the wrong platter to the table which I didn't even realize until the next day because i was too full to realize there was chicken on the platter. Oh well. Husband was in love with the king crab legs...calamari was great...flavoring on the fish was delicious too.

Love the seafood fondue. Shit is straight up amazing. 
I only take advantage of happy hours here. Service is poor but what do you expect from servers who never get tipped by the lower class. 
Great atmosphere, kick ass patio during the winter months and pricey.
Fantastic food, excellent wait staff very attentive. Food was hot and comes in large portions. My salad was made at the table very fresh, oysters were delicious. Definitely recommend!!

So very friendly stuff 
The food was amazing 
It's my first time at this restaurant and definitely I will come back 
Everything is so perfect

My wife and I are both big lovers of seafood and we're very excited about going to Papaduex to eat. Our first visit was great, we both loved to food and our service was excellent but our next visit was just horrible!  My sister wanted to celebrate her Birthday there and made reservations for a party of 13, friends and family on Saturday 10th of February. Management asked that the entire party be there by 7:45 pm in which we all were. At 7:45 we were informed that the party before us had not left the area reserved for us and that we would have to wait till 8pm. We all waited patiently and stood chatting because of the crowd there. At 8pm they informed us that a couple of people were still sitting in the area we reserved and instead of asking them to leave or go to another area the forced us to wait a entire hour! My sister got emotionally upset because a couple of friends and family members got tired of waiting and left. It was the worst example of management I've seen anywhere and totally unprofessional. We were all starving and forced to wait on other people when she had tables reservations for us. They tried to make things a little better by offering free entrées but my sister was so upset because they had ruined her special moment and Birthday with everyone she invited. Some of us drove 45 minutes to an hour just to be there. The food wasn't satisfactory for some of us, maybe because expectations were ruined from wrongfully having to wait when we shouldn't have. All in all it was the worst moment at a restaurant me and my family and friends have ever had, one star would be too much. I don't know if we will ever give our buisness to them again.
Love the food and atmosphere. You can't go wrong. If there is a long wait love to set at the bar. It does get a little noise but it fits .

I really enjoyed the banana pudding.   The coconut shrimp was awesome.  My favorite entrée was the lobster bisque which I ate the next day.     Most importantly the service was immaculate. Julie was an excellent server; she answered all of my questions concerning the menu and kept the drink refills on tap.   On the other hand, the seafood gumbo's roux needs a little work.  Very thin and void of flavor.   Five star nonetheless.
Great food and service.  Only draw back is the dining area is huge and loud so it makes it very difficult to have conversation.
Terrific happy hour, amiable staff. New Clam chowder is scrumptious. A great place for an ice cold on beer and some calamari.

I've eaten here many times but tonight was the best.  We ordered a dozen Gulf Coast Oysters for two.  They were enormous and as fresh as could be.  I ordered the scallops and lump crab.   The scallops were perfectly grilled with a touch of natural sweetness. My friend had grilled bacon wrapped shrimp.  It was scrumptious!  4 beers later our bill was barely $100.   Well worth the night out.  Bartenders Danny and Nick were awesome.!

I love this restaurant. Whenever I'm in Phoenix for work, I make sure I stop by. The service is wonderful and the food is pretty damn good. I love the soft shell crabs with a load mashed potato. I've also tried the Alaskan King Crab, Lobster, and Salmon and Pappadeaux never dissapoints. They sometimes have specials for a half dozen oysters for only $5. 

I'm from Los Angeles and I wished they tore down all the Red Lobsters and Joe's Crab Shacks and opened a couple of these restaurants closer to home.

You get what you pay for. If you think the rich are better than you are go here. You'll realize otherwise. God rich folks are nasty unethical behavior and flat out childlike. Back to the review lol, the waiters and waitresses are classy and excellent and so is the food and restaurant. Just had to throw in the rich nose blowing crouching out loud non manner rich snob rant in here. Because I can.
A little pricey and not the best in taste. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing (bacon wrapped shrimp).

If you want to spend for a night out to dinner, don't even think past Pappadeaux. From great drinks to their perfectly prepared and presented lobster from the tank - you are in the one place in Phoenix where anything you order is going to be fantastic. And seafood in the desert?  However they manage it, it's fresh. And the taste is everything from a delicate rice to the boldest spiced gumbo. Go and sit at the bar and share their crab dip. The bartenders make eating at the bar easy and fun.

What a joke
Got a carry out shrimp and grits and Greek salad was the worst POS I ever ate. I called them right after paying $75 dollars for it. Talked to the manager and they said they would take care of me 3 weeks later gat a $50 gift card which as far as I am concerned can shove up ther ass. I have been going there since they opened. Never again f them
For someone who's lived near New Orleans, this place was mediocre at best. I'm still craving Cajun/Creole cuisine in Phoenix.

Dined at Pappa's last night and it was nothing short a great. I love coming to Pappadeaux because you will almost never be disappointed. We ordered their Alligator and our server Tammy informed us we could do half of our order fried and the other half blackened. I love gator and hearing the option to do half n half was music to my ears. The versions of gator were great but the blackened gator was magnificent. The Mardi Gras pasta and the stuff shrimp were absolutely delightful. Tammy was an awesome server. She was probably the best server I've ever had in my life. If you have never dined at Pappadeaux before, my first question is what is wrong with you? My second question is why not? My third question is when are you planning on dining their because it's a wonderful restaurant

This place is so messed up.  I've been maybe 10 times now, and it is so hit and miss. I keep coming back because I love the king crab legs and the lobster tail; haven't found another place that has them along with a decent array of other food in a lively atmosphere, but they don't inspire me with confidence considering I always spend over $100. My partners always end up with poor meals. 

First of all, their seating management is a disaster. On Friday's visit, I first called for a reservation - 9:30pm was the earliest offer.  I drove there anyway, arrived at 7:30pm, put in our name for a table for two, outside (new system in place - no more numbers, but vibrating alert gizmos).  I asked for outside, but she said 'let us know that when you are called' - probably the problem right there. We were told '20-30 minutes'.  No problem, we went to the smaller bar next to the outdoor dining patio and had a beer.  The Patio was 30% full only, and the waiters servicing the outdoor patio were standing around idle. After watching the patio remain largely empty for at least 20 minutes, I approached the front desk and asked, 'how come we aren't being seated since the patio is not full?" She immediately grabbed a couple of menus and seated us.  We later asked our waiter what was going on, he said ...'million dollar business with a couple of high-school kids running the front desk'.  Just about sums it up! 

We also got dripped on and generally over-chilled by the misters and fans. We finally asked for them to be turned off, but it took a good 20 mins for the misters to completely 'dry out' (one of the reasons I want to sit outside is to avoid the over-chilled interior). 

I had the lobster tail, it was great. My partner had the 'hudson bay combo' ... the bacon-wrapped shrimp were great, but the lobster tail and the scallop were totally lukewarm, tasting like they were cooked well in advance.  Not good for a $27 entree.
Seafood are soooo fresh specially the oysters. I'm a seafood lover & it's my 1st time eating in Pappadeaux & I'm definitely gonna come back. Service is great as well.
Out of Flounder and no halibut tonight. Mushroom risotto very salty and too mushroomy. Very pricey. Everything else ok

The shrimp was overcook d and WAYYYY over season... That's that...  We did came in light but why serve us food then if it's going to be all bad.  My friends fried food was dry as hell, they didn't have any more pasta for the Mac and cheese so they used linguini noodles.. with watered down cheese sauce.  I got to admit worse late night dining ever.
Always great food and service.  It's always busy and boisterous, not the place to come if you're looking for a quiet evening...
Scallops are fantastic, cocktail shrimp is perfect, the squash risotto is one of my faves!

Went with Patrick to celebrate 3 years together. After hearing great things I came in with a really high expectation. They met every single one. Not only that but when they did mess up and gave me mushroom risotto before I even realized the fact that it was not what I ordered (no joke was on the table maybe 2 minutes) they had the risotto replacement on the table! APOLOGIZED AND!! YES AND!! Offered to re-plate it!... this wasn't the waitress apologizing... IT WAS THE CHEF! Talk about making me feel really important. The scallops were amazing the herb risotto was amazing and even the desert (which was given to us on the house for coming there to celebrate) of creme brule blow my mind. I had a food high and floated like a overfilled happy balloon all the way home.

Had some gator, pretty cool. Long wait to sit and the place is so busy that any messes are swept or kicked under the table. For my wife and I to eat, it cost $120 including tip.
Cheesecake was awesome.

The Wife and I visited this Pappadeaux  this evening...and i must say i thought the one in Illinois was great, but this one was even greater. It is the only location in the entire state of Arizona...and it is very spacious with plenty of outdoor seating with cool zone fans. They were having a special on Crawfish which my wife had and i had to show her how to eat them...but she really enjoyed them. I had my usual blackened Halibut with the yvette sauce, and dirty rice and it was simply delicious as usual with other locations i have been to.

The happy hour there is top notch as well, we will probably try that next time...but this place while always packed is so very relaxing and the service is spectacular. If it is not on the menu and you want something in particular they probably will have it there, and they will be more than happy to prepare it for you. It is a little expensive to eat here because it is quality seafood...made to order...but it is well worth it. So the next time you want some great cajun and seafood delights make a trip to this establishment off the I-17 South here in phoenix and you will leave happy. Eat, Drink, and Be Merry my friends!!!!

Very, very good seafood just about everything on there menu is great ask for Johnnie for your waiter he is excellent he is on point with the menu he explains everything you need to know very nice gentlemen
Great place to eat. Can't go wrong with some down south food. This is the best place in the valley to eat. If you sit at the bar you get super fast service.
Favorite seafood around. Great steaks and drinks as well. Fried gator isnt too shabby either. Wait can be long but worth it. They do take reservations as well.

Just left after having dinner and this time just was not a pleasant experience.
We started with an hour wait (no problem at all we sat and had drinks)
At the bar we had frog legs mmm they were good.
Our buzzer went off and we got seated.
First they never gave us silverware I had to get up and ask for it (no problem they were busy)
Our waiter seemed pre-occupied and made us feel like unwanted guest.

We sat with our drinks empty most of the dinner our appetizers came late and our food came cold.
I had Costa Rican Mahi it was very good although cold the grits and sauce were amazing.
My husband had bacon wrapped shrimp he asked for a baked potato side was quoted a $3.95 price (I may be wrong on the change) and when the bill came it was almost $6.00 for a baked potato that also came way after the food came out.
We went with friends they had the seafood platter and chicken linguini.
Meal is over we are thirsty as our glasses weren't refilled.
Our friends food gets taken to the back to be boxed only one meal got boxed and when we asked about the other he went to the back and came back with a piece of fish in a box. When we asked where the rest of the meal went he said it got dumped. Well wait that makes no sense as I have a piece of fish right here how do you dump fries but save the fish that was on top of the fries?
Needless to say they won't be eating the fish! 
He did give 2 free deserts to make up for the food that got thrown.
Key lime pie was very good as was the chocolate brownie.

Of course we will return we enjoy this place.
Hopefully next time it will be better :)

Get the shrimp and grits.. it is the best I have ever tasted.. We also had lobster bisque which has huge chunks of lobster in it.. It is a bit pricey but huge portions and worth every penny.. I have also had the tilapia there and it was wonderful.. Service is right on very good..

What a wonderful meal. I like to sit at the bar, as I feel that it gives the best view of the rest of the restaurant, for people watching.  From the attentive and knowledgeable staff, to the expert chefs that prepare the delectable dishes, dinner was delicious and perfect. 
 
I started with the oysters,  which were large and perfectly prepared. I highly recommend them.

I ordered a fresh seafood item, the scallops with sweet pea risotto.  Absolutely Devine! 

Since I am celebrating my birthday month, I also enjoyed a dessert.  The mixed dessert of  pecan  and sweet potato pie, creme brulee 
, and banana pudding was the perfect ending.

You can sign up online for your complementary birthday dessert. I hope that your visit is as delicious as mine was.

Not impressed. I waited years to go here, heard great things. The restaurant was too packed. Very loud. Had to shout to have a conversation. Food wasn't great. After spending $110 the kids meal was the best thing

Just had dinner here tonight and absolutely loved it.  I had raw oysters, boiled shrimp, salad, and prime rib with asparagus.  Everything was superb and perfectly timed. 

A young man named Steven waited on our table and took excellent care of us.  


The one complaint I have is that there was no hot water in the men's rest room.  I hope that the restaurant is not trying to cut costs, especially considering the many menu items that require eating by hand.

The shrimp creole and grits, jumbo lump crab cake, shrimp and scallop orecchiette pasta and the creme brule were all outstanding. 

The fried frogs legs was pretty good also considering I'm not a frog legs connoisseur.

Great food ...friday nite was close to an hour wait but worth it.

@ 6 pm on a Monday evening there was a fifteen minute wait. Seated and no server but Nick stopped and took our drink order and said he didn't know who had table. While Nick was getting drinks ( Beer and waters) another waiter put waters down probably seeing we hadn't been waited on. Nick went and took our table and I ordered a dinner salad with bleu cheese dressing ($4.75) and the chef specialty - 
SHRIMP & SCALLOP ORECCHIETTE PASTAshrimp & scallops over orecchiette pasta with jumbo lump crab & asparagus in a creamy parmesan vodka sauce 29.95. The salad needed more dressing but was good. The pasta was VERY good with the three large scallops exceptional and three shrimp tasty. Just the right amount of food!

We came came for a schmoozing from a corporate client. It worked. 

We had the Mediterranean Calamari for apps. They were really good, I like the deep fried artichoke. 

I had lobster bisque, it was really creamy and had great flavor. 

The lunch was a halibut fillet sandwich and dirty rice. The rice was perfectly seasoned and fluffy. The halibut was cooked perfectly and was a very nice size. It was flaky and not dry at all. 

The building was really neat, I think a nice outside happy hour would be great in mid to late October. 

The service was perfect, not over pretentious or up on you the whole time.

I HATE SEAFOOD!!! I was dragged to this place but I do want to say that the chicken pasta I had was very delicious. Their drinks were amazing.... ( I HATE TEA!!!)  But their sweet southern tea OMG so freaking good!!! I want to go back just to order their drinks!!!!! They were very busy so we were forced to sit outside on the patio which as first I was groaning about since it was 99 degrees, however how they have the fans and mist it was very nice and cool.... I had a great experience the waitress came by often was very sweet and chatty and even helped me find items that were non seafood for me to order. Even with the amount of people in the restaurant at that time they came back often and refilled our drinks/ asked if we needed anything often and it was very appreciated.

First great service! Our waitress filled our teas and was just wonderful.  Even brought us a to go ice tea. The appetizer was the fried calamari.  I would call it a 3.5 it was tough and chewy and greasy. I ordered the Chicken Pasta dish and I give it a 5/5. Big portion great flavors. My husband had the Cajun Combo. He loved the catfish but the shrimp portion had a huge pile of white rice with tomatoes and then 5 little shrimp. Still a great value and well done. I recommend sitting in the back as its a noisy place but great atmosphere.

I've eaten in pappadeaux in Chicago as well as Texas and the food and the atmosphere was amazing. Here in phoenix the food was not worth the bill. After the server forgot to bring me the right drink three times I received my meal. I ordered the Alligator tail and it was extremely salty and taste horrible compared to the restaurant in  Schaumburg IL. My fiancée fish was burned on the other side and was tried to be hidden with vegetables.  One the good side they comped us the 1 drink and still brought me a bill for $120.00 and yes they no longer have swordfish. waste of a drive. Pappadeaux is a great restaurant, just not in Arizona.

So I came to Phoenix to visit my family and work. Just so happen to drive by this Texas gem in the middle of the desert. So you know my friends and I had to stop inside. We get there and put it names on the list. Was expecting to wait 30 min...boom 15 min. Got seated fast and I order the voodoo drink. Filet mignon with the lobster. Side of asparagus and grits. I love this place and I love it more now that is on the west coast. I want one in California. Just love the Southern hospitality! The servers are always well groomed. The good is always perfect. It's worth every penny.

This was a delicious experience.  The atmosphere is fantastic and so is the food and finally the customer service.  

The first items I ordered:  fried alligator 5/5(the sauce was spicy, creamy, and almost gravy like).  The next was the spinach dip with the bombest bread ever 5/5!

For the main course I had to try the Andouille, Crab, and Shrimp Gumbo!  Delicious people!  It took me down south with every bite!  It was an explosion of flavor that I truly enjoyed.  Also, the Shrimp Po Boys were fantastic!  Finally I ordered the Fried Catfish with almost a beignet covered in spicy gravy!  Yum!  Also the sides were great I highly recommend the Cheesy Grits with Andouille.  Bring your friends, bring hour family, and definitely bring your fat pants!  Pappadeaux oh how I've fallen in love with thee!  Cheers !!

This is a good date night place. Their food is on the expensive side but it's seafood and they do not skimp on the seafood. Free bread and butter and Ordered the oyster duo, crawfish etouffee with dirty rice and a cup of gumbo. All delicious. Did i mention they dont skimp on seafood? Yea, they don't. The oyster duo is a combination the baton rouge and the oyster pappadeux. I preferred the oyster baton rouge. It's cheesy. Crawfish etouffee just reminded me of New Orleans. overall good experience. The waiters were very attentive and fast.

Have gone here for years and always enjoyed the food. Unfortunately tonight was not going to happen as someone at the restaurant decided to park not only a storage container blocking off parking spots in the back lot, but THEN an entire flipping SEMI-TRUCK with trailer that blocked off a good 8-9 parking spots. 

No way to find a place to park, customers were driving in the parking lot, looking then leaving. Sad to say I was one of those. The food is IMHO great but if you cannot get a place to park you cannot eat. I may be back but not sure when....

Love this place so much we have spent Christmas Eve here the last 15 years.  One of our favorite places to go.  Visited last Friday and the service just seemed overwhelmed.  Only writing this hoping it was a glitch and whoever reads this takes a look at the operations.  Timing was off (slow) and a very big no no on a pet peeve of mine - Please don't serve cold beer in hot glasses right out of the dishwasher.   Bartender fixed rounds 2 and 3 after we mentioned it but it should be obvious from the get go.  We did enjoy the music on the patio.  Whoever the singer was, was very good.

Good atmosphere, good service and awesome food, Lobster tails are HUGE and always seems to be fresh. I love going there for the seafood, it's a nice treat. The wait staff always seem to be helpful and the service is good. They can also handle large groups looks like to me.

I love everything about this place.

I have tried so many different items from the menu and they all taste so good.

The Chilean sea bass is so amazing.

Tonight I had the Moroccan Salmon and Shrimp with crab couscous. It was cooked perfectly and so flavorful.

The cocktails are so tasty and you can taste alcohol

Love this place

Service = 6 stars!  You rock!

The food itself is very delicious (I think it's a little too salty for my taste), and really where it shines is the amazing service, both in terms of helpfulness and friendliness.

Okay is a good summation of Pappadeaux. The food is good. Sometimes very good. But certainly not inexpensive, so for the price is SHOULD be good - arguably even better. A reasonable portion (about 6 ounces) of gator, for example, as an app is about $20. 3.5 ounces (medium vs. large) is $15. Is it good? Heck yeah, though with many of the smaller pieces, the gator taste is concealed by the fried batter flavor. But there's no value there.

The entrees are also quite pricey and again good, but not great. In my opinion, not good enough to warrant the prices. To be clear, when you set prices at a premium level the expectation is set deliver a premium meal. Good isn't good enough.

With all that though, both our orders were wrong and after waiting 45 minutes to get in and another 45 to get our entrees we took what we got. The bill adjustments were minimal and did little to reduce the grand total.

Would we come back? Perhaps if it was a special occasion and we wanted their food items specifically. But we eat out OFTEN and would not return for casual or even somewhat fancier dining.

hubby & I both gluten free & when asked for the menu the server gave us a 1-page nothing. She said they only serve what's on that menu for GF patrons. I asked about chilean sea bass which was not on the GF menu but based on how it was made it sounded GF already, server said she'd check w/the cook. Came back & said yes, only the cheese sauce would have to be omitted so I ordered it. It came on a bed of broccolini which was overcooked, tough & tasteless. Fish had nothing on it & was also extremely tasteless. Husband ordered scallops & they were bland as well. Price is way too much for what you get. First & last visit.

Blackened Shrimp & Crawfish Fondeaux... what more do I need to say.  This was the first thing I tried at Pappadeaux's and I have ordered it every time since.  From the fried seafood menu, the Pappadeaux Platter is great and there is enough food for 2 if you get an appetizer to start, unless you are real hungry.

Recommendations: 
1) fried alligator--you have to try it at least once in your life
2) gulf coast oysters--shucked right at the bar
3) cajun bloody mary
4) stuffed shrimp montage

Pass:
1) cheesecake --it wasn't bad; but it is probably better to try one of the other unique desserts like the praline bread or banana wafer puddings
2) cedar plank salmon--my friend's salmon came out mostly raw, even when reheated

This place was pretty frickin' sweet. I haven't enjoyed a dining experience quite like this one in a long time. I savored our meal and had a great time. Our server Rich went above and beyond to make sure things went right.

Patio dining has great atmosphere with the fountains and lights; it's also the only place where you can converse with your table mates as the inside dining room is extremely noisy. Unfortunately our food and service were lacking. Ordered the Sea Bass and grilled shrimp; sea bass very nice, shrimp over cooked and rubbery. Table mate had the shrimp and orecchiette with vodka sauce- pasta over cooked, shrimp rubbery, vodka sauce very nice. Asked three times for tableware, water brought one glass at a time, couldn't find a spoon for my coffee, drink refills had to be requested.  For the prices here I expect better service and food properly prepared. In the past both the food and service were great; last nite, not so much.
The salads here are absolutely ah-mazing!  My fav is the chopped salad with crawfish....delicious!

The food was very delicious. However, the service was very very slowwww. We sat close to 10 minutes without being acknowledged by our waiter. Finally took our drink order and then took close to another 15 minutes to deliver our iced teas and take our entree order. Checked on us once late in the meal. Which is unfortunate because we did need a few times after our entrees were delivered but were never offered additional service. Empty tables all around us. During our meal a family of 5 was seated next to us. I heard the father say "I can't believe we waited 20 minutes to be seated here when it was open the whole time. Maybe if you 4 hostess girls didn't gather around the podium and chat we would have been seated quicker." This gives you an idea that several customers were unhappy by the service provided by the restaurant employees. The food is delicious. The prices are high. The service is poor. Now it's you that has to decide if it's worth experiencing. As for my husband, mother-in-law, and I....probably won't return.

We went there in a short road trip, we had a two hr wait, but a nice waitress told us we could wait at the bar, we found a very large lounge area, we cancelled the wait and had dinner at the bar area, it was awesome,  if you are ever in Phoenix with a loved one, or just a weekend trip, this is a treat!! Very nice!!

What a night! So I decided to treat myself to some lovely mudbugs aka crawfish during the annual crawfish boil that happens every March to April here at Pappadeaux's. I got in just in time to get a seat at the bar and get situated. The fantabulous Susan, Sarah and Colin took GREAT care of me all night. From Susan nudging me to get the bigger glass of beer (good call and it was an easy nudge) to all three of them checking in on me as I was devouring the 2.5 lbs of crawfish I had ordered. #teamgreedy in full effect!

So between the fabulous bar staff and me meeting some new bar patrons, it was a great night. I chatted it up with about everyone and we even had some skinamax stuff going on at the end of the bar. Funny indeed. Oh and to top off my night, my entire dinner tab was paid for by the nice gentleman I had chatted it up with most of the evening. How very sweet and overly generous was that? ( No,no love connection or anything just a kind gesture with NO expectations!) Wow, talking about being blessed. 

I only have about two more weeks before the crawfish boil ends. So needless to say I will be back again the next two Thursdays to get my fix.

If you want real seafood Cajun style this is your place. Their food is to die for!  I had the most succulent fish. The salad was crisp and tasty. All good seasoned well. Glasses were quickly refilled even during the presentation. I have been here several times and will certainly go again.

I really enjoy this restaurant.  I have been here three times and love coming here. It's a bit expensive for a dish but you get a lot of food for the price. I have gotten the oysters, mussels, fried samplers platter,and a couple of the fresh fish options. I also usually get a cup of gumbo with my meals.  The place is usually packed on the weekend but they have a bar and some tvs for the wait.  The services here is always really good as well. I have nothing to complain about this place. Definitely will keep coming back to try the rest of the menu.

I've wanted to try this place out for a while but never did because it's a bit of a drive from the East Valley. But, I had the opportunity to dine here tonight with my boyfriend for a nice dinner out. Since it's a Friday night, we did have to wait but decided a nice drink at the bar would be a good idea. The bar is pretty big and the bartenders are very friendly. Full service bar too so if you don't want to wait, that's an option. The couple we sat next to are regulars of the restaurant and raved about the food before we even sat down to eat. The restaurant itself is very vibrant and nice. The decor is a little outdated but still comfortable. You can dress up or be casual.

When we got our table, we were greeted by a friendly waitress. We were immediately served bread and continued to have great service throughout the night. If our waitress didn't get to us, there were many other staff available to get drinks, napkins, bring out food, etc. When I asked to sample the gumbo, they were more than happy to bring out a sample. It tasted great with the bread! I decided to eat light and went with the mussles whereas my boyfriend ate the mahi alexander. He loved it! Big portions but also a big price tag. 

For good seafood, this place is amazing. They also have a nice outdoor patio and on a nice night, it's nice to sit out and eat. They also have a live band on the weekends too. Overall, this place is great and will definitely return!

We were in Glendale for a friend son's football game and it was lunchtime, so my husband asked me to check out Yelp for restaurants near us. 
I really love the iPhone app, I sorted my bookmarks and Pappadeux was the closest.

My husband ordered a chicken pasta dish (not in the mood for seafood), our friend a Cajun combo plate and for me the fried crawfish/etoufee.

Everyone enjoyed their food, our friends really liked the dirty rice. My dish was absolutely delicious, the etoufee sauce was smoky/spicy and very flavorful and I as well loved the dirty rice The fried crawfish was ok, nothing special. The loaf of bread before dinner was warm and crispy, very good. The kids menu didn't had much for my 17 mo/old son,most  everything was fried  (he doesn't  like fried food much...I know, he didn't got that from me;) but he filled up on bread and the crackers they had at the table. The waiter was very nice and prompt, although it took a while for our food to come out.

We have friends from New Orleans who are great cooks and they enjoyed the food here as well.

I'll definitely will come back for the dirty rice and crawfish etoufee.

Damn wish this place was closer to Gilbert. Best southern seafood I have ever had outside of Louisiana. Everything here is amazing . Crab cakes, alligator and Oysters are fresh and any fish you get you can't go wrong. Love this place and will be coming back as long as we are on that side of town,

Great service food okay at best but the desert is phenomenal so between deserts and service was the savor for the fried tilapia but the shrimp and Caribbean lobster tail was great I think the person frying the fish may have been a little off this night

I love seafood and love this place. I had clam chowder, catfish, fries, and my husband had catfish and a bake potato.  The food was great.  I cannot wait until my next visit.  The service was great.  Our waiter was great.  We will be back.
One of my favorite places for canun seafood. Never ordered anything I didn't love.  Great atmosphere.  Stafd is always friendly.  Great place for date night anf anniversary dinners.

Delicious, really fresh seafood! They also care about their customers. I have an allergy to only one kind of seafood item and they always have a manager talk with me to make sure the dish I order will be safe and prepared to my satisfaction.

We travel to Phoenix sometimes and when we do our number one place to have dinner is Pappadeaux Seafood Restaurant. This place is absolutely amazing I wish they were here in San Diego. The lines are sometimes a little long but while you wait in line they have a nice waiting area and they offer you free appetizers while you wait and you could get a drink at the same time. Definitely a great dinner experience and customer care. The food is Cajun style and all freshly made. But do not hesitate to try the Crispy Fried Alligator as an appetizer, it is delicious (Not like you could imagine).  Steak & Lobster is the best anywhere! Great service and great food.
Loved the food,Although is kinda on the pricey side it's totally worth it. Customer service was also satisfying. We definitely loved the experience.

It is no New Orleans but the food was surprisingly decent for a chain restuarant.  The seafood was fresh and cooked well.  I had the halibut with the Diablo sauce.  They are great with mixing and matching sauces and fishes.  We also ordered a dozen raw oysters and oyster pappadeux.  There are hints of southern style cuisine such as dirty rice, crawfish sauce, and any seafood you like fried.  As for actual taste, I didn't get much southerness from the flavors.

The second time, we got the seabass and two of us got the all you can east lobster. The seabass was cooked well and the sauce was tasty. The lobsters came with dirty rice as the side and it was pretty good. The lobsters are a good decent size and good quality lobsters. I finished 5 of them and the other finished 9 of them. I think eating 3 would be good. i cant say it is necessarily a good deal because it is just eating too much lobster unnecessarily. The time in between each round of new lobster fluctuated a lot and the service was just decent.

They don't have one in Michigan so I was excited to stop here in Arizona.

The food way good but had just a bit too much seasoning. The lobster bisque was good, but not the best I've ever had. The spinach artichoke dip was good as well.

I'd like to come back just not sure when.
This is the best Cajun food I've ever eaten. Lisa the waitress was awesome. The shrimp Great atmosphere was good highly recommend it.

Disappointed. Went to Pappadeaux for an early Mardi Gras celebration. No redfish. No king cake or cheesecake. Bathrooms were disgusting. We sat at the bar and the servers seemed to not care that we were there. It took 30 minuets to get 6 oysters and by the time we were done we finally go some bread.  Our side dish came out several minutes after our entree. Someone needs to teach the kitchen and food runners to look at tickets to make sure an order is complete.

This place is pretty decent, but never gets to really great.  The food is good, yet not always totally fresh.  Service is pretty good if they are slow, but sometimes the place is packed and you have to wait a long time for everything.  There aren't a lot of cajun options in this area, so I still come here every now and then.  I'd go somewhere else if that was an option.

This was my boyfriend and I'd first time coming here. We ordered a dozen cold gulf shucked oysters, fried alligator, shrimp creole and grits, and Atlantic salmon Alexander. The oysters were great, the shells were pretty dirty on the outside that my bf's napkin had so many black smudges on it but I mean you don't put the shell in your mouth so I didn't mind as much as he did. The fried alligator was so tasty and the sauce it came with was awesome and zingy! It also came with these shoestring like fried potato thingys. I ordered the shrimp creole and grits and a baked potato on the side. I have never had grits before but MAN, were those so good!!! And so was the shrimp creole, it had okra, green bell beepers, and I think tomato chunks. My bf ordered the Atlantic salmon Alexander with dirty rice and he said it was the best salmon he's ever had. It was topped with grilled shrimp and scallops and the flavors were perfection. Biggest baked potato I've ever had btw.  
For dessert we ordered the double turtle brownie topped with Haagen Daaz ice cream and Caramel sauce. Since it was our first time they comped the dessert which was so nice of them! 
Only reason I gave 4/5 stars was for less than perfect service time management. 
We got seated, 10 min later he came and asked what drinks we wanted and we ordered apps. 15 min later our waters came. Another 15-20 min our drinks and bread came out. Then another 15-20 min he came and took our orders. The food didn't take too long to come out but when we would look for him to order things it felt like he was no where to be found. We were there for 2 and a half hours and even though we weren't in a rush it felt like a long time. 
Benefit of the doubt, they are a big restaurant with an always packed Saturday night. So if you go on a Saturday night, just be prepared to enjoy some quality time with whoever you go with.

I absolutely love this place the food is delicious and the service is amazing. Dustin was our server I took some friends there for the first time and he made the experience an unforgettable one! He was efficant and always made sure we were taken care of properly he made our experience a fun and fast visit.

We have been to Pappadeaux restaurants before, in other cities, and have always enjoyed the experience.  This location was no exception.  Friendly, attentive service.  Great selection of seafood dishes and Cajun style entrees.  Mixed drinks were flavorful.  A bit pricey, but portions are very generous -- we went home with leftovers. Nice desserts that we took home with us.  Great experience.
Always great seafood!! The Mahi and the Redfish are outstanding. Fresh and never fishy tasting. Can be a bit pricey with long wait times around dinner, otherwise would be a 5 star for me.

Went in over the weekend for an anniversary dinner. Prices are pretty high so it's good place for special occasions. It's very busy at all hours so be prepared to wait. The restaurant itself is beautiful. They have a gorgeous patio area with a waterfall and plenty of seating area to wait. I have been here a few times and service is always fantastic! Everyone is very friendly and prompt service.

We got the appetizer trio to include fried alligator, fried frog legs, and mozzarella. Everything was great. The alligator is a must have and the breading is so light and delicious. The mozzarella sticks were huge and tasty too. We also split the mussels in a sausage, lemon, garlic, wine sauce. Plenty of food and delicious. Mussels are huge! Save some bread to dip in the sauce. So good (:

Of course we ended with the creme brûlée which was perfect to share and very good. Overall everything was amazing and looking forward to coming back again soon!

First visit to this location. Not the last. Probably not even the last this month. I have only been to one other Pappadeaux's...it was in an airport...and it was phenomenal (even though I only had 30 minutes to scarf down the food and drink)

I asked the waiter "Sampler platter or seafood platter, pick one" and he steered me to the seafood platter. Good choice! WAAaaaaaaAAAAyyyyy too much food, but nothing will go to waste. I'm set for lunch today AND dinner tonight. My fried food quota has been met.

Baked potato was tasty...but was quickly eclipsed by the tilapia...which was then put to shame by the stuffed crab (is it me or does it taste JUST LIKE my mom's stuffed crab? WOW! MY FAVORITE!!!) Next time I think I'll just look for a stuffed crab meal (after I check out the kitchen to make sure Mommy isn't being held captive for her culinary skills in there). 

I have a hard time ordering crawfish from anywhere that isn't in Louisiana, but I might be persuaded to order it from here because the guy at the table next to ours looked like he was in some sort of throes of passion as he buried his head in the plate and licked his fingers (pinch da tails and suck da heads indeed! Maybe they should make one of the rooms in the restaurant ADULTS ONLY?!) . KINKY!!! 

Mom in law had the mahi and grits and despite her tiny frame, she was having a hard time putting her fork down! The Hubster (wooooord up!) chose the fried crawfish meal and papa in law chose something that I can't remember w/ a cup of gumbo on the side and he barely uttered a word the entire meal. Shhhh....I'm eating. :) 

If we didn't have King Cake waiting at home, we would've been happy to dive into their scrumptious looking dessert tray too, but alas, sometimes we must show a little restraint, mustn't we?

Oh...and the bread and butter at the beginning of the dining event was deliciously fresh and soft too...I'll definitely be back!

Welp... This was a huge disappointment. First, the service was horrible. I asked for a refill for water. They said someone else was coming. After the third time, they refilled it. Once it was time to order, we were told we could not move spots. Not in a joking way, but more of a we will hate you if you do. My food came and it was cold. They brought out new food pretty fast so that was a plus. Also, Personal space was an issue. I must have been in the wrong seat. I was brushed up on and touched way too many times. At one point, I got up and moved to the other side of the table because i had no space of my own left between myself and the server.  I paid way too much for average food and really bad service. I will never come back here again. Totally not worth it.

We tried this place last night. We both ordered the seafood andouille gumbo. It's a very watery gumbo and there was bits of crab shell in my gumbo I had to pick out. We then went on to order side salads and then the picatta halibut. We received our meals after ordering in like 10 min. It was really fast but a little too fast. If it was fresh halibut I think it would take a little bit longer to cook. The halibut did not taste fresh and was really mushy and fishy tasting. We never received the salads. We also got the butternut squash which is streamed plain squash, no seasoning and it didn't taste like any butter either. I was really disappointed because I've heard such great things about this place.

I was so excited to have dinner at this place.  So many of my friends  have mentioned how the food was so amazing. If you know me I'm hard to please but  this place was amazing....

It feels like you have  timed-lapse back to New Orleans before Katrina. This place has a cottage look to it.... with seating all around and water sprinkler everywhere.  

As we walked in..... an adorable blond hair waitress smiled and asked me how many?  I said "two"......DID SHE SAY AN HOUR WAIT!!

I'M STARVING I don't have an hour to give. I asked the waitress can we sit at the bar she said "Of course if you could find a seat".... 

Aghhhhh.... this place is crowded but as I turned around two seats were available. I'm running now right towards the seats! 

Hooray.....

The menu was amazing every fried foods item that you can imagine.... I don't think I have ever seen so many ways to fry shrimp. LoL 

I ordered the fried lump crab cakes and my hubby ordered the gritts and shrimp!

WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW!!!

It was the best crab cake I ever had and the shrimp with gritts was amazing. I HATE gritts but this buttery cloud taste amazing. I think I'm crying.  

Let's not talk about the trio dessert..... OMG!!! Banana pudding, pecan pie and creme brul?....

Now we known for seafood this delicious in Phoenix isn't cheap. It's not super expensive but two meals, with no drinks (non alcohol) and one dessert ran us $90 without tip. So if you plan on getting an lobster bring a credit card. They start at $45.00 but to some people its worth it. I did!!!!! 

I'll be here again very soon..... I'm tearing again.... lol

I had a really good customer experience here today. Came here for a business lunch and we got to enjoy it in the private wine room. I told the waitress that I have a shellfish allergy and she told me that "they take allergies very serious" and that  a manager would come out to speak with me. A few minutes later the manager came out and asked me about my shellfish allergy and then educated me on how they will prepare my dish to minimize the contact to shellfish and asked me if that was ok. It was more then ok, I have never had a restaurant go through this to make sure that I was ok with how they are going to prepare my food. Definitely a great customer experience and our waitress was fantastic! The food was great too!

Top of the line! Went there to celebrate several birthdays in my family. The waitress was the cutest thing ever. She was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. She did make a mistake but quickly corrected it. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was pleasant.

Every year we are in Arizona my husband and I have to stop here for dinner.  He absolutely loves the fried alligator.  I love the fresh fish dishes.  The prices are a little bit high but well worth it for the quality of food you receive.  

On this past visit we had a great waiter.  He was very helpful and friendly.  He did the right amount of "check ins" on us without being overbearing.

So I'll confess... I'm from NOLA & my expectations are always high at Pappadeaux, but this location def missed the marked. 

I've been to most of the ATL locations as as Houston and it's always been "good for a chain." But dropping into the Phoenix location for HH left much, if not everything, to be desired.

Drinks:
Chain seafood is one thing, but you can traditionally always expect good drinks at Pappadeaux. The bartenders at this place, however, were dismal at best. Ordered the Baton Sweet Tea and the Swamp Thing, and they were so weak that it felt like I had ordered them virgin. 

Food:
The Mini Fondeaux is typically a great appetizer and a highlight on their HH menu. In Phoenix, it was a barely palatable mix of cheese and mushrooms. If there was any seafood in it, they must have swam away before it was served. We didn't bother getting our usual entrees, the cheesy mushroom soup that out fondeaux resembled was just enough to hold us over until we could make it to a better restaurant.

Service:
Mediocre, but met the bare necessities.

Ambience:
More monotone and quiet than usual. TNF was on, but with the awkward TV placement, I'm sure no noticed or cared. 

If you're starving or have low expectations, give it a try if you must. I'd steer clear otherwise.

I've been meaning to check this place out.  Very Authentic cuisine and nice atmosphere!  I had the seafood gumbo and a salad..which was the perfect size for a lunch.  My friends were all happy with their meals and everyone had leftovers.  Our server Denny was very personable and attentive.  I appreciated how accommodating he was and that the restaurant lets you make substitutions with side dishes.  I would definitely go back.

Came here for a mamas night out date night. We arrived around 630p on a Saturday. The atmosphere here is wonderful. The good: large menu selection, fresh fish, beautiful dining areas, polite waitstaff,  delicious desserts, decent wait time during peak hours. The bad: we were seated at a corner table in the main walkway directly outside the bussing station. Worst table in the house. We asked for another table as soon as we were sat there and the hostess told us we would have to go back on the wait list. We were re-sat in about 5 minutes. The next 2 couples they tried to sit at this table also asked for other seating. Our food took almost 45 minutes to come out. My scallops were overdone and the risotto was chewy and raw. It was very loud inside and hard to hear. Poor parking. All in all, if I could rate 3.5 stars I would.

We have been to several of their locations in Houston and Dallas and this one didn't disappoint. Our server, Audrey was wonderful. Her personality and professionalism made the dining experience perfect. 

The portions are large so go easy on the courses or plan to take lots home. My husband had the tilapia and I had a red fish. Both were amazing. I want the recipe for their spaghetti squash!

I love this restaurant and when I came to Phoenix, had to make sure that I came here...what I get is usually the same...crawfish étouffée
 and I take a piece of key lime pie to go....what can I say, some habits I like!

The waitress was amazing and I am so sorry I didn't get her name...she took the time to just make sure our experience was a good one and the person I came with had never been there before!  Left a good impression on her...and it would have been nice to remember her name...to give her a shout out!  

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place it has never disappointed me!
Wonderful oysters, amazing staff and lovely company.  Will be returning soon!  We sat at bar and table and both were romantic atmosphere.  Enjoyed the alligator and lobster also.

The wait was long (I rolled my eyes and apparently a 30-60 minute wait is "good" for this place) The management doesn't have the foresight to have a hostess selling drinks. Leaving money on the table and the customer unhappy!  
The food was fabulous every item was perfectly prepared. I am happy to spend money on food but $9.95 for 1 crab cake appetizer that is SMALLER than a hockey puck means I will be spending my $184.50 for 3 people at a much better restaurant. The cost for the quality is why this is NOT a 5 star review.  Food 10 stars value 2 stars.  I have had much better food for much lower price and much less waiting.  I'm sad. 
Please comment and follow me for more reviews! I would love to have you!

John, our waiter was fantastic, took care of our needs on a timely basis and was very knowledgable of food and drink options.
We will return for more great food and drink.

Pappadeaux and Mammadeaux too~ This place is kicken for Happy Hour Mon-Fri 3pm to 6pm with crazy good food at great prices. Start off with the Blackened Oyster Fondue (under $10), Cold Boiled Shrimp (under $5), Fried Alligator (under $5) and a tall Blue Moon or Swamp Thing! The place packs up around 5ish and the Happy Hour prices only apply to the bar area. A band plays every Friday starting at 6. Good times!

The main restaurant is a great place for groups, however, can be a little loud for intimate dates. The menu is extensive with a lot of great choices.  Check out the website for menu details.

This seems like a great date place... it has clean, nice atmosphere and a lovely patio outside to enjoy when it's not ridiculously hot.

We arrived for lunch promptly at opening time (11 am) and the place got busy really fast.  We had very attentive service and our server was very friendly.  Fried alligator appetizers were wonderful (the secret IS the sauce) and I enjoyed my shrimp etouffee.  Banana pudding and pecan pie are both great as well.

A bit pricey (lunch for 2 w/ dessert plus tip $86) but fabulous! A great place to splurge.

This is the 4th time I have been there and it was the best experience this time.  The service was outstanding.  The waiter kept checking on us and refills came without asking (even after the bill was paid).  I ordered the naked fish selection: blacken costa rica mahi with dirty rice.  WOW, it was very tasty and delicious!  I ordered my fish well, the normally serve it medium.  I was so full, I did not make it to dessert.  The other ladies were impressed too.  One had the cedar planked salmon and the other had a greek salad.  No complaints from us...

My Pappadeaux experiences have been different every time. But the negative has outweighed the positive. On a first visit a couple years ago I went with a group of friends and our children. We enjoyed various appetizers of Shrimp and Crawfish Fondeaux, Calamari and Fried Alligator - which the kids got a kick out of trying for the first time. All was tasty. I ordered a plank salmon with grilled asparagus. No complaints. We did have a mighty tasty watermelon cocktail that was refreshing and strong. 

A second visit was a little less desirable. I was meeting a friend for happy hour. It was late afternoon...about 4:30 and it was quite packed. I had my 11 year (at the time) old daughter with me but she was being picked up by a friend on the way home from work so I could enjoy an outing with a girlfriend. There was a wait to be seated and we wanted to sit at the bar anyways. There were a few chairs and we took a seat. I ordered a chocolate milk for my daughter and was told by the bartender, 'she's not allowed to sit in this area'. I said, 'Really? She's being picked up in 15 minutes anyways so it won't be long. She's sitting here.' Not to mention there was a table right NEXT to the bar behind us with 2 children at it. I'm sure he just didn't want the seat taken by a child and reduce his drink orders...but he was rude about it and I wasn't pleased. Almost wanted to leave. The rest of the visit was decent. Had a cocktail and appetizer with the girlfriend and then left. Bartender continued to NOT be friendly. 

3rd trip was a date night and my first time trying oysters. We ordered an appetizer to start and then a dozen oysters that came out later. My date gave me tips on how to eat. I enjoyed the first one. 2nd one we both ate...had debris, shell fragments, sand or whatever else might be in the oysters that aren't properly cleaned. We ended up returning the oysters and leaving disappointed and still hungry.

I absolutely love this place! I was here for a company get together and was so impressed with the quality of food and service. I ordered the sea bass and it was absolutely to die for! I have heard great things about this restaurant and I'm glad I finally got to try it. I would recommend this place to everyone! I can not wait to go back and try some more! I'm not too sure what the cost is like because my meal was pre ordered for me.

Our last visit was horrible on every level and I am happy to say tonight  it was amazing on every level! Thank you Chris for the best service we have had in a very long time!
We will definitely ne back.

My wife and I went there for my birthday. We had a babysitter until 9pm. We got there at 6:15 and they told us it was going to be a 45 min wait. We spent $80 buck at the bar waiting before we were finally seated at 8:35?? We're ordered our appetizers and dinner walking to our table because we were now in a hurry? I mean come on guys get your times down a little better then that??

My daughter turned 21 today-July 3rd. She wanted to celebrate at Pappadeaux. We ordered lunch. My husband and I split The sampler platter and my daughter ordered a crab and shrimp appetizer with a side salad with ranch dressing. We ordered water and our waiter Andrew brought us sliced lemon on the side.
We informed Andrew that my daughter has Celiac Disease and he explained the manager would be coming over to talk with us about the issue. The manager was very nice to us -- she wanted to make sure the food organization der was clear due to my daughter's Celiac Disease.
Our waiter, Andrew was very friendly; the atmosphere in the restaurant was great. We were seated by the window by a really nice hostess. 
The food was fresh, hot and delicious. Pappadeaux is a nice place to dine whether for lunch or dinner. I highly recommend this seafood dining establishment.

Absolutely fell in love with this place!! Food is amazing!!! The service is too! Hubby & I had our Valentine dinner here and we loved it! Can't wait to go again & take my parents! 
The staff is amazing our server was very very kind and attentive he recommended food and he brought us a free desert!

The Pappas restaurant group is always superb, with Pappadeaux being one of the best. Food is high quality and serving size is larger than most restaurants. Service is always attentive. Atmosphere is pure cajun. We tried the oysters on the half shell and shrimp gumbo for appetizers, the pan seared tilapia was outstanding, and for dessert the pumpkin pecan pie with ice cream was delicious. Wine list is extensive with wine by the glass available, and the bar is stocked with premiums too. Pappadeaux is highly recommended. Enjoy!

Met up with a friend in town and decided to go to Papadeaux, was not disappointed. We started off with the crab cakes and they were fantastic. Our fresh squeezed lemon aid was great and the stripped bass main was perfect! Our wait staff was friendly and quick to serve when asked, we will go there again. Say many other meals come out and they all looked fantastic! I don't think you could get a bad meal at Papadeaux!

Lunch visit:  I dine here with work friends once or twice per year.  Huge fan of the seafood salad, frog legs, alligator, shrimp, catfish, and clam chowder.  I like the change of pace and it's large enough that you rarely have to wait being seated around noon.

For groups of 8-10 ask for the Wine Room off the bar for a more intimate dining experience with groups.  It's a nice quiet room where they store their wines, a great place to have conversation when you are with an oversized group.

The courtyard is nice transition zone from the parking lot and helps set mood.  Unfortunately when you get in it can be a bit noisy.

Spend your money elsewhere!

First time at Pappadeaux we had a bad experience with 1 staff member, brought it to the attention of management and were given a $50 gift card to make things right (was a pretty bad experience, not normally complainers)

When returned for a 2nd time, to use the gift card, the hostess sat our party of 3 in between 2-10+ person parties.  Our 4 person table was squished in between the 2 parties that when the server went to take people's orders at the big party she was literally standing over top of me, shouting to the people on the other side of the table.  We asked to move as they clearly had open tables in other areas that were not so cramped - it was such an ordeal to allow us to move 30 ft to a new table.

We get a new table and it takes 15-20 minutes before anyone comes over.  By this time it's about 6:15pm and we know happy hour is only until 6:30pm.  We asked for a round of drinks and are told happy hour is only available in the bar area.  WTF.

We decline ordering drinks at the table and one of use walks to the bar, orders happy hour priced drinks and brings them back to our table.  Genius!  Apparently this is frowned upon though, oh well.  And the happy hour drink prices are laughable, a sweet tea...whatever its called was $8 - what the hell does it cost non-happy hour.  

Their food is horribly over priced for what you get, its on par with Red Lobster and almost twice as expensive.  My friend ordered the stuffed crab and the server lets her know there is no crab in this dish, its 2 empty crab shells stuffed with breading, shrimp and fish bits.  12 shrimp cost about $17, I did not see any evidence that they had been dipped in gold prior to the fryer.  My friends Caesar salad has ONE lone crouton floating in the soggy, limp lettuce.  Our server, Jimmy was empathetic that we were having a rough experience and he gave us a creme brulee on the house.  Not to sound unappreciative, but I'm glad we didn't pay for it, was just meh.

Time to pay.  Our bill comes to $72.  We have the $50 gift card and throw in $40 in cash and decide to let Jimmy keep the difference which is a pretty nice tip, since he had given us dessert.  He picks up the check book and we tell him we are good, no change needed.  We start to get ready to leave and another server/manager perhaps comes over w/ a receipt showing we owe $18 after the gift card was charged.  The $40 has disappeared, did Jimmy think we gave him a $40 tip??  To avoid any further annoyance we just leave and leave the $18 DUE receipt on the table.  

Go to Red Lobster :)

This is my favorite seafood spot when in TX. Glad they have a location in PHX!  We had lunch here and we were extremely satisfied with the service we had with our server Jaclyn. Jaclyn was timely, very polite, attentive, and has a great sense humor.  Jaclyn is overall fantastic!  When you have a server like Jaclyn, everything else will fall into place.  Great food and drinks!  Thank you Jaclyn!

My fiancé and I went to try Papaadeauxs on a Friday during Lent. We were not disappointed. The service was superior. Our waitress always checked on us and made sure we always had full drinks. 

We ordered the oysters papaadeaux and the only thing I'd say is they were a bit salty, but nonetheless delicious. The creme brûlée also did not disappoint!!

Service was the best I've had and definitely will be coming back again for it. Food was exquisite and very tasteful. We tried the frog legs for the first time thanks to our server, Joey. He made our whole experience the best experience we've ever had thus far at Pappadeaux. We will be back to see Joey!

Usually I don't give four stars to a chain, BUT Pappadeaux is usually pretty good and this one being this far west I am a fan. I do live in Las Vegas, but when I goto Phoenix I try to swing by here at least once every trip. 

The boudin is always something that I get here, it is usually pretty good. If I am alone this is enough for me to eat along with a glass of wine. 

If I am dining with others I try to get some alligator along with some other type of sea food appetizer so that I can have a variety. 

All of the sea food is good here, but not as good as their locations on the coast, you just can't beat the freshness of the sea food on the gulf coast!
Seafood is so fresh here! And cooked to perfection.Surprisingly this place is affordable too. Makes red lobster look like a mc donalds in terms of quality.

So good! Fresh seafood in the middle of the desert? Yes, that's possible. However don't fill up on their delicious apps like I did. Service was a bit bleh but the food made up for it. Get here early because it fills up fast. I'm from SoCal so coming all the way to Phoenix for good seafood surprised me!!

Went here with my friend and the wait time was horrible. It took them 2 hours to sit us because they were so busy. However the service was amazing and the food here is to die for. Honestly worth the 2 hours wait but still too long to wait for food. That's how you lose customers. When seated noticed there were many tables open..... The bus boys took their sweet time cleaning tables and didn't seem to care. If they're faster people can get seated a lot sooner.

I've been to Pappadeaux a couple of times since my initial visit and review. Most visits have been pretty good - the worst was when they lost my reservation completely even though I could prove I called and everything. Luckily we got there fairly early so the wait for a table wasn't TOO long. The visit was off to a rocky start and the service was ok. 

We decided to give Pappadeaux another chance and skipped the reservation this time (after what happened last time). We were seated in the alcove area which was nice, minus the fact our waitress kept forgetting about us. Water was warm and nearly hot, food arrived without silverware, bread basket never arrived, we had to ask several times for side plates. Luckily the food was still delicious in spite of the mediocre service. 

We ordered the lobster salad which is a favorite, the fried alligator, the shrimp and grits, coconut shrimp and key lime pie. Although the key lime pie was a standard key lime pie it was delicious! The coconut shrimp stole the show for sure, we ended up liking it better than the alligator (which is why we started coming here).

The epitome of a 4-star restaurant.

Very good food, very large portions, lots of menu options. service was friendly, but not totally unrushed. Try the fried alligator and cajun bloody mary. Also, shrimp is delicious

Food was somewhat overpriced. Wait times are long on Friday nights.

Very nice place to get seafood. Huge restaurant with lots of seating. The food was very good, I had crawfish bisque and the salmon Yvette. The food was served quickly. My waitress was great she was attentive, friendly and talkative. I look forward to visiting again.

I am not a seafood fan, but this place has changed my point of view. The quality of food, atmosphere and service are absolutely great! We started with the crab spinach dip. The server described it as more of a spread and she was right! It was so thick and had chunks of crab meat. It was so savory and decadent.
