We had never had dirty rice so the waitress brought out a "sample" of it. First of all it was basically a side of rice and second it was DELICIOUS! We finished the whole side and also got it with our meal. I got sea bass and my husband had a scallop, shrimp and mahi mahi combo. Everything was excellent! I'm such a fan of this great, fresh seafood! Not to mention, the excellent customer service was so refreshing.

Pappadeaux has been my go to ever since I moved here.  I remember spending a night at their bar watching Kim blow the D-Back's lead in the World Series while eating some fried alligator.  

Since then I have learned to appreciate food more and have become quite fond of Pappadeaux, especially during happy hour.  Pappadeaux's has never let me down in regards to food.  When you sit at the bar the service is sometimes, more often then not, lacking (hence the reason for only four stars).  

You can't go wrong with the Oysters, and their Po' Boys are on point.  If you are there for dinner anything you order is sure to please, but maybe try the seafood platter.  Pretty sure we have sampled most of the menu, which does change.  If you have never had Alligator, try it!!  I can go on and on, but again I don't remember a menu item I did not like or would not recommend.  Me not being a dessert fan it is hard, but I would recommend the key lime pie.

Pappadeaux's you are a treat, thank you for the fresh product and refreshing drink.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: if you're looking for the best oysters in town, look no further than Pappadeaux.  I typically avoid chain restaurants like they've got the plague but... Pappadeaux is one that is certain to be a crowdpleaser.

The menu is filled with lots of Cajun fanfare. Whether you're in the mood for Crab Louie, gumbo, bisque, shrimp or crawfish étouffée, fried seafood, scallops, alligator or lobster, Pappadeaux has you covered. 

Today we enjoyed a dozen Gulf oysters as a starter. Next, my wife dined on the bacon wrapped shrimp with cheese and jalapeño and I have the crawfish étouffée and shrimp. 

Our server Kirk was awesome!  The one-way only access road entrance location is kinda weird if you don't know how to get to it but it is simple enough.  

I'm already looking forward to returning for a few dozen oysters!
There is absolutely nothing bad on the menu. Try the blackened alligator, really delicious. Giant shrimp and grits is my favorite. Pasta Mardi Gras is another favorite.

Second time eating here and each time has been outstanding! Fantastic service, top notch food. Happy hour offers nice range of foods to choose from and they're all excellent. Alligator was great, shrimp and the mini fondeaux (sp) was all amazing. Will be back as often as time and my wallet allows!

Come on! Who doesn't love this place?! The best seafood from down south Cajun style or not, you cannot beat this menu! I know it's a little pricey, but the food is always super fresh and delicious. A great place to go for a nice broiled lobster! The specialty drinks are yummy.

Ate here on a recent trip to Phoenix and loved it. We had a group of 16 guys, mostly drunk and they even put our meals on separate checks without us asking. Gratuity included of course. I had Penne Pasta with chicken as I am allergic to shell fish and had no worries watching everyone else engulf lobster tail, gumbo and crab claws.

This place is right by my folks house and I have been here many times. Great happy hour spot to. I have had so many things on this menu its rediculous. They have deep fried aligator app that is so good. Inside they have a lobster tank with for sure the biggest lobsters I have ever seen. Today I went for lunch and got the Crispy Halibut sanwich and fries. They gave me shoestring fries, if you get fries make sure you get the regular fries cause shoe string fries look cute but they are just annoying. The sandwich was so good, and it was a big piece of halibut for $12.95. My girlfriend got the wood fired talapia with greenbeans, shrimp, and veggy. It was so good and the lunch price $13.95. She usually gets the crab legs and like i said, so many good things i get something different everytime. Nice big bar with a few boths and the dinning area is huge. This place can get busy at night and especialy on the weekends but its worth the wait if you have to.

This restaurant is our all time favorite seafood place. food is excellent, they never failed us . seafood is fresh like we leave near water. I always order the fish opelousa comes with rice, bread is great. Oysters are very fresh I live in surprise and I don't mind driving here every week

Ok. Nice entrance. Needs to have an ambiance update! Someone call Gordon Ramsey STAT. Established in 1986, and every bit of carpet and mirrored walls to prove it. Food, Lobster bisque was good. Seems more of a place for drinks though. The waitress messed up our order, so we weren't too impressed. A bit pricey too. Not going to go back.

So I kept driving by his place a bunch of times so I figured I would give it a try . I pulled up and noticed this is a large ass reasuraunt good thing I went on a monday night, I got seated quickly and got a menu in hand. Getting ready to order will review shortly....
Started out w lobster bisque which was good there was enough lobster chunks to make it worth while to eat

For main course I got house salmon , portion was large and the shrimp was a nice touch they added to the dish

Overall nice seafood place to take a date to and plenty of things to choose from

I made reservations to surprise my boyfriend because he loves eating here (minus this time).  We were early and the people who were walking in, were seated before us ( I was listening to see if they had reservations, and they did not).  We were standing right in front, by the hostess stand and people just kept coming in and were seated.  Finally my boyfriend went up to one of the young girls and she said "oh, sure, we can seat you now".  UMMMM WTF!!!!  What was the point of making a reservation if it wasn't even used to our advantage?  Complete BS.  The food, eh... it was so so.  We had a waiter who was CLUELESS.  He didn't know the specials, if there were even any.  We didn't get any bread, he said the oven wasn't working properly but mind you, people who were sat AFTER us were getting fresh bread.. The kid knew we were pretty pissed so he gave us a free desert.  Big deal.  I personally have zero desire to ever go back to this location.
The best seafood in the desert !! The service is top tier. I had the bacon wrapped shrimp and my wife had the lobster and both were pure heaven. There is none better.

So disappointing. Decided to give this place another chance with a new to town seafood living couple because it was fresh the last time I went. After calling ahead of time, they said the wait would be 15 minutes. It was 45. We have been here for almost two hours, no food on the table yet. I am starving. There are so many people, the waiters are stretched so thin. My little lunch just became dinner....

Not sure how seafood in the middle of the desert gets this good.  I live in socal near the ocean and this place blows doors on any of the restaurants in my local area.  Every time I travel to Phoenix, I will eat here.
The food is pretty good and they have a huge selection of items on the menu. I think it's a bit overpriced but the service is great.

came out on Tuesday night after hearing all those positive reviews. I had high hopes for this place especially since the entrees were mostly $18-45 each. I ordered a crayfish platter, a sausage and seafood gumbo, and then a shrimp brochette. My friend ordered a pan seared tilapia. My friend's tilapia had jumbo shrimp and crab meat on top. The tilapia tasted moist but under-seasoned along with the shrimp. The shrimp was crisp but that was the only good thing about it. As for my gumbo, the muddy taste of the oyster ruined it for me. The crayfish platter was NASTY!! The fried crayfish half was ok but nothing special. The crayfish creole part tasted DISGUSTING along with the dirty rice. I tried one bite and then told the waitress to take it away for me. My waitress recommended another entree for me which was the shrimp brochette. It was another huge disappointment. The bacon and cheese wrapped around the jumbo shrimp was so overpowering and fattening that I couldn't take another bite. The manager came over to apologize and took the two items I ordered off our tab but I don't think I will come back again....charging such high prices for bad quality food #smh

Came here with my daughter for my 45th birthday and I couldn't have been happier with my meal. We started with crab claws which had an amazing sauce. Personally, I don't think the rice on the plate with this app was necessary; a few extra claws would've been way better. My daughter ordered pasta with shrimp and scallops which she loved it. I had the salmon with shrimp and scallops over sautéed spinach. Both of our meals also had crab meat on top. My daughter had leftovers, I'm happy to say I did not! After dinner our server brought us the dessert tray which was on the house for birthdays. We had the banana pudding that came in a mason jar that we got to take home. Raised in Florida makes me picky about my seafood and although this place was a bit of a drive, I will go back for more than just a birthday dinner. Kudos for making great seafood in the middle of the desert!

So I love seafood.    And at times I find pappadeaux over priced for what they are serving.   They have a good atmosphere and good drinks.   Fish is brought in daily - of whatever they are running low on.   So it is freshish sea food.

First off... the smoking section is to open and close to the people waiting to be called for their tables... I don't mind this so much as i hate watching a stand-in hostess stuff her face with crackers while we wait 20 minutes (which turned in to longer, of course while people that got there after us went in before we did...) We get to our table and get the most lethargic and unresponsive waitress we could possibly get. Great we get our order in with no feedback or questions on how we want anything cooked or substitutes on sides or how we want our potatoes... absolutely unacceptable. Get our drinks and my SO's drink cup has a layer of grease film on the top of his Extremely watered down coke... yummy. Menus left on the table, extra silver on the table. Our waitress didn't even clear anything off and just let it all pile up. We ordered calamari and get this microwaved, freeze burn crap that tasted like rubber on some pieces and gushy  on others... gross. Look at the extra plate left on the other side of our already cluttered table and it had food flecks on it.... Absolutely disgusting. Will NEVER go back there again. bad bad bad.

Great food. 
Fantastic service. 
Lovely atmosphere. 

Dinner was absolutely Delicious. 
I wasn't sure if I liked some of the sauces that came on the entree & the waitress had me taste everything before I made my final choice. It was a busy night & she apologized for our food not being up faster, without me even complaining about it, & gave us 20% of our bill! 

The atmosphere was casual & relaxed. The staff is so friendly & welcoming, you just can't help but feel comfortable & happy to be there! 

They have a return customer in me :)

I had the coconut shrimp several years ago and wanted to take my family. The shrimp did not disappoint, including the lovely Asian slaw mix that is used as a garnish. When our meal arrived, however, it was rather disappointing. The fried shrimp was good, but not special.  The catfish had a nice breading, however there was little flavor. The big surprise though was the French fries. The majority of them were cold. There were a few warm fries mixed in, leading us to believe that the kitchen was aware of the situation. I don't really think we will be back again. It was an ok meal for a good meal price.

My server Esther was super nice and helpful. We talked a little too much, felt like I was hogging her from others. I'm sure she didn't mind as she carried half the conversation.

I ordered the appetizer of macaroni and cheese with seafood. And the Pasta Mardi Gras. Both delicious and large servings! Most I took home as we were talking so much my full signal went off. 

It's on the expensive side, but the food, service and decor makes it worth it.
The food was amazing. Date night was a blast. Food was hot and we did not have to wait long. Drinks were not watered down. Atmosphere was very delightful.

Simply terrific!!! Our waitress Audrey was the best!!! The food was delicious so happy we went out. I had the Pappadeaux platter way more than enough for two. The atmosphere was amazingly relaxing and welcoming. Best customer service I've had in a long time.

Amazing food. Came here on a Saturday night with no reservations and got in a table in 20 min with a packed restaurant. The server was very knowledgeable of the menu and had a answer for every question  I asked. Great service never waited long for drinks and food came out quicker then expected for a full house. The portions were huge and everything I ate had lots of flavor. Seafood was the freshest I've had and lots of it. Ill definitely be back soon

I do not like seafood, I'll make that very clear. This is a place in which both my family and my fiance's family likes. I keep an open mind no matter what so though I ordered the chicken linguini pasta I tried the calamari, coconut shrimp and the naked halibut. All of which were quite amazing, which says a lot for somebody who isn't fond of seafood. 
Our server (Nick) was amazing, on top of drinks and kept the entire group of 10 happy. It was a wonderful experience. For a family event or special event I would definitely return. The prices are a bit scary for my taste though. As a college student, you can't really blame me though.

I'll start off by saying I don't like expensive, crowded restaurants where we have a long wait for a table so right off the top I was a bit annoyed. And the only place they could seat us was out side in Phoenix in nearly 100 degree heat ... again not something I wanted or enjoy.

But all was corrected once our meals arrived. There were nine of us and everyone got a very different entree...not one would I have been unhappy being served. 

The Mixed Seafood Grill looked amazing, the lobster tails delicious,  salads were huge and piled high with salmon and lobster. Several melt in your mouth fried platters and creole favorites left nothing lacking. 

Overpriced maybe, but some of the best seafood I've had for a long time. And this was land locked Phoenix which seems funny since we live steps from the ocean in southern California.
The food is good. It's not like the restaurants in Texas. But Crawfish, Andouille sausage, Red Beans and Rice are my favorite.
Love this place!! The Happy Hour food is awesome!! Especially the seafood fondue!! The atmosphere is charming!! Love the patio!!
I love their lobster bisque and Pecan/Praline cheesecake. The stuffed crabs and fried crawfish are also very delicious. Its a little pricey but its worth it more often than not.
Live this place!!! My favorite thing to have here is blackened Puerto rican mahi, it's so tasty...I'm only allowed to eat fish once a week but if I could I would eat here everyday.

Terrible service! 

Cold Mahi Mahi Alexander. Cold Andouille Sausage Gumbo. Cold hard bread. Server Renee B had zero personality, wasn't helpful, didn't bring silver wear until well after the meals were delivered. Never came back to check in us. If she did she would have learned that our food was cold and we didn't have silverware. I understand the place is super busy, but none of the other servers seemed to have a problem checking on their tables. I'm sorry, but there is just no excuse for bad customer service.

And what kind of manager doesn't acknowledge when a mistake by his staff or kitchen has been made? Not even an apology? Shame on you Philip! I came from Cali to patronize your establishment and this is how you treat your customers? Not sure I'd return.

One of the BEST CAJUN SEAFOOD restaurant that I've eaten at! Vontae our server was spot on with his recommendations from the Blackened Alligator, Cajun Crabcakes and Pasta Mardi Gras with extra sauce on the side. I HIGHLY recommend checking this place out, the menu is stacked with seafood entrees with fish flown in daily & everything is made from scratch. Be prepared for an even more pleasant dining experience if you are fortunate to have Vontae as your server. Can't say enough great things about this place. Kudos to Vontae as this was my first time eating here & in Phoenix.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. 

Make reservations or call and get your name on the list at least one hour early....the wait is often 1-2 hours.

Yes it is a chain.  WHO CARES.

The quality is always top notch.  The service is great.  The fish is ultra super fresh 10,000 (if you end anything with 10,000 it means it is the best.)

Most fish are flown in only in season.  Right now you can get a lb of crawfish or a dozen oysters on the half shell for $3.95 (Wednesday nights it he best because fresh shell fish come in that morning.)

PS- Awesome and economic happy hour.
Best seafood restaurant I've ever been to. Seafood flown in fresh everyday and all the sauces are made from scratch everyday.

We visited Pappadeaux last April.  The old man and I were visiting  from out of town. 
Well we chose to visit during some kind of bike week. Reservations were out of the question so we were put on the wait list. We waited about 2 hours before we were seated. But hey it is what it is! Once we were seated things started running like clockwork. Like I said the place was bursting outside of the seams. However our server treated us like we were the only people in the house.
Its been over a year since our visit. The food was good,  I totally forgot what we ordered with the exception of  a Greek Salad that I split with my brother. It was massive.
So 5 stars here...We are visiting Phoenix in July. I will be calling ahead for reservations and plan on going to lunch as well as dinner.

Tried this place for the first time and was not impressed. Started off with the appetizer oysters pappadeaux and alligator which were very good. The wife and I had the sampler platter the tilapia was dry and not very good, you couldn't tell the difference between the shrimp, crawfish or chicken tenderloins everything was fried. Had Four Peaks beer on top which was delicious and the service was great and the atmosphere was pleasant. The food was not worth the money. $70

We went here early on New Year's Eve. There were 8 of us  in our party . They were very, very busy. Even with being that busy, our server, Joshua, was very friendly, helpful and efficient. Our water and drink glasses were kept full.  
We had a full variety of appetizers and entrees. Everyone agreed the food was excellent except for  the salmon  which was  overcooked and a bit dry . The
 price on the food was probably average for the kind of food, the service and the restaurant ambience.  It was cool enough that most people were eating inside, but they do have a nice outside area and they have a nice area where people wait for the reservations. They did take reservations until 4:30 and after that it was first come first serve.

Always very impressed when I go. Everyone is very personable, and never get a bad waiter. Everyone seems happy to be at work. My company host some team builders there and have always had great service. For my birthday I receive two gift cards to there and can not wait to cash in. Just an all around great atmosphere.

Since my last review of Pappa, we've been back about eight times. In fact, six of those times were to celebrate my or my hubby's birthdays, which are two weeks apart. Last visit was last Saturday, the 8th; previous was Dec 26th. This review update could fit either visit. 

Again- quoted 45-50 min wait, but vultured around the bar until a couple of seats opened up and dumped our table wait. It was CRAZY busy this time, with all of the folks in town for BCS, etc. 

Oysters - wow. They were HUGE, delicious and showed up quickly. Our shucker even came by, after we were finished, to ask if we were happy with our order. Boy howdy, yes we were. 

Hubby got filet mignon w/Alaskan King crab compliment; I got my usual crab cake on lemon-caper sauced crawfish bed (sweet potato garnish changed up to fried onion strings with a tomato-y relish on top, yum!). We were both 100% happy with the food. When I mentioned to our bartender (he gets his own paragraph) that it was hubby's birthday, he offered the normal comped dessert (key lime pie, MMMM), but threw in a bonus gift: the rum bottle token. It was appropriate; my hubby had sampled five different rum drinks during our meal. (Pirate Punch was my favorite!) 

Ben was our bartender; he was just incredible!! Before we even got seats at the bar, Ben was asking what drink he could make for us. In fact, despite the extremely busy and loud atmosphere, his excellent and attentive service made it feel like he was our personal server - and I noticed that he was giving everyone around his end of the bar the same service. He is just that great! Or maybe he was just that happy that the Colts lost... :). Another 'tender, Kim, also kept a great eye on us and other nearby patrons, whenever Ben had stepped away. Our thanks to them both, for an absolutely fabulous experience which guarantees the future of our 3-year-old birthday tradition!
Very delicious never had food like this before I'm from san diego so this was new for the family i hope they consider putting a location out here i know the people would love it

We arrived with our large family on a Tuesday nite. The initial hostess was kind in taking our name and setting up a table; however the gal she had setting up the table gave an ugly look when told that there would be two adults and 8 children. 

We were sat close to the hostess stand and upon leaving the second gal was much nicer. It just is frustrating to assume that all kids will be have badly!

The food was ok. It's been a few years since we've been and it didn't seem to live up to the expectations we had. The flavors were nice but the selection of only fish with no shellfish seemed small. The only non seafood appetizer option was mozzarella sticks. That was a bummer. 

I asked the server for her recommendation and she suggested the grilled chicken. This doesn't really build your faith in the seafood restaurant if the servers favorite is chicken. 

Bottom line, it's ok but not worth the price!

I don't care for the dirty rice or the gumbo. Lobster salad isn't worth your money. But nearly every fish entree I've had was delicious. The raw oysters are also so fresh. The mac n cheese appetizer is especially good. Pasta Mardi Gras is a MUST whenever I come. If I don't have it for dinner I'll order it as a take out to have lunch the next day. It's that good. The service here is also usually excellent and I haven't had bad dessert. Overall, it's one of my favorite restaurants for special occasions. But if you go with a group of 4+ people, just know that you will have to shout across the table to be heard! The restaurant is very loud! I actually came home with a sore voice..

09/07/12

The place is huge and beautiful inside and outside. The entrance is somewhat hidden.

The service is very friendly and helpful from the moment that you enter, and there are employees everywhere!

I ordered the handcrafted strawberry lemonade. It was delicious.

I inquired about the spiciness of the crawfish étouffée, and ordered it with a request to kick up the Cajun a bit. I've been craving for some good étouffée since a recent visit to a place in Bakersfield.

The crawfish étouffée was excellent, the portions are huge. My order was accidentally split in half, and each half was huge! 

Yummy...

A freshly baked loaf of bread was delivered to my table.

Robert was a great server and did a great job! Thanks robert!

My wife and I were so glad we found this restaurant. I'm originally from Louisiana and was looking forward to some Cajun fare. I wasn't disappointed. I started with a Captain's Hurricane cocktail and it was very tasty. Then I had the andouille sausage and shrimp gumbo and it was fantastic - full of flavor aroma and perfectly cooked ingredients. My main meal was a platter of half fried crawfish tails and half crawfish ettouffe (sp), with a border of dirty rice in between. It was all so good and flavorful! Almost as good as I've ever had in Louisiana. My wife had the salmon topped with shrimp and crab. Normally she complains that the salmon is not just right or overcooked, but this time she said it was prepared perfectly. Finally we had the vanilla crew brûlée and it too was as good as we've ever eaten.  We were glad that we enjoyed our meal outside on the patio since it seemed a lot less loud than the indoor dining areas. Our waiter, Brent was outstanding in his craft, and was pleasant to talk with. Our only complaint is that each course seemed at least 25% more expensive than it should have been. Next time in Phoenix we will stop again for hopefully another very satisfying dining experience.

I CRAVE their etouffee, their lobster bisque, and this amazing seafood dip with tons of cheese and cream and delicious garlic baguette. OH man, I'm making myself hungry right now!  It's sooo nice to have a great N'awwluns restaurant in north Phoenix. Go early to get a seat for happy hour or plan on standing around!!! They will steam your oysters if your boyfriend wants them that way and they will give you samples of different drinks if you can't make up your mind about what you want.  They have great happy hour specials!  The music is great, too.  I go there for my birthday every year, it's a great tradition that I love and transports you out of the desert (which a former friend who shall remain nameless once described as a "godforsaken wasteland" what a jerk) to the decadent, delightful, deep south. I've been going there for 5 plus years now and the servers are very professional and attentive. It's a fun, different, and top notch dining experience. Wear something elastic or that allows you to loosen the belt, ha ha.
Loved the atmosphere and the food was good.  The wine was great, so we'll be going back again!

If you like seafood, then this seems to be the place. Personally I don't eat any seafood but came with friends. To my surprise, I really liked the scallops. They were the best cooked scallop I have ever had, which says a lot for someone that really dislikes the taste of ocean creatures! I love the creole inspired dishes and the warm bread that comes as an appetizer. Service was also great!

Love this place. We went tonight, the Sunday  before Labor Day, and it was quite busy. We were quoted 45 minutes, but we were called after 15 minutes. We decided to stay at the intimate, quiet bar. Our app, the trio, took awhile, but was so worth it! We replaced the calamari, which they were out of, with more alligator. The app was great! I loved the fondeaux, but my hubby thought the alligator, which was usually moist, was king of dry. We ordered the horseradish plank tilapia and the porchartrain. The tilapia was a bit dry, without sauce. I loved my fish, but I feel like there wasn't enough sauce. The service at the bar was awesome. We will definitely return, but maybe try new entrees. The potions are huge, so we will have a great lunch.
Food here is really good ..had the fried platter which consisted of crawfish, shrimp, fish. Couldn't finish ...!!!!

Went to this place twice in one week! First time in on a Sunday, and second time on a Thursday.  Making a road trip and passing through Phoenix, we saw this place.  Cajun & Seafood will alway catch my attention.  Ordered a dozenoysters both times-- Amazing! Menu was great, all the tasty cajun seafood creations that any spicy cajun lover will be in love with.
If I lived closer, I would be a regular here.  
Totally recommend this spot.
Just had dinner there last night!  Yum!!!!! So fresh and delicious, and the staff, the staff, truly amazing!!!

I was really excited to come here because my friend had posted so many yummy looking pictures .
It had a nice ambiance but I was pretty underwhelmed by the food for as expensive as it was .
The service was great, the drinks were good but I could have made better seafood @ home .
The catfish wasn't crispy or as flavorful as delicious catfish should be .
The crab cake was good but the stuffed shrimp and crab just tasted like a hush puppy .. which I'm not a fan of, so maybe that's just me .

I really love coming here.. even if we only come here for sometime of celebration but every time it's soooooo worth it!
My husband and I have been here 4 times now and every time it's been nothing but the best dinner ever. 
A must you must get or try whatever floats your boat is the alligator tail. Don't be so quick to judge this taste appetizer we usually get half blacked half deep fried. Our 8 year old says it's his favorite thing to get when we come. And we all know kids are picky but he loves it.
Our last time in we got that and we got the trio which came with calamari, this mini shrimp/crawfish cheese dip and the alligator tail. The dip was amazing only down side is that it only came with 2 little slices of bread we were a large party of 8. 
I always go in and get the giant shrimp with giants it's a no fail amazing dish. My husband is always daring and willing to try something different but his all time favorite to get is Atlantic salmon Yvette... it's his favorite other then the gumbo lol.
And you can't leave without getting a dessert
Come eat make a reservation before you come in
It's amazing
Great, unique, seafood dishes! Not to much for the dieter! Good food, and fun atmosphere !

Waitress Crystal was Excellent.. A big thank you to her for being patient with us. Our first time here and the menu is overwhelming but awesome choices. 

Our drinks Mojito and my Tom Collins both were Superb... We had to do two rounds! 

Appetizers simply delicious coconut shrimp and alligator!! Fresh and crispy mmmm good! 

Halibut was out of this world fresh with delicious butter seasoning! 

The sampler trio with blue crab :) beyond amazing!
Loved the fried fish, stuffed ball of crab cake was a slam dunk in my belly. 

We ordered the gumbo.. Woohoo SPICY!

Red beans and Rice boy there was a Cajun party going on.. spicy! 

Cheese grits omgggg sooo heavenly! 

No room for deserts tonight but we Will be back next trip here to beautiful Phoenix! 

Thank you Again Crystal.. She really made our experience a delightful experience!!

Came here for dinner we were a party of four everyone was very pleased with what they ordered and service was excellent. We also ordered dessert we ordered an assortment of desserts the one that absolutely hands down was my favorite was the pumpkin cheesecake ohhh soooo delicious if you like pumpkin and cheesecake which I happen to love both unfortunately it is a seasonal dessert. The reason I give it four stars is just that it is very pricey but it is sort of a fine dining place. I would definitely eat here again from time to time.

One of our favorite family places to eat at.  Large proportions from a large menu from a cook to order kitchen.  Most of the time we just share appetizers instead of ordering a meal.  It's fresh seafood flown in daily so be prepared to pay for it.  They get very busy but worth the wait & we've always had good to great service.  My only complaint is they are a 45 min. drive away wish they would open another restaurant in the SE valley.

I think its overpriced-sure its seafood which is expensive but still. The food was mostly just average tasting for the cost. I do recommend their fondue shrimp/crawfish dip. However their shrimp creole, bread, salad, and fried crab with fries tasted just ok. I was also let down that they didn't just serve plain crab legs-for a big seafood place something is wrong with this picture. Service was excellent and I did like the atmosphere tho.

Seafood Grandeur. Reminded me fondly of the great seafood days I had in New England and Boston in the past. The fish and chips (two-headed fried shrimp, fried tilapia, french fries) is so very New England. The Blackened Mahi Alexander is so creative they put shredded crawfish on top. You may choose something other as an entree, but please do yourself a favor and order the Lobster Bisque, which isn't only brisk bisque but also generous with lobster bites. You'll be full, so don't even dream of somersaults afterwards not unless you're purging.

Excellent food & service, first time, plan on returning to try some other menu items, fried alligator was delicious, the Filet Mignon & Grilled Caribbean Lobster was excellent.
Great selection of appetizers for happy hour.

Thanks for making my birthday dinner horrible! First, I would like to say that our waitress was courteous and very nice, but the food tonight was inedible! My hubby took me here for my birthday dinner, it was my favorite place and we have been coming here for 8 years. I ordered the lobster bisque and he ordered the clam chowder. Both soups were very very salty, but I was ok with that and ate half my soup. For the main course, he ordered the blackened catfish and I got the sea bass. My hubby took one bite of the fish and knew it was bad. I took a bite and yes it was very bad, not just bad in taste, but it tasted rank/sour. My sea bass was good, but what made me mad was that we told the waitress and she said she would have the manager come over and talk to us...... We waited and waited.... I ate my dinner alone while my hubby had nothing....... Finally the waitress came over and after two glasses of liquid courage, I gave her a piece of my mind. Evidently, that brought the manager over. My hubby didn't want to risk another choice from the menu and I was finished eating. They comped our meal, but that didn't make my birthday any better.... And Pappadeaux, no need to respond to my review because no apology is going to be good enough to have me dine in your establishment again.
good food quantities and seafood if you like creole style.
The hostess was very rude. They don't like large party's and are un willing to accommodate large parties. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant for family gatherings
$20 for a double Maker's Mark?  Me thinks not T.G.I. McPappadeaux.  I was not impressed by anything that was there and will not only steer clear but may avoid the I-17 all together.

My wife and I have been there twice within the past 2 years, the second time to see if they could redeem themselves after our horrible first visit.

Service ~ fair: our host never established eye contact and it felt as though we were being seated at a buffet. Our server - although very nice, was inept. Appetizers took 30 min to arrive, then she asked if it would be okay the serve our main courses at the same time. We said no and continued. We finished our appetizers and about 20 min. later the server made to back to our table. Our main course meals were horrible both overcooked overcooked, reheated or whatever, not edible. We spoke with the manager, returned the food, paid and left. The bill would have been $100.+ for very substandard food but the manager did credit us for the bad food. Our server never offered to refill our drinks (beer and mixed drink) pure profit for the biz. We left once again disappointed with service and food.
The thing is my wife wants to give it a (perhaps final) try again today (about 3 months from the last visit. I will report back

So our night begins with arriving at Pappadeaux at 6pm with my family for my mother birthday. Wait time is an hour to an hour and half (which is to be expected for a family of 17 on a Friday night). We are finally seated at 745pm and dinner orders are taken within 10-15mins. Time ticks away and no food, more time and still no food. Asked our server, along with another server and what seems to be a manager and all three gave us the same seemingly rude perhaps rehearsed responses which basically blamed us for having a large party. As a paying customer we should NEVER be treated as an inconvenience or daunting task. Again it's to be expected to have a wait for our food BUT NEVER place blame and attitude on your customers! I'm so disappointed and saddened to see my mothers birthday dinner ruined, especially after seeing and hearing her excitement all week. Her favorite cake was also brought to the restaurant but by that point mom was so upset she just took the cake home! After so many years of enjoying Pappadeaux, I will never again let a restaurant spoiled a family members birthday!

Amazing Seafood!
I hope they bring this place to Vegas!
This was my 2nd Time business the restaurant I had previously visited the one in Atlanta. The restaraunt in Atlanta had an area that displayed the seafood nicely which this location did not. But they did have a live band on this Saturday night on the patio that was actually pretty good. 
I ordered the lobster bisque and stuffed crab the Lobster bisque was super creamy hot and decadent !
The stuffed crab was full of delish delicate seafood and lightly fried. The seafood was fresh in both dishes. 
I also ordered a cocktail that had fresh muddled raspberries and it was very refreshing.
The turtle brownie sundae was amazing and also decadent. A great dessert for sharing. 
Hope to see more locations pop up on west coast!

The food here is so yummy. It's never a disappointment. Our server was very friendly and super quick. Only negative is they don't take reservations so if you're going on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to wait. On a good note the outdoor waiting area is large and has beautiful waterfalls and firepits.

It's hard to find good Cajun restaurants in Phoenix.  I enjoy this place immensely, but I wish they had more steamed/grilled than fried foods.

I did have the shrimp and grits, which was out of this world delicious!

First things first, we had a waiter named Samuel that was the best waiter that we have ever had. We never had to ask for anything he simply provided everything. Go Samuel! I had the Tilapia Ladeaux, my son had the sampler platter. Excellent food and service.

I went there as part of a work team lunch. Since we were a big group and didn't have much time, my manager asked me to call in our orders. The person on the phone told me we couldn't do this at first but then luckily the manager did allow it. 
Our table was ready when we arrived and food was on the table right at 12 o'clock when they said it would be. That was very nice. 
The place itself is just beautiful. I really liked the style and feel of the restaurant. The food looked beautiful too. 
I had the medium seafood lunch salad. It was ok. I wasn't impressed. I couldn't taste the dressing at all so I asked for more. They also brought out some bread and butter. Everyone else's food looked pretty good. Service wasn't bad either considering we were 8 people. 
I do feel like my experience isn't complete yet. I definitely have to go back to try some other things on the menu. I love seafood so I'm happy to have found this place.

I walked in and 3 employees stood and stared and smiled at me... No greeting or anything until I asked "should I leave?"   Finally they woke up one said hello and asked if I was waiting for another person in my party.  Now I don't know of they just don't get single parties... Or maybe it was my tshirt and jeans (clean and groomed)  but by this point I was getting frustrated and I had not even been seated yet.   My server was more professional.   I had seafood gumbo ( which was sour)  I've never had sour gumbo before. Terrible .   The lobster bisque made up for it,    Over $31 for two boils of soup and a sweet tea.  Also restaurant with only 1/2 of the tables filled it was extremely noisy.  Only good thing was server Audrey B. sweet tea and bisque.   I think I'll not be back anytime soon.
I love, love, love Pappadeaux.  I always end up spending way too much.  The drinks are strong, yet delicious and their seafood dishes are to die for.
Excellent happy hour!! Great service. Love the shrimp poorboy and loved the gulf oysters! Boiled Shrimp decent. Prices are high if you miss happy hour but an excellent place for business dinners.

I loved this place. My boyfriend and I went here for our two year anniversary and received excellent service. 

We had to cancel our original reservation and we're able to make another for later in the evening. When we arrived we were seated right away and our server was awesome! She made sure our drinks were never empty, kept the boyfriend's beer filled and took her time discussing the options with us. 

The food was sooooooo gooooood, extra letters needed. Based on the reviews we orders the gator tail. We were so full we couldn't order dessert. 

And then to top it off, I was so happy, full, and distracted, I forgot my purse at the table. Our server chased after us and returned it, what an awesome chick. She was a blonde white chick (can't remember her name, it's been about 5 months), so if you get her you are in good hands!
One our faves, and now our new favorite bartender Cierra took it up a notch. Awesome meal!

We went to Pappadeaux's for the first time tonight and it was seriously amazing. My wife and I started with the Oysters Pappadeaux they were very good. It was our first time trying any kind of baked oyster, we like the raw ones better for sure. We also had the greek salad with lump crab. Oh wow that was good. My wife had the Halibut Picata for dinner and I had the Snapper with Live Maine Lobster. The fish was cooked perfectly and the respective sauces were rich and citrusy balanced to perfection. The sides were great as well. For dessert we had the Strawberry Cheesecake and the Carrot Cake Cheesecake. Both were very good.
The staff was freindly and engaging. Our waitress was very helpful and knew alot about the menu. We always ask our first time at a new place and she was very very good. This place is all class, the food is delicous and the staff is fantastic. I highly reccomend this place when you're in the mood for seafood.

Good was great as usual but I Was very disappointed in the service this time.  Took a very long time to receive out me main course. The server also didn't keep up in clearing our table from appetizers and bread to drink refills.
I absolutely looooove Pappadeaux! I haven't had pappadeaux since 2011.  I would come all the way back to Phoenix just to get a taste. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

This place is a joke. We are a party of 4. The restaurant was half empty. We were told wait time 15 minutes! Almost felt like they didn't want our business. I saw too many employees either standing around doing nothing or running around looking like their heads were cut off. This place very disorganized. 
They were out of too many items to boot! The food very salty and overpriced. The plates, too big for  small table for a party of 4. Come on people, this is a sit-down restaurant. I could make better food at home and be comfortable!To top it off we were overcharged for an item that was not ordered. Always check your itemized receipt!
This place is a disappointment. Very embarrassing for what was supposed to be a special night for taking the in-laws out for dinner.

Shrimp po-boy all the way!  The bisque is good too!  I love this place. 1/6/15

Back again!  Still great!  1/31/16

To be truly honest, I would have to say good old Pappas has had a slight decline in service and food quality since its initial opening. This is especially apparent during its busy times, which is practically every lunch, evening and weekends. The wait time is ridiculous during these meal rushes. 

The last two times that I was there in mid May and just a few weeks ago, my dinner companions and I haven't been able to sit in the normal dining area due to the millions of people already waiting before us. Now don't get me wrong, the patio and bar area are comfortable but sometimes you just want to sit at a normal table. I would definitely suggest trying to avoid the lunch and dinner crowds, by either showing up once they open their doors or maybe and hour or two before they close them, just about any other time outside of that its going to be a mad house in this place. Another thing about seating, on occasion the host or hostess will try to seat you at a back table next to the restrooms. If you're uncomfortable with that (being a 'germ-phobic' person or just don't like the close proximity of the restroom and its visitors) you can ask for another table, they may shoot you a dirty look, but they'll reseat you elsewhere. 

Now to talk about the food. I haven't strayed from my usual dishes all that much, but they're are quite a few for them to be usuals. I would have to say, I'm quite a fan of the hot and fresh bread (on some days it is) and a bowl of their Crawfish bisque. Another favorite of mines is the Salmon Salad, sometimes they under cook the salmon despite how I tell the waiter/waitress for them to have the chef cook it throughly. Other days I'm quite keen on the Po'boys, I jump between a catfish and shrimp combo and an oyster and shrimp combo. Here as well, I tell the waite/waitress that I'd like my oysters fried "hard" (if I wanted them soupy, I would have ordered them right out the half shell) to avoid a soggy Po'boy and I'd have to say 5/10 times they actually did listen and the oysters didn't soggy up the sandwich. 

I have a knack of making the appetizers meals. One of my new usuals has been the fried alligator and I would have to say, it is pretty good, but I don't like how they go skimpy on the shoe string fries. Those things are too good to hold back on! Before the alligator came along, I use to order the fried crawfish appetizer, which is about the only dish there besides some of the desserts that I have nothing to complain about it. 

And oh my if you think the dessert tray looks good, it tastes even better. I have had everything on there that doesn't have chocolate in it or on it. The sweet potato pecan pie, I must say is one of my favorites, the creme brulee, for the few times I have had it, is scrumptious, and I love Nila Waffers, so the banana pudding is pretty yummy if you like bananas and pudding. 

So, if you catch Pappas on a good day and time, I would say you're looking at a 5-star rated dining experience. But if its busy, crowded and the kitchen and staff are overwhelmed you may be looking at a 3.5 or a 4.
A long wait but the gator and frog wernt too bad!

Great place for a New Orleans style feast.  The restaurant is easy to get to; in a great location; beautiful patio; and has a great atmosphere. I went on a Tuesday night at 7:30pm and there was no waiting.  The service was great and the food was excellent.  I ordered the blackened catfish covered with shrimp and crab in a cream/creole sauce.  It could have been a bit more blackened and spicy.  The house salad was good and the gumbo was excellent...just spicy enough for a good kick.  They serve a full loaf of French bread with warm, whipped butter.  There could have been more beer selections.  I may go every night while I'm in town here for 3 days.  MMMMMmmmmm.....GOOD!!

I don't think I will be visiting this restaurant anymore.  This past Thursday my second time visiting this location the 1st was in may of 2013 both times I was very disappointed in the service from the staff.  

In May 2013 my family and I decided we wanted to have our monthly family dinner at the restaurant and my mother called to see if she could schedule a reservations since it would be about 12 of us on a Friday night,  she was told no and that we would have to come in and wait to be seated.  We came and of course it was busy,  we expected a 30-60 minute wait but after 90 minutes and seeing so many people be seated before us we go back to the hostess and she assures us that there is no table to accommodate us yet but she can sit us in an area that we will be close to each other.  With grumbling stomachs we agree.  When we are seated we are light years away from each other and there is no way for us to communicate with one another.  My mother brings it to the attention of the manager and he was able to fix the problem immediately and for her troubles comped one of the 4 meals she had on her ticket.  I had the blackened Mahi Mahi that night and it was absolutely amazing! 

Fast forward to this past Thursday,  I took my mother for her birthday and it was an utter disappointment. I had Mahi Mahi with Alexander sauce and dirty rice.  My mother had the etoufee.  My fish was great but the rice was very undercooked and hard when I brought it to the attention of the manager and asked for a better cooked serving he said he would see what he could do but it may come from the same batch, which only tells me that he was planning on giving more guest that terribly hard rice.  My mother's etoufee was extremely greasy when brought to the servers attention he tried to say that's the way it's supposed to be but my mom is a regular there she knows what is supposed to taste like.  I was brought a fresh batch of rice that was delicious and my mother was able to order a new meal which she had to get to go because the grease from the etoufee upset her stomach and killed her appetite.  The server I wish I had his name was inattentive,  hardly checked up on us and was a bit rude after we complained about the food.  I thanked him twice and both times he looked with no response.  If I'm gonna spend $70 on a dinner for 2 I expect a friendly accommodating staff I get better service at my local burger King.

Whatever the crawfish thing is I get every time I go there is, it's so freekin good.  

I like sitting in the bar better than in the actual restaurant part where the tables are crammed in and there's probably kids running around them.  

A little too commercial feeling for me to give it 4 stars, but I'll still go there for some dang good crawfish.

After writing the review the other day I had a taste for Pappa's. So I went last night and YA-HUMMEE! I tried something new the Hudson platter and this baby did not disappoint! Perfectly grilled scallops, 2 succulent and sweet lobster tails, 4 huge shrimp brochette. If you are not familiar with shrimp brochette it is shrimp stuffed with Monterey jack cheese and a sliver of Jalapeno, wrapped in bacon and char -grilled. DELICIOUSNESS! It is served with the fabulous dirty rice and sauteed green beans all for are you ready for this wait for it 22.95! 

I also indulged in sharing a little pecan sweet potato pie with Hagen daas vanilla ice cream and bourbon sauce. WOOHOO! FYI all deserts purchased until July 26th will have a portion of the proceeds go to a local food bank! 

Dinner last night was sooo freakin good I may be back tonight! Bon Appetite

I fell in love with this place ever since i discovered it when I was in Dallas on business.  I was extremely excited when I found out they were opening a location here.  I like seafood to begin with and when you add some Cajun spices, it's even better.  The servers are always so nice here.  This time our server was Olivia and she was great.  We started out with the wedge salad and for dinner we shared the Pappadeaux platter and a baked potato each.  So much food, if you ever walk away hungry, then you need help ... LOL.  The place is always packed but clean.

Service was really good - very experienced server who knew her stuff.  
Food on the other hand was a bit lacking.  I had an oyster poboy and with 6 or so small oysters spread out over an entire bagette it was really unimpressive.  I tore the bread in half and piled all the oysters on one half and that was a bit more like it.  My husband had the crawfish etouffe (his go to) and he said it was pretty standard.  Not a bad meal but I remember when Pappadeaux used to be really excellent.

3 1/2 stars. It's been a year since last time I dined here and we sat in the main dinning room vs the outside patio. This area is large and overly noisy and it's difficult to even communicate here.

For dinner I ordered the Pasta Mardi Gras Linguine tossed with crawfish, andouille sausage & crimini mushrooms in a marinara cream sauce topped with jumbo grilled shrimp. The dish was tasty and the seafood was fresh except for the crawfish which was out of season. The pasta was not temperature hot - I think the noodles were cold and that made the dish lukewarm. The other entree we tried was Seafood Platter - Fried tilapia fillet, shrimp, blue crab cake, stuffed shrimp & stuffed crab and french fries. This was just eh! There was much filler on the stuffed items and I thought was pricey for what we received. Favorite item was the tilapia. For dessert we split the mint chocolate chip cheesecake which was yummy.

Our waiter was the best - very attentive to details constantly checked in with our needs and handled every request immediately. He was formerly employed at Pappadeaux in Houston but this gent could work at any dinning establishment.

I love this restaurant.  Our server, Taylor M, was AMAZING.  She was super attentive to our needs and provided a wonderful dining experience.  We started with the Oysters Pappadeauxs. AMAZING!  The catfish and redfish were great choices.  We finished off with Key lime pie & crème brulee. We always have to drive a distance to eat here.  I can honestly say I have never been disappointed.

I don't get over to the Phoenix area all that often but when I do this is one place i make a point to visit.  I either get my Pappadeaux fix here or i've got to go to God's Country (Texas).  I always enjoy the food and this time was no different, service is really good.  Vibrant noise level.

Worst experience !!! My server Erin was awesome! My food was delicious! But, yes and there is a but, there was a family with a screaming 4-6 year old girl ( at the top of her lungs, the sound that hits the nerves in your back) she was at the lobster tank and her father was teasing her with the lobsters and taking pictures and no server or manager did a thing about it. So I complained and the manager did nothing and her excuse for doing nothing was lame! Manager, Kathy Belford, her excuse was this is a family restaurant . Like it's a Pieter piper pizza, which I would expect at Peter piper pizza. I spent with tip, $145.47....... Papadeaux thanks for the wonderful entertainment not I'm never coming back!!! Kathy Belford, you must be a millennial!

I've eaten at this restaurant in Phoenix twice now. Last night, a Saturday night, was incredibly busy and as many others have mentioned, it is extremely loud! We were a party of four and could almost not even communicate with each other.

Bring more Pappas restaurants here! Being displaced Houstonians (where Pappa's corporate office is based), we were so happy to see that our new home had a Pappadeaux within driving distance. The food is not as good as it is back home, but much better than anything else Phoenix has to offer. I love it all. The flavored teas/lemonades, sourdough bread, soft butter, seafood, etc.
Always a favorite, the food always is amazing and well prepared. The Tuna was outstanding!

Bad service, old seafood, crappy drinks. I think that sums it up. Ordered a dry martini. A dirty martini was delivered. When I told our waitress she just looked at me like "so what?!" Had to go stand down a bus person to get water. But mostly the shrimp was really old and the fish was old. The dirty rice tasted like chemicals.

I waited for 1 hour for the food I ordered. The lobster and oyster were not that fresh. Gumbo wasn't taste right as well. There was a fly around my table! It is not a good experience. I am disappointed.
Amazing food and atmosphere! Visiting from San Diego and I must say this is one of the best seafood restaurant for the price.

This place is amazing.. any time I have extra cash I spend it right here! the service is amazing and what I love is the fact that I could order a to go order and still get the same amount of food and bread as if I were sitting at the table to dine in. This is something that many restaurants lack! when ordering take out many times they take away a soup or salad... not at this place! The seafood is always fresh and the staff always have a smile!!! I love it here

I have been here 4 times, the first time I went here the service was awesome and so was the food. The second time was great service was great and so was the food. The third time I went here we had a party of about 15 for my mother in laws wedding, we called and made a reservation yet when we got there we still had to wait up front and we stood there for 40 mins! We had made the reservation days earlier. When we went to order they were out of half of the stuff we wanted so I orders the roasted chicken. I was disappointed it was so dry and tasteless. The 4th time was this past Monday, first of all they forgot my food so while everybody with me was eating I was just watching them waiting for my food, I wanted about 15 extra mins, second I was waiting for my server to refill my water almost every time it was gone, and the worst part about all of this.... I got the WORST FOOD POISONING from this place, I had to miss school on Tuesday and I'm missing work today. The only thing I have eatin in the past 32 hours is 3 fruit bars because that's all that my stomach will allow!!! Do not waste you're money at this overrated place, it truly is a waste of money and time, and if you do go here just know that you are taking a chance and you might get food poisoning and honestly I have had it before about twice but this is by far the worst case! DO NOT GO HERE!!!
One of my favorite places! Nice ambience, great service, really good seafood, nice portions, I truly enjoy it!

Unreal how the quality and service isn't what it used to be!  One of our all-time favorite places and we always take our guests here when they're in town. Sad to say, we will be looking for another place now.

3 words: Chilean Sea Bass. I have always loved this place. The atmosphere is Great!  My fiance and I always get the oysters and Alligator. It is a bit pricey, but well worth it. We go every chance we get. Service is ALWAYS on point! Love love love!

One of the best seafood Cajun restaurants out! The food is always fresh and tons of options. Super friendly staff whose always knowledgeable about the menu and give great recommendations. Wish there was one in California' but when I visit Phoenix for my business trip this is a must go!
So salty. Their dirty side rice dish made my stomach hurt. :/ service is ok, and ambience is ok.. I live far so I probably won't go back..
I've been here many times and have always enjoyed it. The seafood is excellent, I especially recommend the oyster plate... wow!
I'm always excited when my boss takes us to Pappadeaux but I'm never really happy with my food. The staff is polite and they handle our large groups real well.

For a while it was average, seemed like fried shrimp and drinks.    I've found some new loves...crab cakes- best around all crab..blackened craw fish bisque.  The red fish was quite large and ooh so tasty....

The dessert tray is always worth sharing a few.

Say hey to Jose my favorites sticker if you need a few oysters.
First time that I try alligator meat and it was actually really good... food is amazing...  deserts really good also..

I've eaten here a lot and while I've been disappointed with the food a couple of times my experiences have been mostly positive. The service is always pretty good too. We will definitely continue coming here!
The setting was pretty dark. Open dining so kind of on the louder side of dining. I give the service a B. Menu selection was pretty good. A lot of fried food, and a little expensive.

Went for lunch on Black Friday, holy cow!!! This place is sooo yummy!! Everything was fresh and you can totally tell they make everything from scratch. Everything was absolutely delish!!! Definitely recommend this place!!! Waiter was great too!! Great service great food!!! 5 stars all day!!!

Every time I go to Pappadeaux  I get the item on the Appetizer menu, Large order of Fried Alligator.  I always ask that I get half Fried and half Blackened Cajun.  Take a piece dip it in that AMAZING sauce that it comes with and be prepared to know what HEAVEN IS LIKE!!!  I just LOVE this dish so much that I get it at least once a month if not more. And anytime I go to a Pappadeaux's Resturant I get this dish.  ITS UNBELIEVABLE!!!!

Okay so the wife and i decided to come by for lunch on the day of the Eclipse.....and once again our dining experience was incredible...scallops seared to perfection...Stone IPA in the coldest frosted goblet ever....The wife ordered the crab fingers as usual with Yvette sauce on the side....magnifico....!!!!
Our server Jaclyn was flawless....God bless this woman what a great personality....
Destiny our usual bartender was the floor manager now and they couldn't have made a better decision...thanks for a great time folks...see u next time...

Food was excellent and staff was very friendly and attentive. We never had empty glasses, food came out hot and fast (but not too fast). It felt pretty cold inside, but I guess that kind of goes with the whole atmosphere of the resturant. Would not hesitate to recommend or return.
Love this place! Food is always delicious sand the staff is so friendly! I always get the Live Maine Lobster and it never disappoints me. I also recommend the blue point oysters

I have never experienced better service and than I did tonight when we went to dinner. The wait was fairly short, we got drinks at the bar while we waited and the bartender was very friendly and fast! We were seated near the kitchen which was kinda cool because I got to see first hand how well the staff here worked together as one cohesive team. Everyone was helping each other and looking out for one another. Our waitress Hannah was amazing, she was so sweet and so kind and very efficient. We had some appetizers then orders the crusted Atlantic salmon. When we got our meal it was cold. We told our waitress and she immediately apologized and offered to bring us another meal ..... We decided to just get dessert instead. She boxed up our cold meal since they were just going to throw it away. Shortly after the manager came over I think her name was Kaylee she apologized for the situation and offered to comp our dessert. When we got our bill she took care of the whole thing..... We were completely shocked! We left our waitress a nice tip and thanked the manager .... We will definitely revisit!

I have been waiting a long time to eat at Pappadeaux so forgive me if I get carried away. In town for some Harley riders fun so we knew this place was going to get crazy crowded, like Vegas Buffett crowded. So as soon as we arrived on Friday we decided to hit this seafood sanctuary early afternoon. YES best decision EVER. We heard the wait time for the whole weekend ended up being over an hour and a half, not for us, not for the trio that has been waiting on this moment since 2012. After we gave them our phone number so they can text us when our table was ready, we walked around to find a seat to wait and as soon as we sat down DING..... The doorbell to foodie heaven rang, literally a 2 minute wait. Okay so now we're headed to our table and I'm scoping the place out left to right up and down all around, this place is HUGE. Fun decorations, big window to see the chefs in action, lobsters in tank, dessert trays, bar popping, patio popping, plates piled with fish, waiters trying to keep a fast pace through the crowd, and lots of happy people. The drinks are fruity and strong, bread n butter on point. Their menu is extensive so it took us awhile to order. I ended up with the seafood platter, hubby had catfish fillets, my ride or die girl had the salmon. People talk about how pricey this place is BUT the portion  and the freshness of the seafood was stellar. We all had enough food left over for another meal. The lump crab cake is just that lump crab delicious. Stuffed crab was perfection. Fish was fried just right and the dirty rice was excellent. I can't wait to return next year same time same place, we will be there because I was checking out the king crab legs and they are now on my radar.

I try to get to Pappadeaux at least 3 times per month.  This time I ordered catfish and grits it did not disappoint. The place was busy (typical) but the service was good and fast. Oh and they have a great happy hour

I took a very lovely lady here on a whim when our original dinner plans fell through. She had never been here before, I had only been once. It was great. Our waiter was spot on, and the food was amazing.

Yes, it's a chain... but there are some good chains. This is one of those places that has such a gargantuan menu with so much goodness that you want to go back just to try everything that you missed on the first run.  The appetizer offerings had so much I wanted to try, particularly the fried alligator; however, this time we tried the mussels, which were delicious.  I'm pretty picky about mussels, I don't like when they are small and have that graininess when you bite into them.  The mussels at Pappadeaux were fantastic -- large in size, very mild, without any graininess whatsoever.   

I ordered the Big Bay Platter for the main course, which comes with Montage Shrimp (jumbo shrimp stuffed with crab), 3 small Caribbean lobster tails, and grilled shrimp.  The price was reasonable for the amount of seafood, about $25.95 and I was really happy with the dish.  The shrimp montage were delicious, stuffed with generous portion of crab meat; the lobster was pretty good, and the grilled shrimp were basted with a spicy sauce that was very tasty.  This was all served on a bed of dirty rice and green beans.  There is so much more I want to come back and try, like the alligator, and some of the other entrees.  

A few tips:

- Get there early or call ahead to get your name on the list, this place gets packed.

-  be prepared that it's very loud in here, especially when they have the "New Orleans trio" band playing.  

- Watch out for the parking lot, it's like a parking lot at the mall on black Friday. You've been warned.

I will definitely return to Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen.

I went to Pappadeaux last night for my Birthday and I have to say it was the worst experience that I have had. Although there was a bright spot and that was our waitress Latica, she was the best part of the evening. We got there and was seated then ordered and it took 55 mins to get our food. Latica kept apologizing for wait and she offered a Salad or Bread. Then when the food came it was one the worst meals that I have had. There was so much water in the plate that the food had no taste. The Shrimp and Scallops were both over cooked. The waitress got the manager to come over and he acted like that he didn't even care. So we told the waitress that we were ready to leave and paid the bill and left. Again the best part of the waitress.

My all time favorite restaurant and I visited this in Dallas and Phoenix. Awesome seafood and portions are large. for appetizers bisque soup is a good choice. Totally recommend papadeaux specialities. I tried almost all the dishes listed under specialities and you cannot go wrong with them. Highly recommend this restaurant to all sea food lovers.

Having grown up in Texas, exposed to lots of cajun food and now living in LA where there is none, a promised visit to Pappadeaux was what sealed the deal for me to visit Phoenix. 

Pappadeaux did not disappoint - food was just as good as I remembered the chain to be in Texas. I love my crawfish etouffee. And going at lunch (even on the weekends) is definitely the best bang for your buck. They are very, very generous with the portions.

Worth coming in here at least just for the $3.95/dozen oysters! Steal of a deal!

Albeit I came for a late Sunday dinner, I shall count the ways why this place is bomb diggity:

- SUPER warm fresh french bread roll upon being sat
- Did I mention a dozen oysters for $3.95?!
- A bigass piece of delicious tilapia that was still good as a leftover lunch
- Cajun shrimp creole- definitely worth trying
- Excellent service: helpful, informative, efficient, and not overbearing at all

Well worth a visit!

Damn this place is definitely a 5 star. The food was so good and the portion was perfect,  I didn't even finish my meal. I ordered the mardi gras pasta which had big shrimps, prawn, sausages and the sauce was amazingly great tasting.  I also ordered the alligator nuggets as an appetizer and I was impressed,  that was the first tyme I tried alligator and maan it was good along with the sauce they give you with it. Our server a young black gurl, very curtious, helpful, knowledgeable, and on point with our drinks never had an empty glass to drink what ever it was. Kudos for the great service and amazing food. I cannot wait to come back n taste all the other food on the menu. It is a lil pricey so bring ur wallet but the portions are good. And the ambiance was cool, nice decos, fairly big establishment,  nice bar, n very very classy. MY NEW SEAFOOD SPOT IN AZ!!

Wow. Catfish poboy and the father in law had fried oysters and shrimp with a baked potato. Portions are big and the good is outstanding!! Server was Jessica who is more reason to give this place 5 stars! The Mrs. ate before we went and just tagged along...also decided to get the bread pudding and loved every bite. Place is huge and the atmosphere is a lot of fun. We'll be back for that poboy and to see Jessica!

Can't go wrong. Great atmosphere, wonderful food and great service. Really fun outdoor area and a large comfortable indoor space. Food is not overly spicy (which unfortunately seems par for most "Cajun" restaurants). 

Very tasty and while not exactly cheap, it's more reasonable than you might expect given the quality and amount of food you get.  Nice bar area too.
can't wait for crawfish seafood ... most of all can't wait till they open one up on the east side ... like gilbert az area ...:)

Great Environment,  Love the live music.
Great Happy hour.  We came there one night for a workers outting.
Classy yet Relaxing.  A bartender that makes a fine drink and food that is pleasing to the pallet.
Do make sure you budget a decent amount.

This is the  very popular Phoenix location of a restaurant chain, with 32 locations, 23 of them in Texas.

The faire is mostly Cajun, so gulf type seafood dishes, blackened spices, and Texas size portions are in the norm. This location gets jammed packed, and you will wait 45 minutes if you are there after 6:00pm. They do have a number call system. The mains are solid choices with nice side dishes. This is not high brow food, but it is a good meal and a place to go with friends to drink, laugh and yak, as it gets pretty loud at peak times for anything else.
Good atmosphere. Not very impressed with the menu. Seems like an upscale Red Lobster.
Excellent service! My daughter loves the coconut shrimp. The shrimp fondue was yummy. Alligator was delish ... Drinks complimented it all

One of my favorite restaurants. The service is amazing. Place is clean, and beautiful. I love lobster, and this is my place. Manager comes to my table every time with a smile to make sure everything is to perfection,  and they never fail to deliver. Good Job guy, keep up the good work.

All I can say is WOW. I love this place from the building and how the lounge area is set up to the food and service. First they have a fire pit outside with lounge chairs and couches so groups can have a nice relaxing time outside and enjoy. I thought that was really awesome. Second the food was sooooo delicious and it comes in large proportions. I couldn't even finish my food and I'm a good eater. The drinks were the best and reasonable pricing also. The most important part was the service because that was A1. I really couldn't say anything bad about this place and that's why they definitely deserve 5 stars. I will definitely be back there every time I go to Arizona.

Met our daughter to celebrate my wife's birthday. Coming from FH was about an hour and the traffic was congested but we made it on time, 6 PM on a Friday. As we walked to our table, I noticed that this place was packed. 
Our server, Audrey, was right on top of things. She greeted us, asked if this was our first time and told us about the specials. She made us feel like we were invited to her house. 
We started off with a small order of alligator which my wife and daughter have never tried. I told them it was like a very tender chicken nugget. They loved it., especially the bed of fried potatoe shavings.
I loved the lettuce wedge and it's just as large as the one at Cheesecake Factory.
My daughter ordered the Crispy Fried Shrimp. My wife had the Live Maine Lobster and I ordered the Cedar Plank Alaskan Salmon.
The shrimp dish had butterflied shrimp with french fries and the main lobster was enjoyed, but I think I would have preferred the Caribbean lobster because the meat would be much firmer. My salmon was cooked just right, it only came with the asparagus which was nice and plump. I brought half of my dinner home.
We finished off the dinner with a Key Lime pie which was delicious. 
Our server had a keen eye. She automatically assumed that it was a birthday dinner, because she saw my wife reading a birthday card and opening her present from my daughter, and comp'd the desert.
Audrey made our evening enjoyable and when we go back, we'll ask for her.

With all the great reviews and seeing as how crowded it was, I was really sad that my experience wasn't the same.  It's been a long time since I've been to the ones in TX but I certainly don't remember the experience being that bad so maybe it was the timing and the location.  On to my review...

We ordered the fried alligator, Mississippi Catfish Opelousas, and what I think was the Crawfish Etouffee.  The only saving grace was the fried alligator which was very well done.  I always used to get it at a cajun place back home so I was excited to try it here.  This is the one thing that Pappadeaux cooked right.  It was perfectly fried without it being too greasy and the alligator was tender.

The Mississippi Catfish Opelousas on the other hand was awful!  Maybe it was an off day but it wasn't nearly as good as it sounded.  The catfish fillet itself was the worse part.  You know how they usually make catfish nuggets with the stomach of the fish? The not-so-good part of the fish.  Well this fillet tasted worse than that.  The whole fillet was such bad quality that we didn't finish it.  I hate wasting food but I didn't even bother taking it home. It was a really big piece too.  It still leaves a bad taste in my mouth clearly. 

The etouffee was meh.  Not as horrible as the catfish dish but I've certainly had better.  And this is not even including the ones I had in TX and New Orleans.  Didn't bother taking that home either.  And I love leftovers since that means I don't have to cook!

Sigh - overall, I was sorely disappointed especially more so b/c of all the great reviews and how crowded it was.  I'll have to go back again when I am in TX visiting family and see how it compares.

The one nice thing was the live entertainment on the patio area while we waited outside for our table.  The band was good.
This place is the best if your in Phoenix don't miss this place. James our server was the best server I've had in a long time.

Best seafood restaurant in town. The atmosphere was fun and festive and very family oriented. Outdoor seating is available and indoor there is a bar and a huge area for dining. The menu could get a little overwhelming, but our waiter was very sweet and helpful. She suggested we try the baked crab Mac and cheese for our appetizer. Let me tell you, it was very delicious. We also ordered the fried calamari with artichoke hearts, and that too was very tasty. The restaurant was pretty packed/busy for a weeknight but our main entree did not take long. It came at the perfect time after finishing the last bit of our appetizer. I had ordered the Moroccan salmon and shrimp. It was served with couscous, it had the perfect bite to it! Salmon was grilled to perfection, very soft, buttery and moist. Shrimp came with a lump of crab which I did not expect but so good! So much flavor in a dish

I am not a huge seafood eater yet. Just recently started eating fish, as long as it doesn't have a fishy taste. Well I didn't want to order a 35 dollar plate I didn't like so I got a chicken chopped salad. It was good but I'm always bummed when I get a salad with romaine or iceberg lettuce. I think it's pretty cheap and would much rather eat spinach or kale, leafy greens. The praline cheesecake was so bomb and I couldn't stop eating that. 

The service was pretty good!

We went here for happy hour and enjoyed the fried alligator and great sauce. The shoestring potatoes on the side were crispy. I've been trying to eat healthy when I go out, so based on the description on the menu, I ordered the Greek salad and added crab for an extra $7.99 for my entree. Although it says "prepared at your table," they brought it to me already dressed, the lettuce was literally drowning in the vinaigrette and limp, and there was maybe a tablespoon or two of small pieces of crab on top. The salad had no cucumbers, but had green peppers, which is unusual. A Greek salad always has cucumbers. As I stirred my salad around so I could get a little bit of everything in each bite, the crab basically disappeared and I only saw a couple of Mediterranean olives. The feta was on the light side also. I mentioned to my waiter that my salad was not what I expected and a manager showed up a little while later. I told her my concerns, including paying $8 bucks for the little bit of crab, and very few olives or feta cheese. She told me the salad had 2 ounces of crab and three olives. Excuse me, but if you figure that out, they are charging $64 a pound for crab!! It wasn't even lump crab, and basically disappeared into the salad so I felt like I didn't get any. The green salad was $12.95 and adding the  $7.99, I could've gotten a full entrée for that price ($21). She did offer to bring more olives and feta, which I accepted - however, the $8 worth of crab that I couldn't even taste was my biggest complaint. I was very disappointed in my meal, felt it was overpriced, and was still hungry when we left.

I've never had a bad experience at Pappadeauxs. I've been here at least a dozen times and have to say that the food and service is always outstanding. There are so many delicious looking items on the menu that it is tough to decide what to order sometimes. 
     I'm combining experiences here. I recently drove 200 miles round trip to have lunch here. My waitress/bartender Erin was awesome.
     Appetizers... alligator is unbelievable. I always ask for it blackened instead of fried... sooo good. Shrimp and Crawfish fondeaux is sooo good yet so bad if you're on a diet. Don't miss out on the oyster duo.. cooked 2 ways. Mediterranean calamari is great, also crab cakes, oysters on the half shell...you get the point.
     This place feels cajun and gets you in the mood with its ambience. Fresh fish, great food, service and generous portions are what Pappadeauxs is all about. You won't be dissapointed.
