This place is soo delicious, but a little on the pricey side.  The first time I had this absolutely awesome pasta with shrimp and scallops.  It was soo good.  The next time they had taken it off the menu, total bummer. I had lobster tail instead, but it really was rubbery.  The eggrolls are yummy and so is the alligator.  so tender.  and desserts,  oh my.  i for sure recommend this place.

This was our first time here and everything was amazing. The jumbo shrimp wrapped in bacon over dirty rice was super good. We started with a sampler platter which included the fried alligator it is a must try it was very good. Inside the restaurant was a bit loud but we sat out in the patio which was very nice. We had a great time we will definitely come back again. Our server Christopher B. was on top of everything . All servers should be like him.

Wife found Pappadeaux on Yelp, and boy am I happy she did. We have been watching a lot of Duck Dynasty, and after watching Mrs. K cook up a whole lotta squirrel Brain Jambalaya, my cajun taste buds kicked in. 

we started with the frog legs and lobster egg rolls. The frog legs were incredible, I could not believe how juicy they were. 

For an entre, Tasia got the scallops, and I got the blackened catfish with the dirty rice. I loved this dish, but could barely finish half of it. 

We will be back for sure

The service sucked!! We had a party of 20 and we didn't get our food till 2 hours later...I got my food 5 minutes after everyone in my party was done!!  Seriously you really need to have a talk with your staff!!!!  i work in a restaurant...serving the customers their food on a timely manner and not forgetting orders is very important!!

Well - this is finally it, my very first bad review.  So we stopped in for dinner and it was about 5:30.  The hostess was great and made us feel very special, ask if it was our first time there and/or if it was a special occasion.  Once we sat down nothing from anyone.  We waited 15 minutes before just getting up and leaving.  I asked to talk to a manager right before leaving and had to wait a couple of minutes for them to pull her from a meeting (looked like about 8-12 people in a room having a meeting) not sure why at 5:45 (dinner rush they were having a meeting.  The manage apologized and offered to treat us to dinner, I choose not to accept as my time is worth more than a free meal.  I was so upset that because this my buddy from the mid west comes to town often and raves about how good there food is (I was originally from Seattle - looking for good seafood in AZ).  

So with that being said - horrible experience (actually the worst experience I have had so far in Phoenix)

I've been wanting to come here for a very long time after several friends claim it's their favorite place.  I arranged for a ladies dinner with a few friends.  Love their reservation process...you get a text confirming and also another one as a reminder the day of.  
We arrived starving!  We were promptly seated and the ordering began.  My meal started with the Lump Crab Artichoke Dip.  It was very delicious.  However, I have to note that it did not taste like it had any crab in it.  No 'lumps' of crab whatsoever, not even a seafood flavor to it.  Still trying to figure that one out.  Did I say anything?  No, because it was a very delicious dip.  But I have to admit that at $17 I was disappointed there clearly was no Crab in it.
After the appetizers we were brought warm bread and butter that was amazing, as well as salads and soups for those that ordered them. 
My entree was the Mahi Alexander, per our server's recommendation.  Wow!  It was delicious.  I ordered the smaller portion and it was more than enough, I ended up with leftovers-yay!  
Our service was great.  We were not offered dessert...just brought our checks (which were wrong and had to be corrected).  If it weren't for those 2 little things I would probably have given 5 stars.  We paid before one in our party realized we weren't offered dessert and she wasn't too happy about it.  I personally was way too stuffed!
For me personally, I am an ambiance girl and I don't feel this is the right ambiance for a date night.  But it also was a little difficult with a large group because it is SO loud.  I would much prefer to sit on the adorable and very NOLA patio.  But being a December night it was much too chilly! I'd like to return in the spring and sit outside where it's quieter.  
All in all, I was pleased and will return.

I know this place is a chain restaurant and I usually avoid those but damn the food is too good to resist. We always receive fabulous service at this location even when the place is packed. Management is good about actually having adequate amounts of servers at all times. We have been here for many lunches and dinners. They are wonderful at either time. The lunch specials do make this place more affordable for all.  Whatever time you come just know it will be worth it.

What a great evening! My husband and I enjoy trying new restaurants (to us) and decided it was time to try Papadeaux's. I'm not going to lie, I was a little apprehensive since I'm not a "frog leg" or "alligator" type of person and up until this point, that's all I knew of Papadeaux's.  Boy was I wrong! Brenda, our server, was so helpful and suggested different ways we could try our selection of foods. She was on point with checking in at our table to make sure everything was good. Drinks never went empty and the food arrived one right after the other. Our bartender came by our table and it was then we learned he was actually one of the managers. Forrest had heard it was our first visit and wanted to  expressed his gratitude that we chose to visit Papadeaux's and even went out of his way to make sure our first visit was perfect. I've never been so pleased with a restaurant before visiting Papadeaux's so a big thank you to Brenda and Forrest. The drinks were amazing, the food was amazing, the service was amazing, everything was amazing!
Great food and service will return again Paul was are server great job and excellent service

I took my son and his girlfriend here one night , it was their first time there.   We were welcomed with smiles, seated and very well taken care of.  There were a couple mishaps, but the server was new, so it was a learning experience.  We each ordered, not knowing how large their plates are.  We ate the appetizer and that was pretty big!  Then the plates came!  They were huge!  We easily got 3 meals out of each one!  I will be going again!

It was my first time dining here and it was amazing! The wait was about 35 minutes so I recommend calling ahead. I ordered the Caribbean Lobster Tail with Mashed Red Potatoes and Asparagus. It was so good. I highly recommend it. I tried the fried calamari and it was good with the lemon aoli sauce. Our waiter, Jacob, was great! He was funny and really accomodating. Our food and drinks came out in a timely manner. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

Always an amazing experience. Have been coming here for years, not one time have they let me down in any way. Great service, great food, great environment. The food is so amazing, it leaves you wanting more even though you cant eat another bite . The shrimp brochette is 5 star deluxe. Hats off to you all that make this dining experience
I love the ambiance and the look of the place. The food is really good but pricey. Great service and always crowded.

Delicious! The only drawback was we were freezing, the air must have been on 50Nick and Christy were awesome! The overall service at the bar area was laid back and on point for a Friday afternoon. The seafood gumbo w/ andouille sausage was sooo good, as well as the fried cat fish, seasoned, fresh and delicious! My husband totally enjoyed the red beans and rice. We will definitely come back again when visiting Phoenix ...we're still disappointed we don't have a Pappadeaux's n Cali!
If you love seafood this is the place.  Service is amazing, Ryan G provided me and my guest amazing service.  Highly recommend, the menu offers many options.  Love it.

Three of us went here an hour before they closed (9pm) and were seated right away. We ordered the alligator appetizer and a cup of lobster bisque. The alligator with the Cajun sauce was deli-sh! My cup of lobster bisque was creamy with chunks of lobster in it. Probably one of the best that i have had. When ordering our waitress was very helpful, we ordered Costa Rican Mahi Alexander, Crawfish Etouffee, and the Soft Shell Crab. By far HANDS DOWN the Alexander was the best dish. It offered a little bit of everything and the flavor or the sauce plus the amazing dirty rice. OMG it was amazing and i am kind of upset that i wasn't the one who ordered them. The Etouffee was colorful and deli-sh the crawfish were really soft and easy to chewy plus the flavor the sauce thy were in was amazing. I ordered the soft shell crab... i had never had soft shell crab before. It was pretty good! I would recommend that you put a little of the Cajun sauce that was served with the alligator.
Fantastic place to dine in I would recommend this place for any and all occasions.  Food is outstanding and service is great also.  Thanks

If you like any kind of seafood, this is the place for you! The trio-appetizer is amazing. Crawfish and shrimp fondeux, fried alligator (better than I had in NOLA!) and calamari. Next course was lobster bisque, which is easiest the best I've ever had!! I had the stuffed shrimp for dinner and it was perfect. My boyfriend had the Mardi Gras pasta and the sausage in it was the best thing on the table.

I had the sweet potato pecan pie for dessert and I could eat a whole pie of that! The creme brûlée looked awesome, but no one at the table ordered it. That will be for next time. 

I HIGHLY recommend this place if you're craving creole or seafood...or both!! It is a bit pricey but definitely worth it!

First time here. Our waiter Dustin made it an excellent experience!! The food was amazing , taste just like the food in Louisiana. We are definitely coming back. You have to try the purple voodoo drink

First time we had ever been to Pappadeaux's.  My husband had the fried platter.  The badder was light and did not weigh you down or over power the food.  I had the Salmon salad.  Best salmon I've ever had!  My mother in law had mauhi over some type of mash.  All the food was fantastic!!  So we shared the bread pudding for dessert.  Best dessert I've ever had!  The server, Joe was also fabulous!  The whole experience is what gives this place 5 stars!  From start to finish, it was amazing!  It's a little higher priced, but definately worth it!  Upscale dining for sure!  Can't wait to go back!

Our server was Macy like the store. She came to the table quickly and was very friendly!  She explained everything perfect and I went with the blue point oysters and my date glue the mix grilled seafood. 

The oysters were one ice,  cold and yummy!  

The mixed grilled seafood my date has was enough for two and very delicious.

Definitely a winner for a night out and we will be  back.  Make sure to ask for Macy as your server for a perfect stay to a fun time.   Jim K

This place rocks with great Cajun food besides San Francisco style seafood dishes. Pleasant atmosphere inside and out! When I have guests from out of town, I like to take them here. Friendly service. 
Just a different experience than most other restaurants because it has a feeling of being outside on a big porch with big picture windows. Close by hotels. All seafood seems pretty fresh considering there's no ocean in Phoenix. 

Dan W. Miller

My wife and I just returned home from a fantastic evening out.  We went to Pappadeaux's to celebrate our 31st wedding Anniversary.  Our evening started with the Crab Lump Spinach dip appetizer and a Classic Caesar salad split between us.  Then the main course, my wife had the Brazino on the Half Shell and I had the Costa Rican Mahi and Lemon Chile Crab.  We finished then evening with coffee and the Bread Pudding and Bourbon sauce.  To say the food was excellent is an understatement.
Now for an equally if not more important part of the evening, our server.
Victoria, AKA: Tory did an exceptional job.  Her knowledge and explanation of items on the menu, and her personality in general made for an enjoyable evening.  We never wanted for anything!
We won't hesitate to recommend this restaurant and we'll definitely be back.  What a Great Place!!!!!!

Since writing the original review, I have been contacted by the manager of the restaurant. He discussed correcting the problems that I noticed, and sent a card for a free meal. Since I accept no free meals from anyone, I gave the card away to another person who would like to eat there. While I can't give another star without eating there again, the concern of the manager speaks volumes to me. I will be reevaluating this restaurant in the future.

We really enjoyed eating here. I have heard of this restaurant for years and never come until yesterday. I had heard it can take a while time get seated because it's popular. We were seated right away. 

The restaurant is big and has plenty of seating so I imagine the special occasions and maybe evenings would be the only time you'd have to actually wait to be seated. We came at lunch time on a Saturday and it was fine. 
 
Our waiter was super nice and explained things. He didn't ask us how the food was with our mouths full of food. They give you like a loaf of bread and butter to get things started lol.

I got the pasta Mardi gras and my gf got the shrimp and grits - both were lunch specials. The total was about 42 bucks prior to tip. We didn't get anything but water to drink. So that gives you an idea how much it costs to eat here. 

As far as the food goes I liked both of our meals. I've never really cared for grits but they make theirs different. It has all sorts of flavor mixed in. Portions were good. 

We had some of the praline cheesecake as well - to go, because I was stuffed but the dessert looked legit. It was comped by the manager because it was our first time here :) I'm not sure if I'm to share that, but it was totally a surprise and made a good experience even better. 

The sauce on the cheesecake had a rum flavor to it and it was awesome. It would have been about 7 bucks for a big slice. 

The restaurant itself is cool. I wouldn't say it's super fancy like Flemings where you'll feel weird wearing jeans. So you can come causal or dressed up and you'll be good. 

We'll definitely come back to try some more of the food. We were spying on other people's food and it all looked good.

Been here a few times as it's a nice place to take people after a long day at the office.  Food is good especially for those who like seafood.  I would say get here early...it gets pretty busy when the sun goes down, at least the last couple of times I was there.

I was in Phoenix for the annual Origami Owl convention.  Pappadeaux is where my team leader chose to have our team dinner. I loved this choice because of the extensive options on the menu. There was so much to choose from that I didn't know where to start! 

I studied the menu the best way I knew how while hungry . I chose a cup of Louisiana  Shrimp Gumbo to start. It wasn't salty like most places it had the right amount of spice to clear your throat. There was also a generous amount of seafood for the size.  I chose the Mississippi Catfish Opelousas for my main dish  after much debate  going on in my head. I usually like my catfish fried but I thought this would be healthier even though it would be sitting on Lemon Garlic Butter sauce. I really can't say, " No" to things with lemon garlic butter. I had an issue with eating oysters that night so they simply left them out and added more Shrimp and jumbo crab meat. It was absolutely divine with the dirty rice ! Loved it!! 

I was stuffed but I couldn't turn my back on the Banana Wafer pudding that was served in a cute mason jar! The pudding was nice and thick and not too sweet. It was perfect! I also shared my husband's drink Swamp Thing but it was too strong for me. 

I wish we had one of these restaurants in Las Vegas!

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The seafood is very fresh, I'm not quite sure how they do that. The crab cakes are to die for. They put crawfish in them and the sauce is d'lish. I love the plank salmon too, but I recently discovered the pasta mardi gras (seafood pasta). I'm usually not a fan of seafood pastas because they taste so fishy, but this was really good. I've never had anything less than great here and each time I go I try something new.

The drinks are good, but the speciality drinks are pretty weak. If you want a good strong drink, order a mixer. On the weekends they usually have live music on the patio, which is usually jazz or blues. It makes waiting for a table all the easier for sure. They do take reservations though, so if you don't want to wait an hour, call ahead.

If you go all out on the meal (appetizer, drinks, and dessert), for two people, you can expect it will easily be over $100. Worth it! Though we usually save it for special occasions.

This is one of my top 5 favorites in the US. Great sea food. If you come before 6 usually can get in quick.  The salmon topped with one of their sauces is the best you have ever had.  This location in Phoenix is equal to their Huston locations. 2 can share any meal and be full.

Treated my friend's family here recently, on a busy Sunday night.  We have been here several times now, but I do not remember the food taking this long.

We had reservations for a party of 7 at 6:30pm, we showed up early at 6:15pm  but we still had to wait till about 6:50pm to be seated.  It was extremely busy.

Food took awhile but it was worth it.  Our server was pretty nice and overall we had a good experience.

Wow! Went here after my graduation from NCU. It did not disappoint. Food was on point through and through.

Waitress: 10
Food Presentation: 10
Food quality:10
Food:10 
Dessert :10

What can I say. I wanted a adjustment to a dish; done no problem. I don't have a bad thing to say.

Had alligator for appetizer: cooked to perfection seasoning, dipping sauce all on point. Crispy not chewy. 

I had the Mardi Gras's pasta with scallops vs. crawfish. Excellent. My family was pleased with their meals as well. Their meals looked good and smelled good too!
I recommend this place.

I never tasted alligator until my bf took me here, it's very good. 
We've tried a few different plates here and love them all. Will definitely be back.

I've only eaten here once but the 2nd time around and oh man its way better. I recommend the jumbo shrimp brochette. Basically jumbo shrimp wrapped in bacon with pepper jack cheese and a slice of jalapeño. I will definitely come back!

2 favorite dishes are Costa Rica Talapia with spaghetti squash  or blackened Costa Rican mahi with cream cheese grits. 

Came here again yesterday with my family and since my son is sensitive to many things the manager came out and asked us exactly what he was allergic to in order to make something custom just for my son.  He was so accommodating that I just had to write another review on it.  I had to order my usual Talapia and it was fantastic as well.  I also did not know that they ship in new seafood daily and everything here is homemade, which is probably why this place is full of awesomeness!

Best seafood you will ever eat! Everything taste fresh and delicious. I ordered the Wild King Alaskan Salmon and the waiter said they were a little disappointed with the presentation of my plate because it broke in half during the plating process. (even though I couldn't tell) he said they were gonna bring me another piece to make up for it. I thought it was just going to be a piece but to my surprise they brought me a new Wild King Alaskan Salmon! If that's not customer service then I don't know what is! The staff does a fine job of keeping your glasses full and keeping your table just happy to be there at the restaurant. I would recommend this place to anyone.... And yes it is 100x better than Red Lobster! you have to try the fried Alligator! it takes a bit like chicken but with it's own distinct flavor.
Great atmosphere. Staff was fantastic! Had a good time @ happy hour....we will be back

This 2 stars is extremely generous. Wanna know why? Read on.

My party of 7 and a baby got to Pappadeux's around 6:30. We were told that it would be a 30-minute wait. It ended up being more than an hour. We were standing right in front of the hostess station, yet no one ever came to give us updates on how long it would be for our table. We would go check about every 20 or so minutes. One time we were told that our table was ready. When we went to check on it after about 20 minutes we were told that they were waiting on a busboy to clean it. A few minutes later they were still waiting on a busboy. In what universe does it take a restaurant 30 minutes to find a busboy to clean a table? We watched group after group after group get seated. A group of 7 that came after us was seated before us. We ended up being sat next to them; by the time we were getting our menus, they were finishing up their meals.

Once we were finally seated, we waited almost 10 minutes before someone came to our table to introduce himself as our waiter. When he asked how we were doing, we kindly told him that we were a little frustrated because it had taken more than twice as long as we were told, and we had been told twice that they were waiting on a busboy to clean the table. The waiter said that it was a busy night and said that he didn't get paid to deal with unhappy customers. He asked, "So are you gonna do this or what?" WHAT?! It was so rude - I don't know how he meant it, but it came across as sounding extremely annoyed. We were appalled and my boyfriend asked to speak to a manager.

The manager came over and spoke with my boyfriend. Not sure what was said, but after that things got much better. The manager brought us an appetizer plate on the house. Our food ended up being really good - including the alligator. I got shrimp etoufee, and it was great. The gumbo wasn't so fabulous. Overall, everyone was satisfied with their meal. We got three different drinks, and they basically tasted the same: like cherry Nyquil.

The food was good, but it's not always about the food. The service was horrible. Don't think I'd ever go there again. There are too many other places with great food and equally great service.

This was an excellent experience all around. The service was fantastic and the food amazing.  I had the fried oysters and they were spot on.  This girl from the South thanks you!  We will be back SOON!
Don't miss this one!

This place is so worth the wait! My brother, bff and I came on Valentine's Day 2015. There was an 90-120 minute wait and no reservations, but that was okay. A bar server named Justin came around to take drink orders outside and was extremely prompt and courteous. Once inside, our server Nora was nothing but friendly and professional. Even though the restaurant was slammed, she treated us as if we were the only diners here. Extremely attentive and lovely. The food was exquisite and the drinks were fabulous! We cannot wait to come back!

So I was an idiot and thought gumbo was jambalaya...  I set myself up for disappointment when I received a bowl of soup. BUT WOW it was so jam packed full of flavor. I don't think I've ever eaten real crab either. It's always been that fake imitation type. And the shrimps!! Mmm I love shrimps. 

I'm sad I'm leaving Phoenix today. I won't get to try the other seafood items, but just from this bowl of gumbo I can tell the other food must be bomb.

Food was good, but a little overpriced.  Drinks were good.  Food was cooked perfect, lobster and filet mignon with asparagus was done to perfection, I had the catfish, it's not my favorite.  Very crowded and little bit of a wait.  Service was good, we got everything we needed right away.  We will be back.

I came was not happy with a food item I received nut  Lisa made me so happy that I will return . She provided me with another dish and I was happy. Jackie was my waiter and not one time did she get frustrated.  Love this place.  Thank you for a great experience.

I was looking for a location to host a party of 50 for a business function and this was perfect. The service was top notch, food delicious and atmosphere exactly what I wanted. I love their outdoor garden so I had our event on the patio. I had the salmon that melts in your mouth and my husband had the shrimp wrapped in bacon. They should rename it " heaven shrimp "

While on an overnight trip to Phoenix we decided to try Pappadeaux for dinner.  It was a fabulous decision.  We got a very friendly greeting when we entered.  We were taken to a table right away.  Once seated it was only a few moments when Chris, our waiter, came by to see if we wanted a drink before dinner.  Shortly after they came by with warm bread & butter.  I decided to order an appetizer and enjoy some raw oysters on the half shell.  They offer more than the usual horse radish & cocktail sauce.  I enjoyed them very much.  My dinner included soup or salad so I chose to try the clam chowder.  It was very good.  A bit different than what I was use to but most enjoyable.  For entrée's my wife opted for the halibut and I decided on the trout & shrimp combo.  Both were great.  When we had finished our entrée's Chris came by with a dessert tray that included some very tempting items.  He told us there was one item available not on the tray.  It was a multilayer cake which we chose.  It was fabulous.  While enjoying our dessert the manager stopped by our table.  We learned later they comped our appetizer & dessert since it was our first time there.  While it was very much appreciated we sure didn't expect it.  The service and food was excellent.  Yes we recommend Pappadeaux and are looking forward to dining here again.

I got the Caribbean lobster tail and filet mignon and it was my first time trying lobster, that why I figured if I didn't care for the lobster I'd eat the filet. Well the lobster was amazing, so delicious. They filet actually needed more seasoning, so I was glad that I did like the lobster- which I should it's a $50 plate. But it was well worth it. I also got the purple voodoo and that drink was very good too. Can't wait to come back and have the lobster again.

My family loves this place. It's a great family restaurant with exceptionally fresh seafood. We look forward to always eating here. The reason I didn't give it a 5 star, which for the service and the food it deserves a 5 star. Is that we wait a long time to get in. We always wait 40 minutes or so for dinner. Other than that we love coming here. Their oysters are so darn good and their grilled fish are so delicious and fresh and everything you order is great.

Love love love!!! This place was so amazing, I've heard many things about it, so given the fact I would be in the area to try it I just had to. I'm so glad I did my food was excellent and my drink was very good as well, I had the swamp thing not to mention it was quite strong compared to other place that give watered down drinks. I will definitely be returning in the near future

Oh, where to begin..

I stopped by Pappadeaux last week to grab a bite when on a Wed, they told me it was a 45min wait for two.. wow.  The place was packed.   The hostess recommended we make a reservation for the weekend, so we made one for Friday at 7PM.

The smells coming from the place when you first pull in automatically keep you wondering what delicious things are waiting inside.  

I'm so glad we did. 

We showed up and they gave us a card with a number and once our number showed up on the screen, it was seating time.  I think we waited maybe ten minutes.

After gazing over the menu for a quick minute, we decided to try the fried alligator with creole sauce.  Being one to enjoy new things, I was pretty excited.  The waiter took our drink orders and and put in the appetizer.  The place at this point was insanely packed, but it was nice to see a place like this.  Made ya feel that something good was to come.  Heck, a place cant' suck if it's this packed, right?   So we order our food, I decided on the stuffed shrimp and the rest of my friends all ordered different things.  It would be a share-a-meal night.. 

About 10min into drinks and conversation, they bring out the fried alligator..  Ok, if you've never eaten anything weird before.  Please please.. you've got to try this.  It sorta reminded me of a cross between soft pork or chicken.  The taste literally melted in my mouth.  To top it off, the creole sauce that went with it, only complimented it.  I could easily have eaten the entire plate alone.  Sadly, I had to share..

After quickly destroying the fried alligator, we got our entrees.  I took one bite and had to pause a moment.. the taste of the stuff shrimp with the crab, Alfredo, spices inside just floored me.  There were only six pieces, but after sharing a piece or two and eating the amazing green beans, this was plenty of food. 

I can't wait for my next trip here.. fantastic food.

The best as always.  It was my girlfriends birthday and we invited my parents and we had the best dinner ever. Our waitress  Esther gave us 1st class service and the food was succulent. Can't wait to return.

Excellent if you like butter + fried foods. I'm not a huge fan so got the crudo which looked amazing when it came out (and it wasn't bad at all). Ten stars for Dominic the really tall server -- SUPER nice and friendly and helpful and kind. I dunno, maybe I'm spoiled with Bay Area food, but I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend the place to friends. Interested to try Cleo's next time. http://www.yelp.com/biz/little-cleos-seafood-legend-phoenix
Really really good food. the food was one of a kind and I can't even begin to describe how good the The bread pudding was. Highly recommend !

The frog legs and oysters are amazing. Came for a birthday was told I would get a free dessert and didn't see waitress for 45 minutes. The bill was over 200$ ....might come back still deciding if it's THAT good
Went here for a holiday dinner. Food was good, service good, all was good. Unique seafood offerings for sure.

For all the money and hype, this seafood restaurant is not all it's cracked up to be. The food was under seasoned and lacking. I was so excited to eat go eat there again only to be let down. I've been there many years ago and remember enjoying whatever seafood pasta dish I had ordered.  But this recent visit left me wanting more and unfortunately it wasn't more food from them.

This place is awesome.  Never had a bad meal here.  Service is exceptionally good.  Love their oysters... the complimentary bread and especially the restaurant made butter are also to die for.  Recommend making reservation on the weekend to avoid long wait time but you can go to the bar and grab a beer or glass of wine while waiting for your table.

Very impressive!!! The place looks classy very romantic atmosphere... On a friday night (we arrived at approximately 8:40) at which point they  said the wait time would be about an hour. We sat outside enjoyed the live music & within 20 minutes... BAAAMMN we were seated! Our server NATHAN was oh so helpful in recommending food as this was our 1st time. Everything was delicious & well portions were filling no room for desert :'(

A bit pricey but great place to take a date or celebrate something! Will definitely come back soon!!!
I love their greek salad! Recently took my aunt for her bday and she thoroughly enjoyed it! Great place for bday lunches n dinners!

I usually go to Pappadeaux for a special occasion.  I think the seafood salad is amazing.  I had the creme brulee for desert.  The coffee the ambiance is so nice and the wait staff are wonderful.  It is not everyday type fare for me, due to the fact it can be pricey.  Everyday is usually packing my own lunch.  I would recommend this venue for "power lunches" and meetings with others.  Just walking in the door improves my mood.  For a date I would say, stop in for an appetizer and a glass of wine.  Excellent food.

INCREDIBLE! My dad had been to their locations in Texas and highly recommended we go out of the way to try this place. So glad we did. EVERYTHING we had was to die for. Even the bread. So I imagine you can't go wrong with anything here. I had the sirloin and was blown away. And the bread pudding... Again, incredible!

When I found out there was a Pappadeaux in Phoenix, I wanted to treat my girlfriend for something different since she's never tried Pappadeaux or Cajun style food.  Atmosphere was great, but it was a tad bit chilly inside (had to grab my coat from the car).  The oysters and cocktail shrimps were nice and plump not the miniature sized ones you would find in other chain seafood restaurants.  I ordered the deep fried soft shell crab and it was amazing as usual and my gf ordered the mahi mahi with the cheese grits and green beans.  One thing that my gf complained was that the menu did not have indications of the food being spicy.  Her grits were a little bit spicy.  But I told her it's kind of inferred since it is Cajun style.  Other than that, food was fantastic.  And would definitely try it if you're in the PHX area.

Second time here and not a bit disappointed. Seafood selection is amazing. Alligator and Steak for the non-seafood individuals. All in all this restaurant is a 10. Don't be deceived by the parking lot, this place is huge and has a great sized bar. Christy was our server and was absolutely phenomenal. Definitely a pleasure to have been served by Christy. She was quick, knew the menu inside and out and is a true asset to this establishment. 

Apps and drinks were served promptly and dinner was amazing. Caribbean lobster was huge and cooked perfectly. The ettouffe  was to die for.. .. Just as if we were back in New Orleans.. Great flash back and desserts topped off the meal. Love-love-love this place.

Papadeux is a treat when in the Phoenix area. The place is always crowded but the wait isn't always very long. Best Cajun food I have ever had outside of Orleans and service is very attentive. If your looking for a steak this place isn't the place, they have steak but the seafood or chicken is where it's at.
Great food! Go here on special occasions as it is a bit expensive but worth every penny. Servers are friendly and well rehearsed on the menu.

Did the happy hour here a few times, food is okay nothing to really brag about and it's expensive to boot. Atmosphere is friendly but not too over the top for the prices they charge. The fish is fresh but the wait was too long especially with two kids in tow. We've gone a few times but just can't seem to get the full satisfaction of good food, good environment and good ole customer service!

What a great lunch. Service here was impeccable. Our server, Ariel was very attentive, super polite and such a sincere, friendly smile! It was two of us and we ordered an appetizer, entrees and was sure to stop early so we could have dessert. Ariel even put our leftovers in a container with ice since we were going to a movie afterward. Very nicely done all around. Oh yeah, the food. Wonderful. Flavors that explode. Carefully devised recipes that resulted in truly satisfying mouthfuls bite after bite. Well done. Slow clap. Where's my pillow?
We came and they were out of crawfish on the last day, but it's okay I'm not mad. However, another customer and I did agree at they need bigger TV screens.

I am 21 and the Manager wouldn't serve me any alcohol because my drivers license were from Utah , the manager said that my drivers license were tampered all because a had a little piece of tape on the bottom where the address was to show my address has changed which at the DMV in Utah said that was okay to do that rather paying 20 dollars for a new drivers license. After the manger told me That they wouldn't serve me she began with sarcastic comments which was really rude. Probably won't come back again. Don't recommend for people who are visiting from other locations with a changed address.

Date night success! The fried alligator and calamari appetizer was so good- my boyfriend and I inhaled it. I had the seafood platter dinner which was a ton of food- I had a lot of leftovers to take home. Very good, fresh tasting seafood. Only downside was there was a wait to be seated but no worries.

Setting:  Dimly lit, nice for dates.  Very clean.  There is another room for bigger parties.  Nice bar for just to hang out and watch a game.

Food:  Yum!!!  Had the steamed Maine lobster.  For less than $20 it was very very good!  Meaty too.  They give you the whole lobster, complete with thick juicy claws.  Oh, and the Greek salad was very very good as well.  Highly recommended for big groups.  Finally, the fondeaux is also very tasty.  Although it's a bit think on the cheese.  But hey, if you like cheese, this is the appetizer for ya.

Service:  Awesome folks, we had a cool waitress.  So sorry we made you take pictures of us and you almost fell off the table!  :(  But she was a great sport.  Very helpful, very nice.
I highly recommend this restaurant!!! Excellent food and excellent service!!! A bit pricey but worth it!!

Loved everything! We ate there because my Mother-in-Law got a tip from her friend that they had an Oyster deal that couldn't be beat! Dad hadn't had Oysters on the half shell in many years.
The place is very large, dimly lit and was busy busy busy! But I think they have a lot of experience with handling the crowds. I would have preferred a quieter restaurant, but the food quality was worth the inconvenience of barely being able to carry on a conversation without yelling. We had appetizers (alligator was good!) and a good meal  -Costa Rican Tilapia LaFayette. OH man! the food was excellent. I would definitely go again in spite of the noise and crowd... I understand why the crowd!

My husband and I have been here several times and have always been pleased with the quality of our meals.  It's hard to find fresh seafood in Phoenix and this place has delivered time and again. We always go during their happy hour which is from 3-6 M-F in their bar area which includes seats at the HUGE bar top and a few booths.  Not sure if HH is available on the patio... Compared to their normal menu prices ($$$) their HH pricing is fantastic.  And if you have a hankering for oysters this is the place to go.  Last time we went we got a dozen  of delicious Gulf Coast oysters for $7.95. They have several other HH food items in the $4-$7 price range ( calamari, catfish poboys, steamed cajun shrimp served with sausage and corn on the cob) but our favorite by far is the alligator.  They typically serve it fried but on our first visit our server recommended trying it blackened. We went with her suggestion and were not disappointed. It is served with a rich, brown sauces that is is on it's own fantastic. The drink prices on their HH are decent as well.  I usually go with their specialty cocktail "The Swampthing" It's a deceptively strong, frozen drink that I highly suggest. Get the large, it comes in an icy goblet that will keep your drink nice and cold as you enjoy your meal. They also have a good draft beer selection if that is more your thing.  The bill between the two of us is usually around $50 for a few  apps, a couple drinks a piece and a dozen oysters. They will also provide you with some fresh baked bread.

The regular menu is rather large and features a variety of seafood.  You have quite the selection to choose from including alaskan king crab legs, live maine lobster  and all sorts of fish.  I think I saw a scallop dish or two on there as well.  They also have several "combination" platters that feature fried shrimp, fish, stuffed shrimp, stuffed crab, etc. My husband once ordered a cajun tilapia (mahi perhaps?) with scallops dish that he loved off their "Specialty Menu". I can suggest the live lobster as well.  On one visit I saw the lobster tank and couldn't help myself. They actually had an 8 lb lobster in there! He proudly carried the title "KIng of the Tank" He was $159 and probably would have been worth every cent but I opted for one of the smaller guys.  I was not disappointed.  Mr Delicious was served with drawn butter and a side of pasta (linguine with diablo sauce I believe) and I have actually gone back and ordered just the side of pasta it was so good! 

The restaurant itself is rather large but it is always busy so get there early or at least call ahead.  Especially if you have a larger group.

I come here about 3-4 times a year for one thing, their Pasta Mardi Gras. In my opinion, it's a much shorter drive than the gulf shores to get authentic tasting seafood heaven. And I never miss on the Crispy Fried Alligator appetizer.

Best Happy Hour in Phoenix AZ!! Love this place  great food & service every time! My absolute favorite is their fried calamari with aioli dipping sauce. YUM! My hubby loves the shrimp and crawfish fondeux, but honestly you will not be disappointed with anything so go ahead and step outside your comfort zone and order something different- the food is excellent in every way!

I have been to this restaurant many times and are amazed every time! Not only is the food out standing, but service exceeds any normal expectation. The "Oysters Pappadeaux" makes my mouth water just thinking of them! 
I was there today with a party of nine today and the service was outstanding and the food met everyone's  expectations! I will a regular!!

Pappadeaux and I have a history.  We're both from Houston.  At home, I've been to just about every Pappas restaurant there is many times.  The Pappas family is an integral part of the Houston restaurant scene, love them or hate them.  (Most people love them.)  And in good old H-Town, they have a longstanding informal rivalry with the Goode family, who are like the working man's Pappas family, maintaining similar but less pricey/fancy restaurants.  At home, given a choice between Pappadeaux and Goode Co. Seafood, I will always choose Goode Co., because that's how my family rolls.  But when you take Pappadeaux out of that context, you must acknowledge that it is really a great restaurant.

This place is a carbon copy of the original, down to the plants on the patio.  I'm fine with that.  Why fix it if it ain't broke?  As far as I can tell, the food is carbon copy too.  And I'm fine with that, too!  It's pretty darn good food, and it's an accurate representation of the kind of food that our part of the world loves best.  You've got your Cajun, you've got your Creole.  You've got your fried fish (yummmm) and you've got your grilled fish (yummm!!!).  Their po-boy is not too terrible at all, considering how removed it is from its original context!  As a matter of fact, it was downright tasty!  I much prefer flounder to catfish, but hey, I'll live.
The original down-home dishes are what Pappadeaux does best, and I am always weirded out to see it advertising itself as some kind of fusion restaurant or lobster buffet.  Sushi?  Seriously?  Come on guys!  You don't need a gimmick!  This isn't a Landry's!

If I had to pick favorite dishes, I'd go with anything mesquite grilled, their fried shrimp, and their crawfish bisque, just because I love bisque (although Pappadeaux does not, I should add, have the best in the world).  The service is always good, although I miss the witty signage that all Pappadeuxs have in Houston.  AH WELL.  I enjoy their atmosphere because it is like so many other seafood restaurants on the Gulf Coast, where I half-expect to see a picture of my grandfather's boat on the wall.  

I haven't had much of what Phoenix has to offer in the seafood department, but I'm willing to bet, based purely on my Houstonian hubris, that this Texas import is one of the best in town.  Now if only we could get Goode Co. out here...

I wish I could give this place a higher review because I love the food here but the last several times my husband and me have came here we have been mis-quoted how long of a wait it would be and not by a little bit. We were quoted 45 mins it's now almost two hours in we wish we would have gone somewhere else but now we will be waiting no matter where we go! Don't come here hungry you will starve before you get your food!**update, we mentioned our wait to wait staff which let the manager know and they quickly handled the situation in a wonderful way! We will be coming back :)

For healthier items, eat from the "naked fish" menu; that's what I did. The meal started with a crispy Cesar salad, which was very traditional, and if you love this kind of salad this will do the trick. 

My main course was the 11oz Costa Rican Tilapia, which was served with a green bean potato medley. Fresh fish, cooked right, no complaints. 

I want to come back on a cheat day and get on down with some of their fried foods, and tempting desserts. This is a beautiful restaurant on the inside and out. Bring a date, have some wine, eat some oysters, get all hot & randy, then go home and make sa-weet love to each other.

First time dining here....extremely disappointed. We dined for my girlfriends birthday on a Friday night. It was a very busy night, which was encouraging in the hopes that a lot of people obviously like eating here. We sat at a round table in a corner of the dining room (we had a party of 6). Even though we were in a corner, it was extremely loud. I could barely hear my girlfriend who was sitting next to me...not much anyone can do about that, so that's not why I'm giving them 2 stars. 

The reason why is whoever is on the grill in the kitchen needs to find a new profession. I ordered the Fillet with lobster tail, and for paying upwards of $60 for that plate, my expectations should be somewhat high. Boy was I let down. I ordered the steak medium rare, it came out charred on the outside (literally crunchy each bite) yet bloody and undercooked on the inside. I hate sending food back, but for what I'm paying, I had no choice. The lobster was a bit dry, but I ate it anyways. By the time the second Fillet came out, everyone else had finished their meals. As soon as I laid eyes on it I could tell it was under cooked....again. It was so freaking bloody, I swear I heard it Moo. I could barely cut into it, it was so freaking rare. At that point I just told the waiter (who was a nice guy) that I did not want another one. He took it off the bill, as expected. 

Overall, if you're going to spend that kind of money on a nice dinner, don't waste your money here.

We had a very good experience here. We were a party of 7 and had made a reservation which was acknowledged when we arrived but it still took us 15 minutes to be seated, which was a bit disappointing. Our waitress, however, made up for that with her great service and the food was really really good! They ran out of sweet tea so refills were not in the cards for us but other than that and the initial wait, it was a near-perfect experience. Great service, awesome food, nice environment (a little loud but it's Saturday night) and generous portion sizes.

Ok, they should be happy that I am understanding of the flying bug that landed in my dessert and died before it was served.  Yes, I found it as I was eating the dessert, grossed me out, but not necessarily their fault.  The manager came over and apologized and took the dessert off the bill and offered me another one.  Anyway, the rest of the meal was great.  My party and I had the scallops with green beans and capers.  Yummy!  I do like Pappadeaux's overall and this is the first time I didn't have a great experience.

This place is cool! It's crowded every time we come so expect a little bit of a wait. There's a lot to choose from on the menu and the portions are pretty big. They have a lovely cocktail menu as well. Come here when you wanna Treat Yo Self cuz it can be a touch pricey.

I have been a customer since the week they opened.  Up until Father's day weekend, I would have given them 5 stars or better.  My wife, our daughter, and our son and daughter-in-law went there Friday before Father's Day.  Drinks were terrible, and we tried several of their house specialties. Waitress messed up orders repeatedly.  Mediterranean Calamari which we recommend to all friends was tough as the sole of an old tennis shoe.  However, the waitress was nice and they were quite busy so we left a very nice tip on a tab over $300.  The next day I glanced at the receipt in my pocket and found that they had double charged on one of the entrees.  So, about $38 lost there too.

Always a killer meal here. King Crabs for the win! Love the atmosphere. One of our party knew the bartender on duty and he made it his life mission to get to know all of us and take care of us. 

King Crabs were cooked just like I like them. Hot and Juicy.

The best word to describe this restaurant...AWESOME!!  I  have found my new favorite dish...Jumbo Shrimp Brochette.  Wish Pappadeaux was in San Diego!

Everything was delicious!  Blue Point Oysters on the half shell, alligator bites, Jumbo Shrimp Brochette, Pasta Mardi Gras (spicy and creamy) and excellent desserts! Even the kid's menu was good.   Do yourself a favor and go indulge!!  

Our server Audrey was great.  She gave us helpful tips, suggestions and kept a great pace on the food.  Wish all servers were as efficient, professional and friendly as she was.

One of my favorite places. I like to order from there appetizer menu and their seafood fondue is thee best! I haven't been here in a while but stopped by just to try there Mardi gras temporary cheesecake on a saturday evening. A band was setting up out on the patio and our waitress was awesome.

Love this place.  Food is great.  Taste fresh.  Doesn't have that  old fish taste.  Atmosphere is good.  Service is great.  I had oysters and shrimp then New Orleans crawfish etouffee. Everything was on point

I have been eating oysters my whole life. I've been to every single place on the West Coast just about in these guys have the best or Oysters I've ever had.
Me and my girls favorite place to go!!!
I've tried everything on the menu and have never had anything bad!!
Service is great!!!
Bartenders are on point and the manager Destiny is super nice!!!
Best food/service/drinks!!!

David and Tonya

Enjoyed a yummy lunch and had great great service by Kirk. He recommended the Costa Rican Tilapia and I'm so happy he did because it was delicious.  It was busy, but the service was so great by everyone that it didn't affect our experience.

The food is always wonderful here. Tried the Crab & Spinach dip this time, and it was phenomenal. My personal favorite is the Shrimp Brochette with dirty rice. I've also enjoyed the mixed seafood grill and the stuffed shrimp. Crab cakes are awesome too. Really, you can't go wrong here.

I had a pretty good experience here. I came in and got seated immediately and my server was very attentive. I tried the fried and blacked alligator as an appetizer and was pretty good. As my main dish I got the redfish with shrimp and oh my, it was amazing. Lastly I tried both the bread pudding (forgot the name) and the pecan pie. Both of these deserts were phenomenal. Over all my experience here was great. The service was on point, the food tasted great but just one negative thing about this place were the tables being way to close to each other.
Hands down the best Seafood and Cajun food in all of Phoenix and the surrounding cities! A must try!

We've only been here once, but would love to return. We had a great experience overall.  We visited on a Friday night, on a holiday weekend (and Fiesta Bowl weekend) and it was raining.  The place was packed. It because it's so big, the tables seemed to turn fairly quickly.   We were told it'd be an hour for a table for 2. They take your cell # and text you when your table is ready. They also have pagers available (for those of us whose cell service is extremely poor there!  Note - they had wifi for guests and we were able to get service but it was splotchy.)

We snagged seats at the very crowded bar for a drink and an app while we waited.   There must have been 7 bartenders on duty - which was awesome. The three women on our end of the bar regularly checked in with us for more drinks, etc.   (Note - drinks are good, and they have some of the NOLA staples like Hurricanes. Drinks ran about $10-11 a pop for their specialty cocktails.) 

We were called to our table in less than an hour.  Our server appeared right away and explained the menu to us and made recommendations.  The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and was hot and tasty.  We held back a bit so we could save room for dessert, which also did not disappoint.  They have a lot of options for your sweet tooth.    Will definitely return as there were numerous menu items we did not get to try.  

Here's what we did have:    Voodoos and Swamp Things (drinks); Lump crab and spinach dip; filet (w/green beans and potatoes); stuffed jumbo shrimp; baked mac n cheese with crab; and NY cheesecake with strawberry.

Absolutely delicious. Worth every dollar I paid! Great service, great environment and absolutely wonderful food. We've wanted to come here for quite a while but just have never been, wish we could've come here sooner! Hands down the best place I've been here in Phoenix.
Always great food and service.  Their mignonette for the oysters is one of the best I have ever tasted. Great for a quick seafood fix or a nice sit down meal.

This place had some seriously amazing Louisiana style sea food dishes.  Too bad i showed up off-season for craw fish, but other than that, it was total class.  
They seated me and my friend in the corner but we end up having a great view of the place, and seemed a bit more intimate that way. This also gave us a great view of the outside seating area to people watch as well.
The food itself was very rich and delicious.  I don't remember the name of the dish but it featured baked oysters.  Every bite was delicious.
I am definitely coming back there if I am looking for a nice seat down in the West Valley.

Ryan (server and trainer) was absolutely amazing. He was very attentive to our party and knowledgeable about the menu. He provided great recommendations and pairings without coming across too informative. He was very kind, personable, and exceeded expectations. Looking forward to being in the area again, and we will be sure to ask to be seated in his section.
Great oysters at fair pricing. The cocktails are exceptionally made. A nice restaurant to swing into in between running errands around town.

we always have a good time here!  we love the alligator with the gator sauce...yumm!  hubby loves to get the different baked oysters.  I had a nice cod dinner and he had shrimp etoufee...both very good but plan on $24 for those plus drinks and appetizers it adds up.  Still, it's good service and a fun place.

Have been going to Pappaduex's off and on for awhile now.  Seems like I go through spurts where I wind up there several times in a row then not going back for what seems like a year.  That said, this chain is consistently good.  The service is always good, some times better than others but never bad.  
It is hard to find good creole and/or cajun food here and while this may not be considered authentic, it is good.  The alligator is lip smackin' good.
The atmosphere is somewhat lacking as the acoustics make conversation almost impossible.  Not a good place for a romantic meal, but a good place to have fun with friends.

Service was sub par especially for the price! Sat at the bar had 1 glass of wine and oysters, wanted to order dinner but could not get service! I was staying at the hotel next-door and will be staying there three more times but will not be back to this restaurant!! damn shame

This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! The Mediterranean calamari and coconut shrimp are the best appetizers! Their lobster is phenomenal, the best I've had. I would recommend creme brûlée for dessert! Cocktail of choice is the Frenchmans spritzer...or something like that ;) the ambiance is beautiful, there is often live music on the patio which is always the best! I'd highly recommend a reservation, otherwise you will wait 2 hours...worth the wait!

Well, we were terribly shocked.  
We always rave about this restaurant, brought friends and 3 were disappointed
One of the favourite dishes was Maui Maui but it wasn't on menu anymore, so we asked and server said sure they do have, so Blacked was requested, it was horrific !!!  Tasted like something from freezer section, no taste and not blackened, rated meal a 0

Other dish was chicken linguini, not good either, picked all the tasteless chicken pieces out before he started on pasta which was ok!!!  Not good or great but ok

The table ordered 4 salmon glaze with 1scallop 2shrimp.   3rated it as a 3.5, other only eat 1/4 of meal, due to being drenched in a pool of butter.

What a shame
We went Monday night Nov 13,2017

I hit this spot up before heading back to Southern California last weekend. I heard many good things so I had to check it out for myself. This place didn't disappoint me. I was promptly greeted when I walked into the restaurant by the host. Lisa, the waitress was very friendly and patient with me because I couldn't make up my mind. As soon as she said this is a cajun/seafood restaurant, I knew I was in Heaven. I snacked on some french bread as I was making this "difficult" decision of what to eat. The food was delicious. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area again.

Here on business and looking for a familiar delicious place to have a nice dinner. Pappadeaux never disappoints - their food seems to be really consistent between locations. Huge portions, awesome flavor combinations, fresh fish... what more could you hope for?! The highlight for me was the service. Kirk was warm and possessed an impressive amount of menu knowledge. He made helpful suggestions and even learned my name. My glass (and bread, and plate) was always full. Yet another great experience at one of the few reliable chains about. Thanks!

The food here is phenomenal. You could literally close your eyes and point to anything on the menu and it's likely to be delicious. Portions are well sized, staff is always friendly and the food is always fresh. Plenty of seats that get filled quickly during dinner time. It's a little darker than I'd prefer during dinner but I get it, it's the ambiance.

The wife & I finally got back to give these guys another try by using the gift cards they sent us in apology for our last experience. This time was much better. Our server, JENNIFER (a trainer) was awesome. Never wanted, needed or had to ask for anything. She was on top of her game! Food was hot, fresh and came out in a relatively quick amount of time. I had the fried shrimp & catfish filets again and my wife tried the Lobster & Crab salad. We were both happy. We also started with a lobster bisque which was just slightly on the salty side. I still think the portions are small in relation to price. I had 5 shrimp and 2 catfish filets ($25). Overall, a save on their part in customer retention.

Let me start out by saying that I don't like chains, but I do like Pappas. However, living in California, I rarely have a chance to patronize them. Was in town visiting this past weekend, so I finally had my chance. Turns out that we liked it so much on Saturday that we came back again the next night on Sunday!

In order to avoid the wait. we had reservations both times. On Saturday, Andres C. Rodriguez was singing and playing some beautiful acoustic guitar, so we decided to sit outside to listen. Even though it was over 80 degrees, it was OK, since the sun wasn't on us. Colin was our server, and he did a great job. Good selection of local beers on tap in 18 and 12 ounce sizes.

Started with Oysters Pappadeaux with crabmeat, spinach & hollandaise, which was absolutely insane! Mom and I agreed that it may indeed have been the best single dish that we have ever eaten and a good value at $13.95 for six. Despite the cooking, the oysters were still juicy and not overdone. I had the amazing Seafood Platter, which included Fried tilapia, shrimp, blue crab cake, stuffed shrimp & stuffed crab with French fries. So much food...I couldn't finish it! Had the fries and one of the tilapia fillets for breakfast! The tilapia was very lightly breaded and perfectly fired. Still very juicy inside. Perhaps the best fried fish anywhere. Mom had sauteed soft shell crabs with dirty rice. No...room...for...dessert! 

On Sunday, we went inside. Nice cozy, dark space. We tried to be clever, but we still over-ordered. Started with the complimentary warm baguette and the small Greek salad, which was expertly assembled table-side and was 100% crisp and fresh. Shared a full bowl of seafood gumbo. Amazing flavor, with okra, crab and tons of shrimp! Followed by Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes over crawfish in a light butter sauce ($23 for two) They were served with a garnish of potato sticks and a bit over-wrought for my taste. No need for breading...these deserve to be broiled. Loved the sauce...mopped it all up!

For our entree, we ordered the Crawfish sampler which was half fried crawfish and half Crawfish etouffee over dirty rice. Took a few bites of the fried while it was warm. It was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. No need for extra sauces. Took the rest to-go. Etouffee had tons of large, juicy tails. It was delicious, even when re-heated in a microwave (I know, god forbid!!!)

One of the good parts about a chain is consistency, in food quality and service. Both were made very clear at this location. The prices aren't cheap, but it's not ridiculous either. Both times, our bill for two, with drinks was in the $90 range. Wish I lived closer. I'm now dying to find proper Gulf Coast seafood in Los Angeles...it's not easy!

We went in early on a Wed. to avoid the rush.  We sat in a bar booth.  They have a good variety of seafood to pick from the menu, which is something you don't see all the time in Arizona.  Service was good, but began to feel a little rushed as we lingered over desert.  We split a Caesar Salad which was very fresh but a bit overdressed and it came with a small loaf of warm French bread..  The 2 different salmon dishes we ordered were really good, well seasoned and cooked to exactly as ordered (didn't need the side sauce.)  By the way the house margarita is pretty good as well. One came out with broccoli rob instead of the green beans on the menu, but  the waiter quickly took it back and returned with the beans and gave us a couple glasses of wine for the mistake.  We finished with coffee and a Pecan Cheesecake which was very good. When we left there were a bunch of people inline waiting for a table and the place was packed. All and all we considered the experience to be positive and will return again. I have heard wait time during peak time can be greater than a hour, so I would suggest to go in off hours or plan a large wait time.
So freaking delicious!   I love this place.  Crawfish Etouffee is to die for!

We love the food here but quite honestly had the most hideous service ever!  Our waiter would walk by, see we needed drinks, whatever and go hang out with the hostess.  Every time we had to throw a hand up....bizarre because it's not cheap! I finally went in to ask him to please take our order and a manager I thought took note but actually not.  We drive 30+ minutes to get here and most likely won't do it again!  Back to our old school
Salt Cellar...if jimmy n is your waiter run for your life!

Came here for Oysters Blue Point which were very good. The presentation was nice. The server we had which was a lady was new but very professional, and accommodating. I was here for a business meeting and the manager came by the table to confirm with my partner on the ingredients in a soup that he had ordered to avoid any food allergies. The service is pretty good here but on this particular day I was really blown away. They have gotten better over the years with changing their menu, and providing the best service. They really left a lasting impression on my client as well as myself

Pappadaux is my favorite seafood place in Phoenix!  The alligator is fabulous and tastes just like chicken!  The portions are huge so we usually split an entree, have an app and some wine and still get out of there for $100 and are stuffed.  You can swap out the fish on the menus with any other fish they have.  So if the menus says it's a salmon dish, you can pick a red fish or halibut or anything else they have.
Good food but unless you make reservations it's a long wait. Super loud in there. Becoming less of a favorite for me.
Experienced happy hour for the first time.  Amazing food and drink for cheap prices.  Only downer the bar tender.  It was a pasted on smile.  I will return and take people with me.

IMHO the meals at Pappadeaux look better than they actually taste.  The flavors were either underwhelming or over salted.  But, they have a great staff that aims to please and is very good about providing substitutions for anything on their extensive menu.  

What I found amazing were the desserts.  And as picky az I'm iz, it's hard to find amazing restaurant food.  Anyway, this review is strictly for the dessert.  Very yummy!  If I could eat sweets all day, I would order all desserts and feast like a Roman.  

The usual suspects:  vanilla cheesecake, praline cheesecake, chocolate cake, bread pudding, creme brule, banana pudding, key lime pie, pecan/sweet potato pie.  Some were topped a la mode, some with yummy creme, berries, thin vanilla wafer, and came with sauces.  (I don't care for sweet sauces with desserts.  That's just overkill.  For goodness sake, aren't we obese enough?)

Who(m)ever is doin' the desserts is mmm oohhh mmm yeah

doin' it and doin' it and doin' it WOW 
doin' it and doin' it and doin' it WOW 

The portions are large so unless you're a glutton like me, you'll need to share.  Move over salmon!  These are the ones that I made room for:

1.  Banana pudding comes in a mason jar that's your keepsake.  Make sure you get a lid, too.  Topped with a tall serving of whipped cream, side strawberry, and a thin vanilla wafer.  I hadn't eaten whipped cream in such a long time, I ate it fast but it took a good five minutes before actually getting to the pudding.  Not a pudding fan, but it looked so pretty, I had to try it.  

2.  Slices of cheesecakes looked about 4" in height and the top is browned so you can tell that they've been baked, deliciously, and then topped with whipped cream and berries.  One came with strawberry sauce, the other with caramel sauce.  The cheese sat on thick graham [Of Course!] crust.  It was hard to stop eating - ur, tasting - these.  

3.  Slice of key lime pie was...key lime pie.  Decent sweet / tartness and a good thick crust.  Holds its own, but I'm not an avid eater of key lime.

4.  Slice of pecan/sweet potato pie came a la mode, quite sweet, and came with bourbon sauce.  The top is packed with pecan halves layered over the sweet potato.  Unfortunately the syrup from the pie, over powers the potato layer (which I could not even taste) and seeps into the crust.  I love pecans.  I love sweet potato.  But I gots no love for syrup.  It sort of ruined the pie.  Did I eat it though?  Sho' nough!

After all the positive reviews the hubby & I decided to check it out. Upon entering everything looks great, the place is spacious and we were greeted and seated immediately. 

I ordered the cajun comb and my husband got the tilipia. While we're waiting for our meals to arrive our waiter offered us fresh baked bread right out of the oven. Not wanting to fill up on bread we declined. We're still sitting there when a roach scurries arcoss the ledge near our booth. ALL BUGS FREAK ME OUT!!!!!!! My husband said it wasn't that big a deal and I should just calm down. The table next to us received their food a couple of minutes before us, as soon as the waiter sat the food on the tray flies swarmed. I tried not to FREAK out but I was really getting uneasy about the safety of our food. Finally, our food comes out a couple of minutes later and I'm eyeballing it like a hawk.....no flies touched it, but it didn't stop them from trying to attack our food once it arrived. It's hard to enjoy your meal while you're swatting away flies and make sure roaches are coming up behind you. 

On to the food, my fish was salty and my husband's was buttery. 2 perfectly good pieces of fish were ruined.

While I went to the restroom my hubby ordered a slice of keylime pie for me. The pie was delicious, our waiter was great, the people watching is extremely interesting, but we will never return here.

I would've given Pappadeaux a 5 star rating, but our service the day I went wasn't the best. Other than that, they have a great gluten free menu! Check out my full review here: http://www.adventuresofahungrylatina.com/restaurant-review-pappadeaux/
Lived in Louisiana for three years. Best Crawfish served daily. The Bisque soup is the very best with Crawfish isn't it amazingly great. Good deserts and Cold beer and great Wine.

I went here for my dad's wedding reception I made a reservation for 10 people and they have a table ready a half an hour before the reserved time. They also texted me to remind me of the reservation before hand. The staff let me set up decorations on the table before the couple arrived and they even offered to help. Our waitress Jannie was super sweet and very attentive!!! Loved her. The restaurant even paid for the newlyweds meal, those small touches really made the experience great. We will definitely be back
The food is pricey but if you need a spot to celebrate this will get the job done. Everything was delicious and service was well done.

Thank you, Pappadeaux, for giving us landlocked Phoenicians a nice seafood place that doesn't break the bank.  The relatives from up north were coming to town and the request was for those classicly native Phoenician foods, lobster and crab legs.  There were going to be 8 of us, and I was getting ready to take out the $1,000 bank loan when Yelp pointed me to Pappadeaux.   Thank goodness they take reservations for 8 or more.  I'm all over it.

Turns out it was crawdad night (crawfish for you cultured Creoles), and the place was an absolute madhouse.  We lucked out finding a parking spot and slowly made our way through the crush of people waiting outside.  I lost my entire party in the crowd and by the time I made it to the hostess desk was sure our reservation was a goner.  But the disheveled hostess, who probably suffers from PTSD after that night, said we were good.  whew.  I sent a rescue crew to retrieve my lost troops.

It was incredibly noisy so we had to do some strategic table placement for the hard of hearing.

The service was impeccable.  Demands for substitutions, butter sent back because it was too salty, help needed for seafood haters - our waiter fielded them all calmly and accommodated even the pickiest requests. 

Everyone loved their food, which really was very good.  I got my favorite banana pudding - who needs an entree, really.  The bill was reasonable and everyone was happy.  Another mission accomplished, another bullet dodged.

This place is aight. I would come here for the oyster appitizer. in fact that's probably the only reason why i would come here. The food is ok at best, nothing that really blows me away. I still think this place is over priced for what it really is. Honestly if you want sea food for cheap, and sea food that i caught and cooked the same day, just go to mexico. It's better, its more fresh, and you don't get ripped off (unless you're an idiot and you set yourself up for failure).

Had the Costa Rican Blackened Mahi-Cooked Perfectly
Also had the Oyster Duo-Both were excellent.
Very pleasantly surprised by this restaurant!

I just don't see how this place gets so much credit. Maybe the illusion of how good it is is set by the high prices. Having lived in Louisiana for 18 years, this place doesn't do Cajun a whole lot of justice. Yet it's always packed which makes it less appealing in my book. There is no desirable ambiance and the tables are snugged up together too tight to make conversion at your own enjoyable.

There are more atmosphere friendly places in the valley with much better food and much better prices, like Baby Kay's. Spices are much more spot on as well.
Love this place! Great food! Great drinks! Beautiful patio and copeous amounts of space for parties of all shapes and sizes.

Pappadeaux was definitely a highlight of my trip to PHX. The Oysters were great, fried alligator was moist, bread was fresh, lobster bisque was flavorful (altho a tad salty), and the blacked cat fish I had was cooked perfectly. 

Hard to imagine better than this outside of NOLA.

Enjoy!

Stopped in as it was an easy pit-stop on our way home from flagstaff to Tucson. Our meals were a-ok. Service was slow considering the restaurant was pretty empty when we arrived. The waiter was apologetic and implied they were having kitchen issues.

I had the catfish lunch plate that came with a shrimp, toast gravy dish on the side and fries. (Sorry I can't recall what the side was called) Fries were really bad, also tasted old. Plenty of shrimp with dish and the gravy was good. Pretty heavy dish! I'll agree with Cindy N- definitely a ton of salt in their dishes. The catfish was tasty. My other half had the Pasta Mardi Gras and enjoyed it, seemed to be plenty of seafood in it as well. Although he said there was very little heat to it. 

I don't know if we will rush here again.

My wife and I stopped in here on Saturday night after the D'Backs game and were told there would be an hour and half wait.  The very visually frazzled hostess kept her composer and let us know that the bar area is first come first serve so we decided to try there.  We scored some seats within 10 minutes and were immediately met by Sarah the bartender and the smiles and service never stopped.  Based on our questions Sarah knew it was our first time and really explained their menu and how everything works.  Our whisky was 10$ a glass but based on the "long pour" it was worth it.  There was a mistake in the kitchen and someone miss ordered a crab legs, we scored because Sarah brought them to us to try.  AMAZING... I ordered a sampler trio as our appetizer and the wife loved it all until she realized it was not breaded chicken and little chunks of lobster in the seafood fondue (I may have led her on a little) but rather alligator and crawfish.  The smile on her face (maybe the whisky) or just the general fun atmosphere and the food quality was well worth the total bill at the end of the night.  I can't wait to go back...
Amazing food. I've tried almost everything on the menu from the gumbo to the alligator and this place doesn't ever fall short. Definitely try it if you haven't already!

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Phoenix! It's food is not like anything else I've really found anywhere else. The alligator tail is amazing and I love the waiter told me you can order it half fried and half blackened bc both ways is delish! The only downside is it's a little pricey but you do get what you pay for.

I love this place - I especially love their Fried chef's platter and the Calamari appetizer.  I often have the Calamari appetizer for dinner - it is THAT good. The Calamari is fried but then mixed with artichokes and feta cheese and tossed with a lemon garlic sauce.  It is really wonderful.  My husband and son love the fried cray fish and my son loves the catfish.  Here is the thing - I don't think they take reservations so you have to just get there early.  Bar seating is limited or you sit outside so if they are crowded, you may have to wait.  It is very popular so often crowded.  But, it is worth the wait.

This always a go to spot for us for great seafood. Even though they were busy as heck tonight they offered to comp an entree for me. The service is great and food is amazing and tasty. The unique atmosphere and ambience makes you feel like your in the dirty south. Love this place. I had the usual appetizer trio and also the scallops in my opinion were the best!

I don't give five stars very often, but yes Pappadeaux's deserves them all. Coming from the east coast, I do miss my seafood. I'm a bit wary of any seafood I get in the Valley because it obviously has to be flown or trucked into the desert. 

Pappadeaux's was recommended to me before I even arrived in Phoenix. The moving company driver told me about this place when he was loading my belongings on his 18-wheeler in North Carolina. I found the place on Yelp, showed him the picture, and he said, "Yep! That's it!" I bookmarked it in the app to check out. 

I've been here a couple times already, but for some reason hadn't reviewed it yet. I most recently came with a friend for his company dinner (dinner on the boss! yay!). I had lobster, shrimp, oysters (fried and on the half-shell), calamari, and something else I can't even remember. The food has always been great. They have some pretty good salads and other items on the menu if you're not into seafood (my friend isn't, so that came in handy).  

Love this place -- will definitely come back!
Have to be the best and the freshest seafood money can buy. Price is little bit on the higher side but the quality is as great as the price. Worth it.

We only go here about once a year to celebrate something really special. However, I crave the Chilean sea bass dinner all year long. It's some of the best I've ever had. It is pricey, but worth it. My husband always tries something different and everything he's tried has been perfect and delicious.

Went there on a Tuesday and was very busy but they were able to seat us right away. Took my parents for the first time and my Mom was not so sure about what kind of food it was. Me, my wife and Dad loved what we ordered...fried oysters, fried crayfish, and Dad had the shrimp special. So the first part of this review is to say the food was awesome! So now  how the service is awesome! My Mom was not too adventurous so only originally  ordered a salad...even while we all sat waiting for Mom to order, our server Ryan did not get annoyed...did not act like "come on lady" but was so nice and waited. Then...my Mom decided she wanted an appetizer...the awesome crab Mac'N'Cheese. Ryan did warn us that since he already put in our entree  order he could not guarantee it would come out at the same time...I know Ryan made sure that happened! Our order came out awesome and all at the same time...and mom loved the dish!

My sister and I went to Pappadeaux's for a sisterly dinner a few nights ago and had a good time. 

For apps we ordered fried alligator and fried frogs legs. I've had alligator before so the fried alligator was very tasty! The fried frogs legs... well that gets a "meh" from the both of us. But the fried alligator pretty much set the bar for everything else.

My entre was fried oysters and fried catfish with a baked potato. It was a lot of food and we did end up getting baggies for our left overs. Our bad for filling up on the apps and warm bread.  OH yesh, you get fresh bread and butter along with your drinks. :) Awesome.

We did order dessert.. and those were very very delicious!
