My overall exp' with this place was great. Our waitress was good. She was very knowledgeable and did not act condescending with all of my questions. 

The atmosphere was good.. that place has good vibes!

I really don't have anything negative to say other than maybe the pricey food, but that's really it. And what we spent for 2 people, including tip, was about $100.00. 

My sister would say some of the food was salty. 

Would I eat here again? Yes. But I'd probably say no to the bread so I can thoroughly enjoy my entre, lol.

I love this place. From gumbo, to crawfish I have never had anything bad here. 
The service is always stellar, I have had the pleasure to talk to some of the new waiters in training and it is intense apparently. They have to have the menus memorized backwards and forwards and be able to answer just about any question you can think of on the spot.

However if I can give one piece of advise:
Save room for dessert. Their dessert tray is to die for and they will bring it to your table so you can see everything on it and make your choice, then they will make you a fresh one of whatever you choose.

Pros: 
Great for families
Great food
Amazing Service

Con:
Kinda expensive on the wallet

Visited Pappadeaux's on a Friday around 8pm and there was no wait so we quickly ordered drinks and began looking at the menus.  We munched on bread while we waited for our dinner.  I ordered the Seafood Platter ($25) while my friend ordered a pasta and seafood dish ($30).  Our waiter was Brian and he was a friendly guy. He appeared to be new as he had to see the menu to know what sides and such we would receive.  The blue lump crab cake was good, but not as good as I remembered. All the food seemed to taste the same.  I also had the spaghetti squash and it was fairly bland. My friend devoured her pasta and seafood dish, but it wasn't much food for the price.
Great spot. Had oysters YUMMY.. Ryan at the bar..Awesome service.. This is the spot for seafood in the desert.huge menu. Beautiful outdoor   seating

I had the Crispy Alaskan Salmon & Scallop, and Crete Brûlée. Both were excellent. My main arrived a little cool. I asked the server to warm it up. The manager cane over right away, treated me to a beverage, and removed the main from my bill (which was not necessary but appreciated). I enjoyed every bite. Excellent old fashioned service and cooking deserves 5 stars.

Wow, I'm going to have to give my first awful review. Waited 15 minutes for our first waiter visit, then another 15 minutes for a glass of water, so we were 45 minutes in before ordering. I had such high hopes for a good sea food experience in the desert. Their menu says, "fresh fish flown in daily," but I know what frozen filets taste like. I ordered the naked halibut. The Brussels sprouts were flavorful, burnt and very oily. Oily as in sitting in a pool of oil. The halibut might have been okay if it had come out to the table on time but it had obviously sat in the window for at least 15 or 20 minutes, because it was maybe just barely luke warm and extremely dry. I was tempted to suffer through it with a smile but three bites in I crunched into a small pebble. I gave up after that. My wife ordered the redfish risotto. The risotto was decent but the fish was cold, dry and over salted. Son ordered chicken fingers. They were extra extra well done (over fried) as well, and he said the fries tasted like cardboard. Truly disappointing.
This was a very good place the food was awesome and very good I would love to keep going back but I don't have the money super good eating there if I become rich I will always be there
Excellent restaurant, very fresh seafood, and a nice ambience. Our server was a bit wet behind the ears, but polite. I would definitely come here again! Good place for a date night.

I have never been here before and based on my experience tonight I do not see a return anytime soon. My evening started when we were seated in probably the worst seat in the house. I asked the hostess for a booth and she ignored my request. I wear a prosthetic leg, so a booth is prefered.Then she sits us at a seat that is right next to the main line of traffic and right by the door. There were many other tables available in the restaurant.The table was about to fall over because it was not leveled out. We were approached by a stuffy waiter that was snobbish and rude.  He was not delightful at all. When we placed our order , I was informed that what i wanted was not available. I asked why the hostess or he did not tell us when we sat down that some items were sold out. I was simply responded with a completely ridiculous excuse. Since my guest had already ordered I was rushed into making a selection. The waiter left and the manager came over and was far from genuine in assisting us, mentioning in a sarcastic tone that she heard I was not happy. After offering absolutely no remediation whatsoever she left. I am still confused as to why she even came by.  When our food came the lady that delivered it, simply walked up and started moving plates that we were eating our appetizers off of. She dumped our food off without a word... 

On a single positive note the food was good, but I can get bad service at a fraction of the price anywhere. I am convinced that this restaurant has convinced themselves that they are too good for their guests.  

Summary: Bad service, horrible guest service from every single person we came in contact with and the seating is clearly specific to what they think you are going to spend or some other type of metric that I am unaware of. I have to say that this was the absolute worst dining experience that I have had in a fine restaurant ever in my life. It is to bad, because the food was really good.

Be prepared to wait 10 minutes on the phone just to place a togo order, and then deal with a rude server on the other end. The food was flavorless, which is the furthest thing from what you expect from a creole inspired restaurant. I tried to contact management and was not followed up with.

One of the best restaurants around!!!.. Austrailian lobster tails....fried gator...pretty much everything on the menu is terrific!!!. If ever near or passing a pappadeaux's, please stop and go sit down and eat and you will not be disappointed!!!. When in the area this is my favorite place to dine at!!!!!.:)

What a treat it was to eat here. For appetizers we had the fried alligator, calamari, baked oysters and raw on the half shell.  For dinner I had the ATLANTIC SALMON ALEXANDER - Blackened salmon with shrimp, scallops & crawfish in a white wine cream sauce, with dirty rice. Everything was prepared to perfection. The service was outstanding and the atmosphere was phenomenal. This was my second time eating at this restaurant. The first was in TX and now in AZ.  It is a seafood lovers paradise. Enjoy.

For being a chain restaurant, Pappadeaux is pretty good.  For an appetizer, I usually have the Blackened Shrimp & Crawfish Fondeaux or the Lump Crab & Spinach Dip;  both are luscious and come with French bread.  My two favorite entrees are the Crawfish Etouffee with white rice and the Pontchartrain Panbroiled Fillet.  My adult beverage of choice is the Swamp Thing.  I do not know what is in it but it is quite tasty and pretty to look at (Yes, I'm a girl!).  I have never had dessert;  have always been too full.  However, my sister and nephew swear by the banana pudding which is served in a Mason jar (Ick!).

The only real draw back  to Pappadeaux is the wait for a table.  No matter when I have gone, the wait has always been at least an hour.

EVERYTHING I have had here is amazing. I'm just going to make this review short and sweet. GO THERE. It's worth the wait. Always busy, but fun atmosphere and you will love the appetizers, entrees and desserts. AND the drinks. Only place I will make the drive to from Gilbert. I heard people travel from different states to come here! I get it now! ;)
What can I say, oysters are the bomb here, and the deserts are top notch, my favorites are the key lime pie and tried a new one called pumpkin cheesecake - delicous!

Ok, it has been awhile since we ate here. The food is pretty good, but not outstanding this time. It used to be out standing. The portion sizes used to be outstanding; not anymore. The service used to be outstanding...and yes not anymore. I will allow everyone has an off night, but Aubrey B. Was not very on tonight....sorry. Ok baked oysters where very good...the rested just ok.

I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile now..I've been hearing few of my coworkers that the food is pretty good.. it's a little pricey but other then that it was pretty good.. we ordered the calamari which I liked..we ordered the small portion which I thought was the perfect amount before having our meal.. my boyfriend ordered the soft shell crab and I ordered the mardi gra pasta which was pretty delicious.. the restaurant is pretty big, bigger then I thought it was going to be... the staff was pretty friendly and even though it was a little busy our waitress still checked up on us which I liked...

Your one-stop destination for all the Cajun food you've been craving. Met up with friends here for a Wednesday night outing, so that we could try their boiled crawfish. I have to say that this is crawfish done right... and at $3.95/lb, you can't beat the value.

We started with an appetizer of Blackened Shrimp & Crawfish Fondeaux with garlic bread, which was free by using a coupon I got by signing up on their website and providing my e-mail address. I would've been a bit disappointed if I had paid for this particular appetizer, since it skimped on the bits of seafood and wasn't a particularly well-done fondue (not nearly cheesy enough), but it kept the group I was with something to nosh on while we waited on our entree orders. Judging from the other reviews, this place is always busy.

I was very happy with the 7-oz. Blackened Mahi Yvette covered with shrimp, crawfish, mushrooms and spinach in a Monterey Jack cheese sauce. No need to order the larger 11-oz. filet, since I had already started filling up on bread, fondue, and a dinner salad. The dirty rice was delicious and scarfable.

Everyone seemed more than happy with their selections as we all shared and sampled from each others' plates of oysters on the half shell, boiled crawfish, and fried alligator. I think the place delivered a great value on the meal, a fantastic selection of nearly every Cajun delight you can think of (although I have yet to spot the elusive Muffaletta on area restaurants' menus), and a great dining experience. This place IS busy... I can only imagine the crowd on the weekends, but the wait staff did their best to be attentive and tend to all of our requests.

We left satisfied and stuffed, reeking of Cajun spices. Now if only they had some Oompah Loompahs available to roll me to my car...

With seafood cravings at an all time high, I had high expectations of Pappadeaux, I mean it has the word seafood in it's name after all ...

I came here for dinner with intentions of ordering oysters and possibly trying their other signature items I've heard so much about. Kind of gimmicky since it's has that themed restaurant feel, think Bubba Gump's, Red Lobster and the likes. It's dark and covered with seaside/fishing decor.

I went with a Watermelon Lemonade to sip on. A dozen Blue Point oysters and the Appetizer Trio to share. No entrees here as we knew this place does hefty portions. The service here is good and very quick, they refill waters with a quickness!

The Watermelon Lemonade was okay, just a lemonade with watermelon syrup and really sweet.

The Blue Point Oysters were good, though they came with horseradish, cocktail sauce ,spicy soy sauce and lemons, I was hoping they would at least have served it with a mignonette. The horseradish was okay, cocktail sauce too sweet and the spicy soy sauce was just plain wrong. I ended up eating the oysters with lemon and tabasco. Nice and slightly more briney than the Pacific oysters that were also on the menu and had more of a bite to them.

The Appetizer Trio came with fried gator, Crawfish/Shrimp Fondeaux and Smoked Salmon. To be quite honest, the fried gator is hands down amazing! I have never had gator and didn't expect it to be so juicy, tender and delicious. The sauce they serve it with is such a great pairing. The Smoked Salmon was juicy and cooked well, slightly smokey flavor. The Fondeaux tasted too strange for my liking, the shrimp tasted off, crawfish was a bit tough and the cheese for the Fondeaux did not pair well with the seafood and garlic bread.

This place is pretty pricey, appetizers go from $10-16 and the entrees from what I recall go from $25+ 

The only thing that was good about Pappadeaux was their fried gator, other than that I would have to pass.
If you have a spare $100 and are not real hungry go here. Long wait,poor service very average food at best but hard to tell when it comes out cold

Two stars for service- food as always great but do not have a large party here- we where a party of 14 and quite frankly it was way to overwhelming for our waitress- after some fraustrating minutes waiting on our drink I asked the manager if she needed help? Manager did she was one of her better waitress- we'll all went down hill from that moment - 20 minutes wait for refills, drinks and that is with constantly asking- I can go on.
It a shame because I was entertaining customers and they were quite surprised by the service.
One more thing - I ordered desert to go, when I got to my hotel- no utensils! Well fist time I had cheese cake as a finger food.

I went here for happy hour today.  The bartender was very attentive. I ordered shrimp and crawfish fondeaux and catfish beignets. I also ordered a large swamp thing to drink. The swamp thing was really good. The catfish beignets were delicious. I didn't love the fondeaux though. First of all it had mushrooms in it and I hate mushrooms. But also the shrimp tasted like dirty dishwater, which is not unusual for shrimp in my opinion, but that ruined the fondeaux for me. Overall my experience was A-Ok.
all the way from cali,had to have this place oh how i love the food great place icant lie i love there food

I am all about great customer service and after my last experience, I considered Pappadeaux's off of our restraurant rotation. I was promptly contacted by the customer relations department and they assured me that my experience did not meet their standards for service or food.  This level of attention exceeded my expectations. After another visit, I am once again a FAN!!!!

Well worth the drive from Chandler... there have been many who have tired to duplicate but this is the closest to NOLA food there is here in the valley.  The atmosphere is great, the staff is always prompt and polite... and if you sign up for the email club you get a comp dessert for your birthday..get here

I personally think this is great food! Best clam chowder I've ever had. The wait can be harsh and long,  but it's worth it and it gets really busy so I understand why. overall, great food and great waitresses and waiters!

Oh Papadeaux, you are one of my most f-a-v-o-r-i-t-e places to go enjoy a lovely, fresh and deliciously flavorful creole or Cajun seafood meal. I love the ambiance of this place as it truly feels like I'm back again in NOLA. I don't even mind waiting 30 or so minutes to be seated while live blues music serenades me in preparation for those addictive flavors to come. The sights, the smells, the sounds, the service and most importantly the flavors, Papadeaux consistently delivers the entire package. I most certainly will return again and again!

Honestly this was the best meal with my family in a very long time. Not only is this place absolutely beautiful, the staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the food is amazing! I had the spiked cherry limeade with my dinner (yum!). We also had both the calamari  and the alligator and appetizers. My husband and daughter had steak and lobster and I had the grilled shrimp brochettes. Each dish was fresh and flavorful! Not a dud in the bunch. We had a wonderful time and are looking forward to returning.

Been craving Pappadeaux's ... I'm from out of town and try to stop by whenever I pass through Phoenix. I have to say that this trip by far was my best experience. From the moment we walked through the door till the moment we left the service was beyond fantastic. Cierra our server was incredibly knowledgable, attentive, friendly and could not have been any better. (Thank you) drinks never with empty food was quick and fresh and absolutely delicious as usual. I eat out often and don't typically do too many yelp reviews but could not go another moment without posting how satisfied we were with our experience. Thanks again Cierra for being so wonderful.

I have a love/hate with Pappadeaux. Their prices are high, the selection is great but not so great.  $20 for a catfish plate is exorbitant; however, what they do, they do it well.  The catfish was perfect, especially with a side of grits and bottle of Louisiana hot sauce.  The platters are huge and enough for two people to share. Not much in the way of non-seafood options - which made it hard for my family members that don't eat seafood to find something. That menu needs to be expanded to more than $40 steaks.  

The Mediterranean Calamari appetizer is $20 and the best app on the menu - however, it's a huge plate for a large table.  I wish had a smaller option.  Only 2 people at our table would eat such a thing but no way could we tackle such a huge plate and calamari isn't something you can take home for later. 

This restaurant has the best patio in the valley.  Open air, fans and misters, lots of greenery and shade.  I could spend forever on Pappadeaux's patio. 

Our waiter was excellent, though the food took a long time. I think it was the stinking steak being cooked. 

*So here is your take-way: Only come with seafood lovers (the rest will be uncomfortable), sit on the patio, have plenty of time to hang out, and be prepared for a high bill - but you won't be disappointed by the food or the atmosphere.

Have been coming to this restaurant for the past 10 years and have always had great food and service . But this time was horrible! Me and wife wife usually seat at the bar for dinner and have great time. We went tonight and Bartender/waiter didn't know what they were doing . No silverware asked twice then were provided. Waited 10 minutes before asked for the order and waited 20 min just to get the appetizer . One of the appetizers were had to be send back . The bartenders Dominic and cierra  had no energy , and enthusiasm and provided horrible service no attention to detail.
Food and service is amazing!  Waitress Audrey was excellent!!!!  Everything that is seafood is so good. I cannot wait to dine here again next!
Went on date night and was Amazed! Fantastic food, great staff, awesome cocktails! Just have to be patient, it's Very popular, which means it Very crowded and long wait! But the bar helps with that!

Overpriced, mediocre food. The wife's lobster was dry, my pasta dish had shrimp and inedible pieces of sausage. The ambiance was crowded and hectic, service was nothing to brag about. Bread was late, but was about the best thing about the meal. I think I'll not be returning.

Have been here once before  and decided to bring my daughter here for her first time. Though they were not crowded, they took us to the very back to were there was a party of 15 and the surrounding tables were full. You would think they would spread out the guests so we didn't feel like we were on top of each other.
I agree with many, that the food is fine but is overpriced. I ordered mussels, which I have had before. When they came, I immediately was taken aback by the smell. I tried one and it turned to to mush in my mouth, I had to spit it out. From what I have learned, theses mussels were caught when spawning which cause their meat to turn to mush. Had to send back and order something else. 
It is also very noisy and hard to have a good conversation.
All in all, an ok experience, just ok food for a high price.

I really don't give 5 stars that often (ever?) but I absolutely love Pappadeaux.

Both times I have eaten there, I've gotten absolutely delicious food across the board.  Typically I will have appetizers (mussels, clams, some gumbo, etc.) but I've also had the trout (which was delicious).  I find their food seasoned well, balanced in flavor, and visually appetizing without tasting too greasy or obnoxiously oily/buttery.

They are open late as well, and the drinks are outstanding.  Fresh lime juice margaritas, not too sweet, with Patron where they don't skimp on the booze?  What can be better?

Pardon my brevity on this review, but just go and you won't be disappointed.  Hats off to the Pappas' group for bringing a great restaurant to Phoenix.  Please don't expand and ruin a good thing either!
This is probably my favorite seafood restaurant! It is pricey, and on some nights there is a long wait, but the food is excellent! If you go in the winter sit outdoors, you won't regret it!

I'm having a real hard time writing a review for this restaurant. I want to write a great review, but I don't wanna use the words "superb" or "excellent" when describing the food, and I don't wanna say the service was "friendly" since all of these are overdone. So let me give this a shot: 

Upon walking inside I'm greeted with "The Saints Go Marching In" playing in the background and the aroma of some great food being served. The four of us go to the auxiliary bar (4 stools inside, main purpose is to drink up the patio guests) and have a seat and order drinks from our lovely waitress. Her timing was right on the button with EVERYTHING as drinks were always full and there was no lull between courses. 

As for the food, WOW. For the appetizer I went with an order of the Lotsa Shrimp. One dozen cold boiled shrimp (whatever cold boiled means) served with cocktail sauce mixed with fresh horseradish. Boy let me tell you that puts every shrimp cocktail I've had between San Francisco and New York to shame. Just the right amount of kick to it, but not the same old lame old. 

For the entree I had the Pasta New Orleans. Overall just an explosion in Cajun flavoring going on in my bowl. A wonderful blend of linguine, crawfish, sausage, mushrooms, and jumbo shrimp mixed in with a creamy yet spicy marinara sauce. And unlike every other place that skimps on the fish, you will not be disappointed here. Portions here are big, so bring an appetite. 

I hate writing lengthy reviews, (yes this is lengthy to me) but this place deserves it. One of the best meals I've had in a long time as far as value for the meal, overall presentation of the meal and restaurant, and just an overall well trained and attentive staff. 

I normally don't drive west of the 51 freeway, but I'm looking for reasons to do so now.

Soooo amazing! The 1000+ positive reviews alone show how good this restaurant is and they were right. I was very impressed with the food and service here. Came on a Saturday late night and when I called around 8pm to gauge to wait I was told 45 minutes to 1 hour yikes. We decided to go anyway and take our chances. Just our luck that soon as we put our names down a booth in the bar area opened up so we got super lucky and were able to get seated instantly. My sister and I shared baked crab mac and cheese, gumbo, crawfish bisque and fried shrimp with fries. Don't come here with a small appetite because the menu is so vast that it's so tempting to order more and more just to try everything especially if you are a seafood lover like myself. I thought the prices were reasonable which was another impressive point. The drink menu is also very expansive with lots of cool options so overall this is a great place not just for food, but if you want just a drink since the bar area itself is quite large. For sure recommend!

They've gone down in general.  Portions are smaller for happy hour.  Service is still aright.  Drained the pond out front.  Sad.  Bread and butter were not fresh last week and I always look forward to THAT simple pleasure .  We can forgive the burnt and salty lobster since they gave us a new one on the house without us even asking.  Just disappointed as we used to LOVE this place.

While returning from a trip up North, the timing was perfect to head over to Pappadeaux (only 1 location in the Valley) en route to heading home. Typically the wait can be LONG but catching them on Sunday afternoon for lunch was perfect.

Just me and the kid and I sold the idea of this place over a fast food chain after being in the car for a while. As expected, no real wait. We were seated immediately but after the initial table, I made a request to move us to the bar area with a booth and a view of the AFC Championship Football game. Worked out perfectly!!! 

Needing a drink, I went with the Strawberry Mangearux Tango drink, a Kids Fried Shrimp & fries meal, and a Louisiana Gumbo & Po boy combo. I wasn't sure what to expect with the PoBoy but figured if it wasn't enough shrimp I'll just steal from the kid. That wasn't the case for lunch. Po Boy sandwich had plenty of shrimp (maybe just 1 sliced pickle too much, but easy to remove) and good complimentary ingredients. Bread used wasn't the same as the baguette type brought out with butter prior to the meal but same taste. Instead of Fries with the Po Boy, that's where the Gumbo came into play. A few choices, but when I heard Andouille sausage everything was a blur. With family roots tied to the south and one of the family's specialized "go to meal" of gumbo, It's always hard for me not to be critical of any others. This one was cool... A little too much juice, but decent flavor. I like mine a bit thicker so some Gumbo Filet may have helped resolve. 

Good options for lunch and the timing from order to table wasn't so bad with the football game playing & kids menu games going on. Next time I plan to give the oysters and fish a go as many of the fish plates leaving the kitchen were looking good...

The best Cajun seafood I've had so far. Everything was perfect as far as service and food. Expect to wait a little bit on a weekend, but well worth it. Everything had the right flavors and serving sizes are large! Shared the alligator bites as an appetizer which I recommend! The Mardi Gras pasta was huge portion but soo good! The praline cheesecake was literally life changing. Love this place and will definitely come back.

Son of a gun, had some fun on the bayou...  We decided to splurge a little for a special occasion, and I'm glad we did!  Pappadeaux was a really fine evening out with exceptional food, delightful surroundings, and excellent company.  I ordered the lobster despite my inexperience with how to approach it -- our waiter gave me a quick tutorial and I'm so grateful.  My husband ordered Pasta Mardi Gras and loved it - he likes it spicy!  I was glad we left the young 'un home so we could be free and easy on a date night, but we could have brought her as it was kid friendly and she would have enjoyed it.  It was a grand night on the town - we loved the ambiance and the swanky yet unpretentious feel of this place.  Their website says "Fun, Festive & Always Original" and I must agree...

This place is best Seafood restaurant, hands down! 
Servers and staff are very attentive even with a full house. If you are in the area definitely check it out.
I recommend the alligator or frog legs as appetizer.
Our server Ryan M. Was fantabulous!!!

Always awesome never fails me whenever I'm in the city where one is I am there without a doubt this location tends to be busy on the weekends but the bartenders will still noticed you in passing so no complaints here great food
Food is wonderful, the atmosphere perfect, and Alex is a sweet and charming waitress.

They were absurdly busy. I had a bar's eye view of the care that goes into the $3.95 1/2 dozen oysters. I would not order them myself. Dinner felt rushed, I didn't feel like a very valued client, and the poor gentleman next to me waited at least 25-30min for his 1/2 dozen oysters (carelessly drained of their delicious fluids).

My dinner was good, but relied heavily on it's fat content to carry it's flavor. My cocktails were good, I would come back for those.

It took another 10min just to pay my tab after I had finished. My dishes were cleaned up by a bartender who looked like he just run a marathon, dripping with sweat. Not exactly how I like to finish my evening.

Thanks, but no thanks Pappadeaux.

Pappadeaux's Pappadeaux is what my family and I chanted following our dinner...its not like a rally chant PA-PA-DEAUXS! It's more of a shake our heads, what have you done to me and why way of saying it. Papa-deaux's Papa-deaux's.
Cocktails are pricey from the regular menu but tasty.  Great combinations that are not  overwhelmed with alcohol  (some may prefer a stronger drink but I'll forgo the "burn" with my dinner)
Watermelon mule light and refreshing
The Grand Hennessey definitely on the stronger side but still sweet and flavorful.
Pink Sapphire who knew gin could be so tasty?  I did but it was good to have with dinner while the drink taste also light and....pink.
Crab fingers...EAT THESE sauteed.  The lemon garlic butter sauce theyre sauteed in is  delicious.
Seafood gumbo was bland and watery.
Papadeaux's fried seafood platter was average at best.
They had a parpadelle with Roasted squash, shrimp, scallops and crab meat that was very very good.  Pasta and seafood was fresh and the sauce creamy and garlicky.
The star of the table was my Texas Redfish Pontchartrain, this was my 2nd time having redfish and it did not disappoint.  It's served with a brown butter that I can bathe in and dirty rice (dry).  Not over seasoned fish remained flaky and moist. EAT THIS!

This place will make you feel like you are in New Orleans. It has jazz on weekends.Fish is always fresh,never frozen at all.enjoy the ambiance,Jazz on weekends.This place is not for crying babies or kids

Loved it, I can't wait to go back when I'm not on a date so I can make a fool of my self devouring my food in a fashion befitting it's awesomeness. I had fried oysters, and granted you can't mess that up to bad, these were cooked just right (not over done) the baked potato could have been a river boat and was loaded down with all the yummy topping you could wish for. The lobster bisque had nice chunks of lobster in it and it was served with French bread and butter. Now the gumbo was not my favorite all though I was impressed that there were oysters in it. I will also admit I'm from Louisiana and I have a high standard for gumbo as my pawpaw is basically a master at making it. The staff was super friendly. Two request- please get a remoulade sauce, it goes good on everything- and get some family dinning specials. I would love to take my three sons for a meal with out having to sell a kidney.

Food was excellent ambiance was outstanding wait staff...not so much.  Greeters were cool...wait staff...aaaaahhhh...

Get there early to get a spot outside they fill up quick.  Bloody Mary after a night out in Phx was right on point.

I attempted to place an togo order first phone call I held on 12 minutes, second call 4 minutes.  I was informed there was no togo person today. Your menu offers to go ordering. I don't have 16 minutes to waste. I'm done with this company.

Even though it was really super busy and even those very very loud the food was very very good and I had a really good time with my husband on a date and it was very nice to have some down-home south'N N'ORLNs ...

Contrary to the sign in front, this restaurant serves the worst seafood in the Phx valley.  I took some family members to dinner hear on a sunday evening and the experience was a total fail from the beginning.  Despite a plethora of open tables, we were told we would need to wait at least 15 minutes to be seated.  I think this may have been because we were a mixed race family. Predictably, when we were seated we were given a poorly situated table at the back of the bus.  We demanded and were reluctantly given another nearby table.  That should have been a sign to leave, but we stayed to endure a truly terrible and overpriced meal.  We ordered an appetizer platter to share, and then entrees of stuffed fried crab, stuffed fried shrimp, cajun catfish, and a cesar salad.  The only good thing in the entire meal was the salmon on the appetizer plate.  All the other seafood items were over-salted to the point of being almost inedible.  Two family members complained of feeling uncomfortably bloated after dinner due to the salinity of the food.  YUCKERS!!!  The service hear is also atrocious.  Despite the fact that this is a fairly expensive restaurant, it is completely staffed by inexperienced high school and college students. They even attempted to overcharge us for one of our entrees.  I left a 10% tip, which was in retrospect was way too much. No return trip ever!
Love this place... The only thing that upsets me is that the portion of the aligator is so small for the price...and no oyster tonight. Not a good night. Darn

First off, I know I'm going to come off as sounding crazy because it seems like everyone loves this place. I have had 3 separate experiences that just weren't up to par (1st time was a pick-up order & the steak was extremely chewy 2nd time was similar to my experience I had on Sunday.) I went to have dinner with my boyfriend and  we were promptly seated, but that is where the promptness ended. When we finally received our food (both had the seafood sampler for somewhere around $21 per plate) and everything tasted similar without any of the WOW factor I was hoping for. The worst part was when we were done eating the waitress brought us our to-go boxes and then took 30 minutes to bring us the check. We debated on just leaving but decided to be responsible, but lets just say the tip was minimal. Overall this place just wasn't worth my $64 bill at the end of the night. I ended up having a BOMB dinner the next day at Jason's Dell for $20 and I enjoyed it WAY more! nuff said

Much better than I expected being that it's a chain restaurant. The fried alligator was fun and good especially the curry flavored sauce. My Mahi Alexander was delicious as was my husband's Chilean sea bass. I couldn't finish mine so I asked for it to be boxed while we shared some creme Brule. Unfortunately someone tossed my leftovers but no worries they made me a whole new order and didn't charge me for the first! I didn't even complain just thought I wasn't going home with leftovers no big deal but they just did it. Great aercice5
great food. :-)

This is our first of many visits to this excellent Cajun Restaurant. on this trip we got the alligator appetizer,  my wife ordered the seafood platter and I the crayfish platter.

Keep in mind you get a large amount of food for every plate.

Alligators is superb with the perfect amount of tastey spice. Slightly hot but outstanding seasoning. The side sauce is very smokey and pairs perfectly.

The seafood platter was excellent. I ate the crab cake for my wife since it was a bit spicey for her. She loved the fish, shrimp, and the huge baked potato fully loaded. 

Crayfish platter was a huge portion of fried crayfish and a large full serving of crayfish etouffet. Wonderfully seasoned with perfect heat. Amazing food.

Also had the excellent praline pecan cheesecake that surpasses all cheesecakes I gave ever eaten. 

All said and done we had 4 to go boxes that could easily cover two more meals. 

I can not say enough wonderful things. Our waiter was so knowledgeable about every aspect of the food and made our stay outstanding. We asked for the manager to sing his praises. Outstanding guy.

I've been here multiple times throughout my life but this past experience is what made me come onto Yelp and make review.. First, the food is great and I am obsessed with the shrimp and crawfish fondue. I have literally come to Pappdeaux and ordered that as my meal! But what really pushed me to do this review was our waitress Jada. I would come in and wait just to sit in her section! She knew the menu, answered our questions fast, my drink never dipped below half full, she was just fun to talk to, and always had a smile! This girl really made the experience just a bit more fun and personal. I'm all about customer service and she was just off the charts.

Love this little Louisiana Fish House ... it rocks you like a Hurricane ... huge menu with plenty of great choices ... a can't miss place for me in Arizona .. try the Captains Hurricane.. the Cajun Pasta and Gumbo are my favs

I came here for the first time with some friends and my cousins for my cousins birthdays. The food was delicious. The service was on point. I wish I could have remembered our waiter name. Everything was perfect! Thank you!

Pappadeaux gets my 5 stars ! No wonder the Chilean sea bass is on their menu cover. It is absolutely perfect. The kids had the pasta Mardi Gras and  it was great. Look at it this way, no doggy bag is needed at pappadeaux even though the portions are huge, the food is addictive !
Amazing food, gorgeous patio, and an authentic atmosphere. My hands down favorite restaurant in town.

Delicious. The Texas red fish never misses. The crab cakes are always awesome. I've been here
Numerous times and the service and staff have always been great.

If you are a Cajun or from New Orleans you will be disappointed. If youre not and are just looking for a casual seafood restaurant with some hints of Nawlins, then you may like this place. The food was good, just not once you've experienced The Big Easy.  I do agree with the other review, it was very loud!
Great Sea-food with an Outstanding Service Help.........

I've been to this restaurant more than a few times and am rarely disappointed. 

On most occasions I sit at the bar with one or two friends. They have a great atmosphere, decent happy hour, and well trained bartenders. I have never had a "slow service' problem eating here, but then again I rarely sit at the tables. 

It gets busy pretty much EVERYDAY not just on weekends so if you are going with a big group or even just a few people and are gonna want a table, I would recommend calling ahead. 

I would have to say their best deal is when their oysters are on sale for something like 4 buck a dozen. They aren't the most premium oysters (out of season) but still pretty good, especially when they are at a bargain price. Try their blue cheese chopped salad its great, they have some kind of special blue cheese dressing that is something to brag about.

The name of our server today was BEN KYLE and his customer service was BAYOU PERFECT! I'm so happy I dropped in, each visit is more special than the one before. I always get more than just a meal... they truly make me feel like home. PS --- I'm from the south, Dallas, TX to be exact. I was raised on Cajun food from the boot (Louisiana). You guys franchise the taste and feeling well. Thank you.

Came here for a farewell lunch for a retiring coworker.. and boy is this place pricy!  Thank goodness I didn't have to pay for her meal, dodge that bullet.

The quality was decent, but still miles from top notch.  The restaurant was pretty clean, and the staff was pretty attentive and annoying.  Service was super slow due to it being so busy, and the parking sucks.  

I wondered why my subordinate did everything to not come here even pretending that he has the stomach flu and that he was stuck in the loo doing a two.  He knows quality and value, I should of known if he doesn't like it, I probably wouldn't either.

Overall an average experience, I don't see a reason for me to return anytime soon.
Love the dirty rice and the cajun catfish. If it wasn't so far from home I would eat there more often.
Our waiter Marcus was amazing. Worth the 45 min drive.  Save yourself time and make reservations

We went in for a light dinner and some drinks. It was happy hour, but that never applies to anything we are drinking. Grabbed some lobster bisque, sausage & Seafood gumbo, and a shrimp po'boy. I was kind of in the mood for a half and half (shrimp and oyster) po'boy but that wasn't on the menu. I'm sure they could have done it, but I was honestly too hot and tired to fuss. Tossed back an Abita and a Blanton's bourbon while m' lady sipped her 12 year old single malt.
The prices are steep - so get ready if you aren't having lunch specials or happy hour items.

As someone who HATES Seafood, I am always so scared and hesitant to go to a seafood place. My husband recently celebrated his birthday, and wanted to try Pappadeaux. I agreed because it was his birthday. 

To begin with, our waiter was amazing!!!!! Also, I got a Greek salad with chicken, and Oh Em Gee! The chicken was phenomenal! I have been craving it ever since! 

This review is for anyone that doesn't like seafood! Although most seafood spots don't have very good non seafood options, that is not the case for Pappadeaux! Their food, whether seafood or not, is so good!

Anniversary Dinner was fantastic!  First time there, I had the sea bass my husband had lobster. We also shared a ceasar salad, gumbo, and smoked salmon. I know it was way too much to eat but so delicious! Our server was Marlin and he was so friendly and informative. Really enjoyed it only complaint was I wish there was some seating a little more private, it was kind of noisy but tha'ts the only complaint I had. We will definately be going back, I never thought I liked salmon but that appetizer was so good I want to try the salmon for dinner. It is a bit pricey, but you do get what you pay for.

Kinda disappointed in the take out service. I called ahead for a noon pickup and didn't get my order till around 12:30. Had to stand leaning on my cane. Not even an offer of water. Wife sat in car waiting in the August heat.

I love seafood and I love Pappadeaux Seafood.  The alligator is to die for and all the fish is fresh and they get it delivered daily (that's what the server told us).  My husband got crawfish etufee and it was delicious.  I got the Salmon alexander with dirty rice and loved it.  We will definitely be back!
Sat at the busy bar and ordered dinner.  Service was just passable.  Food was good, but expensive.

Gorgeous restaurant fantastic Cajun style food ! Lobster crawfish oysters alligator pasta and salad for the weak... love the atmosphere  and decor .. service is always on point . Calamari check seafood check service check and decor check ... wow

Pappa deaux more like Papa-don't. The only reason to come here is the 3.95 dozen oysters. We got here super early on a sunday afternoon (4:30) and the place was still packed for lunch. Service was friendly, kitchen was a little slow, the food was a step above Red Lobster. The stuffed friend shrimp and crab was not really good at all. I guess if you live at least 4 hours a way from fresh ocean this place will have to do.

A wonderful menu full of great seafood options with portions that will leave you full to boot! It's on the expensive side I would say though with a full dinner costing over 100 especially if you want to try something like alligator.
Pappadeaux is overpriced and overrated.  There are so few choices in seafood restaurants in the Phoenix area.  It's a shame.  Franchise.  The food is ok.  One step up from Red Lobster.

Several years ago, when business travel to Houston was regular, I became a big fan of the Pappas family restaurants-- Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen in particular.  As we drove north from Phoenix airport to Sedona I noticed a sign for Pappadeaux, and knew that this would be a lunch stop when the final portion of our vacation brought us back to Phoenix.

The restaurant is large, attractively appointed and comfortable, with an encyclopedic menu of fish and seafood offerings.  Although best known for their Cajun preparations, there are abundant choices for everyone who enjoys well-prepared fish and seafood.

Our server, Nicholaus, effortlessly navigated a crowded lunchtime dining room with our order.  Although a bit distant, he was a consummate professional.

Brought first to the table was a large platter of crispy fried alligator nuggets, served with a full-bodied spicy sauce.  I ordered a platter of fried oysters, one of my favorites, while my family selected po boy sandwiches of shrimp or alligator.  We each had a cup of their Andouille, Crab, and Shrimp Gumbo.  The sandwiches were bountiful, and from what I was told, absolutely delicious.  The same could be said for the fried oysters.  A tartar sauce whose consistency was a bit less obvious as a packaged commercial product is all that separated this lunch from greatness.  The seafood was all fried just to the point of presenting a crispy coating surrounding tender, moist and flavorful protein.

Hardly an inexpensive lunch, Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen is in that class of restaurant that I would seek out wherever they operate.
Been here several times and never dissapointed!!!! Foods great, service is amazing!! Wait time can suck but worth the wait

Not happy with my experience which is weird since I've been here before. This time they just couldn't get things right. Filet over cooked as well as my lobster. By the time they remade the meal I was over it and they still took 20 mins to give me melted butter.  Still had to pay for it all. Will not be coming back. Really upsetting.

Pappadeaux has been around here for a long time.  It is a "chain" restaurant with locations in eight states.  I would say it's a high-end cajun seafood restaurant with a substantial menu.  I remember coming here a couple of decades ago, and we finally returned with my family recently.

We got seated at a round table for 5 and our hostess was very gracious and attentive.  After looking at our menu for a while, we opted to get the large order of crispy fried alligator bites.  After a few minutes, we upgraded to the Appetizer Trio, with mini shrimp & crawfish fondeaux (this was EXCELLENT), calamari with octopus and fried alligator.

It was seriously too much food.  After eating our complimentary bread and working our way through the appetizer trio, most of us were already stuffed!  Still, we ordered our main entrees:

 * Pasta Mardi Gras - FANTASTIC...omg
 * Shrimp & Scallop Orecchiette Pasta - WOW, a stunner
 * Kids fried chicken & shrimp plates

Seniors get lunch prices on entress ALL DAY, so my mother took advantage and ordered a sampler platter off the lunch menu.  We verified on the bill and yes, it was the lunch price.

Overall our service and food was excellent.  We paid dearly for it:  bill came to $260 after tip.  That hurts the wallet let me tell you, but the food was really worth it.  I literally had leftovers for three nights in a row!

Will most definitely come back, after I save up for a year or so ;)

This place is amazing I had the sampler and it had too many things. I loved it and after ordering that I really got to try a lot of things including alligator which I had never tried before. The staff is super nice and very helpful. 
I give it a full 5 stars and recommend this place for when you want to impress someone. The prices are very good for the food your eating. 30 per person.
The food was excellent and our server was wonderful. I wish I remembered her name. We travel over an hour to eat here. Definite favorite.

Called to do call ahead seating was told theuro was no wait and couldn't do call ahead seating, but could change.  Called back 15min later and was told there was a 45 min wait. So why not do the call ahead seating from the begin! !!

Oh man.  So good.  Went here on my birthday and went all out with the rock lobster and filet combo.  Holy crap!  It is amazing!!  We also had crab cakes as an app. and my boyfriend got the crawfish ettouffe (sp?).  Everything was super yummy, the server was great (Thanks Alex!) and the restaurant ran like a well oiled machine.  Can't wait to go back!!!
PS- get a Bellini!!!

Well we made the mistake of going here on a Friday night at about 7pm.  This place was packed.  Strange considering the average price of a dinner is around 20 bucks.  But we decided to try anyways.  I have been here before but that was maybe six years ago. 

Upon arrival we went to the hostess table and she told us there would be a two hour wait.  She said that if you wait for a table in the bar you can get one of those tables first come first serve.  So we took a number and hung out in the bar.  About 20 minutes of waiting in the bar we got two seats at the bar.  Lucky.  The bar staff is very friendly and very fast considering this place was absolutely packed!    

We ordered two of the specialty drinks called the swamp thing!   they were damn tasty.  I don't know how much alcohol is in one but that's all I needed for the rest of the night!  We also ordered some fried alligator as an appetizer.  The alligator taste like a  cross of fish with a chicken texture.  It is very tasty! The presentation was also nice not messy or greasy.  We then ordered our dinner.  

She got the Shrimp Etoufee and I got the Pontchartrain Fish.  The shrimp etoufee came in a smoky sauce with dirty rice.  The Pontchartrain was the fish of the day which was tilapia and had shrimp and crab meat in a butter sauce with dirty rice.  The food is outstanding!  Portion size is fantastic and food served hot and fresh.  The fish has no fishy taste or smell to it.  Its as if it came off the boat and served in your plate.  

Overall I say two thumbs way up!  For an expensive dinner this place is worth it.  Date night yes, want to surprise the family with some creole food YES!   

Only thing I would say is that come early and hungry! Also if it is date night the bar is the way to go.  You don't even have to get alcohol you can get a soda and order food.

Seafood was fresh and superb everything was delicious the seafood platter had different tastes and elements that made the food stand out not mediocre at all something very hard to accomplish with fried food. The dessert trio was to die for and the service was excellent. Definitely coming back

I'm giving them 5 stars for their customer service. They are wonderful here. I ordered the shrimp and crab cocktail. Didn't really like the cocktail sauce. 

The waitress and her manager apologized, asked if they can bring me something else. Didn't charge me for the food. Made me feel very comfortable and not like an annoying, complaining customer. 

Great service, great restaurant. Will definitely be back. Thank you Lisa and Gianna. You guys are the best!

Service was nice and friendly but when you order something and ask for it not to be spicy and it come to the table with xtra spicy flavor that is not good. Sent it back to get a one with no spicy seasoning to then get changed for 2 orders for the same thing  request to have a mgr look at the bill and tell me there is nothing wrong with it.  I had to point it out that one should not be charged for an item that was wrong and should not be doubled on the bill.

This place is very busy.  The menu is large.  Ordered their special of the day.  Blackened salmon topped with scallops, shrimp, crawfish, dirty rice.  I asked for the salmon to be medium rare, came medium well.  The shrimp were overcooked.  The scallops, came perfectly, medium rare!  Overall I thought all the food was very bland and did not have a fresh taste.  Seemed like I was eating at a cafeteria.  Kind of reminded me of the New Orleans section at Disneyland...crowded, not much flavor.  We wished we went somewhere else when we were done.  It was someone's birthday, and we did skip the free desert they were offering.  There is plenty of food.  The plates are huge and when the food arrives, it does look small, but really, it is huge.  So you do get well fed.  Parking is great.  Their patio looks great!  The staff was very friendly.  Service was average.

Went to Pappadeaux's last night for our 20th wedding anniversary. Have been here a few times for special occasions. Never have had a problem. But had to write a review about last night. Great service, Tanya (our waitress) was perfect. Her attention to detail and her skill was amazing. Found out after speaking with her that this is her first waitress position. You couldnt tell.  Definitely ask for her if you can. The dining manager Forrest, stopped by to wish us a happy anniversary and comped our dessert for the occasion. Very nice touch. Loved the food, we had alligator and blue point oysters for appetizers, yum, i had the shrimp brochette, husband had the costa rican mahi alexander, all was perfectly seasoned and served hot. This definitely will be a continuing date night spot for us in the future. Truly enjoyed our visit.

Went in this past weekend for a group dinner. Our server Marcus was excellent at keeping the table cleared, making recommendations and getting everything we asked for. The food was pretty good, though a couple misses here and there with the various things I tried. Overall it was really good and I was pleasantly surprised.

Outstanding! The food was amazing. The flavors and combinations were mouth watering. When we arrived they were pretty crowded but were seated within 15 minutes. Inside was quite busy and crowded and was pretty loud so we opted to sit on the patio. It was beautiful and quiet and our server, Kirk, was outstanding, friendly and helpful and recommended some amazing menu items! My husband ordered the Chilean Seabass which was out of this world, and I had the redfish. Both were very flavorful and not too heavy. Our server recommended the key lime pie which was the best I've ever had. We will definitely come back next time we are in Phoenix.

Food was exceptional! From the appetizers to the entrées the food was superior. The The calamari was a very interesting blend not too heavily fried the taste was perfect. The crispy salmon dish was probably the best I've ever had. My only feedback for the restaurant was that they were understaffed and the service was of low-quality. 30 minutes for a drink isn't acceptable. This is my first time here so that was rather disappointing other than the service everything else was top notch.
Delicious food, overall great experience. Always greeted with a smile walking in the door. While the kitchen can lag when the restaurant fills up, it is always worth the wait for great food.

Huge restaurant.  Neat atmosphere but pretty noisy.  Portions are gigantic - my wife and I could have easily split the main entrée (and we are both big eaters). I had the Parmesan Crusted Flounder it was really quite good.  My wife the pan seared salmon which she enjoyed as well.  The restaurant turns tables fast - we were in/out in less than an hour.  We didn't feel rushed though - just everything was timed perfectly.  Drinks, salad, entrée and deserts offered.  Note: The deserts looked phenomenal , but we were so stuffed had to pass.  Next time we will split an entrée and save just a little bit of room for desert.

Hands down,  this is the ceasar and emperor of seafood restaurants!  period! i started my delectable journey with pappadeaux's in the early 90's when i used to take business trips to houston,  dallas & austin,  texas. then in 2005, i discovered that they were in phoenix, az. equally as phenomenal!  now, over 5 years later,  i'm back in the phoenix area and of course i have to stop back here! and its just as delicious and phenomenol as ever!  you must order the new salmon & shrimp and the sea bass. they are both off the chain!!!! if eating those dishes were a crime!  it would be a felony! the catfish is omg, so, so, so tender, meaty  and dreamy! I PROMISE ALL YOU NON-SEAFOOD LOVERS THAT YOU WILL CHANGE YOUR MIND FOREVER ABOUT SEAFOOD ONCE YOU'VE DINED HEAR. They Ship in Their Seafood "DAILY, DAILY, DAILY"..., Did I Stutter? I've Had 5 Conversions of Clients or Colleagues who Absolutely Hated Fish and Other Seafood,  in My Extensive Dining Experience over the Years, at PAPPADEAUX'S in 2 Atlanta Locations,  Houston, Austin, Phoenix and Denver. IF YOU'RE NOT CONVINCED OR CONVERTED AT THE  END OF YOUR DINING EXPERIENCE THEN YOUR DESTINED TO RECIEVE THE BEST DESSERTS IN THIS UNIVERS!!!,  Not Because Your BEYOND HELP, But If You're a Virgin/1st Timer at PAPPADEAUX'S SEAFOOD KITCHEN, the Management should, at Their Discretion, give You any Dessert on the Dessert  Tray on the House! Especially,  if You Were Too Lame Not to Love the Seafood! BUT I PROMISE THAT YOU WILL BE CONVERTED!  YES, THAT'S THE GOSPEL THAT I'M PREACHING!
The food is yummy but to greasy  the service is excellent and the restaurant is beautiful!!

The food here is one of my favorites in Phoenix love it    I ha d the tomato almond arugula salad and fried calamari
The seafood platter is good a little bit dry but good
The lobster is okay 
Mac and cheese for the children okay 
We usually come here to celebrate our family birthdays
Don,t forget dessert crime brûlée so good 
 The service is good

WOW, I want to go back with some of the 5 star rate people and order what they do as I would have been better off at McD's and saved about $80.00. The only good thing about that place was our waiter who was steller in light of terrible food

Took my girlfriend here on our way back from Sedona, because she loves seafood, and this is my mom's favorite place. I got a steak, and it was bomb.

At first, I was a little irritated, because I felt like they walked me to the back corner to seat us in the dine n dasher's room until I realized that the emergency exit was the fastest route to my car, and my girlfriend and i argued about whether an alarm would really sound. She wouldn't let me test it after we paid, but that was cool.

Rio was our server, and he was cool too. He didn't police our table or make me feel like my every move was being watched which is what I'm used to when I go to nice restaurants, so I was happy.

This is my Favorite Restaurant by FAR. There are a few cons in the past 3 visits though.  Food on one hand is always excellent. Service is usually 
really prompt, but if you want optimal service I would eat at the bar.

1. Lobster Sizes. I try to Order 2lbs or So, and every time I have been up-sold to a 3 or 4 pounder without any discount.
2. The Lobster Eat All you Can deal was turning away customers by 7pm on the opening night,, I was showing off and brought 4 guests up from Gilbert, just to get turned away.
3. The Temperature in there is a bit chilly, so if you don't devour your food quickly, it can tend to get a bit cold.

Best Dish Lobster
Best Appetizer P.E.I Mussels
Best Drink Fat tire

On a nice Date, expect to pay about 80 to 100 per couple..

Ugh....so disappointing.  Went there for with another couple to celebrate his birthday....and well it was probably one of the worst dinning experiences ever!  Our server was horrible...she was pleasant however really should choose a different career path because serving is NOT it.  She was NOT timely with her service, came and took drink order, forgot to bring menus, brought some of the drinks "oops I forgot his beer", "oops forgot your wine", rushing us to order when we were still waiting on appetizer???  Got tired of waiting for the "gluten free" menu, so one of us went looking for one....  But here's the best part, we ordered a salad that two of us were going to share......you'd think - BRING an extra plate when you bring the salad, after all she knew we were sharing......NOPE! No plate.."can you bring an extra plate, please?"  "OK"........YEAH not sure where she went to find this elusive plate, because it never arrived, we had to share off the same plate .  Oh and if you're gluten free...be ready to be interviewed by a manager regarding your deficiency on gluten....REALLY, we need to discuss the level of allergy?....Gluten free is just that, NO GLUTEN in my food please, not rocket science!  No return visit for us - let corporate know, they said "oh sorry, here's a gift card so can try us again".................hmmmmmm

Service was horrid!  When a party calls with a reservation and you confirm said reservation they should not be told to either sit outside or wait for an additional thirty minutes before being seated.  (This is after a 20 minute wait past the reservation already.)  All food was either overcooked or undercooked.  Some meals were not even brought out until after other party members had already fisnished.  Trying to flag down a waiter for a refill on a water was nearly impossiable.  I realize that it is not the wait staff's fault but rather poor management.  In the future I will stick to a less pricey better tasting cajun option.

Prices during happy hour is decent but the house wines aren't much to brag about.  Spend a little more for the Grey Goose martini.  Hot boiled shrimp with potatoes is the best deal on happy hour.  The portion is big enough to make a meal in itself.  Too bad they don't serve this on the regular menu.  The catfish beignet is also good.  

The quality of fried calamari is better than most places.  Fried alligator is decent.  And spend a little more for the blue point oysters.  They're huge and tasty.  I've had the mahi mahi alexander, grilled shrimp and andouille sausage.  The latter isn't all healthy but delicious. 

Don't get the fish fry or filet steak.  I'm picky about fish fry.  In my lifetime, I've only found 2 places that makes really good fish fry.  One in northwest Phoenix and the other in North Carolina lol.  Granted fish fry isn't all that healthy, but I want to be able to see the fish, not taste all the batter and grease.  The filet was overpriced and more fatty like a ribeye. Go to a steakhouse instead. 

Oh, lets not forget about dessert.  Creme brulee is usually my favorite dessert, it's light.  They now have the Andes mint cheesecake.  The best of both worlds.  Yum!!!
An old favorite. Love the boudin and the wide selection of fish and Cajun-style entrees. A bit heavy on fried food... and so I can't get my wife to return. But I would on a business lunch or dinner.

We left town early enough to make it here before closing.  It's our favorite place for fresh fish.  Every time we come, regardless of the season, the food is always top notch.  The service is just as good as the food and tonight was no exception. 

For months we have been waiting for this trip, knowing we would be eating here made the planning even more exciting, and we finally got our most favorite desert, the carrot cake cheesecake.  We had tried this a long time ago and been waiting for it to come back on the menu and we were lucky enough tonight.   

We love this place so much, we always end up buying gift cards for family members to enjoy it too!

I had a wonderful time at Pappadeaux's!   The service was fantastic. Esther was amazing. We dined from 1:00 to 4:00. Never felt rushed or encouraged to move to the next course. We began the meal with a smooth bottle of merlot from Chile. We enjoyed oysters for an appetizer. My Mom had lobster bisque and said it was very good. A soft and warm loaf of bread was also served. My parents had the two pound lobsters and my husband and I feasted on the crab legs. Everything was cooked perfectly and it made for an extraordinary meal. This is the second year we have celebrated my birthday and Anniversary at this restaurant. It is always a memorable celebration.

I got my much needed crawfish Étouffée! Boy was it good! Noisy and busy for a Sunday afternoon but very much welcomed! No need to be quiet here! Seated in five min drink order taken as well as the alligator appetizer! The larger pieces were a bit tough but delicious! The water came first but the bar must have been backed up because it took some time for the Wine and beer to come out. Moving on to the entrees-to die for Crawfish Étouffée done to perfection, tried a good portion on the halibut (let me just say (SUCCULENT). Pricey but oh so worth it! Service was great you won't be disappointed!
Awesome. Pricey but worth it. Try the lobster bisque it's to die for!
Lovely tomato salad with lump crab meat enough for a meal by itself, mussels are great as an app! Good food and consistent.

Yes, I'm once again a fan of Pappadeaux.  Sweet hubby picked up some to-go a couple weekends ago and they are back in the game.  The food was MUCH better than our miserable experience in March.  He enjoyed the shrimp po' boy and seafood gumbo (he kindly gave me some of the gumbo, including a gigantic oyster, which I thoroughly enjoyed).  I ordered the lunch Blackened Catfish with Shrimp Etouffee Pistolette and Dirty Rice.  The catfish was sweet and tender and oh so yummy.  The Shrimp Etouffee Pistolette was a dish of their outstanding Etouffee with a hunk of French bread so decadent, I think they actually dunked it in melted butter and then deep fried it (Texas State Fair anyone?).  I saved some of the Etouffee and cooked plain wild rice to go with it for lunch on Monday.  The dirty rice was once again delicious, so happy they use ground chicken livers, as it should be.
Great food & service is hit or miss but overall it's very decent.  The pasta & seafood dishes are delicious everything we've tried we've been satisfied.
The best place in Arizona for fresh seafood. I've been to places in Scottsdale and just big prices without the freshness and quality.  This is my top pic for lobster, crab and fish.

Update!!!! so upper management reached out to me after reading my review. We spoke and they were very helpful and expressed concern about the situation that occurred. I'm really glad that someone at the corporate office took the time to do so. I will not let this experience ruin the brand name for me and will visit other locations 



. Ok Yelpers by far this is the worst pappadeux I've ever been to! The waiter we had was horrible the food was cold. I just can believe that I'm writing a bad review. The service was so bad that we did a FIRST, ZERO TIP... Let me explain. My moms order was totally wrong.  She ordered catfish and got crawfish yes they both start w a "C" but she also said blackened so that should've said she wasn't saying crawfish. Ok skip the fact that we were never asked if we wanted drinks or appetizers, he just bought us water. Then after eating COLD food we asked for to go boxes. Waite boxed our food and just scrapped everything off the plate including garnishes into the to go box, mixed all the food together. I'm talking catfish tomato shrimp and rice and everything all together and basically said "HERE" don't ask me what my waiter looked like bc he didn't spend more than 5 min total at our table. Maybe it was my waiter but ILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS ESTABLISHMENT (in Phoenix) EVER!

We try to avoid chains when we travel but there were very few restaurants in the vicinity of our hotel except this one. We were well pleased with the food and the service of this place. It had the feel of a mom and pop and we had a good waiter. We had shrimp and fish dishes that were very good.

Came here for my birthday dinner and wasn't disappointed! I have always been a fan of seafood, and they do it right at Pappadeaux.

If you're into oysters I would highly recommend the gulf coast oyster platter on the half shell. So delicious. I could eat those things for breakfast, lunch and dinner for life!

The seafood gumbo was tasty and they didn't skimp on the seafood.

The Pappadeaux Platter was a huge plate of various fried seafood on a bed of french fries. I would have rather have more seafood and less fries, but that's life. 

I'll be back to celebrate special occasions.

Picked up a shrimp and catfish po boy and for $20, I wasn't impressed at all. I never had a po boy with cocktail and tartar sauce but you needed both to get any flavor out of the sandwich. The shrimp and catfish on their own we're lacking, like they didn't season anything. And no tomatoes either! Come on. I would hope their other food tastes better if I go back.

My boyfriend and I went in for dinner and had a great time! The hostess' were all very friendly and our server Kim was wonderful! She offered us the alligator appetizer right away which is very tasty and helped us decide on our entrees, she was very animated and really knew her stuff. The food was delicious and overall we had the best night! Thank you Kim and the rest of the team!

So good.  But, be warned - it's expensive!  Four entrees, two appetizers and a couple of beers totaled nearly $180.00.  Our server, while a bit confused, was charming and likeable.  The food was delicious.  We tried the fried alligator (a first for me) and I'm hooked.  I also got a tilapia fillet that was cooked perfectly with a delicious sauce and side dishes.  I'll go back, just maybe not while we're still in a recession.

I told myself I would Yelp on every restaurant that I ate at on the course of this "road trip" I'm taking, so here goes.  We started off in the familiar territory of Phoenix, AZ.  Our "go to" spot in the northern suburbs of Phoenix used to be the Fish Market in Scottsdale, but since it "changed hands" so to speak, we've been on the look out for another destination.  Well... I think we found it in Pappadeaux.

Service:  5/5

The service we received at Pappadeaux was outstanding from the moment we arrived until the moment we left.  It was about 7:30 on a Friday evening when we got to the restaurant, and since we had been traveling, I did not have the opportunity to make reservations ahead of time.  The parking lot was VERY crowded and we were afraid of a long wait time.  But we were quoted 5-10 minutes when we arrived, and were seated after 7 minutes.  We got one of the few booths in the restaurant near the bar area.

Our waiter, Nate, was very attentive and helpful.  He pointed out some of their more famous dishes and the specials, some of which we ended up ordering.  He was prompt in refilling our water glasses when needed and even stopped a moment to chat with us about our 4-month old son.  The only small blemish I would mention is that dessert was a long time in coming.  It took about ten minutes after we ordered it.  Now I know they don't bake cheesecakes on the fly, so I'm unsure about the reason for the delay, but I thought in the interest of being complete that I would mention it.

Food:  5/5

Absolutely no complaints here.  Everything we ordered was outstanding.  My wife and I got the baked oyster trio and split a Greek salad for appetizers.  The salad was great and so were the oysters.  The salad is served table-side for that extra little touch.  If we were to order again though, I think we would have just gotten a full order of the Parmesan baked oysters instead of the trio.

For entrees, I ordered the special of the evening which was Salmon Diablo, a blackened salmon fillet with extra kick.  The only very minor complaint I would note is the sauce was a bit too much.  It was absolutely delicious, a mix of crab meat and butter and cream, but it overpowered the fish to a degree.  I ended up eating it separately.   As I said, delicious, but a bit much.  My wife ordered the lobster bisque and it was every bit as good as other reviewers have commented.

For dessert we split a carrot cake cheesecake.  I'm always on the look out for new and interesting desserts, and while I have had tons of cheesecakes, this was a combination I hadn't encountered before, so I had to give it a try.  The sweet potato pie also looked interesting, but we went with the cheesecake.  Aside from the delay mentioned above, no complaints here.  The cake was moist, flavorful, and delicious.

Overall Impressions:  5/5

The environment at Pappadeaux is exactly what you would expect.  They do a good job of bringing in that Cajun/creole atmosphere and balance an upscale look with a "down home" attitude.  You'll feel right at home here in your t-shirt and jeans, or in your business attire after a long day at the office.  The staff is very helpful and accommodating.  

Overall if you are looking for a seafood or creole meal in the Phoenix area, I can heartily recommend Pappadeaux.
This place has the best food! It is a little pricey but so worth it! I recommend this place to all those who love sea food! They have a variety of dishes to choose from.

Good food.  Whenever I want a special meal, especially seafood, I go here.   They make a mean sea bass and you can't go wrong with the gumbo.  Can get a bit crowded on Friday and Sat nights.  Oh and the oysters rock!   If your an oyster fan.

So for my Dad's birthday dinner I decided to show him one of my favorite places to go around the valley.  

So we had a reservation at 7:30 and got there around 7:10 which was fine we got to sit outside and enjoy the weather which is awesome this time of year.  At 7:35 we were called to our table.  We already saw the menu outside so we were ready to order once seated.  

My dad got the stuffed lobster and I got the Chilean sea bass.  After about 20 min the manager came over and apologized for the wait which I wasn't even concerned about yet.  She said they overcooked the sea bass the first time so they had to re-fire it.  They brought our dishes out about 5 min later.  Everything was good as always and then about 7 min later she brings over this huge piece of sea bass and said again she was sorry.  

I was amazed as I was not worried about anything and didn't even get upset for the overcooking the first time.  She also said she was going to comp a dessert for me which worked out great cause it was my Dad's bday so she brought a special creme brulee at the end of the meal with a candle and happy birthday written in chocolate which was just perfect.  

I love this place and it brings me back to New Orleans every time I go which is a great place to be reminded of.

Love Pappadeaux!!! I really love the atmosphere here and the decor. It's usually packed here which I don't really care for but that means it's a yummy good place. They have amazing appetizers, the creamy dip and alligator! They have some yummy seafood entrées. Although I do wish they had more crawfish options. I love coming here.
The salmon was raw on the inside and cool when brought to the table.   Very  overpriced for the quality and lack of service.

I remember coming here often with my dad when I lived in the West valley. Haven't been in at least 5-6 years. Food was decent but service needs serious improvement. We had a group of 8 and our tab was over $500 and only had one server. She didn't know the menu well enough to answer our questions. We ordered appetizers, entrees, and desserts. I don't think we ever had a busser come by once. So there was empty dirty dishes that just sat there the whole wall. I can see maybe how everything was on the server and she was just busy. But overhearing the table of another 6-8 people next to us and how their orders were lost makes me believe this was our servers first serving job. 
Last thing I didn't notice until after. 
Husband and I ordered Arnold palmers for our drinks. It was never disclosed refills were NOT free. If we knew that, we probably would have stuck to waters. Overall bad bad experience and don't plan on going back anytime soon.

I love Pappadeaux. I've been going to Pappadeaux for over ten years starting in Houston. When they opened up the one in Phoenix, I was sooo ecstatic! Seafood in Arizona! And I don't have to drive 40 min to Scottsdale to enjoy it!

Before I gush, I will say that I have received some crappy service. When it's bad, you have to make sure you get your waiter to bring you everything you need at once, otherwise it may take a while to track him or her down. Usually these are the times when the place is really busy so I guess I can't get too mad. For the most part though, the waiters know the menu, can offer some good suggestions and come back often for refills.
 
OK, now for some love. Seriously, Love love LOVE when it's $3.95/per dozen oyster time. You do have to make sure it's the right time of the season otherwise you can get some measly oysters. But 99% of the time the oysters are incredibly tasty and fresh. For the person complaining about slow oyster service, they shuck their oysters when you order them. So when they've got 8 orders, there is going to be a wait. I don't know what oysters you're used to eating, but I know shucking oysters is not easy. (Plus you're doing all that work and you don't get to eat them! That would be torture for me!)

I've had a lot of the main fish entrees and they've all been very yummy. It is really pricey, but one entree at Pappadeaux's can last me 2, maybe even 3 meals. It's the damn butter! It fills me up! Butter, you ask? YES! Pappadeaux has the most taste bud pleasing, whipped, salted butter that I have ever eaten. It helps polish down that loaf of freshly toasted french bread that impedes entree eating time.

Fave dessert is the creme brulee for sure. Best way to end the meal. How I have ever had room for dessert, though, is beyond me. Dang butter.

Other dishes I recommend: Calamari, alligator, Greek salad, crawfish etoufee (!!!), soft shelled crab (broiled and fried, ask to go easy on the salt), crawfish gumbo (they only have seafood gumbo listed, but you can ask to have crawfish only)

I don't know how many times I've been here with my family. Obviously I can't have much here because I'm a vegetarian. But oh my goodness. my family rage about this place like nobody's business. Gator to calamari to the steak. But i... I get mashed potatoes and asparagus on the side. Haha

I fail to see the value in this restaurant.  Management seems unable to figure out how to schedule wait staff.  On a recent coerced visit there were 40 - 50 people waiting outside to be seated in an empty restaurant.  We were told the servers weren't scheduled to start for another half-hour.  How absurd!  The responsible manager should have been terminated immediately.

Prices are extremely high for the quality and quantity of food served.  Simply put, this is a chain restaurant that is trying to be upscale; and failing miserably. Service is slow, the wait staff have way too many tables; the bartenders are Chili/Applebee quality but with upscale bar pricing.

The recent salmonella episode at the restaurant adds to my "never again" attitude.

Eat at your own risk.

It's rare that Phoenix has a great restaurant that California does not have.  Phoenix always seems to be the step-child in terms of cuisine when it comes to dining in the southwest compared to California.

So it's quite nice that we have Pappadeaux locally to enjoy some southern food.  We first came to Pappadeaux 10 years ago for fresh gulf oysters, when a friend introduced Pappadeaux to us.

We keep going back for the live crawfish during the spring.  The prices have gone up since we first found this place 10 years ago, but it's so worth it for the best live crawfish in the west coast.

We come here for special events, like birthdays, celebrations, etc.  The ambiance is fantastic, the service is great, and the food is delicious.  The prices are on the higher side so expect to shell out more, but it's worth the cost for special occasions and live crawfish!

This place gets busy during Spring training, nice winter months, and weekends, so make a reservation or you may be waiting for a while for seating.

The only negative is we now have to wait until next spring for the crawfish again, that is a long wait!!
