I was here a couple of weeks ago and has the lobster and shrimp salad with mango, avocado and cashews. DELICIOUS! Lots off shrimp and lobster.  Really wonderful. 

I'm back today on my own dime. I ordered the same thing. Still delicIous. Really. Also ordered mushroom risotto. Very good. 

Service by Marlin was excellent, attentive and quick. 

My only real complaint is the noise. At 4pm the place is not full and it is NOISY. OH, and whoever brought the child/baby/demon who let out several ear splitting, blood curdling screams.... Thank God I'm not you. 

Yeah, the place is expensive. I'm worth it. The calories, oh the calories. I'll be back in January for my birthday. I hope to be thinner by then and can afford the calories.  Three months away, I can do it... Maybe. I shouldn't have ordered the banana pudding in the mason jar.  It is DELICIOUS. And I got the lid and I'm taking most of it home.  If I was good, I'd give the leftovers away. I'm not that good a person or dieter.

Came here for dinner on Valentine's Day. Of course there were a lot of people so our wait time was about 45 mins. While waiting I had a swamp thing from the bar..that drink was so good. We were called in about exactly 45 minutes and it was definitely worth the wait. The food was fantastic. I ordered the Pasta Mardi Gras. It was a large portion so it was enough for 2 people. Our waiter was very friendly and he gave me some beads in celebration of Mardi Gras. I hope to come back again soon!

I like Pappadeaux and find myself there about once every 3 months.

Their live Maine lobster - steamed, please - is usually worth the trip. I have to say that it is inconsistent in preparation. Sometimes it's a bit mealy. Still, this hasn't stopped me from coming back again and again.

Every time I come, I know I'm going to put up with a wait. During that wait, I study the menu and try to convince myself to try something other than their lobster. So far, the fact that the lobster is a great price-point, and I know it's pretty good for the money, I haven't ever tried anything else.

Clearly this place knows what they are doing. They are packed night after night and have been for years. That says a lot.

3.5 years in the Phoenix area, and I had never been to Pappadeaux.  WTF was I thinking?  Seriously!  WTF?  I would soon find out that I was missing out....big time!

My buddy was out for Spring Training, and I had decided that we would finally try this place out.  We arrived around 11:30am and were seated at a table right away.  We ordered our drinks and some appetizers (alligator, and boudin) , then browsed the menu for a bit.  I had an idea of what I was going to get, but there were SO MANY delicious sounding items, it was hard to pick.  I made up my mind though and placed my order for the lunch sized portion of the crawfish combination.  While waiting for our food, our waitress delivered a loaf of French bread and some butter.  Here is how everything was...............

Alligator-  I had only had alligator once before (Dragos in New Orleans), and thought it was delicious.  Somewhat of a chicken texture, but a tad more chewy.  When we went to order the alligator appetizer, our waitress informed us that there was an option for it to be grilled, also (the menu only offers the fried option).  We decided to go with a large order and went half grilled, half fried.  It was a damn fine recommendation by our waitress.  The fried portion was crispy and chewy and had great flavor.  The star of the show though, was the grilled!  It was blackened in a great seasoning, and had great texture.  It comes with some "alligator sauce", and a few dips into that, put my mouth in heaven!  Both my buddy and I liked the grilled a little more than the fried.  Both choices were freaking delicious though!  Can't go wrong with either option!

Boudin- Boudin is a Cajun sausage stuffed with a dirty rice type mixture.  This appetizer came with 2 links on top of a pile of rice.  The casings that they use and pretty strong and somewhat hard to cut.  I pretty much split mine down the middle and just ate the "guts" of the sausage.  It definitely had a different texture/taste.  Reminded me of a "white hot", almost.  It was tasty, but not sure if I would crave it or get it again.  

Crawfish Combination-  This was my entree, and it was damn tasty!  This mountain of a plate came with a massive pile of dirty rice topped with crawfish etouffee, and a massive pile of fried crawfish.  This entree should be split by 2 people.  One man should not try to tackle this thing on its own.  And this was a "lunch" portion.  Can't even imagine how big the "dinner" portion is.  The fried crawfish were breaded and seasoned perfectly!  I kept popping nugget, after nugget into my mouth and could not stop eating them!  The etouffee part of the entree was delicious as well!  It was a thick gravy filled with tons of pieces of crawfish, layered over dirty rice.  I am not the biggest rice fan, but this rice was awesome!  I ate until I could not eat anymore, and there was still about half of the etouffee left.  Got it boxed up and gave it to a homeless lady on our drive home.

My buddy went with the Cajun Combo (catfish and shrimp Creole).  He let me try some of his blackened catfish (biggest filet of catfish I have ever seen!) and it was delicious!  The shrimp creole was a bit skimp though.  It was mainly veggies and very few shrimp.  Total opposite of my crawfish etouffee (overflowing with crawfish).

After we gorged ourselves silly, we still went with some dessert.  My buddy loves key lime pie, so we went with a slice of that.  Holy hell!  Delicious!  HUGE piece of key lime pie.  Great graham cracker crust, perfectly chilled filling and it was topped with berries and puree etc.  It was a great piece of pie!  (It was comped off the bill, too.  Read other reviews of people getting a free dessert if it is your first time dining here...not sure if that is true or not, but it makes sense.  And, that is freaking awesome if that is why!)

Overall, it was a great lunch!  Pricey, yes, but that french bread, alligator, boudin, crawfish combination and key lime pie were all fantastic!  Pair that with great service, great company, and an awesome setting (the restaurant is beautiful!), it justifies the price, somewhat.  Can't eat here every day, but for special occasions or a few times a year, this may be my new "go to spot" in Phoenix.  It wasn't just the best meal of the weekend, it may have been one of the best meals I have had since being in Phoenix!  It was awesome and I can't wait to go back!

Hey now, you can't go wrong with Pappadeaux Seafood Kitchen and their friendly staff.
Even thought some of their items are overpriced I love coming here once or twice a year.
Not the best seafood place in town but still better than  most!!!
Worth the visit and $100 for a party of two.
Enjoy!!

Arrived on time for our 8pm reservation (party of 5)
Came here for a 60th birthday dinner.. it was my first time here and it was absolutely amazing! Our server was obviously very busy but extremely friendly and very knowledgeable about everything in the menu. We had a few bumps throughout our dinner because of the computer system and another because the wrong dinner entrée was brought but the manager Melissa made everything right and had the correct meal out asap! She absolutely made our night. Thank you for the great server from your staff and your management.. we will be back!!

The food here is expensive but really good. I especially love the alligator bites appetizer that they offer. We were seated within two minutes of coming into the restaurant and already had our drinks within five. I do plan on going back but with my budget, I have to say this will be a once or twice a year place for me to visit. I definitely recommended though because it has some of the best seafood in Phoenix.

Excellent except expensive.  People jumping out of line and grabbing open tables was common on the patio. Pissed me off, since wife, son and I waited about an hour and then watched as some smug entitled asshats grabbed a table before it was cleared.

When I want to get my fix for oysters on the half I come here...you can't beat the price!!  Usually between $4 and $6 a dozen depending on specials they have going on.   They also have one of my favorite happy hours with some limited drink specials but some nice food specials served at the bar. 
When I am looking to order a meal I have to say my favorite on the menu is the shrimp brochette (large shrimp stuffed with jalapenos and jack cheese wrapped in bacon and grilled).  I while not bad, opt out of the dirty rice that is served with this dish and have them sub with asparagus or the steamed veggies.   I have had a few other things from the menu like the mixed grill and their cedar plank salmon, and once did the all you can eat lobster special they were running once.   Honestly I have yet to be disapointed by most Pappadeaux's I visit (except the one that was out of oysters).

Have been to this chain many times before this particular store it's further away from my home then I usually travel however my friend insisted we go. We arrived early for a Friday evening about 5:30 PM and scored a booth in the bar area service was extremely attentive and food was fantastic ! We had raw oysters  and shrimp on a stick  for appetizers ...( shrimp however, was  lightly breaded ) tasty but I normally do not eat fried...

For My mail course  which  I always take at least half home and in this case probably three quarters as it was a lot of food I had  the halibut with brussels sprouts and it was melting in my mouth fantastic! 

They have a great happy hour beverage selection and a few good appetizers but a lot of it is fried. 

I'm usually into quality not necessarily quantity however pappadeaux's  provide both I would certainly return. 

Seafood in the desert is hard to find but this chain restaurant gets it right!

Deliciously tasting entrees with great portions. The price is on point for the quality you get. The server was amazing!!!! Honestly she was the best part of our entire visit. (I forgot her name but she had super short red hair and told us about her twins). 

Ambiance - is nice but too loud. 

Parking - plenty of space. 

Decor - beautiful restaurant for its kind. 

Menu - there's a variety of options but not overwhelming. 

Overall, every dish we ordered was cooked to perfection. 

One time stop, though. (We're from CA).

Oh my goodness. The alligator appetizer is so good. Probably my favorite menu item! I've tried the frog legs and they were good as well, I haven't had something that I didn't like so far! Friendly staff and prompt service. One of my favorite restaurants.
The food was Delish and waitress was nice. It took forever to get my food and or if you don't ask for bread you won't get any before your meal.
Great food but had some issues with being told they were out of the selection after order went to kitchen.  But manager really went the extra mile to correct things.  Would go back.  Very fresh fish.

I love going here.  The staff is always friendly and helpful even when the place is packed (which is often).  The food is always good.  Fresh seafood is actually fresh and not frozen.  The drinks are good and not watered down.  I love coming here for special occasions.

This was my second time eating at Pappadeaux and I have to say that I was equally impressed as the first time.  The service was excellent both times and the food is pretty good too!  I had the Shrimp Etouffe the first time and it was an excellent choice and the second time I had the fried shrimp with a side of the Seafood Gumbo.  I really liked the fried shrimp but didn't really care for the Seafood Gumbo, it just totally fell below my expectations (it was chunky and bland) but I was so impressed with the rest of my food that it didn't take away from my overall experience.  We also had the Crab Spinach Dip...yummy!!

Though it is a wonderful venue, I can't lie about the overall quality of the food. Caveat: the Oysters are WONDERFUL (and probably the best thing about the food, but, really you can't fuck oysters up too much if they are fresh shucked...). I also admit, the service was very good, maybe I would add another star for that EXCEPT that the rest of the menu is just plain farce. Poop. Supposed classic dishes like crayfish ettoufee, poop. Crabcakes, poop. I watched my father suffer through a horrible dish of frozen mussels thinking it was good because he didn't know any better. The prices are not nearly worth it. I would go back for a cold beer and oysters, but not for anything else.

Hubby and I were wandering around on a late Friday night looking for something to eat.  Didn't see a lot of options so we drove to this place just looking for some appetizers.  Everything on menu looked good so we ended up ordering the appetizer trio, seared ahi tuna, and some alligator meat.  The ahi tuna was very tasty and definitely my favorite dish of the night.  The alligator meat was a bit on the chewy side, but not too bad.  I would skip it next time around though.  

The service here on a busy Friday night was still great!  So glad we found this place and was able to eat right away.

if you like cajun food this is the place to go. they have a wide variety of everything.  service is always good.  if you are planning a large party call ahead, getting a table is always going to be a wait. all the times i've gone, i've never waited less than 30 minutes to be seated so plan accordingly.
Amazing food , friendly  staff , and the menu always has scrumptious  changes every time  I've been there... mostly when PPL  visit from out of town , or a celebratory date night

You shouldn't have to wait 30 minutes for a table when there is no waitlist.

The Boy and I were in the neighborhood on Friday and he had raved how much he loves the seafood here. Me? Never been but always game for good seafood.

We walked in at 9 PM and were told it would be a minute for them to clean a table for us but the hostess gave us a buzzer and we headed to the bar. The bartenders were polite but were more concerned with interacting with themselves, talking smack about football teams and "Woo Boys Rick Flair" than interacting with us.

Twenty minutes at the bar and I notice a couple walk in and be seated. Then a group of four walks in and is seated. After a couple walked in and was seated, The Boy walked over and asks about our buzzer and how we saw other tables being seated but not ours. No apology from the male host, just "umm we can seat you now".

Our server Nick continued with the poor experience. He was either new, in the weeds, or honestly did not care about our table. Every time he stopped at our table he was two steps past us on to the next table before we could answer. He stopped to check on how our food was and was taking the table behind ours margarita order before either of us could speak. He also floundered when describing the two dishes I was on the fence about. He described the Texas Redfish Pontchartrain as "tasting more like fish" than the shrimp and scallop dish but did slightly rebound with the description of the Shrimp & Scallop Orecchiette Pasta, which I ultimately ordered. I do give him props for not pushing the more expensive dish, which often happens with servers who only want to upsell. 

Other table around us received a crusty loaf of bread and butter before their entrees.  I even heard another server rave about how everyone loves their french loaf but none was offered to us or even mentioned.

The food itself was very good. The Boy got the Pasta Mardi Gras and loved it. The portion was huge and The Boy loved the spices and the mix of seafood and Andouille sausage.  He was head over heals for the Cheese Grits Andouille & Corn.  
I started with the Cesar salad which was very good. I ordered the above mentioned Orecchiette pasta which was also very good but was disappointed by the amount of shrimp and scallops in the dish. The dish had 3, ok sized shrimp, and 4 mediumish scallops.. 

Although our experience was disappointing, I watched the tables around us and was impressed by the service.  Servers and bussers worked as a cohesive team while the servers themselves gave exceptional service and attention to their tables.

Will our meh experience cloud us from coming back? I can't say since we don't live in the area but I can say I would be back in a heartbeat if we has the experience everyone else around us had.
I LOVE this place!!!!! The food is fantastic and atmosphere so enjoyable and entertaining.  Wish so bad they had one on our side of town. The bomb

We always come to Papadeaux when we come to Phoenix! The fried shrimp and catfish is my go too! I have tried several things here and they have all been tasty but there is something about the simplicity of fried shrimp and catfish that just makes me happy! :) The portions are large there's always good food. It's hard to save room for dessert so we ordered it to go. Definitely get the banana pudding. When you order it to go they just put the whole mason jar in the to go box and give it to you!

There was a 7lb lobster in the tank! OMG! We only get to Pappas once a year so we definitely ate a lot of food. During happy hour i had a delicious cocktail, the cajun fonduex, and the gator. I was full before i even ordered the entree but, i still got one anyway. We ordered the Hudson Platter, The Shrimp Brochette and the fried catfish. Everyone loved the shrimp but i thought it was too cheesy, and i love cheese. The fried fish and hudson platter were the bomb, especially cold the next day. I can't wait to return next year!

This place is always a return for me whenever I'm in town. I have to say, I'm never one to really like chain restaurants, but this is an exception! 

The food is generally really good and portions are just enormous. I like this place cuz of the oysters. Was a little disappointed that they didn't have the Blue Point, but for $5.99 a dozen for the Texas Gulf Coast was a score. The gumbo is always tasty. If you feel like sharing among others, order the Jumbo size that's not on the menu! The Greek salad was a good touch to all the heavy food that is served there too. 

One side note for the bartender. When serving a shot of whiskey or anything else, please don't add crushed ice. It sorta ruins the drink. I'm just saying. You don't serve whiskey with crushed ice. 

Bottom line: repeat for sure!

Consistently excellent Cajun seafood and meats. I've been there about 12 times. The dinner salad is made at the table now and tastes crisp and fresh. Hot homemade bread served at table. The seafood is prepared to perfection and if dissatisfied no fuss returning it. I have not had any problems in that regard. The halibut is fabulous. Don't forget dessert if you're still hungry.
Get there early. For lunch before 11 AM. For dinner before 5 PM if possible. There is always a wait in the evening. 
Downside: acoustics are poor. If you plan to visit, by 6 PM it's hard to hear your guests. 
Give it a try. Highly recommended. I don't know of any other place in Phoenix that serves comparable food selections like Pappydeauxs.

Okay so we had our valentine's dinner here and it was amazing from the parking lot to the live entertainment outside while you wait on your table. Once we got inside I was completely taken by the atmosphere the linen was perfect the decor was warm and welcoming I was definitely impressed. Our drinks where delicious the food was outstanding and this is coming from someone who is not a seafood lover. What a memorable experience. We will definitely be coming back.
A must for a sea food lover. Very nice place to take a date. Food is awesome and the people are nice.

We liked the ambiance, the service, food however was disappointing. I ordered their special dish Ahi Tuna with Jumbo Lump crab at $31.95 for the plate. There was just a smear of crab that is not even visible to the naked eye. See for yourself.
The best seafood restaurant in the valley. The food is so fresh and tasty. It melts in your mouth. I think this gonna be my favorite restaurant in Phoenix area despite the high prices!
Its a good franchise with great Cajun cuisine, a fancy atmosphere, a bit pricey if you are in a budget but so good. I recommend trying the blackened alligator. Woooooweeee

I love me some Pappadeaux!  We actually drove out from Los Angeles to Phoenix to get our cravings satisfied and we were not disappointed.  I'm a huge fan of the Shrimp Etouffee and my mom loves the Crab Fingers.  Shoot, everything is pretty good at Pappadeaux!  I wish they could quit playing and drop a location in the heart of LA.

Yummy...Seafood.. This place has both seafood from the west coast and east coast..


I love their selections.. Their shrimp and lobster salad looked succulent and their Cajun gumbo was to die for..  

This is the real deal if you want to eat a seafood restaurant.. Hands down one of the best seafood restaurants I have been too in a long time...

Wonderful very bright atmosphere makes you feel like your on island in the middle of the desert...hehe

The service is great, but the food is just eh.
I was expecting a lot of flavors, but my food was really bland.
The only thing I would go back for is the alligator.

Sat at the bar on a Thursday night. I had a swamp thing and my girlfriend had a beer. The swamp thing is one of my favorite beverages. We ordered the giant shrimp and grits and the salmon Alexander. My shrimp and grits were fantastic but the side of spinach was cold. Her salmon dish was also good by the dirty rice was cold.

It was our first time dining at this restaurant, and we will definitely be back! The atmosphere was fantastic, and service was perfect. The food was absolutely delicious. We had the lobster and the muscles. 
Paul was our server and he rocked it! Personable, very friendly, and checked in just the right amount of times. Thanks Paul!!

This was my first time visiting and I will be back!  The fried alligator was fantastic, crabs cakes were the bomb!  For the entrees I had fried shrimp and fries and the other 2 in my party ordered bass stuffed with crab & scallops and pea risotto.    The signature cocktails are yummy!

This was a terrible experience. 
The Waitress Carla was so short with us, was slow, ignored us and didn't even offer bread. 
I know this isn't the standard because every other waiter/waitress was friendly and upbeat. 
I wanted to order a whole meal but couldn't fathom waisting another minute with Carla. 
This was my first time coming here. 
Also there was a piece of lobster shell in my bisque as well as a hair in my water. I didn't complain to the manager but I should have. Never again. Steer clear of Carla who is an older woman  with glasses and bad attitude. Not to mention it was our Anniversary!!!!
I love Pappadeaux's! They have amazing food and great service. We always have great waiters!
Amazing food drinks and atmosphere.  bites are really good, I love the trout when it's in season. Love the ambiance.
Love the food great service however when we asked for to go boxes our server took our food in the back for about 10 minutes and then returned without food I did not like that it make me nervous

I cannot believe these prices for what you get. Pappadeaux offers a lot of food for amazing prices. I got the Salmon Alexander which was some of the best blackened salmon I have had and the other person ordered the grilled seafood which were two large kabobs of salmon and veggies. I recommend coming here if passing through or staying in Phoenix.

Wow!! This restaurant is amazing! The Chilean sea bass is to die for! Great food a little on the pricey side but definitely well worth what you pay for! The service is great but short handed. But I will definitely be back, great ambience!

My family ate here on Christmas eve.  The pros: crawfish bisque was excellent, the serve was great, the deserts were very good - large portions.  The cons: my Crawfish platter which included both Etoufee and fried crawfish was awful.  The etoufee had a dark brown gravy like taste that overwhelmed the few small pieces of crawfish it included over brown/dirty rice.  It was nasty, I picked out a few of the crawfish, but their flavor was overwhelmed with dark sauce -- I didn't eat.  The fried crawfish was a little better, but instead of being lightly fried, it was very small pieces of crawfish with heavy breading.  Basically, my meal was a waste - so I really didn't bother to eat much of it.  On the flip side, the rest of my family thought the place was pretty good -- not excellent, but good.  I would recommend avoiding the fried platters. My son ordered the chicken, he rated it as nothing special. I should mention that the noise level in the restaurant was extremely loud - so much so, there was a strong desire to exit as soon as possible, even possibly boxing the deserts to go home and eat instead.

Based on this experience, I have no plans to return.

UPDATE:  I guess Pappadeaux reads these reviews as they contacted me shortly after posting.  They asked if I'd be willing to give them another try when in Phoenix if they sent me a gift certificate.  I agreed, but even after providing address information, no certificate was ever received.  (In all fairness, I do know others who have visited other Pappadeaux locations and say it's great.  It just wasn't my experience.)

Went here for a business lunch with customers. Was seated right away, greeted within a minute and had fantastic service. This place was recommended for their seafood. We started off lunch by splitting the sampler of mini shrimp, crawfish fondue, fried alligator and calamari. The alligator was the bomb digitty. I had the fresh sushi and it was fantastic, everything has a southern creole twist on it. Lunch for 3 with appetizer was $75.00 but well worth the money. I will be back again.

went on a Friday night for my gfs birthday. pro tip!! make a reservation we waited more than an hour to get a table around 6pm. we grabbed some drinks at the bar while waiting and Rich the bartender was a great barman. 

after we got our seats we were ready to order. I had the crawfish combo while she had the salmon. entrees are pricey at $25 but after we tasted the food it was worth it. ask for bread if you want to have something to much on. they gave us a free cheesecake since it was my gfs bday. definitely a special occasion type of place and it was overall excellent.

This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix by far!

Pappadeaux makes awesome cajun food. Cajun is one of my favorite styles of food because it is a way of getting food that is spicy and/or seafood and/or covered in butter.

My favorite dish is the mediterranean calamari.  This calamari is fried with artichokes, then topped with feta, capers and tomatoes.  Finally, it is drizzled in butter.  There is clearly a greek influence in this dish, which is another one of my favorite types of cuisine.  

I have frequented this place enough to fall in love with several other appetizers as well: the lump crab and spinach dip, the shrimp and crawfish fondeaux, the jumbo lump crab cakes and the lobster bisque are all delicious!  

For an entree I would recommend the soft shell crab or the lobster tail.  If these are out of your price range, just get a bunch of appetizers and save room for dessert!  The seafood here is the freshest that one can hope for in Arizona, so I personally think it is worth splurging a little.  

Their cocktails are great!  If you get any of the blended ones, be careful!  They are so tasty, you may not notice how strong they are!  I like the frozen margarita and the swamp thing.

Last, but certainly not least, you will undoubtedly be tempted by the deserts here.   This is not only because they have a dessert tray but because they are southern comfort classics.  I am addicted to the banana bread pudding, the key lime pie and all of the different styles of cheesecakes.  They have a few staple items which are always on the tray and they have seasonal selections as well.

I love the atmosphere here.  It has dim, romantic lighting.  It can get loud at times especially when they have live cajun music.  

The service is great here, most of the time.  Once or twice it has been a bit slow, but because of how great the food is, I will always come back for more!
Good food but service was subpar

Never disappointed. The food is amazing so much flavor. This is the real deal. Brunch was amazing. I don't believe there has been anything that I've ordered I didn't enjoy. I try a different dish each time but my favorite appetizer or the oyster duo!!!!! I'm so in love with this place. It's so worth the drive

Amazing food. Amazing atmosphere. Great service! Our server, Mia, was fantastic! Recommended a dish for my son and she was dead on. The crawfish combo dinner was delicious and spicy. The greek salad is made fresh at your tableside. The praline cheesecake was really good.  I would definitely come back to this restaurant and would recommend this if you've never had Cajun food. :)

The restaurant had a nice atmosphere. Wait staff was average. Food was good but not memorable. We tried the frog legs, catfish, stuffed crab, and crawfish etouffe. You have to request the bread to get it and it's warm and tasty. Wouldn't drive across the valley again to go but glad we tried it.

Went to this restaurant Monday night while my father and I were in town for spring training.  The front desk clerk at our hotel (which was conveniently walking distance) recommended this restaurant to us.  When we arrived the hostess told us it was going to to be an hour wait.  Rather than drive (or go to Fridays) we decided to stick around.  My father sat down and I went to the bar to get a couple drinks.  Albeit the bar was busy but the bartender, Mitch, asked me twice what I would like and then completely ignored me and never got them.  I waited for 20 minutes before Linda came and asked me for my drink order and promptly took care of it.  When two seats became available at the bar she quickly suggested we jump on them.  We ended up having dinner at the bar and everything was wonderful.  At Linda's suggestion we tried the Mediterranean calamari which was outstanding.  For our entrees we had the bacon wrapped shrimp and the scallops.  Both were delicious.  And Linda was simply amazing. She made up Mitch and made our evening wonderful.  We will definitely be back when we are in the city again.

On almost every birthday my family brings me to Pappadeaux this place has the best seafood and while it's a little pricey it is absolutely worth it because they have the best seafood the best Oysters very good service and desserts that are to die for! One particular time I ordered for pick up and they made a mistake on my order so they fix the problem by giving me a gift card and it was awesome

Stopped by late night for a nice big beer and some alligator. We tried the appetizer trio and the seared ahi tuna. Food was delicious. Service was great for a Friday night. Definitely go for the larger beer on tap. The bigger size is definitely worth the dollar!!

We love the restaurant and have patronized this location for years. Some changes over time are somewhat troubling, but the overall experience is typically very pleasant. Please bring back the Mediterranean Calimari!!!! Regardless of some small menu changes that we disagree with, we will continue to visit for the fine food, service, and atmosphere.

I was first introduced to this restaurant when on vacation in Arizona back in 2012.  I've been back to Arizona two more times since, and always made an effort to stop at Pappadeaux with whoever was traveling with me, and every one of them have loved the experience!

The food, drink, and service has been fantastic every time, that I would probably consider it my favorite restaurant.  It's unfortunate that there aren't any closer locations to me, but perhaps that helps keep the quality exceptional and my visits more memorable.  For the record, the alligator bites are a must for an appetizer!

So back again and this time we weren't disappointed Jemma was awesome and very attentive and made our dining experience very enjoyable. Total difference from night and day.  My wife had the seafood sampler and I had the half chicken  omg it was delicious every single bite and not a single complaint. I'm a very satisfied and full customer. Jemma restored my faith in the company we will be coming back again.

Great food and great service.  Fresh flowers all through the restaurant.  Good selection from the menu and every bite was fantastic.  Service in most restaurants is a lost art.  While I knew what I wanted to order the waiter explained the menu.  I also liked the fact that he told of the selections he enjoyed to eat himself. Had a very nice lunch and great service.

This is one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. The seafood is perfection and the steaks are excellent. It has a great ambience and service. I leave longing only for my next visit! Never have I been disappointed.

Ate here with my grandparents-in-law when they came for a visit. We had the best time. We started out sharing a greek salad that included shrimp. It was fabulous. Then we all ordered either lobster or a fish dish of some sort. we tried each other's entrees and all were perfectly cooked and spiced. Their dirty rice is off the charts amazing! I had a salmon dish with a cream sauce that I would definitely order again. We were so full we didn't order dessert but if I went back I would love to try their pecan pie. It looked amazing!!!!!

It is was good.  Brought the wife here as a date night and the service was very good.  I was a little taken aback by the wait even though we had a reservation which is why the star deduction.  For sure better seafood than red lobster

My family decided to come here for my mom's birthday dinner. One of my brother's was super eager to try it! The high prices were exactly what I expected, so thankfully that wasn't a surprise when I opened the menu. I only mention that because others have mentioned the high prices.  

Anyhow, I was able to try new foods, like: alligator and frog legs! Alligator was breaded and fried, while the server recommended we get the frog legs seared because they come with better flavoring that way. The sauce was delicious, but I wouldn't order them again. I'd definitely have the alligator again. I ordered the Pasta Mardi Gras for dinner. So good! A huge portion, of course.

Our server, brought out a dessert platter and had my mom choose one, on the house!  She chose bread pudding, it was delicious, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, oh and candle :) Server was very attentive, and personable.

Took my daughter and her fiancee there for his birthday... finally had instance to eat inside (love the patio) it was very comfortable and enjoyable inside.  Server was amazing.  The meal was great.  Oysters are always a top favorite, lobster was cooked wonderfully.  Nothing but praises, nice to have a comfortable and fair, reasonably priced place to go to. Plan on needing a 'to-go' bag.

My wife & I went for dinner with some friends at Pappadeaux's.  The food was good.  We had fried alligator tail for a starter.  My wife had the softshell crabs.  I had the andouille sausage and seafood gumbo.  Both were very good.  The creme brulee we had afterwards was also wonderful.  For Arizona, I would call this good Cajun/Creole....however, nothing beats the French Quarter in New Orleans.

Just had the best birthday dinner in sometime. Chilean sea bass with crab over spinach was awesome. Hurricane with spicy rum mmmmmmm. Isaiah was also awesome with great  descriptions and prompt service.

Is there such a thing as orgasm in a bowl?  YES!  Crawfish ettouffee at Pappadeaux!
I had no idea this was a chain restaurant, or I probably wouldn't have gone.  I'm a mom-and-pop snob :}
Anyway, we had a party of 6 and had about a half hour wait.  We had reservations.  It was a beautiful night, so sitting out on the patio was no big deal.  The hostess even came by once during our wait to let us know they hadn't forgotten about us!
I don't usually get fried calamari (I prefer non-fried seafood) but it was light and crispy and the calamari wasn't rubbery at all.
Service was great, too.  We never had to ask to have our glasses refilled.
it's a great place for a date or a group!
The oysters baton rough is a perfect appetizing start. Just add a small amount of tobasco sauce for that extra kick.
Love the environment and the food. If you are going specifically for a special, like the oysters ask first..... They always run out.

So let me start by saying our server was absolutely amazing. She was so on point with everything. Kept checking on us almost every five minutes. She's great at recognizing facial cues. Her name was naundee j. If the managers are reading she needs a raise she was fabulous. Now with that being said the kitchen could use some help. For apps we ordered the fondue which would have been good if it had been hot. It was lukewarm when it came out. Not the greatest. The. After that is when it gets scary. We waited AN HOUR!!!!!! For our main course to come out. A freaking hour!! That is ridiculous!!! We kept seeing people who had come in long after we did get their food which is absolutely absurd. It was our servers fault she would constantly go back and check if it was ready and would always apologize. I felt bad for her because I'm sure we got flustered with her. The manager on duty had come by maybe 40 minutes into us waiting and said she would go check what was going on and by that point we were ready to leave. Only reason we stayed was because of our server. She was just to sweet. Kept asking if she could get us some soup or salad while we waited. The food came and oddly enough it wasn't even hot. Again lukewarm. So needless to say we won't be going back.

This was the crab fingers sautéed dinner for 23.95 Before we even touched it! It looks like someone's left over meal, not a fresh entree .. the appetizer we ordered at the restaurant was full of sauce and almost no oil.. this thing is like an entree of oil and a side of crab fingers. Gross and tiny portion smaller than the appetizer ! 

We ordered it to go and received it in a closed container already bagged... I wonder why? Who on earth works in their kitchens to approve this to go out ? 

We ate a lobster bisque bowl and the crab fingers appetizer while we were there and both tasted good and were well presented so did not think to open this and check it.. mistake. 

This was our first time there.
First time Pappadeuaxs and it was great! Our server Cristil was fantastic. She had great recommendations! Get the grilled soft shell crab and dirty rice.

Got the crawfish boil...yum!  Good spice mix, but I would have loved to have it spicier.  The oysters were mediocre, not the best quality.  I prefer Ocean Trail for my oysters.  It was super busy, luckily I got there at 5 and didn't have to wait.  I'd really only come here for the crawfish--everything else was average and not special.
Fantastic. New favorite. As busy as they were the staff is dialed. The blackened alligator was to die for.

The best very,, always stop by when we are in Abq.NM. . the happy hour is great,,  especially the po boy..  we love the fresh  oysters.. Wish we had one closer to us in  Az..  this would be my go to place if I lived there,, would give a 6 rating if i could.. being from Louisiana i know good cajun food,, this is the best!!
Brought the family by for a Sunday afternoon lunch. Great atmosphere, staff is well appointed food and drink is delicious.

I would give it a 5 but it is seriously expensive.  Everything that I had was amazing and flavorful. The service was attentive and professional.  All the food was high quality and done to order.  
The atmosphere is a bit noisy and open so if you are hard of hearing it can be overwhelming.  I would recommend for a special occasion or a treat!

We've driven by Pappadeaux's on I-17 for years and have always wanted to stop for a meal but rushed by to get home 100 miles North.  Until today, that is.  Seven of  us lunched here and all were very satisfied.  The appetizer was about the the best and lightest deep fried calamari I've had in years, the gumbo was authentic and good, and my fried oysters were wonderfully done.  The seafood pasta dishes, fried shrimp, tilapia and catfish got high praise from the others. The batter on everything was light with no hint of oiliness. I lived in new Orleans for several years.  Cajun style food this good with uncommonly courteous service in the New Orleans manner  would get praise on the Gulf...to find it in desert-bound Phoenix AZ is amazing. The drinks are great too but I give only 4 stars because its become pricey. Figure about $50 each with two drinks per.

3.5 Nice seafood spot with a variety of grilled or fried entrées.

 For apetitizers my hubby ordered a half dozen Gold Coast Oysters. He said something about them being an aphrodisiac HA! I ordered baked lobster mac and cheese. We shared the Pappadeaux platter (1 pc catfish, 1 pc tilapia, extra shrimp, fried crawfish, 2 blue crab cakes, and french fries) and still didn't finish it. The shrimp and crawfish were too spicy for me my hubby loved it. 

My dad ordered the fried catfish, red beans and rice plate while son ate grilled shrimp/grilled tilipia/broccolini and fries. 

The desert presentation was the best. Although we were past stuffed, we tried to make room for the key lime pie and the humongous serving of vanilla cheesecake.

Overall, the experience wasn't horrible. We would def do it again.

I am a native Texan, so dining at Pappadeaux was simply a way of life!! When my family and I moved to the Los Angeles area, we were deeply saddened there were no Pappas restaurants in Southern Cali. The nearest one is Phoenix.....so what do we do??? We plan our trip to Phoenix just to eat at Pappadeaux! Not even kidding!! 

We made reservations for a Saturday night , 7/22/2017, at 7:30pm and the evening started out horribly. Our server didn't smile, didn't share her name, didn't welcome us, nor did she take our drink order for the first 17 minutes of us being seated. The entire time, my family and I are saying, we drove over 300 miles, we are NOT going to allow one server to ruin our evening. My kids were asking, Mom, when is she going to offer us bread or water? She never did. After I flagged her down so she could finally take our order, her demeanor was even more negative. Even after all of this horrible service, we were still holding out for a better outcome.....until she disrespected my husband in front of my family. My husband asked for butter for our daughters entree because this is the way it's served in Houston. Our server immediately says, "we're not in Houston, but I'll get it for you anyway." And that was it!! We were done... my husband got up to get the manager.

Even though our evening started off on a rough note, Keely Cambridge made us feel sooooo much better. She apologized and made us feel so welcomed. She made our evening spectacular. She also changed our server to Cristil, who catered to us! Thank you Keely and Cristil for turning our lemons into lemonade! We will be back soon

We were in the mood for seafood on a Monday night and thought Pappadeaux would be the perfect place. To my surprise, this place was packed and I know why.

Our waiter Benjamin was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. We were in the mood for some calamari but decided to go with an untraditional version of fried calamari. Benjamin recommended the Mediterranean calamari which comes with a lemon caper sauce, feta cheese and artichokes. It was amazing! The fried calamari was served hot and crispy despite being served in an abundant portion of sauce which was so flavorful!

We ordered a Caesar salad and to my surprise, it had the perfect amount of dressing and cheese! I say this because I find myself always having to order extra sauce or dressing on my entrees because most restaurants skimp. 

We were also served a hot baguette fresh from the oven and our server recommended that we dip the bread in the lemon caper sauce from the calamari and it was addicting! 

We ordered the lobster tail which came with mashed potatoes and broccolini and the shrimp and scallop orecchiette pasta with asparagus and lump crab in a creamy vodka sauce.

The 12 oz lobster tail was cooked to perfection, perfectly seasoned, grilled yet very tender. Each bite tastes like little pockets from heaven especially when you dip it in the melted butter. 12ounces is actually a very generous portion. The broccolini and the mashed potatoes were the perfect sides for this succulent and flavorful lobster tail. We had just come back from Newport Coast and this lobster tail dish ranks as one of the best prepared shellfish entrees that we have ever had. 

My pasta dish had plenty of "tomatoey, creamy" vodka sauce. It wasn't bitter or spicy. It was flavorful with the right amount of cream in order to cut out the acidity and bitterness of the tomato sauce. My pasta was cooked al dente and it came with 4 jumbo sized shrimp. One of my pet peeves is when shrimp isn't properly deveined or cleaned. That was Not the case here but let me tell you about my scallops! My scallops were sweet, tender, savory and they melt in your mouth. On top of my pasta dish were portions of lump crab meat that only because of its color, could easily be missed but the naked eye but not by your taste buds. No doubt that the crab meat added to the decadence of this dish which also had a few pieces of perfectly cooked asparagus tossed in. I truly was doubtful about the combination of scallops, crab and shrimp in this entree has to be one of the best seafood pasta dishes in town!!!! 

For dessert, yes we still ordered dessert! How can you pass up dessert when they bring out the fresh dessert tray for you to view?!!!!
We ordered the banana pudding. I know what you're thinking. Of the entire selection: key lime pie, creme brulee, cheesecake, praline cheesecake, and Haagen Daz ice cream (I can't even remember the others), I picked the vanilla wafer banana pudding?!!!!
Yes I did! The chilled banana pudding is served in a mason jar, is densely layered with wafers, whipped cream ( actual heavy cream that is whipped and sweetened with sugar! No cool whip here!), and fresh banana slices. When I say fresh banana slices, I mean that there was not one brownish, mushy banana slice in the jar! This dessert doesn't look like much but the portion is very generous and we could NOT finish it. 
We decided to take the dessert home and they bring you the lid to the mason jar so you can take it home.

Overall the value was excellent! We took our entrees and our dessert home.

Now let's talk about the service!!!
Benjamin our waiter was attentive and never needed cuing from us for him to refill our beverages. We always had plenty of everything! New forks for the salad and main dishes, plenty of napkins, bussed the table immediately. I really appreciate when the staff is able to make recommendations because they are knowledgeable about the menu. He was excellent, polite, attentive yet allowed us our privacy. I have had experiences at restaurants where waiters tell us their entire life story. Uhhh awkward! Pappadeaux knows what they are doing and it shows!

I swear to you that I am not receiving any compensation or benefit from this review. We overheard someone say as they were leaving the restaurant,"This place makes me feel good!" 
Enough said!

This was our first time here. All in all the food tasted fresh, delivered hot and delicious.  I had the Creole Shrimp & Grits.  The Creole Shrimp was good but I've had better. It was a little bland, could have used a bit more salt. The andouille grits were fantastic. 

Skyler was our server tonight. She was wonderful. Very attentive to our needs, took very good care of us.

There are some very good looking items on the menu so we will be back to try them!

Unbelievable food for a chain restaurant! Normally we would never go to a chain place for dinner - especially in phoenix - but i could not resist all the pics of their food on facebook.

We started with the spinach/lump crab dip, it was good but not outstanding. I ordered the big bayou platter with stuffed shrimp, bacon wrapped shrimp and lobster - it was excellent (dirty rice was great too). My gf ordered king crab legs - wow - she got the medium and i swear it was a full pound and they tasted great.

We come here at least 2x's a month... We always ask for Audrey, she is the best waitress, fun, has a cool Boston accent and is great at what she does. I would recommend her, so request her. :)

Food is always great, I've had 2 instances where I had to send my food back, one was because my toddler sneezed all over my food after only two bites, so they gladly took it back a replaced my meal and the other time was when I was preggo, I had ordered salmon and it was just a little too, "not done"... So the got me a new meal and gave our whole table free desserts. They are excellent at making sure you have a fab dinner and are happy. So be kind if there is an issue, they gladly make thing right with a smile on their face. 

I love many dishes on their menu... Seafood Cobb salad, oysters, gator (1/2 blackened & 1/2 fried) which is a fave of ours, Alexander mahi, salmon Alexander, good ol plank salmon and asparagus, bacon wrapped shrimp is amazing, their pastas are great and we especially love their banana pudding!

Go, you won't be disappointed!

At first it was excellent, till I took a bite of my catfish fillet. A long string like object came out which they were claiming was a tendon... you know a tendon 8 inches long ... News flash Im a graduate of aquatic pathology thanks for the fried tapeworm. If you eat at this place inspect your food, my fault for not checking i suppose but wow. Managers and the server were wonderful people but when called by their call center they were demanding proof. Nah ill save the proof for when and if i get worms and then they will hear from my lawyer. Cheers.

I am from phoenix, but moved to Orange County/Los Angeles area 6 years ago, but still visit AZ a lot. I remember coming here when i was little but don't remember much about the food. Passed this place on the way home from the airport on December 29th, and as a huge fan of Cajun food, I had to stop in. I had to give 5 stars because the food, the service, and the New Orleans ambiance were all to a tee. We got a couple fancy (expensive) cocktails while we waited at the bar for our table. Drinks weren't anything special, but the bartenders very friendly, and offered bread and butter while we waited. We didn't have to wait long before we sat, and if it were warmer out, I would not have minded having cocktail hour on their awesome patio before dinner. You would never know this place is right next to one of Phoenix's busiest freeways. We sat down and our waiter was Bo L(sorry if i didn't get his name right, my receipt rubbed his name off). Anyways we ordered some wine and tried their oyster and shrimp appetizer. Not impressive. But everything else was. Their Lobster Bisque was rich and tasty and I ordered the Seafood Gumbo that came with my Shrimp Po' Boy. My mom ordered her favorite, the Crawfish Etouffée which was superior. My Po' Boy was good, but it was the fried and seasoned shrimp that really made the sandwich. My seafood Gumbo was very authentic and delicious, but i am a sucker for Lobster Bisque which I thought was better. We also ordered a side of their Mushroom Risotto which was cheap and very flavorful. I cannot wait to come here again next weekend when I am visiting. I did some research for good cajun in LA, and cannot find any in, out of all places, Los Angeles. I will have to go to Phoenix for good cajun.
MIA was the best the Manager I forgot her name was very kind and grateful.. the food was amazing literally all of the staff was kind and funny and sweet thank you MIA you made my experience amazing.

I was taken here on a date, I don't really eat cooked seafood (sushi junkie here), so there wasn't much on the menu for me to order, which isn't their fault and if I had been given a choice I wouldn't have gone there.  However the Caesar Salad and French Fries I ordered were great! The complimentary bread was also very good! The service though is absolutely phenomenal, they are on top of everything, very friendly. I felt very well taken care of by them.
Quality and prestige have fizzled out. Used to go there often,but it has been lack luster as of late. Far better places out there with more flare.
Great food and great service! If you want to experience New Orleans delicious cuisine, this is the place. I will be back and recommend it !

Always a fan of Pappadeux.  The last time I was here was for a group Valentine's date with two other couples.  Love was in the air that night especially since the couple at the table next to us got engaged.  Not exactly what I would call a romantic intimate setting but hey, it worked for them because the lady said yes!

I love their crawfish, the fried alligator, and the Pappadeux oysters.  I haven't really ventured out to try anything else besides those three items.  The crawfish they serve up here has good flavor and are big but not exactly the best with all the new crawfish boil shops popping up.  I do think their fried alligator is still the best in town especially with their dipping sauce.  As for the Pappadeux oysters, what's not to love?  It's a dressed up oyster!

This place gets packed fast, it's always super loud in here, and the decor is kind of tacky and gimmicky but it's a seafood restaurant so what do you really expect?  Come to Pappadeux for a fun night out with some decent eats!

Staff was wonderful!  Waiter went the extra mile to get us waters to-go as he found out we were tourists heading out to Sedona for a hike.  During happy hour, bartender was extremely courteous.  When we wanted to move to a booth, she not only helped us bus the table herself personally, but she also continued to bring extra ice teas.  I really miss the service at Pappadeaux.  If only all restaurants give the same experience.  As for the food, order the Happy Hour Fondeaux, cheesy wine butter crawfish and shrimp delight.  Half dozen Oysters for $4.99!

My girlfriend and I went to the I/17 location in Phoenix last night for the first time.  The parking lot was packed, so we were excited that the food must be great.  The hostess said it would take an hour and a half, so we saddled up to the bar instead.  

The bartender's were nice, but way understaffed.  It was taking an average of 5-10 minutes for new people to get recognized.   The bread and butter was the highlight of our meal......warm, crisp and fresh tasting.  My girlfriend's salad was loaded with dressing that was mediocre tasting ( she only had a few bites).  But,my gumbo was pretty good and very fresh tasting. 

 My girlfriend's mussels and lobster dish was overcooked as the seafood was hard and rubbery, while my crispy salmon dish barely resembled the awesome picture on the menu cover.  It tasted bland and only had a single, tiny speck of the delicious crab advertised on the picture.  We ate exactly 1/3 of our meal before calling it a night, and a hundred and fifteen dollars later, we left disappointed.
Excellent experience and excellent food. Went for the first time in San Antonio and will definitely be going back. Yiasou

Received an email from Pappadeaux advertising crawfish special on Wednesday and Thursdays after 3pm. So, me and my family of 8 made the 1 hour and 45 minute drive and we were excited as we haven't had crawfish in a long time.  We were seated at 5 pm and the menus stated the crawfish is available at 5. Ok, no biggie.  I place my order then I'm told "sorry we don't have any crawfish". So I ordered the soft shell crab and my son ordered the steak Oscar medium rare.  Our food arrived, mine is ice cold, my son's steak is still mooing and my sister's food was cold.  The server asked us once in a 2 hour time frame if we needed anything.  I will NOT waste my gas to make the trip here again.

I stop just short of 5 stars only because it's a chain.  Not a huge chain, but a chain none the less.  I love the oysters, but the appetizer trio they have is incredible, especially the fondeaux.  Everything tastes fresh and flavorful from start to finish.  Fried alligator anybody???  You betcha'.  And an incredible dessert selection to finish it all off.  Have the banana pudding with Nilla wafers!!!
This was our first time here!    Such great service from Haleigh and Christian!   Best crab cakes ever! !!!

Being from New Orleans, I was really looking forward to having a dinner here. The opportunity came when I was asked where I wanted to go for my birthday so off we went. 

Openers was Fried Oysters, oh how I miss them, but they were merely satisfying. Buried in French Fries, I found about six small ones. We had another appetizer, don't remember what, that we didn't want to finish. It wanted to take home so we flagged a waiter and asked him to put it in a box so it wouldn't sit uncovered on the table for the entire meal. We had our entrees coming anyway. I ordered the Shrimp Étouffée and the other was a pasta dish of sorts. 

After about 15 minutes our entrees arrive in a bag. They had packed the whole order to go! We explained the problem and the bag went back to the kitchen. 

About 10 minutes later the entrees, and apologies, arrived.  The pasta dish my partner ordered looked and tasted wonderful. The Étouffée looked sad. Over warmed, dry, and tasted it. But it was a birthday gift so I kept my mouth shut and enjoyed the company. 

As we were leaving, I took the waitress aside and apologized for the confusion and asked what had been remade and what had been poured onto a plate and sat to warm under a lamp. You guessed it. 

Now, two wait-persons were involved. Hey, our original disappeared. But you would think she might stop by to check with us before packed up the order based on a message from a trainee. (Our mistake)  But, really, what would it have cost them to remake both entrees as it was their mistake. 

Perhaps a one-off issue but the oysters were disappointing and well, the service badly managed.

This place knows seafood, but if you don't want to wait go in the afternoon it is packed in the evening.

We really enjoyed the food I had the sea bass and it melted in my mouth like butter. I also had the oysters, these things were huge. My 2 young daughters tried them and loved it.

My wife got the ribeye which was huge and very tasty.

The atmosphere is nice, waiting isn't that bad they have a nice  patio and live music so it's bearable.

The only downfall is the table seating inside is too close to the table next to you. It's like they want to get as many into every spot they can.

Overall the food and service were great.

We went here today around 2:30 today and what a great time + delish food! We sat at the bar and had great convo and was happily entertained. Not too mention, the manager, Arizania, was an absolute doll. We LOVE this place! It's our first stop when we come to visit the Phoenix / Scottsdale / Tempe area.

It's a chain but a good one. It's been at this location for a long time now, they're still thriving, and it's all for good reason.

There are a lot of great options here but some of my favorites are the catfish po' boy, fried alligator and crawfish boil. One must try appetizer are the sautéed frog legs. If you haven't had frog legs before this is a good place to try them. 

They've got great atmosphere indoors, a great patio that typically features live music and the service is always fantastic. A fine choice for lunch ,dinner, drinks or all of the above.

Here is my take on this place. Staff is always great and helpful. The food tastes great and always fresh. The happy hour is good, but not a party style happy hour. More subdued happy hour. Good prices but a little more quiet. The restaurant is clean and well kept. Problem I have is the portions continue to get smaller and smaller but the prices never change. I understand market value, but cutting portions into half and keeping the steep price seems a little disingenuous.
Really my only issue is the price to portion here. Everything else I love.

Place is bomb.. had the grilled Frog Legs, Lobster sushi Roll, and the seafood cobb salad for lunch.. sooooo good.. 

Been here once before and had the aligator appetizer, which was really good and also the crab stuffed shrimp.. everything was great.

Tiffany, the girl that waited on us, was really nice and very helpful as well.

Will definitely go back again !

I stumbled onto this place while staying next door at the Hyatt Place and have been coming here for the last few years. I always thought what a Bizarre place to put a Restaurant but I guess when you have a great product then you acquire a following. This place is always busy at night no matter what night of the week. I suggest the Caribbean lobster or Filet Mignon, both very Tasty.

What brings my review down a peg is that our server was not very attentive or efficient.  Barring that, the food was good except the cold fries under my frog legs, which my complaint fell on deaf ears.

The food here is great for a franchise chain, and great service too.  But the prices are way too high.  I mean $8 for soup, not a bowl, but tiny 6 ounce cup.  Drinks are great but at $12 a pop you might want to stick a bottle of rum in your pocket.  The frog legs are good, but again expensive.  Try the happy hour for a better deal.

What can I say? I love this place. When I lived further away, I found myself here only for special occasions. Now that I live 2 miles away, I come here much more often. Lunch, dinner, happy hours... they never disappoint. Food is always delicious. Love the bar area during happy hour. Fun and lively, yet not too raucous... and bartenders are always cool as heck. On wknds, they have live music on the patio, always nice if you like live music, which I do and always appreciate. 
Once recently, I mentioned to our server that one of my sides was really salty. I didn't want any comps or new food and told her so- yet she sent her manager over to our table to reassure us with some kind words. In a world that seems to have forgotten good, old fashioned customer service, Pappadeaux knows what's up.

This place is d'lish for seafood in the desert !  My boyfriend and I have been twice in the past few years because it is pretty far on the west side for us.  But it is well worth it when we are craving some crawfish or crabcakes!  It's easy to pass by if you haven't been because it is along side the highway shortly after you pass Bobby-Q's.

The front entrance is very pretty with the vines, fountain and greenery.  It's nice to see this in the desert...it cools things down drastically !  The bar inside is great and every time I've been it's always been packed but chairs open up pretty quickly.  The bartenders are great and always happy to tweak drinks (I got the mango margarita and added strawberry puree). :)  They had oysters flying outta that bar like ninjas!!  I wished that I liked them because it's part of what everyone loves about this place.  Just can't get past that texture....yeesh. 

When we sat we were in the back room that if this restaurant was on the water we would be hanging right over it....I wish.  Our waiter came back who was VERY stressed out - he stressed US out !  Wiping the sweat from his face, hands shaking, running back and fourth.  It's a good thing they have food runners who help out because I'm not sure we could have handled that all evening.  Now, onto the good stuff....

We ordered a small bowl of Seafood Gumbo to share and try as well as the Fried Calamari.  The Seafood Gumbo was delicious with a little bit of spice to it, lumps of seafood which I'm pretty sure is what gave the yummy broth it's good flavor! Calamari was crispy and good.....not as good as Salt Cellar, but good. :)

For dinner we split the Seafood Platter which they split up for us before it got to our table.  It had.....EVERYTHING.  Crawfish, crabcakes, stuffed shrimp, oysters, etc.  It was a MASSIVE portion so do not order this on your own unless you can gorge yourself into a coma.  I don't recommend it because they have a lot of desserts to chose from.  

On that note, we ordered the creme brulee.  Good....lawd.  It was amazing.  the inside was super creamy and perfect. Top was crispy as expected with a side of strawberries and raspberries.  I was very happy with our choice on desert!

Celebrated another family birthday here Sunday. Started with oysters, crab cakes.
All good. Wife had grilled Texas redfish and really enjoyed. I had blackened red snapper, and it was delicious.
All the food was very good. Service a bit uneven. Different people bringing different things. Had to ask for bread, but got it and it was perfect. Our main server, though not a pro, was pleasant, and that's worth some points.
Free dessert for the birthday, cheesecake, and it was delectable!

The drinks were perfect! The wait was long......my food was mediocre. Our server tried to make it right for us but after being there almost 3 hours, I was over it. Maybe it's Arizona. Everything I ate while visiting was blah.
Excellent food and great service. My husband and I been here several times.

My boyfriend loves to come here for their alligator and even though he's over the frog legs and he'll never eat those again (last time he had them they tasted like swamp is what he said) they have a great filet mignon! Chris Ruth's has NOTHING on them when it comes to their filet mignon! I didn't even need steak sauce because it was so good without it!! We use to make it a yearly thing since we are pretty far away but we seem to be going here way more than our pockets can afford! Hahaha

The food was fabulous and the atmosphere was also nice.  Louisiana Seafood and Sausage gumbo was good, the seafood gumbo was also good, the Seafood platter was great (fried shrimp, fried tilapia, and fried crawfish) and my husband had the shrimp étouffée, dirty rice and   fried catfish and it was also very good.

New update guys.. 

Group of 5 came in on Fri. Our server will, was amazing very detailed oriented and punctual even in a large room and crowd. The food has gotten alot better. In the past it tended to be a tad bit salty. This time everything was on point. Oyster where super fresh no sand witch u tend to get alot out here.had po.boy catfish recommendation more coleslaw the fries or amazing creole seasoning.gumbo had amazing taste not overly salted

Wish They Would Increase Beer Selection MO RE Stouts Ipa.etc. better then last time service and food amazing.

Pappadeaux never ceases to disappoint. I have been to quite a few of their locations and they have consistently had great food and service. 
  This time I tried the Atlantic Salmon Alexander prepared medium rare with shrimp, scallops and crawfish in a slightly spicy cream sauce. It was cooked perfectly with a portion that was big enough to feed 2. No matter what location I go to this place is always busy and has at least a 20 minute wait even longer on the weekends. The owners of these joints originally started in the steakhouse business in Texas so that is what I want to try next time. My servers name was Nick L and he went above and beyond to make my dining experience pleasurable.

I've eaten here multiple time.  Have eaten at other Pappadeaux venues across the US.  Never really had a bad meal here or any other location.  Given that we live in a desert this is about as good as seafood gets.  There are other places that charge a lot more (Eddie Vs for example) but I've found Pappadeaux to be just as good and a whole lot cheaper (although Pappadeaux cost a few bucks).

We used to live in Illinois and would frequent this restaurant every week. We were so excited that it's now in Phoenix.   We don't go weekly, but we try to get there as often as possible. There are so many things on the menu that we love.  Great atmosphere, consistently great food, and live music on the weekends.

Great seafood!  The fish is amazing.  The best I've had in Arizona and... a lot of places really.  I'd go back sooner but the location, while right off the highway, isn't ideal as far as a neighborhood goes, so I do not find myself in that location often.  If someone said they wanted great seafood though, this is where I'd send them.

Hubby and I were back at Pappadeaux last Monday. Right off the bat I will say that I have never gone to Pappadeaux and not had at least a 15 minute wait. There have been times that I was quoted a 1.5 hour wait. Waiting sucks but the food is worth it. Personally a 45 minute wait is my cut off but if there is a seat at the bar I will get a few drinks while waiting. 

We were seated and the waitress explained that she was training so we expected to possibly experience a couple hiccups. We ordered a dozen oysters, fried gator and shared a blackened salmon and salad. Our oysters and gator came out immediately with bread and butter. Everything was excellent. Then we waited for our entree and salad....and waited...and waited. After about 15 to 20 minutes our waitress came by and apologized and let us know that our entree was coming. I tried to play it cool and not act agitated but at this point we knew we would miss the movie that we had planned on seeing after eating. I requested that she bring out our salad while we wait for our entree. 

Our waitress arrived 5 minutes later with our entree and salad in hand and once again apologized for the wait. She also explained that our there was an issue with our salmon when the chef split our meal onto two plates and that she would be bringing us out another fillet shortly. BTW, it is nice that it was split for 2 but I would have been equally happy to share from the same plate, however I do see this as an over and above service and appreciate these little efforts. She also offered to bring us a dessert at the end of our meal to make up for the wait and the problem with the salmon. The food was all delicious and as promised the waitress brought out the dessert tray and asked what we would like to try. We went for the creme brulee which did not disappoint. Our check did not include the dessert and we were given half off our oysters. This is why I adore Pappadeaux. If there is a problem they go way beyond to fix it and make it up to you.

Our new obsession!
Went there for the first time after my daughter gave me a gift card for Christmas.  Now, we are HOOKED!
We always sit at the bar, but I shouldn't tell you that because it can be tough to get a seat there already.
Not a cheap place, but the food is awesome, service is just as awesome, drinks are awesome.
Do yourself a favor and try the blackened alligator. Then try the lobster bisque, then try anything else on the menu.
They also have happy hour deals that are fairly priced and the desserts are amazing!
Great seafood and an enjoyable atmoshpere! It's always packed and they are still timely with seating, order taking and refills. Crab cakes are a must!

Had the worst dining experience ever last night. One member of our party of four was served five minutes before everyone else. Salads and soup brought to our table the same time as our main meal. Drinks never refilled. I finally got up and found a pitcher and water and poured it myself. My wife ordered a baked potato, received French fries. When pointed out to waiter he said, I'll go put that order in now. Never did get it.

I treated my mother to a much needed getaway.  We had lunch and split a gigantic Seafood Cobb Salad.  The salad, coupled with the fresh bagette was the excellent food I've come to expect for many, many years from Pappadeaux's.  Yesterday, our dining was a 5 star experience due to the server.  He was courteous, professional, and patient with my elderly mother. THAT is what put our lunch date over the top!  So, I will return as always. I'm most likely to return mid day for lunch and ask for Benjamin S., our server!  My guests and I will request a table by the courtyard.  We'll enjoy the view from the window, eat fantastic food, & imagine we're in New Orleans.  When Benjamin is serving we will have a helping of southern hospitality at it's finest, because this waiter exhibits those fine qualities to a T!  Thank you, Pappadeaux's!

This place really stands apart from most restaurants around the valley. It has a large seafood selection and everything I've had is fresh and delicious. There are a couple other restaurants popping up that are giving them a run for their money, but as for now if you want some pretty good quality seafood in Phoenix then you should definitely try this place out. Be prepared for it to always be crowded, but they do accept reservations even for small parties which is very nice. The service could definitely improve, but it's really hit or miss. We had a birthday last night at our table and the hostess said she would tell our server. Not sure who forgot but it got missed. We also sat at a small table with dirty dishes and drink cups the entire meal and even when we finished. It was a bit of a drag, but the food was good! We spent about $200 with 3 adults and 1 child. We had 2 appetizers and 4 alcoholic drinks so it can be a bit pricey. I expected way better service for the amount we spent on our meal. Minus 2 stars for the service
